Text

PREFACE Most of the adventures recorded in this book really occurred ; one or two were experiences of [my]0-i own , the rest those of [boys who were schoolmates of [mine]0-i]178-boys who were schoolmates of mine . [Huck Finn]45-huck is drawn from life ; [Tom Sawyer]46-tom also , but not from [an individual]179-an individual — [he]46-tom is a combination of the characteristics of [three boys whom [I]0-i knew]180-three boys whom i knew , and therefore belongs to [the composite order of architecture]181-the composite order of architecture . The odd superstitions touched upon were all prevalent among [children]182-children and slaves in [the West]1-the west at the period of this story — that is to say , thirty or forty years ago . Although [my]0-i book is intended mainly for the entertainment of [boys]183-boys and [girls]184-girls , [I]0-i hope it will not be shunned by [men]185-men and [women]186-women on that account , for part of [my]0-i plan has been to try to pleasantly remind [adults]187-adults of what [they]187-adults once were [themselves]187-adults , and of how [they]187-adults felt and thought and talked , and what queer enterprises [they]187-adults sometimes engaged in . [THE AUTHOR]188-the author . [HARTFORD]2-hartford , 1876 . CHAPTER [I]0-i “ [Tom]46-tom ! ”[189-the old lady] No answer . “ [TOM]46-tom ! ”[189-the old lady] No answer . “ What ’s gone with [that boy]2035-that boy , [I]189-the old lady wonder ? [[You]46-tom [TOM]46-tom]2036-you tom ! ”[189-the old lady] No answer . [The old lady]189-the old lady pulled [her]189-the old lady spectacles down and looked over them about [the room]190-the room ; then [she]189-the old lady put them up and looked out under them . [She]189-the old lady seldom or never looked _ through _ them for so small a thing as [a boy]191-a boy ; they were [her]189-the old lady state pair , the pride of [her]189-the old lady heart , and were built for “ style , ”[189-the old lady] not service — [she]189-the old lady could have seen through a pair of stove - lids just as well . [She]189-the old lady looked perplexed for a moment , and then said , not fiercely , but still loud enough for the furniture to hear : “ Well , [I]189-the old lady lay if [I]189-the old lady get hold of [you]46-tom [I]189-the old lady ’ll — ”[189-the old lady] [She]189-the old lady did not finish , for by this time [she]189-the old lady was bending down and punching under the bed with the broom , and so [she]189-the old lady needed breath to punctuate the punches with . [She]189-the old lady resurrected nothing but the cat . “ [I]189-the old lady never did see the beat of [that boy]2035-that boy ! ”[189-the old lady] [She]189-the old lady went to the open door and stood in it and looked out among the tomato vines and “ jimpson ”[189-the old lady] weeds that constituted [the garden]192-the garden . No [Tom]46-tom . So [she]189-the old lady lifted up [her]189-the old lady voice at an angle calculated for distance and shouted : “ Y - o - u - u [TOM]46-tom ! ”[189-the old lady] There was a slight noise behind [her]189-the old lady and [she]189-the old lady turned just in time to seize [a small boy]193-a small boy by the slack of [his]193-a small boy roundabout and arrest [his]193-a small boy flight . “ [There]2038-there ! [I]189-the old lady might ’ a ’ thought of [that closet]2039-that closet . What [you]193-a small boy been doing in there ? ”[189-the old lady] “ Nothing . ”[189-the old lady] “ Nothing ! Look at [your]193-a small boy hands . And look at [your]193-a small boy mouth . What _ is _ [that truck]2040-that truck ? ”[189-the old lady] “ [I]189-the old lady do n’t know , [aunt]2041-aunt . ”[189-the old lady] “ Well , [I]189-the old lady know . [It]2042-it ’s jam — that ’s what it is . Forty times [I]189-the old lady ’ve said if [you]193-a small boy did n’t let that jam alone [I]189-the old lady ’d skin [you]193-a small boy . Hand [me]189-the old lady that switch . ”[189-the old lady] The switch hovered in the air — the peril was desperate — “ [My]189-the old lady ! Look behind [you]193-a small boy , [aunt]2041-aunt ! ”[189-the old lady] [The old lady]189-the old lady whirled round , and snatched [her]189-the old lady skirts out of danger . [The lad]195-the lad fled on the instant , scrambled up the high board - fence , and disappeared over it . [[His]195-the lad aunt]196-his aunt [Polly]47-aunt polly stood surprised a moment , and then broke into a gentle laugh . “ Hang [the boy]2044-the boy , ca n’t [I]47-aunt polly never learn anything ? Ai n’t [he]2044-the boy played [me]47-aunt polly tricks enough like that for [me]47-aunt polly to be looking out for [him]2044-the boy by this time ? But [old fools]2045-old fools is the biggest fools there is . Ca n’t learn an old dog new tricks , as the saying is . But [my]47-aunt polly goodness , [he]2044-the boy never plays [them]2045-old fools alike , two days , and how is a body to know what ’s coming ? [He]2044-the boy ’ pears to know just how long [he]2044-the boy can torment [me]47-aunt polly before [I]47-aunt polly get [my]47-aunt polly dander up , and [he]2044-the boy knows if [he]2044-the boy can make out to put [me]47-aunt polly off for a minute or make [me]47-aunt polly laugh , it ’s all down again and [I]47-aunt polly ca n’t hit [him]2044-the boy a lick . [I]47-aunt polly ai n’t doing [my]47-aunt polly duty by [that boy]2035-that boy , and that ’s [the Lord]2047-the lord ’s truth , goodness knows . Spare the rod and spile [the child]2048-the child , as the Good Book says . [I]47-aunt polly ’m a laying up sin and suffering for [us]2049-us both , [I]47-aunt polly know . [He]2044-the boy ’s full of the Old Scratch , but laws - a - [me]47-aunt polly ! [he]2044-the boy ’s [[[my]47-aunt polly own dead sister]2050-my own dead sister ’s boy]2051-my own dead sister ’s boy , poor thing , and [I]47-aunt polly ai n’t got the heart to lash [him]2044-the boy , somehow . Every time [I]47-aunt polly let [him]2044-the boy off , [my]47-aunt polly conscience does hurt [me]47-aunt polly so , and every time [I]47-aunt polly hit [him]2044-the boy [my]47-aunt polly old heart most breaks . Well - a - well , [man that is born of woman]2052-man that is born of woman is of few days and full of trouble , as [the Scripture]2053-the scripture says , and [I]47-aunt polly reckon it ’s so . [He]2044-the boy ’ll play [hookey]48-hookey this evening , [ * ] and [I]47-aunt polly ’ll just be obleeged to make [him]2044-the boy work , tomorrow , to punish [him]2044-the boy . It ’s mighty hard to make [him]2044-the boy work Saturdays , when all [the boys]2054-the boys is having holiday , but [he]2044-the boy hates work more than [he]2044-the boy hates anything else , and [I]47-aunt polly ’ve _ got _ to do some of [my]47-aunt polly duty by [him]2044-the boy , or [I]47-aunt polly ’ll be the ruination of [the child]2048-the child . ”[47-aunt polly] [ * ] [Southwestern]49-southwestern for “ afternoon ”[49-southwestern] [Tom]46-tom did play hookey , and [he]46-tom had a very good time . [He]46-tom got back [home]197-home barely in season to help [Jim]50-jim , [the small colored boy]198-the small colored boy , saw next - day ’s wood and split the kindlings before supper — at least [he]46-tom was there in time to tell [his]46-tom adventures to [Jim]50-jim while [Jim]50-jim did three - fourths of the work . [[Tom]46-tom ’s younger brother]199-tom ’s younger brother ( or rather half - brother ) [Sid]51-sid was already through with [his]51-sid part of the work ( picking up chips ) , for [he]51-sid was [a quiet boy]200-a quiet boy , and had no adventurous , trouble - some ways . While [Tom]46-tom was eating [his]46-tom supper , and stealing sugar as opportunity offered , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly asked [him]46-tom questions that were full of guile , and very deep — for [she]47-aunt polly wanted to trap [him]46-tom into damaging revealments . Like [many other simple - hearted souls]201-many other simple - hearted souls , it was [her]47-aunt polly pet vanity to believe [she]47-aunt polly was endowed with a talent for dark and mysterious diplomacy , and [she]47-aunt polly loved to contemplate [her]47-aunt polly most transparent devices as marvels of low cunning . Said [she]47-aunt polly : “ [Tom]46-tom , it was middling warm in [school]2056-school , warn’t it ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ Yes’m . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Powerful warm , warn’t it ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ Yes’m . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Did n’t [you]46-tom want to go in a - swimming , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[47-aunt polly] A bit of a scare shot through [Tom]46-tom — a touch of uncomfortable suspicion . [He]46-tom searched [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s face , but it told [him]46-tom nothing . So [he]46-tom said : “ No’m — well , not very much . ”[46-tom] [The old lady]189-the old lady reached out [her]189-the old lady hand and felt [Tom]46-tom ’s shirt , and said : “ But [you]46-tom ai n’t too warm now , though . ”[189-the old lady] And it flattered [her]189-the old lady to reflect that [she]189-the old lady had discovered that the shirt was dry without [anybody]203-anybody knowing that that was what [she]189-the old lady had in [her]189-the old lady mind . But in spite of [her]189-the old lady , [Tom]46-tom knew where the wind lay , now . So [he]46-tom forestalled what might be the next move : “ [Some of [us]2058-us]2057-some of us pumped on [our]2058-us heads — mine ’s damp yet . See ? ”[46-tom] [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly was vexed to think [she]47-aunt polly had overlooked that bit of circumstantial evidence , and missed a trick . Then [she]47-aunt polly had a new inspiration : “ [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom did n’t have to undo [your]46-tom shirt collar where [I]47-aunt polly sewed it , to pump on [your]46-tom head , did [you]46-tom ? Unbutton [your]46-tom jacket ! ”[47-aunt polly] The trouble vanished out of [Tom]46-tom ’s face . [He]46-tom opened [his]46-tom jacket . [His]46-tom shirt collar was securely sewed . “ Bother ! Well , go ’ long with [you]46-tom . [I]46-tom ’d made sure [you]46-tom ’d played [hookey]2059-hookey and been a - swimming . But [I]46-tom forgive [ye]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom . [I]46-tom reckon [you]46-tom ’re a kind of a singed cat , as the saying is — better’n [you]46-tom look . _ This _ time . ”[46-tom] [She]204-she was half sorry [her]204-she sagacity had miscarried , and half glad that [Tom]46-tom had stumbled into obedient conduct for once . But [Sidney]51-sid said : “ Well , now , if [I]51-sid did n’t think [you]46-tom sewed [his]46-tom collar with white thread , but it ’s black . ”[51-sid] “ Why , [I]51-sid did sew it with white ! [Tom]46-tom ! ”[51-sid] But [Tom]46-tom did not wait for the rest . As [he]46-tom went out at the door [he]46-tom said : “ [Siddy]52-siddy , [I]46-tom ’ll lick [you]52-siddy for that . ”[46-tom] In a safe place [Tom]46-tom examined two large needles which were thrust into the lapels of [his]46-tom jacket , and had thread bound about them — one needle carried white thread and the other black . [He]46-tom said : “ [She]204-she ’d never noticed if it had n’t been for [Sid]51-sid . Confound it ! sometimes [she]204-she sews it with white , and sometimes [she]204-she sews it with black . [I]46-tom wish to gee - miny [she]204-she ’d stick to one or t’other — [I]46-tom ca n’t keep the run of [’em]2060-’em . But [I]46-tom bet [you]52-siddy [I]46-tom ’ll lam [Sid]51-sid for that . [I]46-tom ’ll learn [him]51-sid ! ”[46-tom] [He]46-tom was not [the Model Boy of [the village]206-the village]205-the model boy of the village . [He]46-tom knew [the model boy]207-the model boy very well though — and loathed [him]207-the model boy . Within two minutes , or even less , [he]46-tom had forgotten all [his]46-tom troubles . Not because [his]46-tom troubles were one whit less heavy and bitter to [him]46-tom than [a man]208-a man ’s are to [a man]208-a man , but because a new and powerful interest bore [them]210-them down and drove [them]210-them out of [his]46-tom mind for the time — just as [men]185-men ’s misfortunes are forgotten in the excitement of new enterprises . This new interest was a valued novelty in whistling , which [he]46-tom had just acquired from [a negro]212-a negro , and [he]46-tom was suffering to practise it undisturbed . It consisted in a peculiar bird - like turn , a sort of liquid warble , produced by touching the tongue to the roof of the mouth at short intervals in the midst of the music — [the reader]213-the reader probably remembers how to do it , if [he]46-tom has ever been [a boy]191-a boy . Diligence and attention soon gave [him]46-tom the knack of it , and [he]46-tom strode down [the street]215-the street with [his]46-tom mouth full of harmony and [his]46-tom soul full of gratitude . [He]46-tom felt much as [an astronomer]216-an astronomer feels who has discovered a new planet — no doubt , as far as strong , deep , unalloyed pleasure is concerned , the advantage was with [the boy]2044-the boy , not [the astronomer]218-the astronomer . The summer evenings were long . It was not dark , yet . [Presently Tom]46-tom checked [his]46-tom whistle . [A stranger]219-a stranger was before [him]46-tom — [a boy a shade larger than [himself]220-a boy a shade larger than himself]220-a boy a shade larger than himself . [A new - comer of any age or either sex]221-a new - comer of any age or either sex was an impressive curiosity in [the poor little shabby village of [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg]222-the poor little shabby village of st. petersburg . [This boy]223-this boy was well dressed , too — well dressed on a week - day . This was simply astounding . [His]46-tom cap was a dainty thing , [his]46-tom close - buttoned blue cloth roundabout was new and natty , and so were [his]46-tom pantaloons . [He]46-tom had shoes on — and it was only Friday . [He]46-tom even wore a necktie , a bright bit of ribbon . [He]46-tom had a citified air about [him]46-tom that ate into [Tom]46-tom ’s vitals . The more [Tom]46-tom stared at the splendid marvel , the higher [he]46-tom turned up [his]46-tom nose at [his]46-tom finery and the shabbier and shabbier [his]46-tom own outfit seemed to [him]46-tom to grow . [Neither boy]224-neither boy spoke . If one moved , [the other]225-the other moved — but only sidewise , in a circle ; [they]226-they kept face to face and eye to eye all the time . Finally [Tom]46-tom said : “ [I]46-tom can lick [you]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom ’d like to see [you]46-tom try it . ”[46-tom] “ Well , [I]46-tom can do it . ”[46-tom] “ No [you]46-tom ca n’t , either . ”[46-tom] “ Yes [I]46-tom can . ”[46-tom] “ No [you]46-tom ca n’t . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom can . ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom ca n’t . ”[46-tom] “ Can ! ”[46-tom] “ Ca n’t ! ”[46-tom] An uncomfortable pause . Then [Tom]46-tom said : “ What ’s [your]46-tom name ? ”[46-tom] “ ’ Tisn’t any of [your]46-tom business , maybe . ”[46-tom] “ Well [I]46-tom ’ low [I]46-tom ’ll _ make _ it [my]46-tom business . ”[46-tom] “ Well why do n’t [you]46-tom ? ”[46-tom] “ If [you]46-tom say much , [I]46-tom will . ”[46-tom] “ Much — much—_much _ . There now . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , [you]46-tom think [you]46-tom ’re mighty smart , _ do n’t _ [you]46-tom ? [I]46-tom could lick [you]46-tom with one hand tied behind [me]46-tom , if [I]46-tom wanted to . ”[46-tom] “ Well why do n’t [you]46-tom _ do _ it ? [You]46-tom _ say _ [you]46-tom can do it . ”[46-tom] “ Well [I]46-tom _ will _ , if [you]46-tom fool with [me]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ Oh yes — [I’ve]46-tom seen [whole families]2061-whole families in the same fix . ”[46-tom] “ Smarty ! [You]46-tom think [you]46-tom ’re _ some _ , now , _ do n’t _ [you]46-tom ? Oh , what a hat ! ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom can lump that hat if [you]46-tom do n’t like it . [I]46-tom dare [you]46-tom to knock it off — and [anybody that ’ll take a dare]2062-anybody that ’ll take a dare will suck eggs . ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom ’re [a liar]2063-a liar ! ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom ’re another . ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom ’re [a fighting liar]2064-a fighting liar and dasn’t take it up . ”[46-tom] “ Aw — take a walk ! ”[46-tom] “ Say — if [you]46-tom give [me]46-tom much more of [your]46-tom sass [I]46-tom ’ll take and bounce a rock off’n [your]46-tom head . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , of _ course _ [you]46-tom will . ”[46-tom] “ Well [I]46-tom _ will _ . ”[46-tom] “ Well why do n’t [you]46-tom _ do _ it then ? What do [you]46-tom keep _ saying _ [you]46-tom will for ? Why do n’t [you]46-tom _ do _ it ? It ’s because [you]46-tom ’re afraid . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom _ ai n’t _ afraid . ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom are . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom ai n’t . ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom are . ”[46-tom] Another pause , and more eying and sidling around [each other]227-each other . Presently [they]228-they were shoulder to shoulder . [Tom]46-tom said : “ Get away from here ! ”[46-tom] “ Go away [yourself]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom wo n’t . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom wo n’t either . ”[46-tom] So [they]228-they stood , each with a foot placed at an angle as a brace , and both shoving with might and main , and glowering at [each other]227-each other with hate . But neither could get an advantage . After struggling till [both]230-both were hot and flushed , [each]231-each relaxed [his]231-each strain with watchful caution , and [Tom]46-tom said : “ [You]46-tom ’re [a coward]2065-a coward and [a pup]2066-a pup . [I]46-tom ’ll tell [[my]46-tom big brother]2067-my big brother on [you]46-tom , and [he]2067-my big brother can thrash [you]46-tom with [his]2067-my big brother little finger , and [I]46-tom ’ll make [him]2067-my big brother do it , too . ”[46-tom] “ What do [I]46-tom care for [[your]46-tom big brother]2068-your big brother ? [I]46-tom ’ve got [a brother that ’s bigger than [he]2067-my big brother is]2069-a brother that ’s bigger than he is — and what ’s more , [he]2067-my big brother can throw [him]2067-my big brother over that fence , too . ”[46-tom] [ [Both brothers]232-both brothers were imaginary . ] “ That ’s a lie . ”[46-tom] “ _ [Your]46-tom _ saying so do n’t make it so . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom drew a line in the dust with [his]46-tom big toe , and said : “ [I]46-tom dare [you]46-tom to step over that , and [I]46-tom ’ll lick [you]46-tom till [you]46-tom ca n’t stand up . [Anybody that ’ll take a dare]2062-anybody that ’ll take a dare will steal [sheep]2071-sheep . ”[46-tom] [The new boy]233-the new boy stepped over promptly , and said : “ Now [you]233-the new boy said [you]233-the new boy ’d do it , now let ’s see [you]233-the new boy do it . ”[233-the new boy] “ Do n’t [you]233-the new boy crowd [me]233-the new boy now ; [you]233-the new boy better look out . ”[233-the new boy] “ Well , [you]233-the new boy _ said _ [you]233-the new boy ’d do it — why do n’t [you]233-the new boy do it ? ”[233-the new boy] “ By jingo ! for two cents [I]233-the new boy _ will _ do it . ”[233-the new boy] [The new boy]233-the new boy took two broad coppers out of [his]233-the new boy pocket and held them out with derision . [Tom]46-tom struck them to the ground . In an instant [both boys]235-both boys were rolling and tumbling in the dirt , gripped together like cats ; and for the space of a minute [they]235-both boys tugged and tore at [each other]227-each other ’s hair and clothes , punched and scratched [each other]227-each other ’s nose , and covered [themselves]235-both boys with dust and glory . Presently the confusion took form , and through the fog of battle [Tom]46-tom appeared , seated astride [the new boy]233-the new boy , and pounding [him]233-the new boy with [his]46-tom fists . “ Holler ’nuff ! ”[46-tom] said [he]46-tom . [The boy]2044-the boy only struggled to free [himself]2044-the boy . [He]2044-the boy was crying — mainly from rage . “ [Holler]53-holler ’ nuff!”—and[2044-the boy] the pounding went on . At last [the stranger]240-the stranger got out a smothered “ ’ Nuff ! ”[240-the stranger] and [Tom]46-tom let [him]233-the new boy up and said : “ Now that ’ll learn [you]233-the new boy . Better look out who [you]233-the new boy ’re fooling with next time . ”[46-tom] [The new boy]233-the new boy went off brushing the dust from [his]233-the new boy clothes , sobbing , snuffling , and occasionally looking back and shaking [his]233-the new boy head and threatening what [he]233-the new boy would do to [Tom]46-tom the “ next time [he]46-tom caught [him]233-the new boy out . ”[233-the new boy] To which [Tom]46-tom responded with jeers , and started off in high feather , and as soon as [his]46-tom back was turned [the new boy]233-the new boy snatched up a stone , threw it and hit [him]46-tom between the shoulders and then turned tail and ran like an antelope . [Tom]46-tom chased [the traitor]243-the traitor [home]197-home , and thus found out where [he]243-the traitor lived . [He]46-tom then held a position at the gate for some time , daring [the enemy]245-the enemy to come outside , but [the enemy]245-the enemy only made faces at [him]46-tom through the window and declined . At last [[the enemy]245-the enemy ’s mother]248-the enemy ’s mother appeared , and called [Tom]46-tom [a bad , vicious , vulgar child]249-a bad , vicious , vulgar child , and ordered [him]46-tom away . So [he]46-tom went away ; but [he]46-tom said [he]46-tom “ ’ lowed ”[46-tom] to “ lay ”[46-tom] for [that boy]2035-that boy . [He]46-tom got [home]197-home pretty late that night , and when [he]46-tom climbed cautiously in at the window , [he]46-tom uncovered an ambuscade , in the person of [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ; and when [she]196-his aunt saw the state [his]46-tom clothes were in [her]196-his aunt resolution to turn [his]46-tom Saturday holiday into captivity at hard labor became adamantine in its firmness . CHAPTER II Saturday morning was come , and all [the summer world]253-the summer world was bright and fresh , and brimming with life . There was a song in every heart ; and if the heart was young the music issued at the lips . There was cheer in every face and a spring in every step . The locust - trees were in bloom and the fragrance of the blossoms filled the air . [Cardiff Hill]4-cardiff hill , beyond [the village]206-the village and above [it]4-cardiff hill , was green with vegetation and [it]4-cardiff hill lay just far enough away to seem [a Delectable Land , dreamy , reposeful , and inviting]255-a delectable land , dreamy , reposeful , and inviting . [Tom]46-tom appeared on [the sidewalk]256-the sidewalk with a bucket of whitewash and a long - handled brush . [He]46-tom surveyed the fence , and all gladness left [him]46-tom and a deep melancholy settled down upon [his]46-tom spirit . Thirty yards of board fence nine feet high . Life to [him]46-tom seemed hollow , and existence but a burden . Sighing , [he]46-tom dipped [his]46-tom brush and passed it along the topmost plank ; repeated the operation ; did it again ; compared the insignificant whitewashed streak with the far - reaching continent of unwhitewashed fence , and sat down on a tree - box discouraged . [Jim]50-jim came skipping out at the gate with a tin pail , and singing [Buffalo Gals]54-buffalo gals . Bringing water from [the town pump]257-the town pump had always been hateful work in [Tom]46-tom ’s eyes , before , but now it did not strike [him]46-tom so . [He]46-tom remembered that there was [company at the pump]258-company at the pump . [White , mulatto]259-white , mulatto , and [negro boys]260-negro boys and [girls]184-girls were always there waiting [their]259-white , mulatto turns , resting , trading playthings , quarrelling , fighting , skylarking . And [he]46-tom remembered that although the pump was only a hundred and fifty yards off , [Jim]50-jim never got back with a bucket of water under an hour — and even then [somebody]262-somebody generally had to go after [him]50-jim . [Tom]46-tom said : “ Say , [Jim]50-jim , [I]46-tom ’ll fetch the water if [you]50-jim ’ll whitewash some . ”[46-tom] [Jim]50-jim shook [his]50-jim head and said : “ Ca n’t , [Mars Tom]46-tom . [Ole missis]56-ole missis , [she]56-ole missis tole [me]50-jim [I]50-jim got to go an ’ git dis water an ’ not stop foolin ’ roun ’ wid [anybody]203-anybody . [She]56-ole missis say [she]56-ole missis spec ’ [Mars Tom]46-tom gwine to ax [me]50-jim to whitewash , an ’ so [she]56-ole missis tole [me]50-jim go ’ long an ’ ’ tend to [my]50-jim own business — [she]56-ole missis ’ lowed _ [she]56-ole missis ’d _ ’ tend to de whitewashin ’ . ”[50-jim] “ Oh , never [you]50-jim mind what [she]56-ole missis said , [Jim]50-jim . That ’s the way [she]56-ole missis always talks . Gimme the bucket — [I]50-jim wo n’t be gone only a a minute . _ [She]56-ole missis _ wo n’t ever know . ”[50-jim] “ Oh , [I]46-tom dasn’t , [Mars Tom]46-tom . [Ole missis]56-ole missis [she]56-ole missis ’d take an ’ tar de head off’n [me]46-tom . ’ Deed [she]56-ole missis would . ”[46-tom] “ _ [She]56-ole missis _ ! [She]56-ole missis never licks [anybody]203-anybody — whacks ’em over the head with [her]56-ole missis thimble — and who cares for that , [I]50-jim ’d like to know . [She]56-ole missis talks awful , but talk do n’t hurt — anyways it do n’t if [she]56-ole missis do n’t cry . [Jim]50-jim , [I]50-jim ’ll give [you]50-jim a marvel . [I]50-jim ’ll give [you]50-jim [a white alley]2074-a white alley ! ”[50-jim] [Jim]50-jim began to waver . “ [White alley]2075-white alley , [Jim]50-jim ! And it ’s [a bully]2076-a bully taw . ”[50-jim] “ [My]46-tom ! Dat ’s a mighty gay marvel , [I]46-tom tell [you]50-jim ! But [Mars Tom]46-tom [I]46-tom ’s powerful ’ fraid ole missis — ”[46-tom] “ And besides , if [you]50-jim will [I]50-jim ’ll show [you]50-jim [my]50-jim sore toe . ”[50-jim] [Jim]50-jim was only human — this attraction was too much for [him]50-jim . [He]50-jim put down [his]50-jim pail , took [the white alley]263-the white alley , and bent over the toe with absorbing interest while the bandage was being unwound . In another moment [he]50-jim was flying down [the street]215-the street with [his]50-jim pail and a tingling rear , [Tom]46-tom was whitewashing with vigor , and [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly was retiring from [the field]265-the field with a slipper in [her]47-aunt polly hand and triumph in [her]47-aunt polly eye . But [Tom]46-tom ’s energy did not last . [He]50-jim began to think of the fun [he]50-jim had planned for this day , and [his]50-jim sorrows multiplied . Soon [the free boys]266-the free boys would come tripping along on all sorts of delicious expeditions , and [they]266-the free boys would make a world of fun of [him]50-jim for having to work — the very thought of it burnt [him]50-jim like fire . [He]50-jim got out [his]50-jim worldly wealth and examined it — bits of toys , marbles , and trash ; enough to buy an exchange of _ work _ , maybe , but not half enough to buy so much as half an hour of pure freedom . So [he]50-jim returned [his]50-jim straitened means to [his]50-jim pocket , and gave up the idea of trying to buy [the boys]2054-the boys . At this dark and hopeless moment an inspiration burst upon [him]50-jim ! Nothing less than a great , magnificent inspiration . [He]50-jim took up [his]50-jim brush and went tranquilly to work . [Ben Rogers]57-ben hove in sight presently — [the very boy , of [all boys]269-all boys , whose ridicule [he]57-ben had been dreading]268-the very boy , of all boys , whose ridicule he had been dreading . [Ben]57-ben ’s gait was the hop - skip - and - jump — proof enough that [his]57-ben heart was light and [his]57-ben anticipations high . [He]57-ben was eating an apple , and giving a long , melodious whoop , at intervals , followed by a deep - toned ding - dong - dong , ding - dong - dong , for [he]57-ben was personating [a steamboat]270-a steamboat . As [he]57-ben drew near , [he]57-ben slackened speed , took the middle of [the street]215-the street , leaned far over to starboard and rounded to ponderously and with laborious pomp and circumstance — for [he]57-ben was personating [the Big Missouri]5-the big missouri , and considered [himself]57-ben to be drawing nine feet of water . [He]57-ben was [boat]272-boat and [captain and engine - bells]273-captain and engine - bells combined , so [he]57-ben had to imagine [himself]57-ben standing on [his]57-ben own hurricane - deck giving the orders and executing them : “ Stop [her]2077-her , [sir]2078-sir ! [Ting - a - ling - ling]58-ting - a - ling - ling ! ”[57-ben] The headway ran almost out , and [he]57-ben drew up slowly toward [the sidewalk]256-the sidewalk . “ [Ship]2079-ship up to back ! Ting - a - ling - ling ! ”[57-ben] [His]57-ben arms straightened and stiffened down [his]57-ben sides . “ Set [her]2077-her back on the stabboard ! Ting - a - ling - ling ! Chow ! ch - chow - wow ! Chow ! ”[57-ben] [His]57-ben right hand , mean - time , describing stately circles — for it was representing a forty - foot wheel . “ Let [her]2077-her go back on the labboard ! Ting - a - ling - ling ! [Chow - ch - chow - chow]2080-chow - ch - chow - chow ! ”[57-ben] The left hand began to describe circles . “ Stop the stabboard ! Ting - a - ling - ling ! Stop the labboard ! Come ahead on the stabboard ! Stop [her]2077-her ! Let [your]57-ben outside turn over slow ! [Ting - a - ling - ling]58-ting - a - ling - ling ! Chow - ow - ow ! Get out that head - line ! _ lively _ now ! Come — out with [your]57-ben spring - line — what’re [you]57-ben about there ! Take a turn round that stump with the bight of it ! Stand by that stage , now — let [her]2077-her go ! Done with the engines , [sir]2078-sir ! [Ting - a - ling - ling]58-ting - a - ling - ling ! SH’T ! S’H’T ! SH’T ! ”[57-ben] ( trying the gauge - cocks ) . [Tom]46-tom went on whitewashing — paid no attention to [the steamboat]275-the steamboat . [Ben]57-ben stared a moment and then said : “ _ Hi - [Yi]2082-yi ! [You]46-tom ’re _ up a stump , ai n’t [you]46-tom ! ”[57-ben] No answer . [Tom]46-tom surveyed [his]46-tom last touch with the eye of [an artist]276-an artist , then [he]46-tom gave [his]46-tom brush another gentle sweep and surveyed the result , as before . [Ben]57-ben ranged up alongside of [him]46-tom . [Tom]46-tom ’s mouth watered for the apple , but [he]46-tom stuck to [his]46-tom work . [Ben]57-ben said : “ Hello , [old chap]2083-old chap , [you]46-tom got to work , [hey]2084-hey ? ”[57-ben] [Tom]46-tom wheeled suddenly and said : “ Why , it ’s [you]57-ben , [Ben]57-ben ! [I]46-tom warn’t noticing . ”[46-tom] “ Say — [I’m]46-tom going in a - swimming , [I]46-tom am . Do n’t [you]57-ben wish [you]57-ben could ? But of course [you]57-ben ’d druther _ work_—wouldn’t [you]57-ben ? Course [you]57-ben would ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom contemplated [the boy]2044-the boy a bit , and said : “ What do [you]57-ben call work ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , ai n’t _ that _ work ? ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom resumed [his]46-tom whitewashing , and answered carelessly : “ Well , maybe it is , and maybe it ai n’t . All [I]46-tom know , is , it suits [Tom Sawyer]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ Oh come , now , [you]57-ben do n’t mean to let on that [you]57-ben _ like _ it ? ”[46-tom] The brush continued to move . “ Like it ? Well , [I]46-tom do n’t see why [I]46-tom ought n’t to like it . Does [a boy]191-a boy get a chance to whitewash a fence every day ? ”[46-tom] That put the thing in a new light . [Ben]57-ben stopped nibbling [his]57-ben apple . [Tom]46-tom swept [his]46-tom brush daintily back and forth — stepped back to note the effect — added a touch here and there — criticised the effect again — [Ben]57-ben watching every move and getting more and more interested , more and more absorbed . Presently [he]46-tom said : “ Say , [Tom]46-tom , let _ [me]46-tom _ whitewash a little . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom considered , was about to consent ; but [he]46-tom altered [his]46-tom mind : “ No — no — [I]46-tom reckon it would n’t hardly do , [Ben]57-ben . [You]57-ben see , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s awful particular about this fence — right here on [the street]215-the street , [you]57-ben know — but if it was the back fence [I]46-tom would n’t mind and _ [she]47-aunt polly _ would n’t . Yes , [she]47-aunt polly ’s awful particular about [this fence]2087-this fence ; it ’s got to be done very careful ; [I]46-tom reckon there ai n’t [one boy in a thousand , maybe two thousand]2088-one boy in a thousand , maybe two thousand , that can do it the way it ’s got to be done . ”[46-tom] “ No — is that so ? Oh come , now — lemme just try . Only just a little — [I’d]46-tom let _ [you]57-ben _ , if [you]57-ben was [me]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ [Ben]57-ben , [I]46-tom ’d like to , honest injun ; but [Aunt Polly]2089-aunt polly — well , [Jim]50-jim wanted to do it , but [she]2089-aunt polly would n’t let [him]50-jim ; [Sid]51-sid wanted to do it , and [she]2089-aunt polly would n’t let [Sid]51-sid . Now do n’t [you]57-ben see how [I]46-tom ’m fixed ? If [you]57-ben was to tackle this fence and anything was to happen to it — ”[46-tom] “ Oh , shucks , [I]46-tom ’ll be just as careful . Now lemme try . Say — [I’ll]46-tom give [you]57-ben the core of [my]46-tom apple . ”[46-tom] “ Well , here — No , [Ben]57-ben , now do n’t . [I]46-tom ’m afeard — ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom ’ll give [you]57-ben _ all _ of it ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom gave up the brush with reluctance in [his]46-tom face , but alacrity in [his]46-tom heart . And while [the late steamer Big Missouri]278-the late steamer big missouri worked and sweated in the sun , [the retired artist]279-the retired artist sat on a barrel in the shade close by , dangled [his]279-the retired artist legs , munched [his]279-the retired artist apple , and planned the slaughter of [more innocents]280-more innocents . There was no lack of material ; [boys]183-boys happened along every little while ; [they]183-boys came to jeer , but remained to whitewash . By the time [Ben]57-ben was fagged out , [Tom]46-tom had traded the next chance to [Billy Fisher]59-billy fisher for a kite , in good repair ; and when [he]46-tom played out , [Johnny Miller]60-johnny miller bought in for a dead rat and a string to swing it with — and so on , and so on , hour after hour . And when the middle of the afternoon came , from being [a poor poverty - stricken boy]282-a poor poverty - stricken boy in the morning , [Tom]46-tom was literally rolling in wealth . [He]46-tom had besides the things before mentioned , twelve marbles , part of a jews - harp , a piece of blue bottle - glass to look through , a spool cannon , a key that would n’t unlock anything , a fragment of chalk , a glass stopper of a decanter , [a tin soldier]283-a tin soldier , a couple of tadpoles , six fire - crackers , a kitten with only one eye , a brass door - knob , a dog - collar — but no dog — the handle of a knife , four pieces of orange - peel , and a dilapidated old window sash . [He]46-tom had had a nice , good , idle time all the while — plenty of company — and the fence had three coats of whitewash on it ! If [he]46-tom had n’t run out of whitewash [he]46-tom would have bankrupted [every boy in [the village]206-the village]284-every boy in the village . [Tom]46-tom said to [himself]46-tom that it was not such [a hollow world]286-a hollow world , after all . [He]46-tom had discovered a great law of human action , without knowing it — namely , that in order to make [a man]208-a man or [a boy]191-a boy covet a thing , it is only necessary to make the thing difficult to attain . If [he]46-tom had been [a great and wise philosopher]289-a great and wise philosopher , like [the writer of this book]290-the writer of this book , [he]46-tom would now have comprehended that Work consists of whatever a body is _ obliged _ to do , and that Play consists of whatever a body is not obliged to do . And this would help [him]46-tom to understand why constructing artificial flowers or performing on [a tread - mill]291-a tread - mill is work , while rolling ten - pins or climbing [Mont Blanc]6-mont blanc is only amusement . There are [wealthy gentlemen in [England]7-england]292-wealthy gentlemen in england who drive [four - horse passenger - coaches]293-four - horse passenger - coaches twenty or thirty miles on a daily line , in the summer , because the privilege costs [them]292-wealthy gentlemen in england considerable money ; but if [they]292-wealthy gentlemen in england were offered wages for the service , that would turn it into work and then [they]292-wealthy gentlemen in england would resign . [The boy]2044-the boy mused awhile over the substantial change which had taken place in [his]2044-the boy worldly circumstances , and then wended toward [headquarters]295-headquarters to report . CHAPTER III [Tom]46-tom presented [himself]46-tom before [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , who was sitting by an open window in [a pleasant rearward apartment]296-a pleasant rearward apartment , which was [bedroom]297-bedroom , [breakfast - room]298-breakfast - room , [dining - room]299-dining - room , and [library]300-library , combined . The balmy summer air , the restful quiet , the odor of the flowers , and the drowsing murmur of the bees had had their effect , and [she]47-aunt polly was nodding over [her]47-aunt polly knitting — for [she]47-aunt polly had no company but the cat , and it was asleep in [her]47-aunt polly lap . [Her]47-aunt polly spectacles were propped up on [her]47-aunt polly gray head for safety . [She]47-aunt polly had thought that of course [Tom]46-tom had deserted long ago , and [she]47-aunt polly wondered at seeing [him]46-tom place [himself]46-tom in [her]47-aunt polly power again in this intrepid way . [He]46-tom said : “ May n’t [I]46-tom go and play now , [aunt]2041-aunt ? ”[46-tom] “ What , [a’ready]2091-a’ready ? How much have [you]46-tom done ? ”[46-tom] “ It ’s all done , [aunt]2041-aunt . ”[46-tom] “ [Tom]46-tom , do n’t lie to [me]46-tom — [I]46-tom ca n’t bear it . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom ai n’t , [aunt]2041-aunt ; it _ is _ all done . ”[46-tom] [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly placed small trust in such evidence . [She]47-aunt polly went out to see for [herself]47-aunt polly ; and [she]47-aunt polly would have been content to find twenty per cent . of [Tom]46-tom ’s statement true . When [she]47-aunt polly found the entire fence white - washed , and not only whitewashed but elaborately coated and recoated , and even a streak added to the ground , [her]47-aunt polly astonishment was almost unspeakable . [She]47-aunt polly said : “ Well , [I]47-aunt polly never ! There ’s no getting round it , [you]46-tom can work when [you]46-tom ’re a mind to , [Tom]46-tom . ”[47-aunt polly] And then [she]47-aunt polly diluted the compliment by adding , “ But it ’s powerful seldom [you]46-tom ’re a mind to , [I]47-aunt polly ’m bound to say . Well , go ’ long and play ; but mind [you]46-tom get back some time in a week , or [I]47-aunt polly ’ll tan [you]46-tom . ”[47-aunt polly] [She]47-aunt polly was so overcome by the splendor of [his]46-tom achievement that [she]47-aunt polly took [him]46-tom into [the closet]301-the closet and selected a choice apple and delivered it to [him]46-tom , along with an improving lecture upon the added value and flavor a treat took to itself when it came without sin through virtuous effort . And while [she]47-aunt polly closed with a happy Scriptural flourish , [he]46-tom “ hooked ”[47-aunt polly] a doughnut . Then [he]46-tom skipped out , and saw [Sid]51-sid just starting up the outside stairway that led to [the back rooms on the second floor]302-the back rooms on the second floor . Clods were handy and the air was full of them in a twinkling . They raged around [Sid]51-sid like a hail - storm ; and before [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly could collect [her]47-aunt polly surprised faculties and [sally]61-sally to the rescue , six or seven clods had taken personal effect , and [Tom]46-tom was over the fence and gone . There was a gate , but as [a general thing]303-a general thing [he]46-tom was too crowded for time to make use of [it]304-it . [His]46-tom soul was at peace , now that [he]46-tom had settled with [Sid]51-sid for calling attention to [his]46-tom black thread and getting [him]46-tom into trouble . [Tom]46-tom skirted [the block]305-the block , and came round into [a muddy alley]306-a muddy alley that led by the back of [[[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ’s cow - stable]308-his aunt ’s cow - stable . [He]46-tom presently got safely beyond the reach of capture and punishment , and hastened toward [the public square of [the village]206-the village]309-the public square of the village , where [two “ military ”[312-general of one of these armies] companies of boys]311-two “ military ” companies of boys had met for conflict , according to previous appointment . [Tom]46-tom was [General of [one of [these armies]314-these armies]313-one of these armies]312-general of one of these armies , [Joe Harper]62-joe ( [a bosom friend ) General of the other]315-a bosom friend ) general of the other . [These two great commanders]316-these two great commanders did not condescend to fight in person — that being better suited to the still smaller fry — but sat together on an eminence and conducted the field operations by orders delivered through [aides - de - camp]317-aides - de - camp . [[Tom]46-tom ’s army]318-tom ’s army won a great victory , after a long and hard - fought battle . Then [the dead]319-the dead were counted , [prisoners]320-prisoners exchanged , the terms of the next disagreement agreed upon , and the day for the necessary battle appointed ; after which [the armies]321-the armies fell into line and marched away , and [Tom]46-tom turned homeward alone . As [he]46-tom was passing by [the house where [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher lived]322-the house where jeff thatcher lived , [he]46-tom saw [a new girl]323-a new girl in [the garden]192-the garden — [a lovely little blue - eyed creature with yellow hair plaited into two long - tails , white summer frock and embroidered pantalettes]325-a lovely little blue - eyed creature with yellow hair plaited into two long - tails , white summer frock and embroidered pantalettes . [The fresh - crowned hero fell without firing a shot]326-the fresh - crowned hero fell without firing a shot . A certain [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence vanished out of [his]46-tom heart and left not even a memory of [herself]64-amy lawrence behind . [He]46-tom had thought [he]46-tom loved [her]64-amy lawrence to distraction ; [he]46-tom had regarded [his]46-tom passion as adoration ; and behold it was only a poor little evanescent partiality . [He]46-tom had been months winning [her]64-amy lawrence ; [she]64-amy lawrence had confessed hardly a week ago ; [he]46-tom had been [the happiest and the proudest boy in [the world]328-the world]327-the happiest and the proudest boy in the world only seven short days , and here in one instant of time [she]64-amy lawrence had gone out of [his]46-tom heart like [a casual stranger whose visit is done]329-a casual stranger whose visit is done . [He]46-tom worshipped [this new angel]330-this new angel with furtive eye , till [he]46-tom saw that [she]64-amy lawrence had discovered [him]46-tom ; then [he]46-tom pretended [he]46-tom did not know [she]64-amy lawrence was present , and began to “ show off ”[46-tom] in all sorts of absurd boyish ways , in order to win [her]64-amy lawrence admiration . [He]46-tom kept up this grotesque foolishness for some time ; but by - and - by , while [he]46-tom was in the midst of some dangerous gymnastic performances , [he]46-tom glanced aside and saw that [the little girl]331-the little girl was wending [her]331-the little girl way toward [the house]332-the house . [Tom]46-tom came up to the fence and leaned on it , grieving , and hoping [she]331-the little girl would tarry yet awhile longer . [She]331-the little girl halted a moment on the steps and then moved toward the door . [Tom]46-tom heaved a great sigh as [she]331-the little girl put [her]331-the little girl foot on the threshold . But [his]46-tom face lit up , right away , for [she]331-the little girl tossed a pansy over the fence a moment before [she]331-the little girl disappeared . [The boy]2044-the boy ran around and stopped within a foot or two of the flower , and then shaded [his]2044-the boy eyes with [his]2044-the boy hand and began to look down street as if [he]2044-the boy had discovered something of interest going on in that direction . Presently [he]2044-the boy picked up a straw and began trying to balance it on [his]2044-the boy nose , with [his]2044-the boy head tilted far back ; and as [he]2044-the boy moved from side to side , in [his]2044-the boy efforts , [he]2044-the boy edged nearer and nearer toward the pansy ; finally [his]2044-the boy bare foot rested upon it , [his]2044-the boy pliant toes closed upon it , and [he]2044-the boy hopped away with the treasure and disappeared round the corner . But only for a minute — only while [he]2044-the boy could button the flower inside [his]2044-the boy jacket , next [his]2044-the boy heart — or next [his]2044-the boy stomach , possibly , for [he]2044-the boy was not much posted in anatomy , and not hypercritical , anyway . [He]2044-the boy returned , now , and hung about the fence till nightfall , “ showing off , ”[2044-the boy] as before ; but [the girl]334-the girl never exhibited [herself]334-the girl again , though [Tom]46-tom comforted [himself]46-tom a little with the hope that [she]334-the girl had been near some window , meantime , and been aware of [his]46-tom attentions . Finally [he]2044-the boy strode [home]197-home reluctantly , with [his]2044-the boy poor head full of visions . All through supper [his]2044-the boy spirits were so high that [[his]2044-the boy aunt]196-his aunt wondered “ what had got into [the child]2048-the child . ”[2044-the boy] [He]2044-the boy took a good scolding about clodding [Sid]51-sid , and did not seem to mind it in the least . [He]2044-the boy tried to steal sugar under [[his]2044-the boy aunt]196-his aunt ’s very nose , and got [his]2044-the boy knuckles rapped for it . [He]2044-the boy said : “ [Aunt]2095-aunt , [you]2095-aunt do n’t whack [Sid]51-sid when [he]51-sid takes it . ”[2044-the boy] “ Well , [Sid]51-sid do n’t torment a body the way [you]46-tom do . [You]46-tom ’d be always into that sugar if [I]2044-the boy warn’t watching [you]46-tom . ”[2044-the boy] Presently [she]196-his aunt stepped into [the kitchen]338-the kitchen , and [Sid]51-sid , happy in [his]51-sid immunity , reached for the sugar - bowl — a sort of glorying over [Tom]46-tom which was wellnigh unbearable . But [Sid]51-sid ’s fingers slipped and the bowl dropped and broke . [Tom]46-tom was in ecstasies . In such ecstasies that [he]46-tom even controlled [his]46-tom tongue and was silent . [He]46-tom said to [himself]46-tom that [he]46-tom would not speak a word , even when [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt came in , but would sit perfectly still till [she]196-his aunt asked who did the mischief ; and then [he]46-tom would tell , and there would be nothing so good in [the world]328-the world as to see [that pet model]341-that pet model “ catch it . ”[46-tom] [He]46-tom was so brimful of exultation that [he]46-tom could hardly hold [himself]46-tom when [the old lady]189-the old lady came back and stood above the wreck discharging lightnings of wrath from over [her]189-the old lady spectacles . [He]46-tom said to [himself]46-tom , “ Now it ’s coming ! ”[46-tom] And the next instant [he]46-tom was sprawling on the floor ! The potent palm was uplifted to strike again when [Tom]46-tom cried out : “ Hold on , now , what ’ er [you]189-the old lady belting _ [me]46-tom _ for?—Sid broke it ! ”[46-tom] [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly paused , perplexed , and [Tom]46-tom looked for healing pity . But when [she]189-the old lady got [her]189-the old lady tongue again , [she]189-the old lady only said : “ Umf ! Well , [you]46-tom did n’t get a lick amiss , [I]189-the old lady reckon . [You]46-tom been into some other audacious mischief when [I]189-the old lady was n’t around , like enough . ”[189-the old lady] Then [her]189-the old lady conscience reproached [her]189-the old lady , and [she]189-the old lady yearned to say something kind and loving ; but [she]189-the old lady judged that this would be construed into a confession that [she]189-the old lady had been in the wrong , and discipline forbade that . So [she]189-the old lady kept silence , and went about [her]189-the old lady affairs with a troubled heart . [Tom]46-tom sulked in a corner and exalted [his]46-tom woes . [He]46-tom knew that in [her]189-the old lady heart [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt was on [her]189-the old lady knees to [him]46-tom , and [he]46-tom was morosely gratified by the consciousness of it . [He]46-tom would hang out no signals , [he]46-tom would take notice of none . [He]46-tom knew that a yearning glance fell upon [him]46-tom , now and then , through a film of tears , but [he]46-tom refused recognition of it . [He]46-tom pictured [himself]46-tom lying sick unto death and [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt bending over [him]46-tom beseeching one little forgiving word , but [he]46-tom would turn [his]46-tom face to the wall , and die with that word unsaid . Ah , how would [she]196-his aunt feel then ? And [he]46-tom pictured [himself]46-tom brought [home]197-home from [the river]346-the river , dead , with [his]46-tom curls all wet , and [his]46-tom sore heart at rest . How [she]196-his aunt would throw [herself]196-his aunt upon [him]46-tom , and how [her]196-his aunt tears would fall like rain , and [her]196-his aunt lips pray [God]65-god to give [her]196-his aunt back [[her]196-his aunt boy]347-her boy and [she]196-his aunt would never , never abuse [him]46-tom any more ! But [he]46-tom would lie there cold and white and make no sign — [a poor little sufferer , whose griefs were at an end]348-a poor little sufferer , whose griefs were at an end . [He]46-tom so worked upon [his]46-tom feelings with the pathos of these dreams , that [he]46-tom had to keep swallowing , [he]46-tom was so like to choke ; and [his]46-tom eyes swam in a blur of water , which overflowed when [he]46-tom winked , and ran down and trickled from the end of [his]46-tom nose . And such a luxury to [him]46-tom was this petting of [his]46-tom sorrows , that [he]46-tom could not bear to have any worldly cheeriness or any grating delight intrude upon it ; it was too sacred for such contact ; and so , presently , when [[his]46-tom cousin]349-his cousin [Mary]47-aunt polly danced in , all alive with the joy of seeing [home]197-home again after an age - long visit of one week to [the country]351-the country , [he]46-tom got up and moved in clouds and darkness out at one door as [she]47-aunt polly brought song and sunshine in at the other . [He]46-tom wandered far from the accustomed haunts of [boys]183-boys , and sought desolate places that were in harmony with [his]46-tom spirit . [A log raft in [the river]346-the river]353-a log raft in the river invited [him]46-tom , and [he]46-tom seated [himself]46-tom on [its]353-a log raft in the river outer edge and contemplated the dreary vastness of [the stream]355-the stream , wishing , the while , that [he]46-tom could only be drowned , all at once and unconsciously , without undergoing the uncomfortable routine devised by nature . Then [he]46-tom thought of [his]46-tom flower . [He]46-tom got it out , rumpled and wilted , and it mightily increased [his]46-tom dismal felicity . [He]46-tom wondered if [she]47-aunt polly would pity [him]46-tom if [she]47-aunt polly knew ? Would [she]47-aunt polly cry , and wish that [she]47-aunt polly had a right to put [her]47-aunt polly arms around [his]46-tom neck and comfort [him]46-tom ? Or would [she]47-aunt polly turn coldly away like all [the hollow world]356-the hollow world ? This picture brought such an agony of pleasurable suffering that [he]46-tom worked it over and over again in [his]46-tom mind and set it up in new and varied lights , till [he]46-tom wore it threadbare . At last [he]46-tom rose up sighing and departed in the darkness . About half - past nine or ten o’clock [he]46-tom came along [the deserted street]357-the deserted street to where [the Adored Unknown]358-the adored unknown lived ; [he]46-tom paused a moment ; no sound fell upon [his]46-tom listening ear ; a candle was casting a dull glow upon the curtain of a second - story window . Was the sacred presence [there]2038-there ? [He]46-tom climbed the fence , threaded [his]46-tom stealthy way through the plants , till [he]46-tom stood under that window ; [he]46-tom looked up at [it]360-it long , and with emotion ; then [he]46-tom laid [him]46-tom down on the ground under it , disposing [himself]46-tom upon [his]46-tom back , with [his]46-tom hands clasped upon [his]46-tom breast and holding [his]46-tom poor wilted flower . And thus [he]46-tom would die — out in [the cold world]361-the cold world , with no shelter over [his]46-tom homeless head , no friendly hand to wipe the death - damps from [his]46-tom brow , no loving face to bend pityingly over [him]46-tom when the great agony came . And thus _ [she]362-she _ would see [him]46-tom when [she]362-she looked out upon the glad morning , and oh ! would [she]362-she drop one little tear upon [his]46-tom poor , lifeless form , would [she]362-she heave one little sigh to see [a bright young life so rudely blighted , so untimely cut down]363-a bright young life so rudely blighted , so untimely cut down ? The window went up , [a maid - servant]364-a maid - servant ’s discordant voice profaned the holy calm , and a deluge of water drenched [the prone martyr]365-the prone martyr ’s remains ! [The strangling hero]366-the strangling hero sprang up with a relieving snort . There was a whiz as of a missile in the air , mingled with the murmur of a curse , a sound as of shivering glass followed , and a small , vague form went over the fence and shot away in the gloom . Not long after , as [Tom]46-tom , all undressed for bed , was surveying [his]46-tom drenched garments by the light of a tallow dip , [Sid]51-sid woke up ; but if [he]51-sid had any dim idea of making any “ references to allusions , ”[51-sid] [he]51-sid thought better of it and held [his]51-sid peace , for there was danger in [Tom]46-tom ’s eye . [Tom]46-tom turned in without the added vexation of prayers , and [Sid]51-sid made mental note of the omission . CHAPTER IV The sun rose upon [a tranquil world]367-a tranquil world , and beamed down upon [the peaceful village]368-the peaceful village like a benediction . Breakfast over , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly had [family]369-family worship : it began with a prayer built from the ground up of solid courses of Scriptural quotations , welded together with a thin mortar of originality ; and from the summit of this [she]47-aunt polly delivered a grim chapter of the Mosaic Law , as from [Sinai]66-sinai . Then [Tom]46-tom girded up [his]46-tom loins , so to speak , and went to work to “ get [his]46-tom verses . ”[47-aunt polly] [Sid]51-sid had learned [his]51-sid lesson days before . [Tom]46-tom bent all [his]46-tom energies to the memorizing of five verses , and [he]46-tom chose part of the Sermon on [the Mount]370-the mount , because [he]46-tom could find no verses that were shorter . At the end of half an hour [Tom]46-tom had a vague general idea of [his]46-tom lesson , but no more , for [his]46-tom mind was traversing the whole field of human thought , and [his]46-tom hands were busy with distracting recreations . [Mary]47-aunt polly took [his]46-tom book to hear [him]46-tom recite , and [he]46-tom tried to find [his]46-tom way through the fog : “ Blessed are the — a — a — ”[47-aunt polly] “ [Poor]2096-poor ”[47-aunt polly] — “ Yes — poor ; blessed are [the poor]2097-the poor — a — a — ”[47-aunt polly] “ In spirit — ”[47-aunt polly] “ In spirit ; [blessed are the poor]2098-blessed are the poor in spirit , for [they]2098-blessed are the poor — [they]2098-blessed are the poor — ”[47-aunt polly] “ _ [Theirs]2098-blessed are the poor _ — ”[47-aunt polly] “ For _ [theirs]2098-blessed are the poor _ . Blessed are [the poor]2097-the poor in spirit , for [theirs]2097-the poor is [the kingdom of heaven]2100-the kingdom of heaven . Blessed are [they]2097-the poor that mourn , for [they]2097-the poor — [they]2097-the poor — ”[47-aunt polly] “ Sh — ”[47-aunt polly] “ For [they]2097-the poor — a — ”[47-aunt polly] “ S , H , A — ”[47-aunt polly] “ For [they]2097-the poor S , H — Oh , [I]47-aunt polly do n’t know what it is ! ”[47-aunt polly] “ _ Shall _ ! ”[47-aunt polly] “ Oh , _ shall _ ! for [they]2097-the poor shall — for [they]2097-the poor shall — a — a — shall mourn — a — a — blessed are [they]2097-the poor that shall — [they]2097-the poor that — a — [they]2097-the poor that shall mourn , for [they]2097-the poor shall — a — shall _ what _ ? Why do n’t [you]47-aunt polly tell [me]47-aunt polly , [Mary?—what]67-mary?—what do [you]47-aunt polly want to be so mean for ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ Oh , [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom poor thick - headed thing , [I]47-aunt polly ’m not teasing [you]46-tom . [I]47-aunt polly would n’t do that . [You]46-tom must go and learn it again . Do n’t [you]46-tom be discouraged , [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom ’ll manage it — and if [you]46-tom do , [I]47-aunt polly ’ll give [you]46-tom something ever so nice . There , now , that ’s [a good boy]2101-a good boy . ”[47-aunt polly] “ All right ! What is it , [Mary]47-aunt polly , tell [me]47-aunt polly what it is . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Never [you]46-tom mind , [Tom]46-tom . [You]46-tom know if [I]47-aunt polly say it ’s nice , it is nice . ”[47-aunt polly] “ [You]47-aunt polly bet [you]46-tom that ’s so , [Mary]47-aunt polly . All right , [I]47-aunt polly ’ll tackle it again . ”[47-aunt polly] And [he]371-he did “ tackle it again”—and[47-aunt polly] under the double pressure of curiosity and prospective gain [he]371-he did it with such spirit that [he]371-he accomplished a shining success . [Mary]47-aunt polly gave [him]371-he a brand - new “ Barlow ”[47-aunt polly] knife worth twelve and a half cents ; and the convulsion of delight that swept [his]371-he system shook [him]371-he to [his]371-he foundations . True , the knife would not cut anything , but it was [a “ sure - enough ”[372-a “ sure - enough ” barlow] Barlow]372-a “ sure - enough ” barlow , and there was inconceivable grandeur in that — though where [the Western boys]373-the western boys ever got the idea that such a weapon could possibly be counterfeited to its injury is an imposing mystery and will always remain so , perhaps . [Tom]46-tom contrived to scarify the cupboard with it , and was arranging to begin on the bureau , when [he]46-tom was called off to dress for Sunday - school . [Mary]47-aunt polly gave [him]371-he a tin basin of water and a piece of soap , and [he]371-he went outside the door and set the basin on a little bench there ; then [he]371-he dipped the soap in the water and laid it down ; turned up [his]371-he sleeves ; poured out the water on the ground , gently , and then entered [the kitchen]338-the kitchen and began to wipe [his]371-he face diligently on the towel behind the door . But [Mary]47-aunt polly removed the towel and said : “ Now ai n’t [you]46-tom ashamed , [Tom]46-tom . [You]46-tom must n’t be so bad . Water wo n’t hurt [you]46-tom . ”[47-aunt polly] [Tom]46-tom was a trifle disconcerted . The basin was refilled , and this time [he]46-tom stood over it a little while , gathering resolution ; took in a big breath and began . When [he]46-tom entered [the kitchen]338-the kitchen presently , with both eyes shut and groping for the towel with [his]46-tom hands , an honorable testimony of suds and water was dripping from [his]46-tom face . But when [he]46-tom emerged from the towel , [he]46-tom was not yet satisfactory , for the clean territory stopped short at [his]46-tom chin and [his]46-tom jaws , like a mask ; below and beyond this line there was a dark expanse of unirrigated soil that spread downward in front and backward around [his]46-tom neck . [Mary]47-aunt polly took [him]46-tom in hand , and when [she]47-aunt polly was done with [him]46-tom [he]46-tom was [a man]208-a man and [a brother , without distinction of color]377-a brother , without distinction of color , and [his]46-tom saturated hair was neatly brushed , and its short curls wrought into a dainty and symmetrical general effect . [ [He]46-tom privately smoothed out the curls , with labor and difficulty , and plastered [his]46-tom hair close down to [his]46-tom head ; for [he]46-tom held curls to be effeminate , and [his]46-tom own filled [his]46-tom life with bitterness . ] Then [Mary]47-aunt polly got out a suit of [his]46-tom clothing that had been used only on Sundays during two years — they were simply called [his]46-tom “ other clothes”—and[334-the girl] so by that [we]378-we know the size of [his]46-tom wardrobe . [The girl]334-the girl “ put [him]46-tom to rights ”[334-the girl] after [he]46-tom had dressed [himself]46-tom ; [she]334-the girl buttoned [his]46-tom neat roundabout up to [his]46-tom chin , turned [his]46-tom vast shirt collar down over [his]46-tom shoulders , brushed [him]46-tom off and crowned [him]46-tom with [his]46-tom speckled straw hat . [He]46-tom now looked exceedingly improved and uncomfortable . [He]46-tom was fully as uncomfortable as [he]46-tom looked ; for there was a restraint about whole clothes and cleanliness that galled [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom hoped that [Mary]47-aunt polly would forget [his]46-tom shoes , but the hope was blighted ; [she]47-aunt polly coated them thoroughly with tallow , as was the custom , and brought them out . [He]46-tom lost [his]46-tom temper and said [he]46-tom was always being made to do everything [he]46-tom did n’t want to do . But [Mary]47-aunt polly said , persuasively : “ Please , [Tom]46-tom — that ’s [a good boy]2101-a good boy . ”[47-aunt polly] So [he]46-tom got into the shoes snarling . [Mary]47-aunt polly was soon ready , and [the three children]380-the three children set out for Sunday - school — [a place that [Tom]46-tom hated with [his]46-tom whole heart]381-a place that tom hated with his whole heart ; but [Sid]51-sid and [Mary]47-aunt polly were fond of it . Sabbath - school hours were from nine to half - past ten ; and then church service . [Two of [the children]383-the children]382-two of the children always remained for the sermon voluntarily , and the other always remained too — for stronger reasons . [[The church]384-the church ’s high - backed , uncushioned pews]385-the church ’s high - backed , uncushioned pews would seat about [three hundred persons]386-three hundred persons ; [the edifice]387-the edifice was but a small , plain affair , with a sort of pine board tree - box on top of [it]387-the edifice for a steeple . At the door [Tom]46-tom dropped back a step and accosted [a Sunday - dressed comrade]388-a sunday - dressed comrade : “ Say , [Billy]59-billy fisher , got a yaller ticket ? ”[388-a sunday - dressed comrade] “ Yes . ”[388-a sunday - dressed comrade] “ What ’ll [you]388-a sunday - dressed comrade take for [her]388-a sunday - dressed comrade ? ”[388-a sunday - dressed comrade] “ What ’ll [you]388-a sunday - dressed comrade give ? ”[388-a sunday - dressed comrade] “ Piece of lickrish and a fish - hook . ”[388-a sunday - dressed comrade] “ Less see [’em]2103-’em . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom exhibited . [They]389-they were satisfactory , and [the property]390-the property changed hands . Then [Tom]46-tom traded [a couple of white alleys]391-a couple of white alleys for three red tickets , and some small trifle or other for a couple of blue ones . [He]46-tom waylaid [other boys]392-other boys as [they]392-other boys came , and went on buying tickets of various colors ten or fifteen minutes longer . [He]46-tom entered [the church]384-the church , now , with [a swarm of [clean and noisy boys]395-clean and noisy boys and [girls]184-girls]394-a swarm of clean and noisy boys and girls , proceeded to [his]46-tom seat and started a quarrel with [the first boy that came handy]397-the first boy that came handy . [The teacher]398-the teacher , [a grave , elderly man]399-a grave , elderly man , interfered ; then turned [his]398-the teacher back a moment and [Tom]46-tom pulled [a boy]191-a boy ’s hair in the next bench , and was absorbed in [his]46-tom book when [the boy]2044-the boy turned around ; stuck a pin in [another boy]402-another boy , presently , in order to hear [him]2044-the boy say “ Ouch ! ”[2044-the boy] and got a new reprimand from [[his]2044-the boy teacher]403-his teacher . [[Tom]46-tom ’s whole class]404-tom ’s whole class were of a pattern — restless , noisy , and troublesome . When [they]404-tom ’s whole class came to recite [their]404-tom ’s whole class lessons , [not one of [them]404-tom ’s whole class]405-not one of them knew [his]405-not one of them verses perfectly , but had to be prompted all along . However , [they]404-tom ’s whole class worried through , and each got [his]405-not one of them reward — in small blue tickets , each with a passage of Scripture on it ; each blue ticket was pay for two verses of the recitation . Ten blue tickets equalled a red one , and could be exchanged for it ; ten red tickets equalled a yellow one ; for ten yellow tickets [the superintendent]406-the superintendent gave a very plainly bound Bible ( worth forty cents in those easy times ) to [the pupil]407-the pupil . How many of [[my]0-i readers]408-my readers would have the industry and application to memorize two thousand verses , even for a Doré Bible ? And yet [Mary]47-aunt polly had acquired two Bibles in this way — it was the patient work of two years — and [a boy of German parentage]409-a boy of german parentage had won four or five . [He]409-a boy of german parentage once recited three thousand verses without stopping ; but the strain upon [his]409-a boy of german parentage mental faculties was too great , and [he]409-a boy of german parentage was little better than [an idiot]410-an idiot from that day forth — a grievous misfortune for [the school]411-the school , for on great occasions , before [company]412-company , [the superintendent]406-the superintendent ( as [Tom]46-tom expressed it ) had always made [this boy]223-this boy come out and “ spread [himself]409-a boy of german parentage . ”[406-the superintendent] Only [the older pupils]415-the older pupils managed to keep [their]415-the older pupils tickets and stick to [their]415-the older pupils tedious work long enough to get a Bible , and so the delivery of one of these prizes was a rare and noteworthy circumstance ; [the successful pupil]416-the successful pupil was so great and conspicuous for that day that on the spot [every scholar]417-every scholar ’s heart was fired with a fresh ambition that often lasted a couple of weeks . It is possible that [Tom]46-tom ’s mental stomach had never really hungered for one of those prizes , but unquestionably [his]46-tom entire being had for many a day longed for the glory and the eclat that came with it . In due course [the superintendent]406-the superintendent stood up in front of the pulpit , with a closed hymn - book in [his]406-the superintendent hand and [his]406-the superintendent forefinger inserted between its leaves , and commanded attention . When [a Sunday - school superintendent]419-a sunday - school superintendent makes [his]419-a sunday - school superintendent customary little speech , a hymn - book in the hand is as necessary as is the inevitable sheet of music in the hand of [a singer who stands forward on the platform and sings a solo at a concert]420-a singer who stands forward on the platform and sings a solo at a concert — though why , is a mystery : for neither the hymn - book nor the sheet of music is ever referred to by [the sufferer]421-the sufferer . [This superintendent]422-this superintendent was [a slim creature of thirty - five , with a sandy goatee and short sandy hair]423-a slim creature of thirty - five , with a sandy goatee and short sandy hair ; [he]422-this superintendent wore a stiff standing - collar whose upper edge almost reached [his]422-this superintendent ears and whose sharp points curved forward abreast the corners of [his]422-this superintendent mouth — a fence that compelled [a straight lookout ahead , and a turning of the whole body]424-a straight lookout ahead , and a turning of the whole body when a side view was required ; [his]422-this superintendent chin was propped on a spreading cravat which was as broad and as long as a bank - note , and had fringed ends ; [his]422-this superintendent boot toes were turned sharply up , in the fashion of the day , like sleigh - runners — an effect patiently and laboriously produced by [the young men]425-the young men by sitting with [their]425-the young men toes pressed against a wall for hours together . [Mr. Walters]68-mr. walters was very earnest of mien , and very sincere and honest at heart ; and [he]68-mr. walters held sacred things and places in such reverence , and so separated them from worldly matters , that unconsciously to [himself]68-mr. walters [his]68-mr. walters Sunday - school voice had acquired a peculiar intonation which was wholly absent on week - days . [He]68-mr. walters began after this fashion : “ Now , [children]182-children , [I]68-mr. walters want [you]182-children all to sit up just as straight and pretty as [you]182-children can and give [me]68-mr. walters all [your]182-children attention for a minute or two . There — that is it . That is the way [good little boys]2105-good little boys and [girls]184-girls should do . [I]68-mr. walters see [one little girl who is looking out of the window]2107-one little girl who is looking out of the window — [I]68-mr. walters am afraid [she]2107-one little girl who is looking out of the window thinks [I]68-mr. walters am out there somewhere — perhaps up in one of the trees making a speech to the little birds . [ Applausive titter . ] [I]68-mr. walters want to tell [you]182-children how good it makes [me]68-mr. walters feel to see so many bright , clean little faces assembled in a place like this , learning to do right and be good . ”[68-mr. walters] And so forth and so on . It is not necessary to set down the rest of the oration . It was of a pattern which does not vary , and so it is familiar to [us]426-us all . The latter third of the speech was marred by the resumption of fights and other recreations among [certain of [the bad boys]428-the bad boys]427-certain of the bad boys , and by fidgetings and whisperings that extended far and wide , washing even to the bases of isolated and incorruptible rocks like [Sid]51-sid and [Mary]47-aunt polly . But now every sound ceased suddenly , with the subsidence of [Mr. Walters]68-mr. walters ’ voice , and the conclusion of the speech was received with a burst of silent gratitude . A good part of the whispering had been occasioned by an event which was more or less rare — the entrance of [visitors]429-visitors : [lawyer Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher , accompanied by [a very feeble and aged man]430-a very feeble and aged man ; [a fine , portly , middle - aged gentleman with iron - gray hair]431-a fine , portly , middle - aged gentleman with iron - gray hair ; and [a dignified lady who was doubtless [the latter]433-the latter ’s wife]432-a dignified lady who was doubtless the latter ’s wife . [The lady]434-the lady was leading [a child]435-a child . [Tom]46-tom had been restless and full of chafings and repinings ; conscience - smitten , too — [he]46-tom could not meet [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence ’s eye , [he]46-tom could not brook [her]64-amy lawrence loving gaze . But when [he]46-tom saw [this small newcomer]436-this small newcomer [his]46-tom soul was all ablaze with bliss in a moment . The next moment [he]46-tom was “ showing off ”[46-tom] with all [his]46-tom might — cuffing [boys]183-boys , pulling hair , making faces — in a word , using every art that seemed likely to fascinate [a girl]438-a girl and win [her]438-a girl applause . [His]46-tom exaltation had but one alloy — the memory of [his]46-tom humiliation in [[this angel]439-this angel ’s garden]440-this angel ’s garden — and that record in sand was fast washing out , under the waves of happiness that were sweeping over it now . [The visitors]441-the visitors were given the highest seat of honor , and as soon as [Mr. Walters]68-mr. walters ’ speech was finished , [he]68-mr. walters introduced [them]441-the visitors to [the school]411-the school . [The middle - aged man]443-the middle - aged man turned out to be [a prodigious personage]444-a prodigious personage — no less a one than [the county judge]445-the county judge — altogether [the most august creation [these children]447-these children]446-the most august creation these children had ever looked upon — and [they]447-these children wondered what kind of material [he]443-the middle - aged man was made of — and [they]447-these children half wanted to hear [him]443-the middle - aged man roar , and were half afraid [he]443-the middle - aged man might , too . [He]443-the middle - aged man was from [Constantinople]8-constantinople , twelve miles away — so [he]443-the middle - aged man had travelled , and seen [the world]328-the world — these very eyes had looked upon [the county court - house — which was said to have a tin roof]449-the county court - house — which was said to have a tin roof . The awe which these reflections inspired was attested by the impressive silence and the ranks of staring eyes . This was [the great Judge [Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher , brother of [[their]447-these children own lawyer]451-their own lawyer]450-the great judge thatcher , brother of their own lawyer . [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher immediately went forward , to be familiar with [the great man]452-the great man and be envied by [the school]411-the school . It would have been music to [his]63-jeff thatcher soul to hear the whisperings : “ Look at [him]443-the middle - aged man , [Jim]50-jim ! [He]443-the middle - aged man ’s a going up there . Say — look ! [he]443-the middle - aged man ’s a going to shake hands with [him]443-the middle - aged man — [he]443-the middle - aged man _ is _ shaking hands with [him]443-the middle - aged man ! By jings , do n’t [you]50-jim wish [you]50-jim was [Jeff]63-jeff thatcher ? ”[68-mr. walters] [Mr. Walters]68-mr. walters fell to “ showing off , ”[68-mr. walters] with all sorts of official bustlings and activities , giving orders , delivering judgments , discharging directions here , there , everywhere that [he]68-mr. walters could find [a target]454-a target . [The librarian]455-the librarian “ showed off”—running[455-the librarian] hither and thither with [his]455-the librarian arms full of books and making a deal of the splutter and fuss that [insect authority]456-insect authority delights in . [The young lady teachers]457-the young lady teachers “ showed off”—bending[457-the young lady teachers] sweetly over [pupils that were lately being boxed]458-pupils that were lately being boxed , lifting pretty warning fingers at [bad little boys]459-bad little boys and patting [good ones]460-good ones lovingly . [The young gentlemen teachers]461-the young gentlemen teachers “ showed off ”[461-the young gentlemen teachers] with small scoldings and other little displays of authority and fine attention to discipline — and [most of [the teachers , of both sexes]463-the teachers , of both sexes]462-most of the teachers , of both sexes , found business up at [the library]464-the library , by the pulpit ; and it was business that frequently had to be done over again two or three times ( with much seeming vexation ) . [The little girls]465-the little girls “ showed off ”[465-the little girls] in various ways , and [the little boys]466-the little boys “ showed off ”[466-the little boys] with such diligence that the air was thick with paper wads and the murmur of scufflings . And above it all [the great man]452-the great man sat and beamed a majestic judicial smile upon all [the house]332-the house , and warmed [himself]452-the great man in the sun of [his]452-the great man own grandeur — for [he]452-the great man was “ showing off , ”[452-the great man] too . There was only one thing wanting to make [Mr. Walters]68-mr. walters ’ ecstasy complete , and that was a chance to deliver a Bible - prize and exhibit [a prodigy]469-a prodigy . [Several pupils]470-several pupils had a few yellow tickets , but none had enough — [he]452-the great man had been around among [the star pupils]471-the star pupils inquiring . [He]452-the great man would have given worlds , now , to have [that German lad]472-that german lad back again with a sound mind . And now at this moment , when hope was dead , [Tom Sawyer]46-tom came forward with nine yellow tickets , nine red tickets , and ten blue ones , and demanded a Bible . This was a thunderbolt out of a clear sky . [Walters]68-mr. walters was not expecting an application from [this source]473-this source for the next ten years . But there was no getting around it — here were [the certified checks]474-the certified checks , and [they]474-the certified checks were good for [their]474-the certified checks face . [Tom]46-tom was therefore elevated to [a place with [the Judge]476-the judge and [the other elect]477-the other elect]475-a place with the judge and the other elect , and the great news was announced from [headquarters]295-headquarters . It was the most stunning surprise of the decade , and so profound was the sensation that it lifted [the new hero]479-the new hero up to [the judicial one]480-the judicial one ’s altitude , and [the school]411-the school had two marvels to gaze upon in place of one . [The boys]2054-the boys were all eaten up with envy — but [those that suffered the bitterest pangs]483-those that suffered the bitterest pangs were those who perceived too late that [they]483-those that suffered the bitterest pangs [themselves]483-those that suffered the bitterest pangs had contributed to this hated splendor by trading tickets to [Tom]46-tom for the wealth [he]46-tom had amassed in selling whitewashing privileges . [These]484-these despised [themselves]484-these , as being [the dupes of a wily fraud]485-the dupes of a wily fraud , a guileful snake in the grass . The prize was delivered to [Tom]46-tom with as much effusion as [the superintendent could pump up under the circumstances]486-the superintendent could pump up under the circumstances ; but it lacked somewhat of the true gush , for [the poor fellow]487-the poor fellow ’s instinct taught [him]46-tom that there was a mystery here that could not well bear the light , perhaps ; it was simply preposterous that [this boy]223-this boy had warehoused two thousand sheaves of Scriptural wisdom on [[his]223-this boy premises]489-his premises — a dozen would strain [his]223-this boy capacity , without a doubt . [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence was proud and glad , and [she]64-amy lawrence tried to make [Tom]46-tom see it in [her]64-amy lawrence face — but [he]46-tom would n’t look . [She]64-amy lawrence wondered ; then [she]64-amy lawrence was just a grain troubled ; next a dim suspicion came and went — came again ; [she]64-amy lawrence watched ; a furtive glance told [her]64-amy lawrence worlds — and then [her]64-amy lawrence heart broke , and [she]64-amy lawrence was jealous , and angry , and the tears came and [she]64-amy lawrence hated [everybody]490-everybody . [Tom]46-tom most of all ( [she]64-amy lawrence thought ) .
