[Tom]46-tom was introduced to [the Judge]476-the judge ; but [his]46-tom tongue was tied , [his]46-tom breath would hardly come , [his]46-tom heart quaked — partly because of the awful greatness of [the man]492-the man , but mainly because [he]492-the man was [[her]64-amy lawrence parent]493-her parent . [He]476-the judge would have liked to fall down and worship [him]46-tom , if it were in the dark . [The Judge]476-the judge put [his]476-the judge hand on [Tom]46-tom ’s head and called [him]46-tom [a fine little man]495-a fine little man , and asked [him]46-tom what [his]46-tom name was . [The boy]2044-the boy stammered , gasped , and got it out : “ [Tom]46-tom . ”[2044-the boy] “ Oh , no , not [Tom]46-tom — it is — ”[476-the judge] “ [Thomas]46-tom . ”[476-the judge] “ Ah , that ’s it . [I]476-the judge thought there was more to it , maybe . That ’s very well . But [you]46-tom ’ve another one [I]476-the judge daresay , and [you]46-tom ’ll tell it to [me]476-the judge , wo n’t [you]46-tom ? ”[476-the judge] “ Tell [the gentleman]2108-the gentleman [your]46-tom other name , [Thomas]46-tom , ”[68-mr. walters] said [Walters]68-mr. walters , “ and say [sir]2078-sir . [You]46-tom must n’t forget [your]46-tom manners . ”[68-mr. walters] “ [Thomas Sawyer]46-tom — [sir]2078-sir . ”[476-the judge] “ That ’s it ! That ’s [a good boy]2101-a good boy . [Fine boy]2112-fine boy . [Fine , manly little fellow]2113-fine , manly little fellow . Two thousand verses is [a great many — very , very great many]2114-a great many — very , very great many . And [you]46-tom never can be sorry for the trouble [you]46-tom took to learn them ; for knowledge is worth more than anything there is in [the world]328-the world ; it ’s what makes [great men]2116-great men and [good men]2117-good men ; [you]46-tom ’ll be [a great man]2118-a great man and [a good man]2119-a good man [yourself]46-tom , some day , [Thomas]46-tom , and then [you]46-tom ’ll look back and say , It ’s all owing to the precious Sunday - school privileges of [[my]46-tom boyhood]2120-my boyhood — it ’s all owing to [[my]46-tom dear teachers]2121-my dear teachers that taught [me]46-tom to learn — it ’s all owing to [the good superintendent , who encouraged [me]46-tom , and watched over [me]46-tom , and gave [me]46-tom a beautiful Bible — a splendid elegant Bible — to keep and have it all for [my]46-tom own , always]2122-the good superintendent , who encouraged me , and watched over me , and gave me a beautiful bible — a splendid elegant bible — to keep and have it all for my own , always — it ’s all owing to right bringing up ! That is what [you]46-tom will say , [Thomas]46-tom — and [you]46-tom would n’t take any money for those two thousand verses — no indeed [you]46-tom would n’t . And now [you]46-tom would n’t mind telling [me]46-tom and [this lady]2123-this lady some of the things [you]46-tom ’ve learned — no , [I]46-tom know [you]46-tom wouldn’t — for [we]2124-we are proud of [little boys that learn]2125-little boys that learn . Now , no doubt [you]46-tom know the names of [all the twelve disciples]2126-all the twelve disciples . Wo n’t [you]46-tom tell [us]2124-we the names of [the first two that were appointed]2127-the first two that were appointed ? ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom was tugging at a button - hole and looking sheepish . [He]46-tom blushed , now , and [his]46-tom eyes fell . [Mr. Walters]68-mr. walters ’ heart sank within [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom said to [himself]46-tom , it is not possible that [the boy]2044-the boy can answer the simplest question — why _ did _ [the Judge]476-the judge ask [him]2044-the boy ? Yet [he]46-tom felt obliged to speak up and say : “ Answer [the gentleman]2108-the gentleman , [Thomas]46-tom — don’t be afraid . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom still hung fire . “ Now [I]434-the lady know [you]46-tom ’ll tell [me]434-the lady , ”[434-the lady] said [the lady]434-the lady . “ The names of [the first two disciples]2129-the first two disciples were — ”[434-the lady] “ _ [David]69-david and [Goliah]70-goliah ! _ ”[434-the lady] Let [us]500-us draw the curtain of charity over the rest of the scene . CHAPTER V About half - past ten the cracked bell of [the small church]501-the small church began to ring , and presently [the people]502-the people began to gather for the morning sermon . [The Sunday - school children]503-the sunday - school children distributed [themselves]503-the sunday - school children about [the house]332-the house and occupied pews with [[their]503-the sunday - school children parents]505-their parents , so as to be under supervision . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly came , and [Tom]46-tom and [Sid]51-sid and [Mary]47-aunt polly sat with [her]47-aunt polly — [Tom]46-tom being placed next the aisle , in order that [he]46-tom might be as far away from the open window and the seductive outside summer scenes as possible . [The crowd]506-the crowd filed up [the aisles]507-the aisles : [the aged and needy postmaster , who had seen better days]508-the aged and needy postmaster , who had seen better days ; [the mayor]509-the mayor and [[his]509-the mayor wife]510-his wife — for [they]511-they had [a mayor]512-a mayor [there]2038-there , among other unnecessaries ; [the justice of the peace]514-the justice of the peace ; [the widow [Douglas]71-the widow douglas]515-the widow douglas , fair , smart , and forty , [a generous , good - hearted soul and well - to - do]516-a generous , good - hearted soul and well - to - do , [[her]515-the widow douglas hill mansion [the only palace in [the town]519-the town]518-the only palace in the town]517-her hill mansion the only palace in the town , and the most hospitable and much the most lavish in the matter of festivities that [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg could boast ; [the bent and venerable Major]520-the bent and venerable major and [Mrs. Ward]72-mrs. ward ; [lawyer Riverson]73-lawyer riverson , [the new notable]521-the new notable from a distance ; next [the belle of [the village]206-the village]522-the belle of the village , followed by a troop of [lawn - clad and ribbon - decked young heart - breakers]524-lawn - clad and ribbon - decked young heart - breakers ; then all [the young clerks in [town]526-town]525-the young clerks in town in a body — for [they]525-the young clerks in town had stood in [the vestibule]527-the vestibule sucking [their]525-the young clerks in town cane - heads , a circling wall of [oiled and simpering admirers]528-oiled and simpering admirers , till [the last girl]529-the last girl had run [their]525-the young clerks in town gantlet ; and last of all came [the Model Boy , [Willie Mufferson]74-willie mufferson , taking as heedful care of [[his]74-willie mufferson mother]531-his mother as if [she]531-his mother were cut glass]530-the model boy , willie mufferson , taking as heedful care of his mother as if she were cut glass . [He]74-willie mufferson always brought [[his]74-willie mufferson mother]531-his mother to [church]533-church , and was the pride of [all the matrons]534-all the matrons . [The boys]2054-the boys all hated [him]74-willie mufferson , [he]74-willie mufferson was so good . And besides , [he]74-willie mufferson had been “ thrown up to [them]2054-the boys ”[74-willie mufferson] so much . [His]74-willie mufferson white handkerchief was hanging out of [his]74-willie mufferson pocket behind , as usual on Sundays — accidentally . [Tom]46-tom had no handkerchief , and [he]46-tom looked upon [boys who had as snobs]536-boys who had as snobs . [The congregation]537-the congregation being fully assembled , now , the bell rang once more , to warn [laggards and stragglers]538-laggards and stragglers , and then a solemn hush fell upon [the church]384-the church which was only broken by the tittering and whispering of the choir in [the gallery]540-the gallery . [The choir]541-the choir always tittered and whispered all through service . There was once [a church choir that was not ill - bred , but [I]0-i have forgotten where it was]542-a church choir that was not ill - bred , but i have forgotten where it was , now . It was a great many years ago , and [I]0-i can scarcely remember anything about it , but [I]0-i think it was in [some foreign country]543-some foreign country . [The minister]544-the minister gave out the hymn , and read it through with a relish , in a peculiar style which was much admired in [that part of [the country]351-the country]545-that part of the country . [His]74-willie mufferson voice began on a medium key and climbed steadily up till it reached a certain point , where it bore with strong emphasis upon the topmost word and then plunged down as if from a spring - board : Shall [I]0-i be car - ri - ed toe the skies , on flow’ry _ beds _ of ease , Whilst [others fight to win the prize]547-others fight to win the prize , and sail thro ’ _ blood _ -y seas ? [He]74-willie mufferson was regarded as [a wonderful reader]548-a wonderful reader . At [church “ sociables ”]2130-church “ sociables ”[74-willie mufferson] [he]74-willie mufferson was always called upon to read poetry ; and when [he]74-willie mufferson was through , [the ladies]549-the ladies would lift up [their]549-the ladies hands and let [them]549-the ladies fall helplessly in [their]549-the ladies laps , and “ wall ”[549-the ladies] [their]549-the ladies eyes , and shake [their]549-the ladies heads , as much as to say , “ Words can not express it ; it is too beautiful , TOO beautiful for [this mortal earth]2131-this mortal earth . ”[549-the ladies] After the hymn had been sung , [the Rev. Mr. Sprague]75-the rev. mr. sprague turned [himself]74-willie mufferson into a bulletin - board , and read off “ notices ”[549-the ladies] of meetings and societies and things till it seemed that the list would stretch out to the crack of doom — a queer custom which is still kept up in [America]9-america , even in [cities]550-cities , away [here]551-here in this age of abundant newspapers . Often , the less there is to justify a traditional custom , the harder it is to get rid of it . And now [the minister]544-the minister prayed . A good , generous prayer it was , and went into details : it pleaded for [the church]384-the church , and [the little children of [the church]384-the church]554-the little children of the church ; for [the other churches of [the village]206-the village]556-the other churches of the village ; for [the village]206-the village itself ; for [the county]559-the county ; for [the State]560-the state ; for [the State officers]561-the state officers ; for [the United States]10-the united states ; for [the churches of [the United States]563-the united states]562-the churches of the united states ; for Congress ; for [the President]564-the president ; for [the officers of [the Government]566-the government]565-the officers of the government ; for [poor sailors , tossed by stormy seas]567-poor sailors , tossed by stormy seas ; for [the oppressed millions groaning under the heel of European monarchies and Oriental despotisms]568-the oppressed millions groaning under the heel of european monarchies and oriental despotisms ; for such as have the light and the good tidings , and yet have not eyes to see nor ears to hear withal ; for the heathen in [the far islands of the sea]569-the far islands of the sea ; and closed with a supplication that the words [he]544-the minister was about to speak might find grace and favor , and be as seed sown in [fertile ground]570-fertile ground , yielding in time a grateful harvest of good . Amen . There was a rustling of dresses , and [the standing congregation]571-the standing congregation sat down . [The boy whose history this book relates]572-the boy whose history this book relates did not enjoy the prayer , [he]572-the boy whose history this book relates only endured it — if [he]572-the boy whose history this book relates even did that much . [He]572-the boy whose history this book relates was restive all through it ; [he]572-the boy whose history this book relates kept tally of the details of the prayer , unconsciously — for [he]572-the boy whose history this book relates was not listening , but [he]572-the boy whose history this book relates knew the ground of old , and [the clergyman]573-the clergyman ’s regular route over it — and when a little trifle of new matter was interlarded , [his]572-the boy whose history this book relates ear detected it and [his]572-the boy whose history this book relates whole nature resented it ; [he]572-the boy whose history this book relates considered additions unfair , and scoundrelly . In the midst of the prayer a fly had lit on the back of the pew in front of [him]572-the boy whose history this book relates and tortured [his]572-the boy whose history this book relates spirit by calmly rubbing its hands together , embracing its head with [its]574-its arms , and polishing it so vigorously that it seemed to almost part company with the body , and the slender thread of a neck was exposed to view ; scraping its wings with its hind legs and smoothing them to its body as if they had been coat - tails ; going through its whole toilet as tranquilly as if it knew it was perfectly safe . As indeed it was ; for as sorely as [Tom]46-tom ’s hands itched to grab for it [they]575-they did not dare — [he]46-tom believed [his]46-tom soul would be instantly destroyed if [he]46-tom did such a thing while the prayer was going on . But with the closing sentence [his]46-tom hand began to curve and steal forward ; and the instant the “ Amen ”[576-a prisoner of war] was out the fly was [a prisoner of war]576-a prisoner of war . [[His]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt detected the act and made [him]46-tom let it go . [The minister]544-the minister gave out [his]544-the minister text and droned along monotonously through an argument that was so prosy that [many a head by and by]579-many a head by and by began to nod — and yet it was an argument that dealt in limitless fire and brimstone and thinned [the predestined elect]580-the predestined elect down to a company so small as to be hardly worth the saving . [Tom]46-tom counted the pages of the sermon ; after [church]533-church [he]46-tom always knew how many pages there had been , but [he]46-tom seldom knew anything else about the discourse . However , this time [he]46-tom was really interested for a little while . [The minister]544-the minister made a grand and moving picture of the assembling together of [[the world]328-the world ’s hosts]584-the world ’s hosts at the millennium when the lion and the lamb should lie down together and [a little child]585-a little child should lead [them]586-them . But the pathos , the lesson , the moral of the great spectacle were lost upon [the boy]2044-the boy ; [he]2044-the boy only thought of the conspicuousness of [the principal character before the on - looking nations]588-the principal character before the on - looking nations ; [his]2044-the boy face lit with the thought , and [he]2044-the boy said to [himself]2044-the boy that [he]2044-the boy wished [he]2044-the boy could be [that child]589-that child , if it was a tame lion . Now [he]2044-the boy lapsed into suffering again , as the dry argument was resumed . Presently [he]2044-the boy bethought [him]2044-the boy of a treasure [he]2044-the boy had and got it out . It was [a large black beetle with formidable jaws — a “ pinchbug]2132-a large black beetle with formidable jaws — a “ pinchbug , ”[2044-the boy] [he]2044-the boy called it . It was in a percussion - cap box . The first thing the beetle did was to take [him]2044-the boy by the finger . A natural fillip followed , the beetle went floundering into [the aisle]590-the aisle and lit on its back , and the hurt finger went into [the boy]2044-the boy ’s mouth . [The beetle]592-the beetle lay there working its helpless legs , unable to turn over . [Tom]46-tom eyed it , and longed for it ; but it was safe out of [his]46-tom reach . [Other people uninterested in the sermon]593-other people uninterested in the sermon found relief in the beetle , and [they]593-other people uninterested in the sermon eyed it too . Presently a vagrant poodle dog came idling along , sad at heart , lazy with the summer softness and the quiet , weary of captivity , sighing for change . [He]594-his spied the beetle ; the drooping tail lifted and wagged . [He]594-his surveyed the prize ; walked around it ; smelt at it from a safe distance ; walked around it again ; grew bolder , and took a closer smell ; then lifted [his]594-his lip and made a gingerly snatch at it , just missing it ; made another , and another ; began to enjoy the diversion ; subsided to [his]594-his stomach with the beetle between [his]594-his paws , and continued [his]594-his experiments ; grew weary at last , and then indifferent and absent - minded . [His]594-his head nodded , and little by little [his]594-his chin descended and touched [the enemy]245-the enemy , who seized it . There was a sharp yelp , a flirt of the poodle ’s head , and the beetle fell a couple of yards away , and lit on its back once more . [The neighboring spectators]596-the neighboring spectators shook with a gentle inward joy , [several faces]597-several faces went behind [fans and hand - kerchiefs]598-fans and hand - kerchiefs , and [Tom]46-tom was entirely happy . The dog looked foolish , and probably felt so ; but there was resentment in [his]594-his heart , too , and a craving for revenge . So [he]594-his went to the beetle and began a wary attack on it again ; jumping at [it]592-the beetle from every point of a circle , lighting with [his]594-his fore - paws within an inch of the creature , making even closer snatches at it with [his]594-his teeth , and jerking [his]594-his head till [his]594-his ears flapped again . But [he]594-his grew tired once more , after a while ; tried to amuse [himself]594-his with a fly but found no relief ; followed an ant around , with [his]594-his nose close to the floor , and quickly wearied of that ; yawned , sighed , forgot the beetle entirely , and sat down on it . Then there was a wild yelp of agony and the poodle went sailing up [the aisle]590-the aisle ; the yelps continued , and so did the dog ; [he]594-his crossed [the house]332-the house in front of the altar ; [he]594-his flew down [the other aisle]601-the other aisle ; [he]594-his crossed before the doors ; [he]594-his clamored up the home - stretch ; [his]594-his anguish grew with [his]594-his progress , till presently [he]594-his was but a woolly comet moving in its orbit with the gleam and the speed of light . At last [the frantic sufferer]602-the frantic sufferer sheered from its course , and sprang into [its master]603-its master ’s lap ; [he]594-his flung it out of the window , and the voice of distress quickly thinned away and died in the distance . By this time [the whole church]604-the whole church was red - faced and suffocating with suppressed laughter , and the sermon had come to a dead standstill . The discourse was resumed presently , but it went lame and halting , all possibility of impressiveness being at an end ; for even the gravest sentiments were constantly being received with a smothered burst of unholy mirth , under cover of some remote pew - back , as if [the poor parson]605-the poor parson had said a rarely facetious thing . It was a genuine relief to [the whole congregation]606-the whole congregation when the ordeal was over and the benediction pronounced . [Tom Sawyer]46-tom went [home]197-home quite cheerful , thinking to [himself]46-tom that there was some satisfaction about divine service when there was a bit of variety in it . [He]46-tom had but one marring thought ; [he]46-tom was willing that the dog should play with [his]594-his pinchbug , but [he]46-tom did not think it was upright in [him]46-tom to carry it off . CHAPTER VI Monday morning found [Tom Sawyer]46-tom miserable . Monday morning always found [him]46-tom so — because it began another week ’s slow suffering in [school]2056-school . [He]46-tom generally began that day with wishing [he]46-tom had had no intervening holiday , it made the going into captivity and fetters again so much more odious . [Tom]46-tom lay thinking . Presently it occurred to [him]46-tom that [he]46-tom wished [he]46-tom was sick ; then [he]46-tom could stay [home]197-home from [school]2056-school . [Here]551-here was a vague possibility . [He]46-tom canvassed [his]46-tom system . No ailment was found , and [he]46-tom investigated again . This time [he]46-tom thought [he]46-tom could detect colicky symptoms , and [he]46-tom began to encourage them with considerable hope . But they soon grew feeble , and presently died wholly away . [He]46-tom reflected further . Suddenly [he]46-tom discovered something . One of [his]46-tom upper front teeth was loose . This was lucky ; [he]46-tom was about to begin to groan , as a “ starter , ”[46-tom] as [he]46-tom called it , when it occurred to [him]46-tom that if [he]46-tom came into [court]612-court with that argument , [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt would pull it out , and that would hurt . So [he]46-tom thought [he]46-tom would hold the tooth in reserve for the present , and seek further . Nothing offered for some little time , and then [he]46-tom remembered hearing [the doctor]614-the doctor tell about a certain thing that laid up [a patient]615-a patient for two or three weeks and threatened to make [him]615-a patient lose a finger . So [the boy]2044-the boy eagerly drew [his]2044-the boy sore toe from under the sheet and held it up for inspection . But now [he]46-tom did not know the necessary symptoms . However , it seemed well worth while to chance it , so [he]46-tom fell to groaning with considerable spirit . But [Sid]51-sid slept on unconscious . [Tom]46-tom groaned louder , and fancied that [he]46-tom began to feel pain in the toe . No result from [Sid]51-sid . [Tom]46-tom was panting with [his]46-tom exertions by this time . [He]46-tom took a rest and then swelled [himself]46-tom up and fetched a succession of admirable groans . [Sid]51-sid snored on . [Tom]46-tom was aggravated . [He]46-tom said , “ [Sid]51-sid , [Sid]51-sid ! ”[46-tom] and shook [him]51-sid . This course worked well , and [Tom]46-tom began to groan again . [Sid]51-sid yawned , stretched , then brought [himself]51-sid up on [his]51-sid elbow with a snort , and began to stare at [Tom]46-tom . [Tom]46-tom went on groaning . [Sid]51-sid said : “ [Tom]46-tom ! Say , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[51-sid] [ No response . ] “ Here , [Tom]46-tom ! [TOM]46-tom ! What is the matter , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[51-sid] And [he]51-sid shook [him]46-tom and looked in [his]46-tom face anxiously . [Tom]46-tom moaned out : “ Oh , do n’t , [Sid]51-sid . Do n’t joggle [me]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ Why , what ’s the matter , [Tom]46-tom ? [I]51-sid must call [auntie]2133-auntie . ”[51-sid] “ No — never mind . It ’ll be over by and by , maybe . Do n’t call [anybody]203-anybody . ”[51-sid] “ But [I]46-tom must ! _ Do n’t _ groan so , [Tom]46-tom , it ’s awful . How long [you]46-tom been this way ? ”[46-tom] “ Hours . Ouch ! Oh , do n’t stir so , [Sid]51-sid , [you]51-sid ’ll kill [me]51-sid . ”[51-sid] “ [Tom]46-tom , why did n’t [you]51-sid wake [me]51-sid sooner ? Oh , [Tom]46-tom , _ do n’t ! _ It makes [my]51-sid flesh crawl to hear [you]51-sid . [Tom]46-tom , what is the matter ? ”[51-sid] “ [I]51-sid forgive [you]51-sid everything , [Sid]51-sid . [ Groan . ] Everything [you]51-sid ’ve ever done to [me]51-sid . When [I]51-sid ’m gone — ”[51-sid] “ Oh , [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom ai n’t dying , are [you]46-tom ? Do n’t , [Tom]46-tom — oh , do n’t . Maybe — ”[51-sid] “ [I]51-sid forgive [everybody]490-everybody , [Sid]51-sid . [ Groan . ] Tell ’em so , [Sid]51-sid . And [Sid]51-sid , [you]51-sid give [my]51-sid window - sash and [my]51-sid cat with one eye to [that new girl that ’s come to [town]526-town]2136-that new girl that ’s come to town , and tell [her]2136-that new girl that ’s come to town — ”[51-sid] But [Sid]51-sid had snatched [his]51-sid clothes and gone . [Tom]46-tom was suffering in reality , now , so handsomely was [his]46-tom imagination working , and so [his]46-tom groans had gathered quite a genuine tone . [Sid]51-sid flew [downstairs]617-downstairs and said : “ Oh , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , come ! [Tom]46-tom ’s dying ! ”[51-sid] “ Dying ! ”[51-sid] “ Yes’m . Do n’t wait — come quick ! ”[51-sid] “ [Rubbage]11-rubbage ! [I]51-sid do n’t believe it ! ”[51-sid] But [she]618-she fled [upstairs]619-upstairs , nevertheless , with [Sid]51-sid and [Mary]47-aunt polly at [her]618-she heels . And [her]618-she face grew white , too , and [her]618-she lip trembled . When [she]618-she reached the bedside [she]618-she gasped out : “ [You]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom ! [Tom]46-tom , what ’s the matter with [you]46-tom ? ”[618-she] “ Oh , [auntie]2133-auntie , [I]51-sid ’m — ”[51-sid] “ What ’s the matter with [you]46-tom — what is the matter with [you]46-tom , [child]2139-child ? ”[189-the old lady] “ Oh , [auntie]2133-auntie , [my]189-the old lady sore toe ’s mortified ! ”[189-the old lady] [The old lady]189-the old lady sank down into a chair and laughed a little , then cried a little , then did both together . This restored [her]189-the old lady and [she]189-the old lady said : “ [Tom]46-tom , what a turn [you]46-tom did give [me]189-the old lady . Now [you]46-tom shut up that nonsense and climb out of this . ”[189-the old lady] The groans ceased and the pain vanished from the toe . [The boy]2044-the boy felt a little foolish , and [he]2044-the boy said : “ [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , it _ seemed _ mortified , and it hurt so [I]2044-the boy never minded [my]2044-the boy tooth at all . ”[2044-the boy] “ [Your]46-tom tooth , indeed ! What ’s the matter with [your]46-tom tooth ? ”[189-the old lady] “ One of them ’s loose , and it aches perfectly awful . ”[189-the old lady] “ There , there , now , do n’t begin that groaning again . Open [your]46-tom mouth . Well — [your]46-tom tooth _ is _ loose , but [you]46-tom ’re not going to die about that . [Mary]47-aunt polly , get [me]46-tom a silk thread , and a chunk of fire out of [the kitchen]338-the kitchen . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom said : “ Oh , please , [auntie]2133-auntie , do n’t pull it out . It do n’t hurt any more . [I]2044-the boy wish [I]2044-the boy may never stir if it does . Please do n’t , [auntie]2133-auntie . [I]2044-the boy do n’t want to stay [home]197-home from [school]2056-school . ”[2044-the boy] “ Oh , [you]46-tom do n’t , do n’t [you]46-tom ? So all this row was because [you]46-tom thought [you]46-tom ’d get to stay [home]197-home from [school]2056-school and go a - fishing ? [Tom]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , [I]189-the old lady love [you]46-tom so , and [you]46-tom seem to try every way [you]46-tom can to break [my]189-the old lady old heart with [your]46-tom outrageousness . ”[189-the old lady] By this time the dental instruments were ready . [The old lady]189-the old lady made one end of the silk thread fast to [Tom]46-tom ’s tooth with a loop and tied the other to the bedpost . Then [she]189-the old lady seized the chunk of fire and suddenly thrust it almost into [the boy]2044-the boy ’s face . The tooth hung dangling by the bedpost , now . But all trials bring [their]624-their compensations . As [Tom]46-tom wended to [school]2056-school after breakfast , [he]46-tom was the envy of [every boy [he]46-tom met]626-every boy he met because the gap in [his]46-tom upper row of teeth enabled [him]46-tom to expectorate in a new and admirable way . [He]46-tom gathered quite a following of [lads interested in the exhibition]627-lads interested in the exhibition ; and one that had cut [his]46-tom finger and had been [a centre of fascination and homage up to this time]628-a centre of fascination and homage up to this time , now found [himself]46-tom suddenly without [an adherent]629-an adherent , and shorn of [his]46-tom glory . [His]46-tom heart was heavy , and [he]46-tom said with a disdain which [he]46-tom did not feel that it was n’t anything to spit like [Tom Sawyer]46-tom ; but [another boy]402-another boy said , “ Sour grapes ! ”[46-tom] and [he]46-tom wandered away [a dismantled hero]631-a dismantled hero . Shortly [Tom]46-tom came upon [the juvenile pariah of [the village]206-the village]632-the juvenile pariah of the village , [Huckleberry Finn]45-huck , [son of [the town drunkard]635-the town drunkard]634-son of the town drunkard . [Huckleberry]45-huck was cordially hated and dreaded by [all the mothers of [the town]519-the town]636-all the mothers of the town , because [he]45-huck was idle and lawless and vulgar and bad — and because all [[their]636-all the mothers of the town children]638-their children admired [him]45-huck so , and delighted in [his]45-huck forbidden society , and wished [they]638-their children dared to be like [him]45-huck . [Tom]46-tom was like [the rest of [the respectable boys]640-the respectable boys]639-the rest of the respectable boys , in that [he]46-tom envied [Huckleberry]45-huck [his]46-tom gaudy outcast condition , and was under strict orders not to play with [him]45-huck . So [he]46-tom played with [him]45-huck every time [he]46-tom got a chance . [Huckleberry]45-huck was always dressed in the cast - off clothes of [full - grown men]641-full - grown men , and [they]641-full - grown men were in perennial bloom and fluttering with rags . [His]45-huck hat was a vast ruin with a wide crescent lopped out of its brim ; [his]45-huck coat , when [he]45-huck wore one , hung nearly to [his]45-huck heels and had the rearward buttons far down the back ; but one suspender supported [his]45-huck trousers ; the seat of the trousers bagged low and contained nothing , the fringed legs dragged in the dirt when not rolled up . [Huckleberry]45-huck came and went , at [his]45-huck own free will . [He]45-huck slept on [doorsteps]642-doorsteps in fine weather and in empty hogsheads in wet ; [he]45-huck did not have to go to [school]2056-school or to [church]533-church , or call any being [master]645-master or obey [anybody]203-anybody ; [he]45-huck could go fishing or swimming when and where [he]45-huck chose , and stay as long as it suited [him]45-huck ; [nobody]647-nobody forbade [him]45-huck to fight ; [he]45-huck could sit up as late as [he]45-huck pleased ; [he]45-huck was always [the first boy that went barefoot in the spring and the last to resume leather in the fall]648-the first boy that went barefoot in the spring and the last to resume leather in the fall ; [he]45-huck never had to wash , nor put on clean clothes ; [he]45-huck could swear wonderfully . In a word , everything that goes to make life precious [that boy]2035-that boy had . So thought [every harassed , hampered , respectable boy in [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg]650-every harassed , hampered , respectable boy in st. petersburg . [Tom]46-tom hailed [the romantic outcast]651-the romantic outcast : “ Hello , [Huckleberry]45-huck ! ”[46-tom] “ Hello [yourself]45-huck , and see how [you]45-huck like it . ”[45-huck] “ What ’s that [you]45-huck got ? ”[45-huck] “ Dead cat . ”[46-tom] “ Lemme see [him]2035-that boy , [Huck]45-huck . [My]45-huck , [he]2035-that boy ’s pretty stiff . Where ’d [you]45-huck get [him]2035-that boy ? ”[45-huck] “ Bought [him]2035-that boy off’n [a boy]191-a boy . ”[45-huck] “ What did [you]45-huck give ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]46-tom give a blue ticket and a bladder that [I]46-tom got at [the slaughter - house]2149-the slaughter - house . ”[46-tom] “ Where ’d [you]45-huck get the blue ticket ? ”[45-huck] “ Bought it off’n [Ben Rogers]57-ben two weeks ago for a hoop - stick . ”[45-huck] “ Say — what is dead cats good for , [Huck]45-huck ? ”[45-huck] “ Good for ? Cure warts with . ”[46-tom] “ No ! Is that so ? [I]45-huck know something that ’s better . ”[45-huck] “ [I]45-huck bet [you]45-huck do n’t . What is it ? ”[45-huck] “ Why , spunk - water . ”[45-huck] “ Spunk - water ! [I]46-tom would n’t give a dern for spunk - water . ”[46-tom] “ [You]45-huck would n’t , would n’t [you]45-huck ? [D’you]45-huck ever try it ? ”[45-huck] “ No , [I]45-huck hain’t . But [Bob Tanner]76-bob tanner did . ”[45-huck] “ Who told [you]45-huck so ! ”[45-huck] “ Why , [he]76-bob tanner told [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher , and [Jeff]63-jeff thatcher told [Johnny Baker]77-johnny baker , and [Johnny]77-johnny baker told [Jim Hollis]50-jim , and [Jim]50-jim told [Ben Rogers]57-ben , and [Ben]57-ben told [a nigger]2150-a nigger , and [the nigger]2151-the nigger told [me]46-tom . [There]2038-there now ! ”[46-tom] “ Well , what of it ? [They]2153-they ’ll all lie . Leastways all but [the nigger]2151-the nigger . [I]45-huck do n’t know _ [him]2151-the nigger _ . But [I]45-huck never see [a nigger]2150-a nigger that _ would n’t _ lie . Shucks ! Now [you]45-huck tell [me]45-huck how [Bob Tanner]76-bob tanner done it , [Huck]45-huck . ”[45-huck] “ Why , [he]76-bob tanner took and dipped [his]76-bob tanner hand in a rotten stump where the rain - water was . ”[45-huck] “ In the daytime ? ”[45-huck] “ Certainly . ”[46-tom] “ With [his]76-bob tanner face to the stump ? ”[45-huck] “ Yes . Least [I]45-huck reckon so . ”[45-huck] “ Did [he]76-bob tanner say anything ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom do n’t reckon [he]76-bob tanner did . [I]46-tom do n’t know . ”[46-tom] “ Aha ! Talk about trying to cure warts with spunk - water such a blame fool way as that ! Why , that ai n’t a - going to do any good . [You]45-huck got to go all by [yourself]45-huck , to [the middle of [the woods]2157-the woods]2156-the middle of the woods , where [you]45-huck know there ’s a spunk - water stump , and just as it ’s midnight [you]45-huck back up against the stump and jam [your]45-huck hand in and say : ‘ Barley - corn , barley - corn , injun - meal shorts , Spunk - water , spunk - water , swaller these warts , ’ and then walk away quick , eleven steps , with [your]45-huck eyes shut , and then turn around three times and walk [home]197-home without speaking to [anybody]203-anybody . Because if [you]45-huck speak the charm ’s busted . ”[45-huck] “ Well , that sounds like a good way ; but that ai n’t the way [Bob Tanner]76-bob tanner done . ”[45-huck] “ No , [sir]2078-sir , [you]45-huck can bet [he]76-bob tanner did n’t , becuz [he]76-bob tanner ’s [the wartiest boy in [this town]2162-this town]2161-the wartiest boy in this town ; and [he]76-bob tanner would n’t have a wart on [him]76-bob tanner if [he]76-bob tanner ’d knowed how to work spunk - water . [I]46-tom ’ve took off thousands of warts off of [my]46-tom hands that way , [Huck]45-huck . [I]46-tom play with [frogs]2163-frogs so much that [I]46-tom ’ve always got considerable many warts . Sometimes [I]46-tom take [’em]2164-’em off with a bean . ”[46-tom] “ Yes , bean ’s good . [I]46-tom ’ve done that . ”[46-tom] “ Have [you]45-huck ? What ’s [your]45-huck way ? ”[45-huck] “ [You]45-huck take and split the bean , and cut the wart so as to get some blood , and then [you]45-huck put the blood on one piece of the bean and take and dig a hole and bury it ’bout midnight at the crossroads in the dark of the moon , and then [you]45-huck burn up the rest of the bean . [You]45-huck see that piece that ’s got the blood on it will keep drawing and drawing , trying to fetch the other piece to it , and so that helps the blood to draw the wart , and pretty soon off [she]2165-she comes . ”[45-huck] “ Yes , that ’s it , [Huck]45-huck — that ’s it ; though when [you]45-huck ’re burying it if [you]45-huck say ‘ Down bean ; off wart ; come no more to bother [me]46-tom ! ’ it ’s better . That ’s the way [Joe Harper]62-joe does , and [he]62-joe ’s been nearly to [Coonville]12-coonville and most everywheres . But say — how do [you]45-huck cure ’em with dead cats ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , [you]45-huck take [your]45-huck cat and go and get in [the grave - yard]2166-the grave - yard ’ long about midnight when [somebody that was wicked]2167-somebody that was wicked has been buried ; and when it ’s midnight [a devil]2168-a devil will come , or maybe two or three , but [you]45-huck ca n’t see ’em , [you]45-huck can only hear something like the wind , or maybe hear ’em talk ; and when [they]2168-a devil ’re taking [that feller]2169-that feller away , [you]45-huck heave [your]45-huck cat after ’em and say , ‘ [Devil]78-devil follow corpse , cat follow devil , [warts]2170-warts follow cat , [I]46-tom ’m done with [ye]2169-that feller ! ’ That ’ll fetch _ any _ wart . ”[46-tom] “ Sounds right . D’you ever try it , [Huck]45-huck ? ”[45-huck] “ No , but [old Mother Hopkins]79-old mother hopkins told [me]45-huck . ”[45-huck] “ Well , [I]46-tom reckon it ’s so , then . Becuz [they]2168-a devil say [she]2169-that feller ’s [a witch]2171-a witch . ”[46-tom] “ Say ! Why , [Tom]46-tom , [I]46-tom _ know _ [she]2169-that feller is . [She]2169-that feller witched [pap]2172-pap . [Pap]80-pap says so [[his]80-pap own self]2173-his own self . [He]2172-pap come along one day , and [he]2172-pap see [she]2169-that feller was a - witching [him]2172-pap , so [he]2172-pap took up a rock , and if [she]2169-that feller had n’t dodged , [he]2172-pap ’d a got [her]2169-that feller . Well , that very night [he]2172-pap rolled off’n [a shed]2174-a shed wher ’ [he]2172-pap was [a layin drunk]2175-a layin drunk , and broke [his]2172-pap arm . ”[46-tom] “ Why , that ’s awful . How did [he]2172-pap know [she]2169-that feller was a - witching [him]2172-pap ? ”[45-huck] “ [Lord]2176-lord , [pap]2172-pap can tell , easy . [Pap]80-pap says when [they]2178-they keep looking at [you]2179-you right stiddy , [they]2178-they ’re a - witching [you]2179-you . Specially if [they]2178-they mumble . Becuz when [they]2178-they mumble [they]2178-they ’re saying [the Lord]2047-the lord ’s Prayer backards . ”[45-huck] “ Say , [Hucky]45-huck , when [you]45-huck going to try the cat ? ”[46-tom] “ To - night . [I]46-tom reckon [they]2178-they ’ll come after [old Hoss Williams]81-old hoss williams to - night . ”[46-tom] “ But [they]2178-they buried [him]2172-pap Saturday . Did n’t [they]2178-they get [him]2172-pap Saturday night ? ”[45-huck] “ Why , how [you]45-huck talk ! How could [their]2178-they charms work till midnight?—and _ then _ it ’s Sunday . [Devils]82-devils do n’t slosh around much of a Sunday , [I]45-huck do n’t reckon . ”[45-huck] “ [I]46-tom never thought of that . That ’s so . Lemme go with [you]45-huck ? ”[46-tom] “ Of course — if [you]45-huck ai n’t afeard . ”[46-tom] “ Afeard ! ’ Tain’t likely . Will [you]45-huck meow ? ”[45-huck] “ Yes — and [you]45-huck meow back , if [you]45-huck get a chance . Last time , [you]45-huck kep ’ [me]45-huck a - meowing around till [old Hays]83-old hays went to throwing rocks at [me]45-huck and says ‘ [Dern that cat]2181-dern that cat ! ’ and so [I]45-huck hove a brick through [his]83-old hays window — but do n’t [you]45-huck tell . ”[45-huck] “ [I]46-tom wo n’t . [I]46-tom could n’t meow that night , becuz [auntie]84-auntie was watching [me]46-tom , but [I]46-tom ’ll meow this time . Say — what ’s that ? ”[46-tom] “ Nothing but a tick . ”[46-tom] “ Where ’d [you]45-huck get [him]2181-dern that cat ? ”[45-huck] “ Out in [the woods]2157-the woods . ”[45-huck] “ What ’ll [you]45-huck take for [him]2181-dern that cat ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]45-huck do n’t know . [I]45-huck do n’t want to sell [him]2181-dern that cat . ”[45-huck] “ All right . It ’s a mighty small tick , anyway . ”[45-huck] “ Oh , [anybody]203-anybody can run a tick down that do n’t belong to [them]203-anybody . [I]46-tom ’m satisfied with it . It ’s a good enough tick for [me]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ Sho , there ’s ticks a plenty . [I]46-tom could have a thousand of ’em if [I]46-tom wanted to . ”[46-tom] “ Well , why do n’t [you]45-huck ? Becuz [you]45-huck know mighty well [you]45-huck ca n’t . This is a pretty early tick , [I]45-huck reckon . It ’s the first one [I]45-huck ’ve seen this year . ”[45-huck] “ Say , [Huck]45-huck — [I’ll]45-huck give [you]45-huck [my]46-tom tooth for [him]45-huck . ”[46-tom] “ Less see it . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom got out a bit of paper and carefully unrolled it . [Huckleberry]45-huck viewed it wistfully . The temptation was very strong . At last [he]45-huck said : “ Is it [genuwyne]85-genuwyne ? ”[45-huck] [Tom]46-tom lifted [his]46-tom lip and showed the vacancy . “ Well , all right , ”[45-huck] said [Huckleberry]45-huck , “ it ’s a trade . ”[45-huck] [Tom]46-tom enclosed the tick in the percussion - cap box that had lately been [[the pinchbug]652-the pinchbug ’s prison]653-the pinchbug ’s prison , and [the boys]2054-the boys separated , each feeling wealthier than before . When [Tom]46-tom reached [the little isolated frame school - house]655-the little isolated frame school - house , [he]46-tom strode in briskly , with the manner of one who had come with all honest speed . [He]46-tom hung [his]46-tom hat on a peg and flung [himself]46-tom into [his]46-tom seat with business - like alacrity . [The master]656-the master , throned on high in [his]656-the master great splint - bottom arm - chair , was dozing , lulled by the drowsy hum of study . The interruption roused [him]656-the master . “ [Thomas Sawyer]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom knew that when [his]46-tom name was pronounced in full , it meant trouble . “ [Sir]2078-sir ! ”[46-tom] “ Come up here . Now , [sir]2078-sir , why are [you]2078-sir late again , as usual ? ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom was about to take refuge in a lie , when [he]46-tom saw two long tails of yellow hair hanging down a back that [he]46-tom recognized by the electric sympathy of love ; and by that form was _ [the only vacant place _ on [the girls]658-the girls ’ side of [the school - house]659-the school - house]657-the only vacant place _ on the girls ’ side of the school - house . [He]656-the master instantly said : “ _ [I]656-the master stopped to talk with [Huckleberry Finn]45-huck ! _ ”[656-the master] [The master]656-the master ’s pulse stood still , and [he]656-the master stared helplessly . The buzz of study ceased . [The pupils]661-the pupils wondered if [this foolhardy boy]662-this foolhardy boy had lost [his]662-this foolhardy boy mind . [The master]656-the master said : “ [You]2078-sir — [you]2078-sir did what ? ”[656-the master] “ Stopped to talk with [Huckleberry Finn]45-huck . ”[656-the master] There was no mistaking the words . “ [Thomas Sawyer]46-tom , this is the most astounding confession [I]656-the master have ever listened to . [No mere ferule]2186-no mere ferule will answer for this offence . Take off [your]2078-sir jacket . ”[656-the master] [The master]656-the master ’s arm performed until it was tired and the stock of switches notably diminished . Then the order followed : “ Now , [sir]2078-sir , go and sit with [the girls]658-the girls ! And let this be a warning to [you]2078-sir . ”[656-the master] The titter that rippled around [the room]190-the room appeared to abash [the boy]2044-the boy , but in reality that result was caused rather more by [his]2044-the boy worshipful awe of [[his]2044-the boy unknown idol]667-his unknown idol and the dread pleasure that lay in [his]2044-the boy high good fortune . [He]2044-the boy sat down upon the end of the pine bench and [the girl]334-the girl hitched [herself]334-the girl away from [him]2044-the boy with a toss of [her]334-the girl head . Nudges and winks and whispers traversed [the room]190-the room , but [Tom]46-tom sat still , with [his]46-tom arms upon the long , low desk before [him]46-tom , and seemed to study [his]46-tom book . By and by attention ceased from [him]46-tom , and the accustomed school murmur rose upon the dull air once more . Presently [the boy]2044-the boy began to steal furtive glances at [the girl]334-the girl . [She]334-the girl observed it , “ made a mouth ”[334-the girl] at [him]2044-the boy and gave [him]2044-the boy the back of [her]334-the girl head for the space of a minute . When [she]334-the girl cautiously faced around again , a peach lay before [her]334-the girl . [She]334-the girl thrust it away . [Tom]46-tom gently put it back . [She]334-the girl thrust it away again , but with less animosity . [Tom]46-tom patiently returned it to its place . Then [she]334-the girl let it remain . [Tom]46-tom scrawled on [his]46-tom slate , “ Please take it — [I]46-tom got more . ”[46-tom] [The girl]334-the girl glanced at the words , but made no sign . Now [the boy]2044-the boy began to draw something on the slate , hiding [his]2044-the boy work with [his]2044-the boy left hand . For a time [the girl]334-the girl refused to notice ; but [her]334-the girl human curiosity presently began to manifest itself by hardly perceptible signs . [The boy]2044-the boy worked on , apparently unconscious . [The girl]334-the girl made a sort of non - committal attempt to see , but [the boy]2044-the boy did not betray that [he]2044-the boy was aware of it . At last [she]334-the girl gave in and hesitatingly whispered : “ Let [me]334-the girl see it . ”[334-the girl] [Tom]46-tom partly uncovered a dismal caricature of [a house]678-a house with two gable ends to [it]678-a house and a corkscrew of smoke issuing from the chimney . Then [the girl]334-the girl ’s interest began to fasten itself upon the work and [she]334-the girl forgot everything else . When it was finished , [she]334-the girl gazed a moment , then whispered : “ It ’s nice — make [a man]208-a man . ”[334-the girl] [The artist]680-the artist erected [a man in [the front yard]682-the front yard]681-a man in the front yard , that resembled a derrick . [He]681-a man in the front yard could have stepped over [the house]332-the house ; but [the girl]334-the girl was not hypercritical ; [she]334-the girl was satisfied with the monster , and whispered : “ It ’s [a beautiful man]2190-a beautiful man — now make [me]334-the girl coming along . ”[334-the girl] [Tom]46-tom drew an hour - glass with a full moon and straw limbs to it and armed the spreading fingers with a portentous fan . [The girl]334-the girl said : “ It ’s ever so nice — [I]334-the girl wish [I]334-the girl could draw . ”[334-the girl] “ It ’s easy , ”[46-tom] whispered [Tom]46-tom , “ [I]334-the girl ’ll learn [you]334-the girl . ”[334-the girl] “ Oh , will [you]334-the girl ? When ? ”[334-the girl] “ At noon . Do [you]334-the girl go [home]197-home to dinner ? ”[334-the girl] “ [I]334-the girl ’ll stay if [you]334-the girl will . ”[334-the girl] “ Good — that ’s a whack . What ’s [your]334-the girl name ? ”[334-the girl] “ [Becky Thatcher]86-becky . What ’s [yours]334-the girl ? Oh , [I]334-the girl know . It ’s [Thomas Sawyer]46-tom . ”[334-the girl] “ That ’s the name [they]2192-they lick [me]334-the girl by . [I]334-the girl ’m [Tom]46-tom when [I]334-the girl ’m good . [You]334-the girl call [me]334-the girl [Tom]46-tom , will [you]334-the girl ? ”[334-the girl] “ Yes . ”[334-the girl] Now [Tom]46-tom began to scrawl something on the slate , hiding the words from [the girl]334-the girl . But [she]334-the girl was not backward this time . [She]334-the girl begged to see . [Tom]46-tom said : “ Oh , it ai n’t anything . ”[46-tom] “ Yes it is . ”[334-the girl] “ No it ai n’t . [You]334-the girl do n’t want to see . ”[334-the girl] “ Yes [I]334-the girl do , indeed [I]334-the girl do . Please let [me]334-the girl . ”[334-the girl] “ [You]334-the girl ’ll tell . ”[334-the girl] “ No [I]334-the girl won’t — deed and deed and double deed wo n’t . ”[334-the girl] “ [You]334-the girl wo n’t tell [anybody]203-anybody at all ? Ever , as long as [you]334-the girl live ? ”[334-the girl] “ No , [I]334-the girl wo n’t ever tell _ any_body . Now let [me]334-the girl . ”[334-the girl] “ Oh , _ [you]334-the girl _ do n’t want to see ! ”[334-the girl] “ Now that [you]334-the girl treat [me]334-the girl so , [I]334-the girl _ will _ see . ”[334-the girl] And [she]334-the girl put [her]334-the girl small hand upon [his]46-tom and a little scuffle ensued , [Tom]46-tom pretending to resist in earnest but letting [his]46-tom hand slip by degrees till these words were revealed : “ _ [I]334-the girl love [you]334-the girl _ . ”[334-the girl] “ Oh , [you]46-tom bad thing ! ”[334-the girl] And [she]334-the girl hit [his]46-tom hand a smart rap , but reddened and looked pleased , nevertheless . Just at this juncture [the boy]2044-the boy felt a slow , fateful grip closing on [his]2044-the boy ear , and a steady lifting impulse . In that wise [he]2044-the boy was borne across [the house]332-the house and deposited in [his]2044-the boy own seat , under a peppering fire of giggles from [the whole school]689-the whole school . Then [the master]656-the master stood over [him]2044-the boy during a few awful moments , and finally moved away to [his]656-the master throne without saying a word . But although [Tom]46-tom ’s ear tingled , [his]46-tom heart was jubilant . As [the school]411-the school quieted down [Tom]46-tom made an honest effort to study , but the turmoil within [him]46-tom was too great . In turn [he]46-tom took [his]46-tom place in the reading class and made a botch of it ; then in the geography class and turned [lakes]692-lakes into mountains , mountains into [rivers]693-rivers , and [rivers]693-rivers into [continents]695-continents , till chaos was come again ; then in the spelling class , and got “ turned down , ”[46-tom] by a succession of mere baby words , till [he]46-tom brought up at the foot and yielded up the pewter medal which [he]46-tom had worn with ostentation for months . CHAPTER VII The harder [Tom]46-tom tried to fasten [his]46-tom mind on [his]46-tom book , the more [his]46-tom ideas wandered . So at last , with a sigh and a yawn , [he]46-tom gave it up . It seemed to [him]46-tom that the noon recess would never come . The air was utterly dead . There was not a breath stirring . It was the sleepiest of sleepy days . The drowsing murmur of [the five and twenty studying scholars]696-the five and twenty studying scholars soothed the soul like the spell that is in the murmur of bees . Away off in the flaming sunshine , [Cardiff Hill]4-cardiff hill lifted its soft green sides through a shimmering veil of heat , tinted with the purple of distance ; a few birds floated on lazy wing high in the air ; no other living thing was visible but some cows , and [they]697-they were asleep . [Tom]46-tom ’s heart ached to be free , or else to have something of interest to do to pass the dreary time . [His]46-tom hand wandered into [his]46-tom pocket and [his]46-tom face lit up with a glow of gratitude that was prayer , though [he]46-tom did not know it . Then furtively the percussion - cap box came out . [He]46-tom released the tick and put [him]698-him on the long flat desk . The creature probably glowed with a gratitude that amounted to prayer , too , at this moment , but it was premature : for when [he]46-tom started thankfully to travel off , [Tom]46-tom turned [him]46-tom aside with a pin and made [him]46-tom take a new direction . [[Tom]46-tom ’s bosom friend]699-tom ’s bosom friend sat next [him]46-tom , suffering just as [Tom]46-tom had been , and now [he]699-tom ’s bosom friend was deeply and gratefully interested in this entertainment in an instant . [This bosom friend]700-this bosom friend was [Joe Harper]62-joe . [The two boys]701-the two boys were [sworn friends]702-sworn friends all the week , and embattled enemies on Saturdays . [Joe]62-joe took a pin out of [his]62-joe lapel and began to assist in exercising [the prisoner]703-the prisoner . [The sport]704-the sport grew in interest momently . Soon [Tom]46-tom said that [they]701-the two boys were interfering with each other , and neither getting the fullest benefit of the tick . So [he]46-tom put [Joe]62-joe ’s slate on the desk and drew a line down the middle of it from top to bottom . “ Now , ”[46-tom] said [he]46-tom , “ as long as [he]703-the prisoner is on [your]62-joe side [you]62-joe can stir [him]703-the prisoner up and [I]46-tom ’ll let [him]703-the prisoner alone ; but if [you]62-joe let [him]703-the prisoner get away and get on [my]46-tom side , [you]62-joe ’re to leave [him]703-the prisoner alone as long as [I]46-tom can keep [him]703-the prisoner from crossing over . ”[46-tom] “ All right , go ahead ; start [him]703-the prisoner up . ”[46-tom] The tick escaped from [Tom]46-tom , presently , and crossed [the equator]705-the equator . [Joe]62-joe harassed [him]46-tom awhile , and then [he]46-tom got away and crossed back again . This change of base occurred often . While [one boy]706-one boy was worrying the tick with absorbing interest , [the other]225-the other would look on with interest as strong , the two heads bowed together over the slate , and [the two souls]708-the two souls dead to all things else . At last luck seemed to settle and abide with [Joe]62-joe . The tick tried this , that , and the other course , and got as excited and as anxious as [the boys]2054-the boys [themselves]2054-the boys , but time and again just as [he]46-tom would have victory in [his]46-tom very grasp , so to speak , and [Tom]46-tom ’s fingers would be twitching to begin , [Joe]62-joe ’s pin would deftly head [him]46-tom off , and keep possession . At last [Tom]46-tom could stand it no longer . The temptation was too strong . So [he]46-tom reached out and lent a hand with [his]46-tom pin . [Joe]62-joe was angry in a moment . Said [he]62-joe : “ [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom let [him]46-tom alone . ”[62-joe] “ [I]62-joe only just want to stir [him]46-tom up a little , [Joe]62-joe . ”[62-joe] “ No , [sir]2078-sir , it ai n’t fair ; [you]2078-sir just let [him]46-tom alone . ”[62-joe] “ Blame it , [I]62-joe ai n’t going to stir [him]46-tom much . ”[62-joe] “ Let [him]46-tom alone , [I]62-joe tell [you]62-joe . ”[62-joe] “ [I]62-joe wo n’t ! ”[62-joe] “ [You]62-joe shall — [he]46-tom ’s on [my]62-joe side of the line . ”[62-joe] “ Look here , [Joe Harper]62-joe , whose is that tick ? ”[62-joe] “ [I]62-joe do n’t care whose tick [he]46-tom is — [he]46-tom ’s on [my]62-joe side of the line , and [you]62-joe sha’n’t touch [him]46-tom . ”[62-joe] “ Well , [I]62-joe ’ll just bet [I]62-joe will , though . [He]46-tom ’s [my]62-joe tick and [I]62-joe ’ll do what [I]62-joe blame please with [him]46-tom , or die ! ”[62-joe] A tremendous whack came down on [Tom]46-tom ’s shoulders , and its duplicate on [Joe]62-joe ’s ; and for the space of two minutes the dust continued to fly from [the two jackets]710-the two jackets and [the whole school]689-the whole school to enjoy it . [The boys]2054-the boys had been too absorbed to notice the hush that had stolen upon [the school]411-the school awhile before when [the master]656-the master came tiptoeing down [the room]190-the room and stood over [them]2054-the boys . [He]656-the master had contemplated a good part of the performance before [he]656-the master contributed [his]656-the master bit of variety to it . When [school]2056-school broke up at noon , [Tom]46-tom flew to [Becky Thatcher]86-becky , and whispered in [her]86-becky ear : “ Put on [your]86-becky bonnet and let on [you]86-becky ’re going [home]197-home ; and when [you]86-becky get to the corner , give the rest of [’em]2196-’em the slip , and turn down through [the lane]2197-the lane and come back . [I]46-tom ’ll go the other way and come it over ’em the same way . ”[46-tom] So [the one]717-the one went off with [one group of scholars]718-one group of scholars , and [the other with another]719-the other with another . In a little while [the two]720-the two met at the bottom of [the lane]2197-the lane , and when [they]720-the two reached [the school]411-the school [they]720-the two had it all to [themselves]720-the two . Then [they]720-the two sat together , with a slate before [them]720-the two , and [Tom]46-tom gave [Becky]86-becky the pencil and held [her]86-becky hand in [his]46-tom , guiding it , and so created [another surprising house]723-another surprising house . When the interest in art began to wane , [the two]720-the two fell to talking . [Tom]46-tom was swimming in bliss . [He]46-tom said : “ Do [you]86-becky love rats ? ”[46-tom] “ No ! [I]46-tom hate [them]2198-them ! ”[46-tom] “ Well , [I]46-tom do , too—_live _ ones . But [I]46-tom mean dead ones , to swing round [your]86-becky head with a string . ”[46-tom] “ No , [I]46-tom do n’t care for rats much , anyway . What [I]46-tom like is chewing - gum . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , [I]46-tom should say so ! [I]46-tom wish [I]46-tom had some now . ”[46-tom] “ Do [you]86-becky ? [I]46-tom ’ve got some . [I]46-tom ’ll let [you]86-becky chew it awhile , but [you]86-becky must give it back to [me]46-tom . ”[46-tom] That was agreeable , so [they]720-the two chewed it turn about , and dangled [their]720-the two legs against the bench in excess of contentment . “ Was [you]86-becky ever at [a circus]2199-a circus ? ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ Yes , and [[my]46-tom pa]2200-my pa ’s going to take [me]46-tom again some time , if [I]46-tom ’m good . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom been to the circus three or four times — lots of times . [Church]87-church ai n’t shucks to [a circus]2199-a circus . There ’s things going on at [a circus]2199-a circus all the time . [I]46-tom ’m going to be a clown in [a circus]2199-a circus when [I]46-tom grow up . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , are [you]46-tom ! That will be nice . [They]2204-they ’re so lovely , all spotted up . ”[46-tom] “ Yes , that ’s so . And [they]2204-they get slathers of money — most a dollar a day , [Ben Rogers]57-ben says . Say , [Becky]86-becky , was [you]86-becky ever engaged ? ”[46-tom] “ What ’s that ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , engaged to be married . ”[46-tom] “ No . ”[46-tom] “ Would [you]46-tom like to ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom reckon so . [I]46-tom do n’t know . What is it like ? ”[46-tom] “ Like ? Why it ai n’t like anything . [You]86-becky only just tell [a boy]191-a boy [you]86-becky wo n’t ever have [anybody]203-anybody but [him]191-a boy , ever ever ever , and then [you]86-becky kiss and that ’s all . [Anybody]203-anybody can do it . ”[46-tom] “ Kiss ? What do [you]46-tom kiss for ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , that , [you]46-tom know , is to — well , [they]2204-they always do that . ”[46-tom] “ [Everybody]490-everybody ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , yes , [everybody that ’s in love with [each other]227-each other]2209-everybody that ’s in love with each other . Do [you]46-tom remember what [I]46-tom wrote on the slate ? ”[46-tom] “ [Ye]46-tom — yes . ”[46-tom] “ What was it ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom sha’n’t tell [you]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ Shall [I]46-tom tell _ [you]46-tom _ ? ”[46-tom] “ [Ye]46-tom — yes — but some other time . ”[46-tom] “ No , now . ”[46-tom] “ No , not now — to - morrow . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , no , _ now _ . Please , [Becky]86-becky — [I’ll]46-tom whisper it , [I]86-becky ’ll whisper it ever so easy . ”[86-becky] [Becky]86-becky hesitating , [Tom]46-tom took silence for consent , and passed [his]46-tom arm about [her]86-becky waist and whispered the tale ever so softly , with [his]46-tom mouth close to [her]86-becky ear . And then [he]46-tom added : “ Now [you]86-becky whisper it to [me]46-tom — just the same . ”[46-tom] [She]86-becky resisted , for a while , and then said : “ [You]46-tom turn [your]46-tom face away so [you]46-tom ca n’t see , and then [I]86-becky will . But [you]46-tom must n’t ever tell anybody—_will _ [you]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom ? Now [you]46-tom wo n’t , _ will _ [you]86-becky ? ”[86-becky] “ No , indeed , indeed [I]46-tom wo n’t . Now , [Becky]86-becky . ”[46-tom] [He]46-tom turned [his]46-tom face away . [She]86-becky bent timidly around till [her]86-becky breath stirred [his]46-tom curls and whispered , “ [I]86-becky — love — [you]46-tom ! ”[86-becky] Then [she]86-becky sprang away and ran around and around the desks and benches , with [Tom]46-tom after [her]86-becky , and took refuge in a corner at last , with [her]86-becky little white apron to [her]86-becky face . [Tom]46-tom clasped [her]86-becky about [her]86-becky neck and pleaded : “ Now , [Becky]86-becky , it ’s all done — all over but the kiss . Do n’t [you]86-becky be afraid of that — it ai n’t anything at all . Please , [Becky]86-becky . ”[46-tom] And [he]46-tom tugged at [her]86-becky apron and the hands . By and by [she]86-becky gave up , and let [her]86-becky hands drop ; [her]86-becky face , all glowing with the struggle , came up and submitted . [Tom]46-tom kissed the red lips and said : “ Now it ’s all done , [Becky]86-becky . And always after this , [you]86-becky know , [you]86-becky ai n’t ever to love [anybody]203-anybody but [me]46-tom , and [you]86-becky ai n’t ever to marry [anybody]203-anybody but [me]46-tom , ever never and forever . Will [you]86-becky ? ”[46-tom] “ No , [I]46-tom ’ll never love [anybody]203-anybody but [you]86-becky , [Tom]46-tom , and [I]46-tom ’ll never marry [anybody]203-anybody but [you]86-becky — and [you]86-becky ai n’t to ever marry anybody but [me]46-tom , either . ”[46-tom] “ Certainly . Of course . That ’s _ part _ of it . And always coming to [school]2056-school or when [we]2216-we ’re going [home]197-home , [you]86-becky ’re to walk with [me]46-tom , when there ai n’t [anybody]203-anybody looking — and [you]86-becky choose [me]46-tom and [I]46-tom choose [you]86-becky at parties , because that ’s the way [you]86-becky do when [you]86-becky ’re engaged . ”[46-tom] “ It ’s so nice . [I]46-tom never heard of it before . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , it ’s ever so gay ! Why , [me]46-tom and [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence — ”[46-tom] The big eyes told [Tom]46-tom [his]46-tom blunder and [he]46-tom stopped , confused . “ Oh , [Tom]46-tom ! Then [I]46-tom ai n’t [the first [you]46-tom ’ve ever been engaged to]2219-the first you ’ve ever been engaged to ! ”[46-tom] [The child]2048-the child began to cry . [Tom]46-tom said : “ Oh , do n’t cry , [Becky]86-becky , [I]46-tom do n’t care for [her]64-amy lawrence any more . ”[46-tom] “ Yes , [you]46-tom do , [Tom]46-tom — [you]46-tom know [you]46-tom do . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom tried to put [his]46-tom arm about [her]2048-the child neck , but [she]2048-the child pushed [him]46-tom away and turned [her]2048-the child face to the wall , and went on crying . [Tom]46-tom tried again , with soothing words in [his]46-tom mouth , and was repulsed again . Then [his]46-tom pride was up , and [he]46-tom strode away and went outside . [He]46-tom stood about , restless and uneasy , for a while , glancing at the door , every now and then , hoping [she]2048-the child would repent and come to find [him]46-tom . But [she]2048-the child did not . Then [he]46-tom began to feel badly and fear that [he]46-tom was in the wrong . It was a hard struggle with [him]46-tom to make new advances , now , but [he]46-tom nerved [himself]46-tom to it and entered . [She]2048-the child was still standing back there in the corner , sobbing , with [her]2048-the child face to the wall . [Tom]46-tom ’s heart smote [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom went to [her]2048-the child and stood a moment , not knowing exactly how to proceed . Then [he]46-tom said hesitatingly : “ [Becky]86-becky , [I]46-tom — [I]46-tom do n’t care for [anybody]203-anybody but [you]86-becky . ”[46-tom] No reply — but sobs . “ Becky”—pleadingly[46-tom] . “ [Becky]86-becky , wo n’t [you]86-becky say something ? ”[46-tom] More sobs . [Tom]46-tom got out [his]46-tom chiefest jewel , a brass knob from the top of an andiron , and passed it around [her]2048-the child so that [she]2048-the child could see it , and said : “ Please , [Becky]86-becky , wo n’t [you]86-becky take it ? ”[2048-the child] [She]2048-the child struck it to the floor . Then [Tom]46-tom marched out of [the house]332-the house and over [the hills]727-the hills and far away , to return to [school]2056-school no more that day . Presently [Becky]86-becky began to suspect . [She]86-becky ran to the door ; [he]46-tom was not in sight ; [she]86-becky flew around to [the play - yard]729-the play - yard ; [he]46-tom was not there . Then [she]86-becky called : “ [Tom]46-tom ! Come back , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[86-becky] [She]86-becky listened intently , but there was no answer . [She]86-becky had [no companions]730-no companions but silence and loneliness . So [she]86-becky sat down to cry again and upbraid [herself]86-becky ; and by this time [the scholars]731-the scholars began to gather again , and [she]86-becky had to hide [her]86-becky griefs and still [her]86-becky broken heart and take up the cross of a long , dreary , aching afternoon , with none among the strangers about [her]86-becky to exchange sorrows with . CHAPTER VIII [Tom]46-tom dodged hither and thither through [lanes]732-lanes until [he]46-tom was well out of the track of [returning scholars]733-returning scholars , and then fell into a moody jog . [He]46-tom crossed [a small “ branch ”]2221-a small “ branch ”[46-tom] two or three times , because of a prevailing juvenile superstition that to cross water baffled pursuit . Half an hour later [he]46-tom was disappearing behind [the Douglas mansion]734-the douglas mansion on [the summit of [Cardiff Hill]4-cardiff hill]735-the summit of cardiff hill , and [the school - house]659-the school - house was hardly distinguishable away off in [the valley]737-the valley behind [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom entered [a dense wood]738-a dense wood , picked [his]46-tom pathless way to the centre of [it]738-a dense wood , and sat down on [a mossy spot under a spreading oak]739-a mossy spot under a spreading oak . There was not even a zephyr stirring ; the dead noonday heat had even stilled the songs of the birds ; nature lay in a trance that was broken by no sound but the occasional far - off hammering of [a wood - pecker]740-a wood - pecker , and this seemed to render the pervading silence and sense of loneliness the more profound . [The boy]2044-the boy ’s soul was steeped in melancholy ; [his]46-tom feelings were in happy accord with [his]46-tom surroundings . [He]46-tom sat long with [his]46-tom elbows on [his]46-tom knees and [his]46-tom chin in [his]46-tom hands , meditating . It seemed to [him]46-tom that life was but a trouble , at best , and [he]46-tom more than half envied [Jimmy Hodges]88-jimmy hodges , so lately released ; it must be very peaceful , [he]46-tom thought , to lie and slumber and dream forever and ever , with the wind whispering through the trees and caressing the grass and the flowers over the grave , and nothing to bother and grieve about , ever any more . If [he]46-tom only had a clean Sunday - school record [he]46-tom could be willing to go , and be done with it all . Now as to [this girl]742-this girl . What had [he]46-tom done ? Nothing . [He]46-tom had meant the best in [the world]328-the world , and been treated like a dog — like a very dog . [She]742-this girl would be sorry some day — maybe when it was too late . Ah , if [he]46-tom could only die _ temporarily _ ! But the elastic heart of [youth]744-youth can not be compressed into one constrained shape long at a time . [Tom]46-tom presently began to drift insensibly back into the concerns of this life again . What if [he]46-tom turned [his]46-tom back , now , and disappeared mysteriously ? What if [he]46-tom went away — ever so far away , into [unknown countries beyond the seas]745-unknown countries beyond the seas — and never came back any more ! How would [she]742-this girl feel then ! The idea of being [a clown]746-a clown recurred to [him]46-tom now , only to fill [him]46-tom with disgust . For frivolity and jokes and spotted tights were an offense , when [they]747-they intruded [themselves]747-they upon a spirit that was exalted into [the vague august realm of the romantic]748-the vague august realm of the romantic . No , [he]46-tom would be [a soldier , and return after long years , all war - worn and illustrious]749-a soldier , and return after long years , all war - worn and illustrious . No — better still , [he]46-tom would join [the Indians]89-the indians , and hunt buffaloes and go on the warpath in [the mountain ranges]750-the mountain ranges and [the trackless great plains of [the Far West]14-the far west]751-the trackless great plains of the far west , and away in the future come back [a great chief , bristling with feathers , hideous with paint , and prance into Sunday - school]752-a great chief , bristling with feathers , hideous with paint , and prance into sunday - school , some drowsy summer morning , with a blood - curdling war - whoop , and sear the eyeballs of [all [his]46-tom companions]753-all his companions with unappeasable envy . But no , there was something gaudier even than this . [He]46-tom would be [a pirate]754-a pirate ! That was it ! _ now _ [his]46-tom future lay plain before [him]46-tom , and glowing with unimaginable splendor . How [his]46-tom name would fill [the world]328-the world , and make [people]756-people shudder ! How gloriously [he]46-tom would go plowing [the dancing seas]757-the dancing seas , in [[his]46-tom long , low , black - hulled racer]758-his long , low , black - hulled racer , the Spirit of the Storm , with [his]46-tom grisly flag flying at the fore ! And at the zenith of [his]46-tom fame , how [he]46-tom would suddenly appear at [the old village]759-the old village and stalk into [church]533-church , brown and weather - beaten , in [his]46-tom black velvet doublet and trunks , [his]46-tom great jack - boots , [his]46-tom crimson sash , [his]46-tom belt bristling with horse - pistols , [his]46-tom crime - rusted cutlass at [his]46-tom side , [his]46-tom slouch hat with waving plumes , [his]46-tom black flag unfurled , with the skull and crossbones on it , and hear with swelling ecstasy the whisperings , “ It ’s [Tom Sawyer]46-tom [the Pirate!—the Black Avenger of the Spanish Main]2222-the pirate!—the black avenger of the spanish main ! ”[46-tom] Yes , it was settled ; [his]46-tom career was determined . [He]46-tom would run away from [home]197-home and enter upon [it]197-home . [He]46-tom would start the very next morning . Therefore [he]46-tom must now begin to get ready . [He]46-tom would collect [his]46-tom resources together . [He]46-tom went to a rotten log near at hand and began to dig under one end of it with [his]46-tom Barlow knife . [He]46-tom soon struck wood that sounded hollow . [He]46-tom put [his]46-tom hand there and uttered this incantation impressively : “ What has n’t come here , come ! What ’s here , stay here ! ”[46-tom] Then [he]46-tom scraped away the dirt , and exposed a pine shingle . [He]46-tom took it up and disclosed [a shapely little treasure - house whose bottom and sides were of shingles]762-a shapely little treasure - house whose bottom and sides were of shingles . In [it]762-a shapely little treasure - house whose bottom and sides were of shingles lay a marble . [Tom]46-tom ’s astonishment was boundless ! [He]46-tom scratched [his]46-tom head with a perplexed air , and said : “ Well , that beats anything ! ”[46-tom] Then [he]46-tom tossed the marble away pettishly , and stood cogitating . The truth was , that a superstition of [his]46-tom had failed , here , which [he]46-tom and [all [his]46-tom comrades]763-all his comrades had always looked upon as infallible . If [you]764-you buried a marble with certain necessary incantations , and left it alone a fortnight , and then opened the place with the incantation [he]46-tom had just used , [you]764-you would find that all the marbles [you]764-you had ever lost had gathered themselves together there , meantime , no matter how widely [they]765-they had been separated . But now , this thing had actually and unquestionably failed . [Tom]46-tom ’s whole structure of faith was shaken to its foundations . [He]46-tom had many a time heard of this thing succeeding but never of its failing before . It did not occur to [him]46-tom that [he]46-tom had tried it several times before , [himself]46-tom , but could never find the hiding - places afterward . [He]46-tom puzzled over the matter some time , and finally decided that [some witch]766-some witch had interfered and broken the charm . [He]46-tom thought [he]46-tom would satisfy [himself]46-tom on that point ; so [he]46-tom searched around till [he]46-tom found a small sandy spot with a little funnel - shaped depression in it . [He]46-tom laid [himself]46-tom down and put [his]46-tom mouth close to this depression and called — “ Doodle - bug , doodle - bug , tell [me]46-tom what [I]46-tom want to know ! Doodle - bug , doodle - bug , tell [me]46-tom what [I]46-tom want to know ! ”[46-tom] The sand began to work , and presently a small black bug appeared for a second and then darted under again in a fright . “ [He]2223-he dasn’t tell ! So it _ was _ [a witch]2171-a witch that done it . [I]46-tom just knowed it . ”[46-tom] [He]46-tom well knew the futility of trying to contend against [witches]767-witches , so [he]46-tom gave up discouraged . But it occurred to [him]46-tom that [he]46-tom might as well have the marble [he]46-tom had just thrown away , and therefore [he]46-tom went and made a patient search for it . But [he]46-tom could not find it . Now [he]46-tom went back to [[his]46-tom treasure - house]768-his treasure - house and carefully placed [himself]46-tom just as [he]46-tom had been standing when [he]46-tom tossed the marble away ; then [he]46-tom took another marble from [his]46-tom pocket and tossed it in the same way , saying : “ [Brother]90-brother , go find [[your]90-brother brother]2225-your brother ! ”[46-tom] [He]46-tom watched where it stopped , and went there and looked . But it must have fallen short or gone too far ; so [he]46-tom tried twice more . The last repetition was successful . The two marbles lay within a foot of each other . Just here the blast of a toy tin trumpet came faintly down [the green aisles of [the forest]770-the forest]769-the green aisles of the forest . [Tom]46-tom flung off [his]46-tom jacket and trousers , turned a suspender into a belt , raked away some brush behind the rotten log , disclosing a rude bow and arrow , a lath sword and a tin trumpet , and in a moment had seized these things and bounded away , barelegged , with fluttering shirt . [He]46-tom presently halted under a great elm , blew an answering blast , and then began to tiptoe and look warily out , this way and that . [He]46-tom said cautiously — to an imaginary company : “ Hold , [[my]46-tom merry men]2226-my merry men ! Keep hid till [I]46-tom blow . ”[46-tom] Now appeared [Joe Harper]62-joe , as airily clad and elaborately armed as [Tom]46-tom . [Tom]46-tom called : “ Hold ! Who comes here into [Sherwood Forest]15-sherwood forest without [my]46-tom pass ? ”[46-tom] “ [Guy of [Guisborne]16-guisborne]2227-guy of guisborne wants [no man]2228-no man ’s pass . Who art [thou]2229-you that — that — ”[46-tom] “ Dares to hold such language , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom , prompting — for [they]771-they talked “ by the book , ”[771-they] from memory . “ Who art [thou]2229-you that dares to hold such language ? ”[771-they] “ [I]46-tom , indeed ! [I]46-tom am [Robin Hood]91-robin hood , as [thy]46-tom caitiff carcase soon shall know . ”[46-tom] “ Then art [thou]2229-you indeed [that famous outlaw]2230-that famous outlaw ? Right gladly will [I]771-they dispute with [thee]2229-you [the passes of [the merry wood]2232-the merry wood]2231-the passes of the merry wood . Have at [thee]2229-you ! ”[771-they] [They]771-they took [their]771-they lath swords , dumped [their]771-they other traps on the ground , struck a fencing attitude , foot to foot , and began a grave , careful combat , “ two up and two down . ”[46-tom] Presently [Tom]46-tom said : “ Now , if [you]2229-you ’ve got the hang , go it lively ! ”[46-tom] So [they]771-they “ went it lively , ”[46-tom] panting and perspiring with the work . By and by [Tom]46-tom shouted : “ Fall ! fall ! Why do n’t [you]2229-you fall ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom sha’n’t ! Why do n’t [you]2229-you fall [yourself]2229-you ? [You]2229-you ’re getting the worst of it . ”[46-tom] “ Why , that ai n’t anything . [I]772-the authorities ca n’t fall ; that ai n’t the way it is in the book . The book says , ‘ Then with one back - handed stroke [he]772-the authorities slew [poor Guy of [Guisborne]16-guisborne]2233-poor guy of guisborne . ’ [You]2229-you ’re to turn around and let [me]772-the authorities hit [you]2229-you in the back . ”[772-the authorities] There was no getting around [the authorities]772-the authorities , so [Joe]62-joe turned , received the whack and fell . “ Now , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe , getting up , “ [you]2229-you got to let [me]62-joe kill _ [you]2229-you _ . That ’s fair . ”[62-joe] “ Why , [I]772-the authorities ca n’t do that , it ai n’t in the book . ”[772-the authorities] “ Well , it ’s blamed mean — that ’s all . ”[62-joe] “ Well , say , [Joe]62-joe , [you]62-joe can be [Friar Tuck]92-friar tuck or [[Much the miller]2234-much the miller ’s son]2235-much the miller ’s son , and lam [me]62-joe with a quarter - staff ; or [I]62-joe ’ll be [the Sheriff of [Nottingham]17-nottingham]2236-the sheriff of nottingham and [you]62-joe be [Robin Hood]91-robin hood a little while and kill [me]62-joe . ”[62-joe] This was satisfactory , and so these adventures were carried out . Then [Tom]46-tom became [Robin Hood]91-robin hood again , and was allowed by [the treacherous nun]773-the treacherous nun to bleed [his]46-tom strength away through [his]46-tom neglected wound . And at last [Joe]62-joe , representing [a whole tribe of weeping outlaws]774-a whole tribe of weeping outlaws , dragged [him]46-tom sadly forth , gave [his]62-joe bow into [his]62-joe feeble hands , and [Tom]46-tom said , “ Where this arrow falls , there bury poor [Robin Hood]91-robin hood under the greenwood tree . ”[46-tom] Then [he]46-tom shot the arrow and fell back and would have died , but [he]46-tom lit on a nettle and sprang up too gaily for a corpse . [The boys]2054-the boys dressed [themselves]2054-the boys , hid [their]2054-the boys accoutrements , and went off grieving that there were [no outlaws]776-no outlaws any more , and wondering what [modern civilization]777-modern civilization could claim to have done to compensate for [their]2054-the boys loss . [They]2054-the boys said [they]2054-the boys would rather be outlaws a year in [Sherwood Forest]15-sherwood forest than [President of [the United States]563-the united states]778-president of the united states forever . CHAPTER IX At half - past nine , that night , [Tom]46-tom and [Sid]51-sid were sent to bed , as usual . [They]2054-the boys said [their]2054-the boys prayers , and [Sid]51-sid was soon asleep . [Tom]46-tom lay awake and waited , in restless impatience . When it seemed to [him]46-tom that it must be nearly daylight , [he]46-tom heard the clock strike ten ! This was despair . [He]46-tom would have tossed and fidgeted , as [his]46-tom nerves demanded , but [he]46-tom was afraid [he]46-tom might wake [Sid]51-sid . So [he]46-tom lay still , and stared up into the dark . Everything was dismally still . By and by , out of the stillness , little , scarcely perceptible noises began to emphasize themselves . The ticking of the clock began to bring itself into notice . Old beams began to crack mysteriously . The stairs creaked faintly . Evidently spirits were abroad . A measured , muffled snore issued from [[Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s chamber]780-aunt polly ’s chamber . And now the tiresome chirping of a cricket that no human ingenuity could locate , began . Next the ghastly ticking of a death - watch in the wall at the bed ’s head made [Tom]46-tom shudder — it meant that [somebody]262-somebody ’s days were numbered . Then the howl of a far - off dog rose on the night air , and was answered by a fainter howl from a remoter distance . [Tom]46-tom was in an agony .
