At last [he]46-tom was satisfied that time had ceased and eternity begun ; [he]46-tom began to doze , in spite of [himself]46-tom ; the clock chimed eleven , but [he]46-tom did not hear it . And then there came , mingling with [his]46-tom half - formed dreams , a most melancholy caterwauling . The raising of a neighboring window disturbed [him]46-tom . A cry of “ [Scat]93-scat ! [you]93-scat devil ! ”[46-tom] and the crash of an empty bottle against the back of [[[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ’s woodshed]783-his aunt ’s woodshed brought [him]46-tom wide awake , and a single minute later [he]46-tom was dressed and out of the window and creeping along the roof of [the “ ell ”]2237-the “ ell ”[46-tom] on all fours . [He]46-tom “ meow’d ”[46-tom] with caution once or twice , as [he]46-tom went ; then jumped to the roof of [the woodshed]784-the woodshed and thence to the ground . [Huckleberry Finn]45-huck was there , with [his]45-huck dead cat . [The boys]2054-the boys moved off and disappeared in the gloom . At the end of half an hour [they]2054-the boys were wading through the tall grass of [the graveyard]786-the graveyard . It was [a graveyard of the old - fashioned Western kind]787-a graveyard of the old - fashioned western kind . [It]787-a graveyard of the old - fashioned western kind was on [a hill]788-a hill , about a mile and a half from [the village]206-the village . [It]787-a graveyard of the old - fashioned western kind had a crazy board fence around [it]787-a graveyard of the old - fashioned western kind , which leaned inward in places , and outward the rest of the time , but stood upright nowhere . Grass and weeds grew rank over [the whole cemetery]790-the whole cemetery . All the old graves were sunken in , there was not a tombstone on [the place]791-the place ; round - topped , worm - eaten boards staggered over the graves , leaning for support and finding none . “ Sacred to the memory of ”[792-them] So - and - So had been painted on [them]792-them once , but it could no longer have been read , on the most of [them]792-them , now , even if there had been light . A faint wind moaned through the trees , and [Tom]46-tom feared it might be the spirits of the dead , complaining at being disturbed . [The boys]2054-the boys talked little , and only under [their]2054-the boys breath , for the time and the place and the pervading solemnity and silence oppressed [their]2054-the boys spirits . [They]2054-the boys found the sharp new heap [they]2054-the boys were seeking , and ensconced [themselves]2054-the boys within the protection of three great elms that grew in a bunch within a few feet of [the grave]794-the grave . Then [they]2054-the boys waited in silence for what seemed a long time . The hooting of a distant owl was all the sound that troubled the dead stillness . [Tom]46-tom ’s reflections grew oppressive . [He]46-tom must force some talk . So [he]46-tom said in a whisper : “ [Hucky]45-huck , do [you]45-huck believe [the dead people]2238-the dead people like it for [us]2054-the boys to be here ? ”[46-tom] [Huckleberry]45-huck whispered : “ [I]45-huck wisht [I]45-huck knowed . It ’s awful solemn like , _ ai n’t _ it ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]46-tom bet it is . ”[46-tom] There was a considerable pause , while [the boys]2054-the boys canvassed this matter inwardly . Then [Tom]46-tom whispered : “ Say , [Hucky]45-huck — do [you]45-huck reckon [Hoss Williams]81-old hoss williams hears [us]2054-the boys talking ? ”[46-tom] “ O ’ course [he]81-old hoss williams does . Least [[his]81-old hoss williams sperrit]2239-his sperrit does . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , after a pause : “ [I]46-tom wish [I]46-tom ’d said [Mister Williams]94-mister williams . But [I]46-tom never meant any harm . [Everybody]490-everybody calls [him]81-old hoss williams [Hoss]81-old hoss williams . ”[46-tom] “ A body ca n’t be too partic’lar how [they]490-everybody talk ’bout these - [yer dead people]2241-yer dead people , [Tom]46-tom . ”[46-tom] This was a damper , and conversation died again . [Presently Tom]46-tom seized [[his]46-tom comrade]796-his comrade ’s arm and said : “ Sh ! ”[46-tom] “ What is it , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[46-tom] And [the two]720-the two clung together with beating hearts . “ Sh ! There ’ tis again ! Did n’t [you]46-tom hear it ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom — ”[46-tom] “ There ! Now [you]46-tom hear it . ”[46-tom] “ [Lord]2242-lord , [Tom]46-tom , [they]490-everybody ’re coming ! [They]490-everybody ’re coming , sure . What ’ll [we]720-the two do ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom dono . Think [they]490-everybody ’ll see [us]720-the two ? ”[46-tom] “ Oh , [Tom]46-tom , [they]490-everybody can see in the dark , same as cats . [I]46-tom wisht [I]46-tom had n’t come . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , do n’t be afeard . [I]46-tom do n’t believe [they]490-everybody ’ll bother [us]720-the two . [We]720-the two ai n’t doing any harm . If [we]720-the two keep perfectly still , maybe [they]490-everybody wo n’t notice [us]720-the two at all . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom ’ll try to , [Tom]46-tom , but , [Lord]2243-lord , [I]46-tom ’m all of a shiver . ”[46-tom] “ Listen ! ”[46-tom] [The boys]2054-the boys bent [their]2054-the boys heads together and scarcely breathed . A muffled sound of voices floated up from the far end of [the graveyard]786-the graveyard . “ Look ! See there ! ”[46-tom] whispered [Tom]46-tom . “ What is it ? ”[46-tom] “ It ’s devil - fire . Oh , [Tom]46-tom , this is awful . ”[800-some vague figures] [Some vague figures]800-some vague figures approached through the gloom , swinging an old - fashioned tin lantern that freckled the ground with innumerable little spangles of light . [Presently Huckleberry]45-huck whispered with a shudder : “ It ’s the devils sure enough . Three of [’em]2244-’em ! [Lordy]95-lordy , [Tom]46-tom , [we]720-the two ’re goners ! Can [you]46-tom pray ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]804-the third voice ’ll try , but do n’t [you]46-tom be afeard . [They]490-everybody ai n’t going to hurt [us]720-the two . ‘ Now [I]804-the third voice lay [me]804-the third voice down to sleep , [I]804-the third voice — ’ ”[804-the third voice] “ Sh ! ”[45-huck] “ What is it , [Huck]45-huck ? ”[45-huck] “ [They]490-everybody ’re _ humans _ ! One of ’em is , anyway . One of ’em ’s [old Muff Potter]96-potter ’s voice . ”[804-the third voice] “ No—’tain’t so , is it ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]45-huck bet [I]45-huck know it . Do n’t [you]46-tom stir nor budge . [He]96-potter ai n’t sharp enough to notice [us]720-the two . [Drunk]97-drunk , the same as usual , likely — blamed [old rip]2245-old rip ! ”[45-huck] “ All right , [I]804-the third voice ’ll keep still . Now [they]490-everybody ’re stuck . Ca n’t find it . Here [they]490-everybody come again . Now [they]490-everybody ’re hot . Cold again . Hot again . Red hot ! [They]490-everybody ’re p’inted right , this time . Say , [Huck]45-huck , [I]804-the third voice know [another o ’ them voices]2246-another o ’ them voices ; it ’s Injun [Joe]62-joe . ”[804-the third voice] “ That ’s so — [that murderin ’ half - breed]2247-that murderin ’ half - breed ! [I]45-huck ’d [druther]2248-druther [they]490-everybody was devils a dern sight . What kin [they]490-everybody be up to ? ”[45-huck] The whisper died wholly out , now , for [the three men]801-the three men had reached [the grave]794-the grave and stood within a few feet of [the boys]2054-the boys ’ hiding - place . “ Here it is , ”[804-the third voice] said [the third voice]804-the third voice ; and [the owner of it]805-the owner of it held the lantern up and revealed the face of [young Doctor Robinson]98-young doctor robinson . [Potter]96-potter and Injun [Joe]62-joe were carrying a handbarrow with a rope and a couple of shovels on it . [They]801-the three men cast down [their]801-the three men load and began to open [the grave]794-the grave . [The doctor]614-the doctor put the lantern at the head of [the grave]794-the grave and came and sat down with [his]614-the doctor back against one of the elm trees . [He]614-the doctor was so close [the boys]2054-the boys could have touched [him]614-the doctor . “ Hurry , [men]185-men ! ”[614-the doctor] [he]614-the doctor said , in a low voice ; “ the moon might come out at any moment . ”[614-the doctor] [They]801-the three men growled a response and went on digging . For some time there was no noise but the grating sound of the spades discharging [their]801-the three men freight of mould and gravel . It was very monotonous . Finally a spade struck upon the coffin with a dull woody accent , and within another minute or two [the men]810-the men had hoisted it out on the ground . [They]810-the men pried off the lid with [their]810-the men shovels , got out the body and dumped it rudely on the ground . The moon drifted from behind the clouds and exposed the pallid face . [The barrow]811-the barrow was got ready and the corpse placed on it , covered with a blanket , and bound to its place with the rope . [Potter]96-potter took out a large spring - knife and cut off the dangling end of the rope and then said : “ Now [the cussed thing]2250-the cussed thing ’s ready , [Sawbones]99-sawbones , and [you]96-potter ’ll just out with another five , or here [she]2250-the cussed thing stays . ”[96-potter] “ That ’s the talk ! ”[100-injun joe] said [Injun Joe]100-injun joe . “ Look here , what does this mean ? ”[614-the doctor] said [the doctor]614-the doctor . “ [You]96-potter required [your]96-potter pay in advance , and [I]614-the doctor ’ve paid [you]96-potter . ”[614-the doctor] “ Yes , and [you]614-the doctor done more than that , ”[100-injun joe] said [Injun Joe]100-injun joe , approaching [the doctor]614-the doctor , who was now standing . “ Five years ago [you]614-the doctor drove [me]814-i away from [[[your]96-potter father]2251-your father ’s kitchen]2252-your father ’s kitchen one night , when [I]814-i come to ask for something to eat , and [you]614-the doctor said [I]814-i warn’t there for any good ; and when [I]814-i swore [I]814-i ’d get even with [you]614-the doctor if it took a hundred years , [[your]96-potter father]2251-your father had [me]814-i jailed for [a vagrant]2254-a vagrant . Did [you]614-the doctor think [I]814-i ’d forget ? The Injun blood ai n’t in [me]814-i for nothing . And now [I]814-i ’ve _ got _ [you]614-the doctor , and [you]614-the doctor got to _ settle _ , [you]614-the doctor know ! ”[814-i] [He]814-i was threatening [the doctor]614-the doctor , with [his]814-i fist in [his]814-i face , by this time . [The doctor]614-the doctor struck out suddenly and stretched [the ruffian on the ground]817-the ruffian on the ground . [Potter]96-potter dropped [his]96-potter knife , and exclaimed : “ Here , now , do n’t [you]614-the doctor hit [my]96-potter pard ! ”[96-potter] and the next moment [he]814-i had grappled with [the doctor]614-the doctor and [the two]720-the two were struggling with might and main , trampling the grass and tearing the ground with [their]720-the two heels . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe sprang to [his]100-injun joe feet , [his]100-injun joe eyes flaming with passion , snatched up [Potter]96-potter ’s knife , and went creeping , catlike and stooping , round and round about [the combatants]820-the combatants , seeking an opportunity . All at once [the doctor]614-the doctor flung [himself]614-the doctor free , seized the heavy headboard of [[Williams]81-old hoss williams ’ grave]822-williams ’ grave and felled [Potter]96-potter to the earth with it — and in the same instant [the half - breed]823-the half - breed saw [his]614-the doctor chance and drove the knife to the hilt in [the young man]824-the young man ’s breast . [He]614-the doctor reeled and fell partly upon [Potter]96-potter , flooding [him]96-potter with [his]96-potter blood , and in the same moment the clouds blotted out the dreadful spectacle and [the two frightened boys]825-the two frightened boys went speeding away in the dark . Presently , when the moon emerged again , [Injun Joe]100-injun joe was standing over the two forms , contemplating [them]825-the two frightened boys . [The doctor]614-the doctor murmured inarticulately , gave a long gasp or two and was still . [The half - breed]823-the half - breed muttered : “ _ That _ score is settled — damn [you]100-injun joe . ”[823-the half - breed] Then [he]614-the doctor robbed the body . After which [he]614-the doctor put the fatal knife in [Potter]96-potter ’s open right hand , and sat down on the dismantled coffin . Three — four — five minutes passed , and then [Potter]96-potter began to stir and moan . [His]96-potter hand closed upon the knife ; [he]96-potter raised it , glanced at it , and let it fall , with a shudder . Then [he]96-potter sat up , pushing the body from [him]96-potter , and gazed at it , and then around [him]96-potter , confusedly . [His]96-potter eyes met [Joe]100-injun joe ’s . “ [Lord]2255-lord , how is this , [Joe]100-injun joe ? ”[96-potter] [he]96-potter said . “ It ’s a dirty business , ”[100-injun joe] said [Joe]100-injun joe , without moving . “ What did [you]96-potter do it for ? ”[100-injun joe] “ [I]96-potter ! [I]96-potter never done it ! ”[96-potter] “ Look here ! That kind of talk wo n’t wash . ”[96-potter] [Potter]96-potter trembled and grew white . “ [I]96-potter thought [I]96-potter ’d got sober . [I]96-potter ’d no business to drink to - night . But it ’s in [my]96-potter head yet — worse’n when [we]2256-we started [here]551-here . [I]96-potter ’m all in a muddle ; ca n’t recollect anything of it , hardly . Tell [me]96-potter , [Joe—_honest]101-joe—_honest _ , now , [old feller]2258-old feller — did [I]96-potter do it ? [Joe]100-injun joe , [I]96-potter never meant to—’pon [my]96-potter soul and honor , [I]96-potter never meant to , [Joe]100-injun joe . Tell [me]96-potter how it was , [Joe]100-injun joe . Oh , it ’s awful — and [him]96-potter so young and promising . ”[96-potter] “ Why , [you]100-injun joe two was scuffling , and [he]96-potter fetched [you]100-injun joe one with the [headboard]2259-headboard and [you]100-injun joe fell flat ; and then up [you]100-injun joe come , all reeling and staggering like , and snatched the knife and jammed it into [him]96-potter , just as [he]96-potter fetched [you]100-injun joe another awful clip — and here [you]100-injun joe ’ve laid , as dead as a wedge til now . ”[96-potter] “ Oh , [I]96-potter did n’t know what [I]96-potter was a - doing . [I]96-potter wish [I]96-potter may die this minute if [I]96-potter did . It was all on account of the whiskey and the excitement , [I]96-potter reckon . [I]96-potter never used [a weepon]2260-a weepon in [my]96-potter life before , [Joe]100-injun joe . [I]96-potter ’ve fought , but never with [weepons]2261-weepons . [They]2261-weepons ’ll all say that . [Joe]100-injun joe , do n’t tell ! Say [you]100-injun joe wo n’t tell , [Joe]100-injun joe — that ’s [a good feller]2262-a good feller . [I]96-potter always liked [you]100-injun joe , [Joe]100-injun joe , and stood up for [you]100-injun joe , too . Do n’t [you]100-injun joe remember ? [You]100-injun joe _ wo n’t _ tell , _ will _ [you]100-injun joe , [Joe]100-injun joe ? ”[96-potter] And [the poor creature]828-the poor creature dropped on [his]828-the poor creature knees before [the stolid murderer]829-the stolid murderer , and clasped [his]828-the poor creature appealing hands . “ No , [you]100-injun joe ’ve always been fair and square with [me]828-the poor creature , [Muff Potter]96-potter , and [I]828-the poor creature wo n’t go back on [you]100-injun joe . There , now , that ’s as fair as [a man]208-a man can say . ”[828-the poor creature] “ Oh , [Joe]100-injun joe , [you]100-injun joe ’re [an angel]2264-an angel . [I]96-potter ’ll bless [you]100-injun joe for this the longest day [I]96-potter live . ”[96-potter] And [Potter]96-potter began to cry . “ Come , now , that ’s enough of that . This ai n’t any time for blubbering . [You]100-injun joe be off yonder way and [I]96-potter ’ll go this . Move , now , and do n’t leave any tracks behind [you]100-injun joe . ”[96-potter] [Potter]96-potter started on a trot that quickly increased to a run . [The half - breed]823-the half - breed stood looking after [him]96-potter . [He]823-the half - breed muttered : “ If [he]823-the half - breed ’s as much stunned with the lick and fuddled with the rum as [he]823-the half - breed had the look of being , [he]823-the half - breed wo n’t think of the knife till [he]823-the half - breed ’s gone so far [he]823-the half - breed ’ll be afraid to come back after it to such a place by [himself]823-the half - breed — chicken - heart ! ”[823-the half - breed] Two or three minutes later [the murdered man]831-the murdered man , the blanketed corpse , the lidless coffin , and [the open grave]832-the open grave were under no inspection but the moon ’s . The stillness was complete again , too . CHAPTER X [The two boys]701-the two boys flew on and on , toward [the village]206-the village , speechless with horror . [They]701-the two boys glanced backward over [their]701-the two boys shoulders from time to time , apprehensively , as if [they]701-the two boys feared [they]701-the two boys might be followed . Every stump that started up in [their]701-the two boys path seemed [a man]208-a man and [an enemy]836-an enemy , and made [them]701-the two boys catch [their]701-the two boys breath ; and as [they]701-the two boys sped by [some outlying cottages that lay near [the village]206-the village]837-some outlying cottages that lay near the village , the barking of the aroused watch - dogs seemed to give wings to [their]701-the two boys feet . “ If [we]701-the two boys can only get to [the old tannery]2265-the old tannery before [we]701-the two boys break down ! ”[46-tom] whispered [Tom]46-tom , in short catches between breaths . “ [I]46-tom ca n’t stand it much longer . ”[46-tom] [Huckleberry]45-huck ’s hard pantings were [his]45-huck only reply , and [the boys]2054-the boys fixed [their]2054-the boys eyes on the goal of [their]2054-the boys hopes and bent to [their]2054-the boys work to win it . [They]2054-the boys gained steadily on it , and at last , breast to breast , [they]2054-the boys burst through the open door and fell grateful and exhausted in the sheltering shadows beyond . By and by [their]2054-the boys pulses slowed down , and [Tom]46-tom whispered : “ [Huckleberry]45-huck , what do [you]45-huck reckon’ll come of this ? ”[46-tom] “ If [Doctor Robinson]98-young doctor robinson dies , [I]46-tom reckon hanging’ll come of it . ”[46-tom] “ Do [you]46-tom though ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , [I]46-tom _ know _ it , [Tom]46-tom . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom thought a while , then [he]46-tom said : “ [Who ’ll tell]2266-who ’ll tell ? [We]2054-the boys ? ”[46-tom] “ What are [you]46-tom talking about ? S’pose something happened and [Injun Joe]100-injun joe _ did n’t _ hang ? Why , [he]100-injun joe ’d kill [us]2054-the boys some time or other , just as dead sure as [we]2054-the boys ’re a laying here . ”[46-tom] “ That ’s just what [I]46-tom was thinking to [myself]46-tom , [Huck]45-huck . ”[46-tom] “ If [anybody]203-anybody tells , let [Muff Potter]96-potter do it , if [he]96-potter ’s fool enough . [He]96-potter ’s generally drunk enough . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom said nothing — went on thinking . Presently [he]46-tom whispered : “ [Huck]45-huck , [Muff Potter]96-potter do n’t know it . How can [he]96-potter tell ? ”[46-tom] “ What ’s the reason [he]96-potter do n’t know it ? ”[46-tom] “ Because [he]96-potter ’d just got that whack when [Injun Joe]100-injun joe done it . [D’you]2268-d’you reckon [he]96-potter could see anything ? [D’you]2268-d’you reckon [he]96-potter knowed anything ? ”[46-tom] “ By hokey , that ’s so , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ And besides , look - a - here — maybe that whack done for _ [him]96-potter _ ! ”[46-tom] “ No , ’ taint likely , [Tom]46-tom . [He]96-potter had liquor in [him]96-potter ; [I]46-tom could see that ; and besides , [he]96-potter always has . Well , when pap ’s full , [you]2269-you might take and belt [him]96-potter over the head with [a church]2270-a church and [you]2269-you could n’t phase [him]96-potter . [He]96-potter says so , [[his]96-potter own self]2173-his own self . So it ’s the same with [Muff Potter]96-potter , of course . But if [a man]208-a man was dead sober , [I]46-tom reckon maybe that whack might fetch [him]96-potter ; [I]46-tom dono . ”[46-tom] After another reflective silence , [Tom]46-tom said : “ [Hucky]45-huck , [you]45-huck sure [you]45-huck can keep [mum]2273-mum ? ”[46-tom] “ [Tom]46-tom , [we]2274-we _ got _ to keep [mum]2273-mum . [You]46-tom know that . [That Injun devil]2276-that injun devil would n’t make any more of drownding [us]2274-we than a couple of cats , if [we]2274-we was to squeak ’bout this and [they]2277-they did n’t hang [him]2276-that injun devil . Now , look - a - here , [Tom]46-tom , less take and swear to [one another]2278-one another — that ’s what [we]2274-we got to do — swear to keep [mum]2273-mum . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom ’m agreed . It ’s the best thing . Would [you]46-tom just hold hands and swear that [we]2274-we — ”[46-tom] “ Oh no , that would n’t do for this . That ’s good enough for little rubbishy common things — specially with [gals]2280-gals , cuz _ [they]2280-gals _ go back on [you]46-tom anyway , and blab if [they]2280-gals get in a huff — but there orter be writing ’bout a big thing like this . And blood . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom ’s whole being applauded this idea . It was deep , and dark , and awful ; the hour , the circumstances , the surroundings , were in keeping with it . [He]46-tom picked up a clean pine shingle that lay in the moon - light , took a little fragment of “ red keel ”[46-tom] out of [his]46-tom pocket , got the moon on [his]46-tom work , and painfully scrawled these lines , emphasizing each slow down - stroke by clamping [his]46-tom tongue between [his]46-tom teeth , and letting up the pressure on the up - strokes . “ [Huck Finn]45-huck and [Tom Sawyer]46-tom swears [they]2280-gals will keep mum about This and [They]2280-gals wish [They]2280-gals may Drop down dead in [[Their]2280-gals Tracks]2281-their tracks if [They]2280-gals ever Tell and Rot . ”[45-huck] [Huckleberry]45-huck was filled with admiration of [Tom]46-tom ’s facility in writing , and the sublimity of [his]46-tom language . [He]45-huck at once took a pin from [his]45-huck lapel and was going to prick [his]45-huck flesh , but [Tom]46-tom said : “ Hold on ! Do n’t do that . A pin ’s brass . It might have verdigrease on it . ”[46-tom] “ What ’s verdigrease ? ”[45-huck] “ It ’s p’ison . That ’s what it is . [You]2282-you just swaller some of it once — [you’ll]2282-you see . ”[46-tom] So [Tom]46-tom unwound the thread from one of [his]46-tom needles , and [each boy]840-each boy pricked the ball of [his]46-tom thumb and squeezed out a drop of blood . In time , after many squeezes , [Tom]46-tom managed to sign [his]46-tom initials , using the ball of [his]46-tom little finger for a pen . Then [he]46-tom showed [Huckleberry]45-huck how to make an H and an F , and the oath was complete . [They]841-they buried the shingle close to the wall , with some dismal ceremonies and incantations , and the fetters that bound [their]841-they tongues were considered to be locked and the key thrown away . [A figure]842-a figure crept stealthily through a break in the other end of [the ruined building]843-the ruined building , now , but [they]841-they did not notice it . “ [Tom]46-tom , ”[45-huck] whispered [Huckleberry]45-huck , “ does this keep [us]841-they from _ ever _ telling—_always _ ? ”[45-huck] “ Of course it does . It do n’t make any difference _ what _ happens , [we]841-they got to keep [mum]2273-mum . [We]841-they ’d drop down dead — don’t _ [you]46-tom _ know that ? ”[842-a figure] “ Yes , [I]841-they reckon that ’s so . ”[841-they] [They]841-they continued to whisper for some little time . Presently a dog set up a long , lugubrious howl just outside — within ten feet of [them]841-they . [The boys]2054-the boys clasped [each other]227-each other suddenly , in an agony of fright . “ Which of [us]841-they does [he]842-a figure mean ? ”[45-huck] gasped [Huckleberry]45-huck . “ [I]45-huck dono — peep through the crack . Quick ! ”[45-huck] “ No , _ [you]46-tom _ , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[45-huck] “ [I]45-huck can’t — [I]45-huck ca n’t _ do _ it , Huck ! ”[45-huck] “ Please , [Tom]46-tom . There ’ tis again ! ”[45-huck] “ Oh , lordy , [I]46-tom ’m thankful ! ”[46-tom] whispered [Tom]46-tom . “ [I]46-tom know [his]842-a figure voice . It ’s [Bull Harbison]102-bull harbison . ”[46-tom] * [ * If [Mr. Harbison]103-mr. harbison owned [a slave]846-a slave named [Bull]102-bull harbison , [Tom]46-tom would have spoken of [him]102-bull harbison as “ [[Harbison]102-bull harbison ’s Bull]2284-harbison ’s bull , ”[46-tom] but [a son or a dog of that name]847-a son or a dog of that name was “ [Bull Harbison]102-bull harbison . ”[46-tom] ] “ Oh , that ’s good — [I]45-huck tell [you]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , [I]45-huck was most scared to death ; [I]45-huck ’d a bet anything it was a _ stray _ dog . ”[45-huck] The dog howled again . [The boys]2054-the boys ’ hearts sank once more . “ Oh , [my]45-huck ! that ai n’t no [Bull Harbison]102-bull harbison ! ”[45-huck] whispered [Huckleberry]45-huck . “ _ Do _ , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[45-huck] [Tom]46-tom , quaking with fear , yielded , and put [his]46-tom eye to the crack . [His]46-tom whisper was hardly audible when [he]46-tom said : “ Oh , [Huck]45-huck , _ it ’s a stray dog _ ! ”[46-tom] “ Quick , [Tom]46-tom , quick ! Who does [he]102-bull harbison mean ? ”[46-tom] “ [Huck]45-huck , [he]102-bull harbison must mean [us]2285-us both — [we’re]2285-us right together . ”[45-huck] “ Oh , [Tom]46-tom , [I]46-tom reckon [we]2285-us ’re goners . [I]46-tom reckon there ai n’t no mistake ’bout where _ [I]46-tom ’ll _ go to . [I]46-tom been so wicked . ”[46-tom] “ [Dad]104-dad fetch it ! This comes of playing hookey and doing everything [a feller]2286-a feller ’s told _ not _ to do . [I]46-tom might a been good , like [Sid]51-sid , if [I]46-tom ’d a tried — but no , [I]46-tom would n’t , of course . But if ever [I]46-tom get off this time , [I]46-tom lay [I]46-tom ’ll just _ waller _ in [Sunday - schools]2287-sunday - schools ! ”[46-tom] And [Tom]46-tom began to snuffle a little . “ _ [You]46-tom _ bad ! ”[46-tom] and [Huckleberry]45-huck began to snuffle too . “ Consound it , [Tom Sawyer]46-tom , [you]46-tom ’re just old pie , ’ long - side o ’ what [I]45-huck am . Oh , _ lordy _ , lordy , lordy , [I]45-huck wisht [I]45-huck only had half [your]46-tom chance . ”[45-huck] [Tom]46-tom choked off and whispered : “ Look , [Hucky]45-huck , look ! [He]45-huck ’s got [his]45-huck _ back _ to [us]2288-us ! ”[46-tom] [Hucky]45-huck looked , with joy in [his]45-huck heart . “ Well , [he]45-huck has , by [jingoes]2289-jingoes ! Did [he]45-huck before ? ”[45-huck] “ Yes , [he]45-huck did . But [I]46-tom , like [a fool]2290-a fool , never thought . Oh , this is [bully]2291-bully , [you]46-tom know . _ Now _ who can [he]45-huck mean ? ”[46-tom] The howling stopped . [Tom]46-tom pricked up [his]46-tom ears . “ Sh ! What ’s that ? ”[46-tom] [he]46-tom whispered . “ Sounds like — like hogs grunting . No — it ’s [somebody]262-somebody snoring , [Tom]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ That _ is _ it ! Where ’ bouts is it , [Huck]45-huck ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]46-tom bleeve it ’s down at ’ tother end . Sounds so , anyway . [Pap]80-pap used to sleep there , sometimes , ’ long with the hogs , but laws bless [you]46-tom , [he]80-pap just lifts things when _ [he]80-pap _ snores . Besides , [I]46-tom reckon [he]80-pap ai n’t ever coming back to [this town]2162-this town any more . ”[46-tom] The spirit of adventure rose in [the boys]2054-the boys ’ souls once more . “ [Hucky]45-huck , do [you]45-huck das’t to go if [I]45-huck lead ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]46-tom do n’t like to , much . [Tom]46-tom , s’pose it ’s Injun [Joe]100-injun joe ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom quailed . But presently the temptation rose up strong again and [the boys]2054-the boys agreed to try , with the understanding that [they]2054-the boys would take to [their]2054-the boys heels if the snoring stopped . So [they]2054-the boys went tiptoeing stealthily down , the one behind the other . When [they]2054-the boys had got to within five steps of the snorer , [Tom]46-tom stepped on a stick , and it broke with a sharp snap . [The man]492-the man moaned , writhed a little , and [his]492-the man face came into the moonlight . It was [Muff Potter]96-potter . [The boys]2054-the boys ’ hearts had stood still , and [their]2054-the boys hopes too , when [the man]492-the man moved , but [their]2054-the boys fears passed away now . [They]2054-the boys tip - toed out , through the broken weather - boarding , and stopped at a little distance to exchange a parting word . That long , lugubrious howl rose on the night air again ! [They]2054-the boys turned and saw the strange dog standing within a few feet of where [Potter]96-potter was lying , and _ facing [_ Potter]96-potter , with [his]492-the man nose pointing heavenward . “ Oh , geeminy , it ’s _ [him]492-the man _ ! ”[235-both boys] exclaimed [both boys]235-both boys , in a breath . “ Say , [Tom]46-tom — [they]2054-the boys say a stray dog come howling around [[Johnny Miller]60-johnny miller ’s house]2294-johnny miller ’s house , ’bout midnight , as much as two weeks ago ; and a whippoorwill come in and lit on the banisters and sung , the very same evening ; and there ai n’t [anybody dead there]2295-anybody dead there yet . ”[235-both boys] “ Well , [I]492-the man know that . And suppose there ai n’t . Did n’t [Gracie Miller]60-johnny miller fall in the kitchen fire and burn [herself]60-johnny miller terrible the very next Saturday ? ”[492-the man] “ Yes , but [she]60-johnny miller ai n’t _ dead _ . And what ’s more , [she]60-johnny miller ’s getting better , too . ”[235-both boys] “ All right , [you]46-tom wait and see . [She]60-johnny miller ’s [a goner]2296-a goner , just as dead sure as [Muff Potter]96-potter ’s [a goner]2296-a goner . That ’s what [the niggers]2298-the niggers say , and [they]2298-the niggers know all about these kind of things , [Huck]45-huck . ”[492-the man] Then [they]235-both boys separated , cogitating . When [Tom]46-tom crept in at [his]46-tom bedroom window the night was almost spent . [He]46-tom undressed with excessive caution , and fell asleep congratulating [himself]46-tom that [nobody]647-nobody knew of [his]46-tom escapade . [He]46-tom was not aware that [the gently - snoring Sid]856-the gently - snoring sid was awake , and had been so for an hour . When [Tom]46-tom awoke , [Sid]51-sid was dressed and gone . There was a late look in the light , a late sense in the atmosphere . [He]46-tom was startled . Why had [he]46-tom not been called — persecuted till [he]46-tom was up , as usual ? The thought filled [him]46-tom with bodings . Within five minutes [he]46-tom was dressed and down - [stairs]857-stairs , feeling sore and drowsy . [The family]858-the family were still at table , but [they]858-the family had finished breakfast . There was no voice of rebuke ; but there were averted eyes ; there was a silence and an air of solemnity that struck a chill to [the culprit]859-the culprit ’s heart . [He]46-tom sat down and tried to seem gay , but it was up - hill work ; it roused no smile , no response , and [he]46-tom lapsed into silence and let [his]46-tom heart sink down to the depths . After breakfast [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt took [him]46-tom aside , and [Tom]46-tom almost brightened in the hope that [he]46-tom was going to be flogged ; but it was not so . [[His]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt wept over [him]46-tom and asked [him]46-tom how [he]46-tom could go and break [her]196-his aunt old heart so ; and finally told [him]46-tom to go on , and ruin [himself]46-tom and bring [her]196-his aunt gray hairs with sorrow to the grave , for it was no use for [her]196-his aunt to try any more . This was worse than a thousand whippings , and [Tom]46-tom ’s heart was sorer now than [his]46-tom body . [He]46-tom cried , [he]46-tom pleaded for forgiveness , promised to reform over and over again , and then received [his]46-tom dismissal , feeling that [he]46-tom had won but an imperfect forgiveness and established but a feeble confidence . [He]46-tom left [the presence]862-the presence too miserable to even feel revengeful toward [Sid]51-sid ; and so [the latter]433-the latter ’s prompt retreat through the back gate was unnecessary . [He]46-tom moped to school gloomy and sad , and took [his]46-tom flogging , along with [Joe Harper]62-joe , for playing hookey the day before , with the air of [one whose heart was busy with heavier woes and wholly dead to trifles]864-one whose heart was busy with heavier woes and wholly dead to trifles . Then [he]46-tom betook [himself]46-tom to [his]46-tom seat , rested [his]46-tom elbows on [his]46-tom desk and [his]46-tom jaws in [his]46-tom hands , and stared at the wall with the stony stare of suffering that has reached the limit and can no further go . [His]46-tom elbow was pressing against some hard substance . After a long time [he]46-tom slowly and sadly changed [his]46-tom position , and took up this object with a sigh . It was in a paper . [He]46-tom unrolled it . A long , lingering , colossal sigh followed , and [his]46-tom heart broke . It was [his]46-tom brass andiron knob ! This final feather broke the camel ’s back . CHAPTER XI Close upon the hour of noon [the whole village]865-the whole village was suddenly electrified with the ghastly news . No need of the as yet un - dreamed - of telegraph ; the tale flew from [man]866-man to [man]866-man , from [group]868-group to [group]868-group , from [house]870-house to [house]870-house , with little less than telegraphic speed . Of course [the schoolmaster]872-the schoolmaster gave holiday for that afternoon ; [the town]519-the town would have thought strangely of [him]872-the schoolmaster if [he]872-the schoolmaster had not . A gory knife had been found close to [the murdered man]831-the murdered man , and it had been recognized by [somebody]262-somebody as belonging to [Muff Potter]96-potter — so the story ran . And it was said that [a belated citizen]876-a belated citizen had come upon [Potter]96-potter washing [himself]96-potter in the “ branch ”[876-a belated citizen] about one or two o’clock in the morning , and that [Potter]96-potter had at once sneaked off — suspicious circumstances , especially the washing which was not a habit with [Potter]96-potter . It was also said that [the town]519-the town had been ransacked for [this “ murderer ”]2299-this “ murderer ”[880-the sheriff] ( [the public]878-the public are not slow in the matter of sifting evidence and arriving at a verdict ) , but that [he]96-potter could not be found . [Horsemen]105-horsemen had departed down [all the roads]879-all the roads in every direction , and [the Sheriff]880-the sheriff “ was confident ”[880-the sheriff] that [he]96-potter would be captured before night . All [the town]519-the town was drifting toward [the graveyard]786-the graveyard . [Tom]46-tom ’s heartbreak vanished and [he]46-tom joined [the procession]883-the procession , not because [he]46-tom would not a thousand times rather go anywhere else , but because an awful , unaccountable fascination drew [him]46-tom on . Arrived at [the dreadful place]884-the dreadful place , [he]46-tom wormed [his]46-tom small body through [the crowd]506-the crowd and saw the dismal spectacle . It seemed to [him]46-tom an age since [he]46-tom was there before . [Somebody]262-somebody pinched [his]46-tom arm . [He]46-tom turned , and [his]46-tom eyes met [Huckleberry]45-huck ’s . Then both looked elsewhere at once , and wondered if [anybody]203-anybody had noticed anything in [their]888-their mutual glance . But [everybody]490-everybody was talking , and intent upon the grisly spectacle before [them]490-everybody . “ [Poor fellow]2300-poor fellow ! ”[490-everybody] “ [Poor young fellow]2301-poor young fellow ! ”[544-the minister] “ This ought to be a lesson to [grave robbers]2302-grave robbers ! ”[544-the minister] “ [Muff Potter’ll]106-muff potter’ll hang for this if [they]2302-grave robbers catch [him]106-muff potter’ll ! ”[490-everybody] This was the drift of remark ; and [the minister]544-the minister said , “ It was a judgment ; [His]106-muff potter’ll hand is here . ”[544-the minister] Now [Tom]46-tom shivered from head to heel ; for [his]46-tom eye fell upon the stolid face of [Injun Joe]100-injun joe . At this moment [the crowd]506-the crowd began to sway and struggle , and voices shouted , “ It ’s [him]106-muff potter’ll ! it ’s [him]106-muff potter’ll ! [he]106-muff potter’ll ’s coming [himself]106-muff potter’ll ! ”[506-the crowd] “ Who ? Who ? ”[506-the crowd] from twenty voices . “ [Muff Potter]96-potter ! ”[506-the crowd] “ [Hallo]107-hallo , [he]106-muff potter’ll ’s stopped!—Look out , [he]106-muff potter’ll ’s turning ! Do n’t let [him]106-muff potter’ll get away ! ”[892-a bystander] People in the branches of the trees over [Tom]46-tom ’s head said [he]46-tom was n’t trying to get away — [he]46-tom only looked doubtful and perplexed . “ Infernal impudence ! ”[892-a bystander] said [a bystander]892-a bystander ; “ wanted to come and take a quiet look at [his]106-muff potter’ll work , [I]892-a bystander reckon — didn’t expect any company . ”[892-a bystander] [The crowd]506-the crowd fell apart , now , and [the Sheriff]880-the sheriff came through , ostentatiously leading [Potter]96-potter by the arm . [The poor fellow]487-the poor fellow ’s face was haggard , and [his]487-the poor fellow eyes showed the fear that was upon [him]487-the poor fellow . When [he]487-the poor fellow stood before [the murdered man]831-the murdered man , [he]487-the poor fellow shook as with a palsy , and [he]487-the poor fellow put [his]487-the poor fellow face in [his]487-the poor fellow hands and burst into tears . “ [I]487-the poor fellow did n’t do it , [friends]2303-friends , ”[487-the poor fellow] [he]487-the poor fellow sobbed ; “ ’ pon [my]487-the poor fellow word and honor [I]487-the poor fellow never done it . ”[487-the poor fellow] “ Who ’s accused [you]96-potter ? ”[96-potter] shouted a voice . This shot seemed to carry [home]197-home . [Potter]96-potter lifted [his]96-potter face and looked around [him]96-potter with a pathetic hopelessness in [his]96-potter eyes . [He]96-potter saw [Injun Joe]100-injun joe , and exclaimed : “ Oh , [Injun Joe]100-injun joe , [you]100-injun joe promised [me]100-injun joe [you]100-injun joe ’d never — ”[100-injun joe] “ Is that [your]100-injun joe knife ? ”[96-potter] and it was thrust before [him]96-potter by [the Sheriff]880-the sheriff . [Potter]96-potter would have fallen if [they]899-they had not caught [him]96-potter and eased [him]96-potter to the ground . Then [he]96-potter said : “ Something told [me]96-potter ’ t if [I]96-potter did n’t come back and get — ”[96-potter] [He]96-potter shuddered ; then waved [his]96-potter nerveless hand with a vanquished gesture and said , “ Tell ’em , [Joe]100-injun joe , tell ’em — it ai n’t any use any more . ”[96-potter] Then [Huckleberry]45-huck and [Tom]46-tom stood dumb and staring , and heard [the stony - hearted liar]900-the stony - hearted liar reel off [his]900-the stony - hearted liar serene statement , [they]899-they expecting every moment that the clear sky would deliver [God]65-god ’s lightnings upon [his]900-the stony - hearted liar head , and wondering to see how long the stroke was delayed . And when [he]900-the stony - hearted liar had finished and still stood alive and whole , [their]899-they wavering impulse to break [their]899-they oath and save [the poor betrayed prisoner]901-the poor betrayed prisoner ’s life faded and vanished away , for plainly [this miscreant]902-this miscreant had sold [himself]902-this miscreant to [Satan]108-satan and it would be fatal to meddle with the property of such a power as that . “ Why did n’t [you]900-the stony - hearted liar leave ? What did [you]900-the stony - hearted liar want to come here for ? ”[262-somebody] [somebody]262-somebody said . “ [I]96-potter could n’t help it — [I]96-potter could n’t help it , ”[96-potter] [Potter]96-potter moaned . “ [I]96-potter wanted to run away , but [I]96-potter could n’t seem to come anywhere but here . ”[96-potter] And [he]900-the stony - hearted liar fell to sobbing again . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe repeated [his]100-injun joe statement , just as calmly , a few minutes afterward on the inquest , under oath ; and [the boys]2054-the boys , seeing that the lightnings were still withheld , were confirmed in [their]2054-the boys belief that [Joe]100-injun joe had sold [himself]100-injun joe to [the devil]905-the devil . [He]100-injun joe was now become , to [them]2054-the boys , the most balefully interesting object [they]2054-the boys had ever looked upon , and [they]2054-the boys could not take [their]2054-the boys fascinated eyes from [his]100-injun joe face . [They]2054-the boys inwardly resolved to watch [him]100-injun joe nights , when opportunity should offer , in the hope of getting a glimpse of [[his]100-injun joe dread master]906-his dread master . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe helped to raise the body of [the murdered man]831-the murdered man and put it in [a wagon]908-a wagon for removal ; and it was whispered through [the shuddering crowd]909-the shuddering crowd that the wound bled a little ! [The boys]2054-the boys thought that this happy circumstance would turn suspicion in the right direction ; but [they]2054-the boys were disappointed , for more than [one villager]911-one villager remarked : “ [It]2304-it was within three feet of [Muff Potter]96-potter when it done it . ”[911-one villager] [Tom]46-tom ’s fearful secret and gnawing conscience disturbed [his]46-tom sleep for as much as a week after this ; and at breakfast one morning [Sid]51-sid said : “ [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom pitch around and talk in [your]46-tom sleep so much that [you]46-tom keep [me]51-sid awake half the time . ”[51-sid] [Tom]46-tom blanched and dropped [his]46-tom eyes . “ It ’s a bad sign , ”[47-aunt polly] said [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , gravely . “ What [you]46-tom got on [your]46-tom mind , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ Nothing . Nothing ’ t [I]2044-the boy know of . ”[2044-the boy] But [the boy]2044-the boy ’s hand shook so that [he]2044-the boy spilled [his]2044-the boy coffee . “ And [you]46-tom do talk such stuff , ”[51-sid] [Sid]51-sid said . “ Last night [you]46-tom said , ‘ It ’s blood , it ’s blood , that ’s what it is ! ’ [You]46-tom said that over and over . And [you]46-tom said , ‘ Do n’t torment [me]51-sid so — [I’ll]51-sid tell ! ’ Tell _ what _ ? What is it [you]46-tom ’ll tell ? ”[51-sid] Everything was swimming before [Tom]46-tom . There is no telling what might have happened , now , but luckily the concern passed out of [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s face and [she]47-aunt polly came to [Tom]46-tom ’s relief without knowing it . [She]47-aunt polly said : “ [Sho]109-sho ! It ’s that dreadful murder . [I]47-aunt polly dream about it most every night [myself]47-aunt polly . Sometimes [I]47-aunt polly dream it ’s [me]47-aunt polly that done it . ”[47-aunt polly] [Mary]47-aunt polly said [she]47-aunt polly had been affected much the same way . [Sid]51-sid seemed satisfied . [Tom]46-tom got out of the presence as quick as [he]46-tom plausibly could , and after that [he]46-tom complained of toothache for a week , and tied up [his]46-tom jaws every night . [He]46-tom never knew that [Sid]51-sid lay nightly watching , and frequently slipped the bandage free and then leaned on [his]51-sid elbow listening a good while at a time , and afterward slipped the bandage back to its place again . [Tom]46-tom ’s distress of mind wore off gradually and the toothache grew irksome and was discarded . If [Sid]51-sid really managed to make anything out of [Tom]46-tom ’s disjointed mutterings , [he]51-sid kept it to [himself]51-sid . It seemed to [Tom]46-tom that [[his]46-tom schoolmates]913-his schoolmates never would get done holding inquests on dead cats , and thus keeping [his]46-tom trouble present to [his]46-tom mind . [Sid]51-sid noticed that [Tom]46-tom never was [coroner]914-coroner at one of these inquiries , though it had been [his]46-tom habit to take the lead in all new enterprises ; [he]51-sid noticed , too , that [Tom]46-tom never acted as [a witness]915-a witness — and that was strange ; and [Sid]51-sid did not overlook the fact that [Tom]46-tom even showed a marked aversion to these inquests , and always avoided them when [he]46-tom could . [Sid]51-sid marvelled , but said nothing . However , even inquests went out of vogue at last , and ceased to torture [Tom]46-tom ’s conscience . Every day or two , during this time of sorrow , [Tom]46-tom watched [his]46-tom opportunity and went to [the little grated jail]916-the little grated jail - window and smuggled such small comforts through to [the “ murderer ”]2305-the “ murderer ”[2305-the “ murderer ”] as [he]46-tom could get hold of . [The jail]917-the jail was [a trifling little brick den that stood in [a marsh at the edge of [the village]206-the village]919-a marsh at the edge of the village]918-a trifling little brick den that stood in a marsh at the edge of the village , and [no guards]921-no guards were afforded for [it]917-the jail ; indeed , [it]917-the jail was seldom occupied . These offerings greatly helped to ease [Tom]46-tom ’s conscience . [The villagers]922-the villagers had a strong desire to tar - and - feather [Injun Joe]100-injun joe and ride [him]100-injun joe on a rail , for body - snatching , but so formidable was [his]46-tom character that [nobody]647-nobody could be found who was willing to take the lead in the matter , so it was dropped . [He]46-tom had been careful to begin both of [his]46-tom inquest - statements with the fight , without confessing the grave - robbery that preceded it ; therefore it was deemed wisest not to try the case in the courts at present . CHAPTER XII One of the reasons why [Tom]46-tom ’s mind had drifted away from its secret troubles was , that it had found a new and weighty matter to interest [itself]924-itself about . [Becky Thatcher]86-becky had stopped coming to [school]2056-school . [Tom]46-tom had struggled with [his]46-tom pride a few days , and tried to “ whistle [her]86-becky down the wind , ”[86-becky] but failed . [He]46-tom began to find [himself]46-tom hanging around [[[her]86-becky father]926-her father ’s house]927-her father ’s house , nights , and feeling very miserable . [She]86-becky was ill . What if [she]86-becky should die ! There was distraction in the thought . [He]46-tom no longer took an interest in war , nor even in piracy . The charm of life was gone ; there was nothing but dreariness left . [He]46-tom put [his]46-tom hoop away , and [his]46-tom bat ; there was no joy in them any more . [[His]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt was concerned . [She]196-his aunt began to try all manner of remedies on [him]46-tom . [She]196-his aunt was one of [those people who are infatuated with patent medicines and all new - fangled methods of producing health or mending it]929-those people who are infatuated with patent medicines and all new - fangled methods of producing health or mending it . [She]196-his aunt was [an inveterate experimenter in these things]930-an inveterate experimenter in these things . When something fresh in this line came out [she]196-his aunt was in a fever , right away , to try it ; not on [herself]196-his aunt , for [she]196-his aunt was never ailing , but on [anybody else that came handy]931-anybody else that came handy . [She]196-his aunt was [a subscriber for all the “ Health ”[932-a subscriber for all the “ health ” periodicals and phrenological frauds] periodicals and phrenological frauds]932-a subscriber for all the “ health ” periodicals and phrenological frauds ; and the solemn ignorance [they]933-they were inflated with was breath to [her]196-his aunt nostrils . All the “ rot ”[933-they] [they]933-they contained about ventilation , and how to go to bed , and how to get up , and what to eat , and what to drink , and how much exercise to take , and what frame of mind to keep [one]934-one ’s self in , and what sort of clothing to wear , was all gospel to [her]196-his aunt , and [she]196-his aunt never observed that [her]196-his aunt health - journals of the current month customarily upset everything [they]933-they had recommended the month before . [She]196-his aunt was as simple - hearted and honest as the day was long , and so [she]196-his aunt was [an easy victim]935-an easy victim . [She]196-his aunt gathered together [her]196-his aunt quack periodicals and [her]196-his aunt quack medicines , and thus armed with death , went about on [her]196-his aunt pale horse , metaphorically speaking , with “ hell following after . ”[196-his aunt] But [she]196-his aunt never suspected that [she]196-his aunt was not [an angel of healing]936-an angel of healing and the balm of [Gilead]110-gilead in disguise , to [the suffering neighbors]937-the suffering neighbors . The water treatment was new , now , and [Tom]46-tom ’s low condition was a windfall to [her]196-his aunt . [She]196-his aunt had [him]46-tom out at daylight every morning , stood [him]46-tom up in [the wood - shed]938-the wood - shed and drowned [him]46-tom with a deluge of cold water ; then [she]196-his aunt scrubbed [him]46-tom down with a towel like a file , and so brought [him]46-tom to ; then [she]196-his aunt rolled [him]46-tom up in a wet sheet and put [him]46-tom away under blankets till [she]196-his aunt sweated [his]46-tom soul clean and “ the yellow stains of it came through [his]46-tom pores”—as[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom said . Yet notwithstanding all this , [the boy]2044-the boy grew more and more melancholy and pale and dejected . [She]196-his aunt added hot baths , sitz baths , shower baths , and plunges . [The boy]2044-the boy remained as dismal as a hearse . [She]196-his aunt began to assist the water with a slim oatmeal diet and blister - plasters . [She]196-his aunt calculated [his]46-tom capacity as [she]196-his aunt would a jug ’s , and filled [him]46-tom up every day with quack cure - alls . [Tom]46-tom had become indifferent to persecution by this time . This phase filled [the old lady]189-the old lady ’s heart with consternation . This indifference must be broken up at any cost . Now [she]196-his aunt heard of [Pain - killer]942-pain - killer for the first time . [She]196-his aunt ordered a lot at once . [She]196-his aunt tasted it and was filled with gratitude . It was simply fire in a liquid form . [She]196-his aunt dropped the water treatment and everything else , and pinned [her]196-his aunt faith to [Pain - killer]942-pain - killer . [She]196-his aunt gave [Tom]46-tom a teaspoonful and watched with the deepest anxiety for the result . [Her]196-his aunt troubles were instantly at rest , [her]196-his aunt soul at peace again ; for the “ indifference ”[196-his aunt] was broken up . [The boy]2044-the boy could not have shown a wilder , heartier interest , if [she]196-his aunt had built a fire under [him]2044-the boy . [Tom]46-tom felt that it was time to wake up ; this sort of life might be romantic enough , in [his]46-tom blighted condition , but it was getting to have too little sentiment and too much distracting variety about it . So [he]46-tom thought over various plans for relief , and finally hit upon that of professing to be fond of [Pain - killer]942-pain - killer . [He]46-tom asked for it so often that [he]46-tom became a nuisance , and [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ended by telling [him]46-tom to help [himself]46-tom and quit bothering [her]196-his aunt . If it had been [Sid]51-sid , [she]196-his aunt would have had no misgivings to alloy [her]196-his aunt delight ; but since it was [Tom]46-tom , [she]196-his aunt watched the bottle clandestinely . [She]196-his aunt found that the medicine did really diminish , but it did not occur to [her]196-his aunt that [the boy]2044-the boy was mending the health of a crack in the sitting - room floor with it . One day [Tom]46-tom was in the act of dosing the crack when [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ’s yellow cat came along , purring , eyeing the teaspoon avariciously , and begging for a taste . [Tom]46-tom said : “ Do n’t ask for it unless [you]111-peter want it , [Peter]111-peter . ”[46-tom] But [Peter]111-peter signified that [he]111-peter did want it . “ [You]46-tom better make sure . ”[111-peter] [Peter]111-peter was sure . “ Now [you]46-tom ’ve asked for it , and [I]111-peter ’ll give it to [you]46-tom , because there ai n’t anything mean about [me]111-peter ; but if [you]46-tom find [you]46-tom do n’t like it , [you]46-tom must n’t blame [anybody]203-anybody but [[your]46-tom own self]2307-your own self . ”[111-peter] [Peter]111-peter was agreeable . So [Tom]46-tom pried [his]46-tom mouth open and poured down [the Pain - killer]949-the pain - killer . [Peter]111-peter sprang a couple of yards in the air , and then delivered a war - whoop and set off round and round [the room]190-the room , banging against furniture , upsetting flower - pots , and making general havoc . Next [he]46-tom rose on [his]46-tom hind feet and pranced around , in a frenzy of enjoyment , with [his]46-tom head over [his]46-tom shoulder and [his]46-tom voice proclaiming [his]46-tom unappeasable happiness . Then [he]46-tom went tearing around [the house]332-the house again spreading chaos and destruction in [his]46-tom path . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly entered in time to see [him]46-tom throw a few double summersets , deliver a final mighty hurrah , and sail through the open window , carrying the rest of the flower - pots with [him]46-tom . [The old lady]189-the old lady stood petrified with astonishment , peering over [her]189-the old lady glasses ; [Tom]46-tom lay on the floor expiring with laughter . “ [Tom]46-tom , what on earth ails that cat ? ”[46-tom] “ [I]2044-the boy do n’t know , [aunt]2041-aunt , ”[2044-the boy] gasped [the boy]2044-the boy . “ Why , [I]2044-the boy never see anything like it . What did make [him]46-tom act so ? ”[2044-the boy] “ [Deed]112-deed [I]46-tom do n’t know , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ; cats always act so when [they]2309-they ’re having a good time . ”[46-tom] “ [They]2309-they do , do [they]2309-they ? ”[2044-the boy] There was something in the tone that made [Tom]46-tom apprehensive . “ Yes’m . That is , [I]2044-the boy believe [they]2309-they do . ”[2044-the boy] “ [You]2044-the boy _ do _ ? ”[46-tom] “ Yes’m . ”[189-the old lady] [The old lady]189-the old lady was bending down , [Tom]46-tom watching , with interest emphasized by anxiety . Too late [he]46-tom divined [her]189-the old lady “ drift . ”[46-tom] The handle of the telltale tea - spoon was visible under the bed - valance . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly took it , held it up . [Tom]46-tom winced , and dropped [his]46-tom eyes . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly raised [him]46-tom by the usual handle — [his]46-tom ear — and cracked [his]46-tom head soundly with [her]47-aunt polly thimble . “ Now , [sir]2078-sir , what did [you]2078-sir want to treat that poor dumb beast so , for ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ [I]47-aunt polly done it out of pity for [him]46-tom — because [he]46-tom had n’t [any aunt]2311-any aunt . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Had n’t any aunt!—you numskull . What has that got to do with it ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ Heaps . Because if [he]46-tom ’d had one [she]2311-any aunt ’d a burnt [him]46-tom out [herself]2311-any aunt ! [She]2311-any aunt ’d a roasted [his]46-tom bowels out of [him]46-tom ’ thout any more feeling than if [he]46-tom was [a human]2312-a human ! ”[47-aunt polly] [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly felt a sudden pang of remorse . This was putting the thing in a new light ; what was cruelty to a cat _ might _ be cruelty to [a boy]191-a boy , too . [She]47-aunt polly began to soften ; [she]47-aunt polly felt sorry . [Her]47-aunt polly eyes watered a little , and [she]47-aunt polly put [her]47-aunt polly hand on [Tom]46-tom ’s head and said gently : “ [I]47-aunt polly was meaning for the best , [Tom]46-tom . And , [Tom]46-tom , it _ did _ do [you]46-tom good . ”[47-aunt polly] [Tom]46-tom looked up in [her]47-aunt polly face with just a perceptible twinkle peeping through [his]46-tom gravity . “ [I]47-aunt polly know [you]47-aunt polly was meaning for the best , [aunty]2313-aunty , and so was [I]47-aunt polly with [Peter]111-peter . It done _ [him]111-peter _ good , too . [I]47-aunt polly never see [him]111-peter get around so since — ”[47-aunt polly] “ Oh , go ’ long with [you]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , before [you]46-tom aggravate [me]46-tom again . And [you]46-tom try and see if [you]46-tom ca n’t be [a good boy]2101-a good boy , for once , and [you]46-tom need n’t take any more medicine . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom reached [school]2056-school ahead of time . It was noticed that this strange thing had been occurring every day latterly . And now , as usual of late , [he]46-tom hung about the gate of [the schoolyard]957-the schoolyard instead of playing with [[his]46-tom comrades]958-his comrades . [He]46-tom was sick , [he]46-tom said , and [he]46-tom looked it . [He]46-tom tried to seem to be looking everywhere but whither [he]46-tom really was looking — down [the road]959-the road . Presently [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher hove in sight , and [Tom]46-tom ’s face lighted ; [he]63-jeff thatcher gazed a moment , and then turned sorrowfully away . When [Jeff]63-jeff thatcher arrived , [Tom]46-tom accosted [him]63-jeff thatcher ; and “ led up ”[46-tom] warily to opportunities for remark about [Becky]86-becky , but [the giddy lad]960-the giddy lad never could see the bait . [Tom]46-tom watched and watched , hoping whenever [a frisking frock]961-a frisking frock came in sight , and hating the owner of [it]961-a frisking frock as soon as [he]46-tom saw [she]86-becky was not the right one . At last frocks ceased to appear , and [he]46-tom dropped hopelessly into the dumps ; [he]46-tom entered [the empty schoolhouse]962-the empty schoolhouse and sat down to suffer . Then [one more frock]963-one more frock passed in at the gate , and [Tom]46-tom ’s heart gave a great bound . The next instant [he]46-tom was out , and “ going on ”[46-tom] like [an Indian]964-an indian ; yelling , laughing , chasing [boys]183-boys , jumping over the fence at risk of life and limb , throwing handsprings , standing on [his]46-tom head — doing all the heroic things [he]46-tom could conceive of , and keeping a furtive eye out , all the while , to see if [Becky Thatcher]86-becky was noticing . But [she]86-becky seemed to be unconscious of it all ; [she]86-becky never looked . Could it be possible that [she]86-becky was not aware that [he]46-tom was [there]2038-there ? [He]46-tom carried [his]46-tom exploits to [[her]86-becky immediate vicinity]967-her immediate vicinity ; came war - whooping around , snatched [a boy]191-a boy ’s cap , hurled it to the roof of [the schoolhouse]969-the schoolhouse , broke through [a group of [boys]183-boys]970-a group of boys , tumbling [them]970-a group of boys in every direction , and fell sprawling , [himself]46-tom , under [Becky]86-becky ’s nose , almost upsetting [her]86-becky — and [she]86-becky turned , with [her]86-becky nose in the air , and [he]46-tom heard [her]86-becky say : “ Mf ! [some people]2315-some people think [they]2315-some people ’re mighty smart — always showing off ! ”[86-becky] [Tom]46-tom ’s cheeks burned . [He]46-tom gathered [himself]46-tom up and sneaked off , crushed and crestfallen . CHAPTER XIII [Tom]46-tom ’s mind was made up now . [He]46-tom was gloomy and desperate . [He]46-tom was [a forsaken , friendless boy]972-a forsaken , friendless boy , [he]46-tom said ; [nobody]647-nobody loved [him]46-tom ; when [they]647-nobody found out what [they]647-nobody had driven [him]46-tom to , perhaps [they]647-nobody would be sorry ; [he]46-tom had tried to do right and get along , but [they]647-nobody would not let [him]46-tom ; since nothing would do [them]647-nobody but to be rid of [him]46-tom , let it be so ; and let [them]647-nobody blame _ [him]46-tom _ for the consequences — why should n’t [they]647-nobody ? What right had [the friendless]974-the friendless to complain ? Yes , [they]647-nobody had forced [him]46-tom to it at last : [he]46-tom would lead a life of crime . There was no choice . By this time [he]46-tom was far down [Meadow Lane]19-meadow lane , and the bell for [school]2056-school to “ take up ”[647-nobody] tinkled faintly upon [his]46-tom ear . [He]46-tom sobbed , now , to think [he]46-tom should never , never hear that old familiar sound any more — it was very hard , but it was forced on [him]46-tom ; since [he]46-tom was driven out into [the cold world]361-the cold world , [he]46-tom must submit — but [he]46-tom forgave [them]647-nobody . Then the sobs came thick and fast . Just at this point [he]46-tom met [[his]46-tom soul ’s sworn comrade]977-his soul ’s sworn comrade , [Joe Harper]62-joe — hard - eyed , and with evidently a great and dismal purpose in [his]62-joe heart . Plainly here were “ [two souls with but a single thought]2316-two souls with but a single thought . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , wiping [his]46-tom eyes with [his]46-tom sleeve , began to blubber out something about a resolution to escape from hard usage and lack of sympathy at [home]197-home by roaming abroad into [the great world]979-the great world never to return ; and ended by hoping that [Joe]62-joe would not forget [him]46-tom . But it transpired that this was a request which [Joe]62-joe had just been going to make of [Tom]46-tom , and had come to hunt [him]46-tom up for that purpose . [[His]46-tom mother]531-his mother had whipped [him]46-tom for drinking some cream which [he]46-tom had never tasted and knew nothing about ; it was plain that [she]531-his mother was tired of [him]46-tom and wished [him]46-tom to go ; if [she]531-his mother felt that way , there was nothing for [him]46-tom to do but succumb ; [he]46-tom hoped [she]531-his mother would be happy , and never regret having driven [[her]531-his mother poor boy]981-her poor boy out into [the unfeeling world]982-the unfeeling world to suffer and die . As [the two boys]701-the two boys walked sorrowing along , [they]701-the two boys made a new compact to stand by [each other]227-each other and be [brothers]985-brothers and never separate till death relieved [them]701-the two boys of [their]701-the two boys troubles . Then [they]701-the two boys began to lay [their]701-the two boys plans . [Joe]62-joe was for being [a hermit]986-a hermit , and living on crusts in [a remote cave]987-a remote cave , and dying , some time , of cold and want and grief ; but after listening to [Tom]46-tom , [he]62-joe conceded that there were some conspicuous advantages about a life of crime , and so [he]62-joe consented to be [a pirate]754-a pirate . Three miles below [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg , at [a point where [the Mississippi River]20-the mississippi river]989-a point where the mississippi river was a trifle over a mile wide , there was [a long , narrow , wooded island]990-a long , narrow , wooded island , with a shallow bar at the head of [it]990-a long , narrow , wooded island , and this offered well as a rendezvous . It was not inhabited ; [it]990-a long , narrow , wooded island lay far over toward [the further shore]991-the further shore , abreast [a dense and almost wholly unpeopled forest]992-a dense and almost wholly unpeopled forest . So [[Jackson]113-jackson ’s Island]21-jackson ’s island was chosen . Who were to be [the subjects of [their]701-the two boys piracies]993-the subjects of their piracies was a matter that did not occur to [them]701-the two boys . Then [they]701-the two boys hunted up [Huckleberry Finn]45-huck , and [he]45-huck joined [them]701-the two boys promptly , for all careers were one to [him]45-huck ; [he]45-huck was indifferent . [They]701-the two boys presently separated to meet at [a lonely spot on [the river - bank]995-the river - bank two miles above [the village]206-the village]994-a lonely spot on the river - bank two miles above the village at the favorite hour — which was midnight . There was a small log raft there which [they]701-the two boys meant to capture . Each would bring hooks and lines , and such provision as [he]45-huck could steal in the most dark and mysterious way — as became [outlaws]997-outlaws . And before the afternoon was done , [they]701-the two boys had all managed to enjoy the sweet glory of spreading the fact that pretty soon [the town]519-the town would “ hear something . ”[999-all who got this vague hint] [All who got this vague hint]999-all who got this vague hint were cautioned to “ be [mum and wait]2317-mum and wait . ”[999-all who got this vague hint] About midnight [Tom]46-tom arrived with a boiled ham and a few trifles , and stopped in a dense undergrowth on [a small bluff overlooking [the meeting - place]1001-the meeting - place]1000-a small bluff overlooking the meeting - place . [It]1002-it was starlight , and very still . [The mighty river]1003-the mighty river lay like [an ocean at rest]1004-an ocean at rest . [Tom]46-tom listened a moment , but no sound disturbed the quiet . Then [he]46-tom gave a low , distinct whistle . It was answered from under [the bluff]1005-the bluff . [Tom]46-tom whistled twice more ; these signals were answered in the same way . Then a guarded voice said : “ Who goes [there]2038-there ? ”[46-tom] “ [Tom Sawyer]46-tom , [the Black Avenger of the Spanish Main]2319-the black avenger of the spanish main . Name [your]46-tom names . ”[46-tom] “ [Huck Finn the Red - Handed]45-huck , and [Joe Harper]62-joe [the Terror of [the Seas]22-the seas]2320-the terror of the seas . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom had furnished these titles , from [his]46-tom favorite literature . “ ’ Tis well . Give the countersign . ”[46-tom] Two hoarse whispers delivered the same awful word simultaneously to the brooding night : “ _ Blood _ ! ”[46-tom] Then [Tom]46-tom tumbled [his]46-tom ham over [the bluff]1005-the bluff and let [himself]46-tom down after it , tearing both skin and clothes to some extent in the effort . There was an easy , comfortable path along [the shore]1007-the shore under [the bluff]1005-the bluff , but [it]1009-it lacked the advantages of difficulty and danger so valued by [a pirate]754-a pirate . [The Terror of [the Seas]22-the seas]2320-the terror of the seas had brought a side of bacon , and had about worn [himself]46-tom out with getting it [there]2038-there . [Finn the Red - Handed]45-huck had stolen a skillet and a quantity of half - cured leaf tobacco , and had also brought a few corn - cobs to make pipes with . But [none of [the pirates]1014-the pirates]1013-none of the pirates smoked or “ chewed ”[46-tom] but [himself]46-tom . [The Black Avenger of the Spanish Main]2319-the black avenger of the spanish main said it would never do to start without some fire . That was a wise thought ; matches were hardly known [there]2038-there in that day . [They]1017-they saw a fire smouldering upon a great raft a hundred yards above , and [they]1017-they went stealthily thither and helped [themselves]1017-they to a chunk . [They]1017-they made an imposing adventure of it , saying , “ Hist ! ”[1017-they] every now and then , and suddenly halting with finger on lip ; moving with hands on imaginary dagger - hilts ; and giving orders in dismal whispers that if “ [the foe ”]2321-the foe ”[1017-they] stirred , to “ let [him]2321-the foe ” have it to the hilt , ”[1017-they] because “ [dead men]2322-dead men tell no tales . ”[1017-they] [They]1017-they knew well enough that [the raftsmen]1018-the raftsmen were all down at [the village]206-the village laying in stores or having a spree , but still that was no excuse for [their]1017-they conducting this thing in an unpiratical way . [They]1017-they shoved off , presently , [Tom]46-tom in command , [Huck]45-huck at the after oar and [Joe]62-joe at the forward . [Tom]46-tom stood amidships , gloomy - browed , and with folded arms , and gave [his]46-tom orders in a low , stern whisper : “ Luff , and bring [her]2323-her to the wind ! ”[46-tom] “ Aye - aye , [sir]2078-sir ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Steady , steady - y - y - y ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Steady it is , [sir]2078-sir ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Let [her]2323-her go off a point ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Point it is , [sir]2078-sir ! ”[2054-the boys] As [the boys]2054-the boys steadily and monotonously drove [the raft]1021-the raft toward [mid - stream]1022-mid - stream it was no doubt understood that these orders were given only for “ style , ”[2054-the boys] and were not intended to mean anything in particular . “ What sail ’s [she]2323-her carrying ? ”[2054-the boys] “ Courses , tops’ls , and flying - jib , [sir]2078-sir . ”[2054-the boys] “ Send the r’yals up ! Lay out aloft , there , half a dozen of [ye]2054-the boys — foretopmaststuns’l ! Lively , now ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Aye - aye , [sir]2078-sir ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Shake out that maintogalans’l ! Sheets and braces ! _ now _ [my]2054-the boys hearties ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Aye - aye , [sir]2078-sir ! ”[2054-the boys] “ [Hellum]23-hellum - a - lee — hard a port ! Stand by to meet [her]2323-her when [she]2323-her comes ! [Port]24-port , port ! _ Now _ , [men]185-men ! With a will ! Stead - y - y - y ! ”[2054-the boys] “ Steady it is , [sir]2078-sir ! ”[2054-the boys] [The raft]1021-the raft drew beyond the middle of [the river]346-the river ; [the boys]2054-the boys pointed [her]1026-her head right , and then lay on [their]2054-the boys oars . [The river]346-the river was not high , so there was not more than a two or three mile current . Hardly a word was said during the next three - quarters of an hour . Now [the raft]1021-the raft was passing before [the distant town]1029-the distant town . Two or three glimmering lights showed where [it]1021-the raft lay , peacefully sleeping , beyond the vague vast sweep of star - gemmed water , unconscious of the tremendous event that was happening . [The Black Avenger]114-the black avenger stood still with folded arms , “ looking [his]114-the black avenger last ”[114-the black avenger] upon the scene of [his]114-the black avenger former joys and [his]114-the black avenger later sufferings , and wishing “ [she]1026-her ”[114-the black avenger] could see [him]114-the black avenger now , abroad on [the wild sea]1030-the wild sea , facing peril and death with dauntless heart , going to [his]114-the black avenger doom with a grim smile on [his]114-the black avenger lips . It was but a small strain on [his]114-the black avenger imagination to remove [[Jackson]113-jackson ’s Island]1031-jackson ’s island beyond eye - shot of [the village]206-the village , and so [he]114-the black avenger “ looked [his]114-the black avenger last ”[1033-the other pirates] with a broken and satisfied heart . [The other pirates]1033-the other pirates were looking [their]1033-the other pirates last , too ; and [they]1033-the other pirates all looked so long that [they]1033-the other pirates came near letting the current drift [them]1033-the other pirates out of [the range of [the island]1035-the island]1034-the range of the island . But [they]1033-the other pirates discovered the danger in time , and made shift to avert it . About two o’clock in the morning the raft grounded on the bar two hundred yards above [the head of [the island]1035-the island]1036-the head of the island , and [they]1033-the other pirates waded back and forth until [they]1033-the other pirates had landed [their]1033-the other pirates freight . Part of the little raft ’s belongings consisted of an old sail , and this [they]1033-the other pirates spread over a nook in the bushes for a tent to shelter [their]1033-the other pirates provisions ; but [they]1033-the other pirates [themselves]1033-the other pirates would sleep in the open air in good weather , as became outlaws . [They]1033-the other pirates built a fire against the side of a great log twenty or thirty steps within [the sombre depths of [the forest]770-the forest]1038-the sombre depths of the forest , and then cooked some bacon in the frying - pan for supper , and used up half of the corn “ pone ”[1033-the other pirates] stock [they]1033-the other pirates had brought . It seemed glorious sport to be feasting in that wild , free way in [the virgin forest]1040-the virgin forest of [an unexplored and uninhabited island]1041-an unexplored and uninhabited island , far from the haunts of [men]185-men , and [they]1033-the other pirates said [they]1033-the other pirates never would return to civilization . The climbing fire lit up [their]1033-the other pirates faces and threw its ruddy glare upon the pillared tree - trunks of [[their]1033-the other pirates forest temple]1043-their forest temple , and upon the varnished foliage and festooning vines . When the last crisp slice of bacon was gone , and the last allowance of corn pone devoured , [the boys]2054-the boys stretched [themselves]2054-the boys out on the grass , filled with contentment . [They]2054-the boys could have found a cooler place , but [they]2054-the boys would not deny [themselves]2054-the boys such a romantic feature as [the roasting campfire]1045-the roasting campfire . “ _ Ai n’t _ it gay ? ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe . “ It ’s _ nuts _ ! ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ What would [the boys]2054-the boys say if [they]2054-the boys could see [us]2054-the boys ? ”[46-tom] “ Say ? Well , [they]2054-the boys ’d just die to be here — hey , [Hucky]45-huck ! ”[45-huck] “ [I]45-huck reckon so , ”[45-huck] said [Huckleberry]45-huck ; “ anyways , [I]45-huck ’m suited . [I]45-huck do n’t want nothing better’n this . [I]45-huck do n’t ever get enough to eat , gen’ally — and here [they]2054-the boys ca n’t come and pick at [a feller]2286-a feller and bullyrag [him]2286-a feller so . ”[45-huck] “ It ’s just the life for [me]46-tom , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ [You]2334-you do n’t have to get up , mornings , and [you]2334-you do n’t have to go to [school]2056-school , and wash , and all that blame foolishness . [You]2334-you see [a pirate]754-a pirate do n’t have to do _ anything _ , [Joe]62-joe , when [he]754-a pirate ’s [ashore]2337-ashore , but [a hermit]986-a hermit _ [he]754-a pirate _ has to be praying considerable , and then [he]754-a pirate do n’t have any fun , anyway , all by [himself]754-a pirate that way . ”[46-tom] “ Oh yes , that ’s so , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe , “ but [I]62-joe had n’t thought much about it , [you]2334-you know . [I]62-joe ’d a good deal rather be [a pirate]754-a pirate , now that [I]62-joe ’ve tried it . ”[62-joe] “ [You]2334-you see , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom , “ [people]756-people do n’t go much on [hermits]2341-hermits , nowadays , like [they]2341-hermits used to in old times , but [a pirate]754-a pirate ’s always respected . And [a hermit]986-a hermit ’s got to sleep on [the hardest place [he]986-a hermit can find]2344-the hardest place he can find , and put sackcloth and ashes on [his]986-a hermit head , and stand out in the rain , and — ”[46-tom] “ What does [he]986-a hermit put sackcloth and ashes on [his]986-a hermit head for ? ”[45-huck] inquired [Huck]45-huck . “ [I]45-huck dono . But [they]2341-hermits ’ve _ got _ to do it . [Hermits]2341-hermits always do . [You]45-huck ’d have to do that if [you]45-huck was [a hermit]986-a hermit . ”[45-huck] “ Dern’d if [I]45-huck would , ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck . “ Well , what would [you]45-huck do ? ”[45-huck] “ [I]45-huck dono . But [I]45-huck would n’t do that . ”[45-huck] “ Why , [Huck]45-huck , [you]45-huck ’d _ have _ to . How ’d [you]45-huck get around it ? ”[45-huck] “ Why , [I]45-huck just would n’t stand it . [I]45-huck ’d run away . ”[45-huck] “ Run away ! Well , [you]45-huck _ would _ be [a nice old slouch of a hermit]2347-a nice old slouch of a hermit . [You]45-huck ’d be [a disgrace]2348-a disgrace . ”[45-huck] [The Red - Handed]45-huck made no response , being better employed . [He]45-huck had finished gouging out a cob , and now [he]45-huck fitted a weed stem to it , loaded it with tobacco , and was pressing a coal to the charge and blowing a cloud of fragrant smoke — [he]45-huck was in the full bloom of luxurious contentment . [The other pirates]1033-the other pirates envied [him]45-huck this majestic vice , and secretly resolved to acquire it shortly . [Presently Huck]45-huck said : “ What does [pirates]2349-pirates have to do ? ”[45-huck] [Tom]46-tom said : “ Oh , [they]2349-pirates have just a bully time — take [ships]2350-ships and burn [them]2350-ships , and get the money and bury it in awful places in [[their]2349-pirates island]2351-their island where there ’s ghosts and things to watch it , and kill everybody in [the ships]2352-the ships — make ’em walk a plank . ”[46-tom] “ And [they]2349-pirates carry [the women]2353-the women to [the island]1035-the island , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe ; “ [they]2349-pirates do n’t kill [the women]2353-the women . ”[62-joe] “ No , ”[46-tom] assented [Tom]46-tom , “ [they]2349-pirates do n’t kill [the women]2353-the women — they’re too noble . And [the women]2353-the women ’s always beautiful , too . ”[46-tom] “ And do n’t [they]2353-the women wear the bulliest clothes ! Oh no ! All gold and silver and di’monds , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe , with enthusiasm . “ Who ? ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck . “ Why , [the pirates]1014-the pirates . ”[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck scanned [his]45-huck own clothing forlornly . “ [I]45-huck reckon [I]45-huck ai n’t dressed fitten for [a pirate]754-a pirate , ”[45-huck] said [he]45-huck , with a regretful pathos in [his]45-huck voice ; “ but [I]45-huck ai n’t got none but these . ”[45-huck] But [the other boys]1047-the other boys told [him]45-huck the fine clothes would come fast enough , after [they]1047-the other boys should have begun [their]1047-the other boys adventures . [They]1047-the other boys made [him]45-huck understand that [his]45-huck poor rags would do to begin with , though it was customary for [wealthy pirates]1048-wealthy pirates to start with a proper wardrobe . Gradually [their]1047-the other boys talk died out and drowsiness began to steal upon the eyelids of [the little waifs]1049-the little waifs . The pipe dropped from the fingers of [the Red - Handed]45-huck , and [he]45-huck slept the sleep of the conscience - free and the weary . [The Terror of [the Seas]22-the seas]2320-the terror of the seas and [the Black Avenger of the Spanish Main]2319-the black avenger of the spanish main had more difficulty in getting to sleep . [They]1047-the other boys said [their]1047-the other boys prayers inwardly , and lying down , since there was nobody there with authority to make [them]1047-the other boys kneel and recite aloud ; in truth , [they]1047-the other boys had a mind not to say [them]1047-the other boys at all , but [they]1047-the other boys were afraid to proceed to such lengths as that , lest [they]1047-the other boys might call down a sudden and special thunderbolt from heaven . Then at once [they]1047-the other boys reached and hovered upon the imminent verge of sleep — but [an intruder]1052-an intruder came , now , that would not “ down . ”[1052-an intruder] It was conscience . [They]1047-the other boys began to feel a vague fear that [they]1047-the other boys had been doing wrong to run away ; and next [they]1047-the other boys thought of the stolen meat , and then the real torture came .
