[They]1047-the other boys tried to argue it away by reminding conscience that [they]1047-the other boys had purloined sweetmeats and apples scores of times ; but conscience was not to be appeased by such thin plausibilities ; it seemed to [them]1047-the other boys , in the end , that there was no getting around the stubborn fact that taking sweetmeats was only “ hooking , ”[1053-their piracies] while taking bacon and hams and such valuables was plain simple stealing — and there was a command against that in the Bible . So [they]1047-the other boys inwardly resolved that so long as [they]1047-the other boys remained in the business , [[their]1047-the other boys piracies]1053-their piracies should not again be sullied with the crime of stealing . Then conscience granted a truce , and [these curiously inconsistent pirates]1054-these curiously inconsistent pirates fell peacefully to sleep . CHAPTER XIV When [Tom]46-tom awoke in the morning , [he]46-tom wondered where [he]46-tom was . [He]46-tom sat up and rubbed [his]46-tom eyes and looked around . Then [he]46-tom comprehended . It was the cool gray dawn , and there was a delicious sense of repose and peace in the deep pervading calm and silence of [the woods]2157-the woods . Not a leaf stirred ; not a sound obtruded upon great [Nature]115-nature ’s meditation . Beaded dewdrops stood upon the leaves and grasses . A white layer of ashes covered the fire , and a thin blue breath of smoke rose straight into the air . [Joe]62-joe and [Huck]45-huck still slept . Now , far away in [the woods]2157-the woods a bird called ; another answered ; presently the hammering of a woodpecker was heard . Gradually the cool dim gray of the morning whitened , and as gradually sounds multiplied and life manifested itself . The marvel of Nature shaking off sleep and going to work unfolded itself to [the musing boy]1057-the musing boy . A little green worm came crawling over a dewy leaf , lifting two - thirds of [his]46-tom body into the air from time to time and “ sniffing around , ”[46-tom] then proceeding again — for [he]46-tom was measuring , [Tom]46-tom said ; and when the worm approached [him]46-tom , of its own accord , [he]46-tom sat as still as a stone , with [his]46-tom hopes rising and falling , by turns , as the creature still came toward [him]46-tom or seemed inclined to go elsewhere ; and when at last it considered a painful moment with its curved body in the air and then came decisively down upon [Tom]46-tom ’s leg and began a journey over [him]46-tom , [his]46-tom whole heart was glad — for that meant that [he]46-tom was going to have a new suit of clothes — without the shadow of a doubt a gaudy piratical uniform . Now a procession of ants appeared , from nowhere in particular , and went about [their]1058-their labors ; one struggled manfully by with a dead spider five times as big as itself in its arms , and lugged it straight up a tree - trunk . [A brown spotted lady - bug]1059-a brown spotted lady - bug climbed the dizzy height of a grass blade , and [Tom]46-tom bent down close to it and said , “ [Lady - bug]2360-lady - bug , [lady - bug]2360-lady - bug , fly away [home]197-home , [[your]2360-lady - bug house]2363-your house is on fire , [[your]2360-lady - bug children]2364-your children ’s alone , ”[46-tom] and [she]1059-a brown spotted lady - bug took wing and went off to see about it — which did not surprise [the boy]2044-the boy , for [he]2044-the boy knew of old that this insect was credulous about conflagrations , and [he]2044-the boy had practised upon its simplicity more than once . A tumblebug came next , heaving sturdily at its ball , and [Tom]46-tom touched the creature , to see it shut its legs against its body and pretend to be dead . The birds were fairly rioting by this time . A catbird , the Northern mocker , lit in a tree over [Tom]46-tom ’s head , and trilled out [her]1059-a brown spotted lady - bug imitations of [[her]1059-a brown spotted lady - bug neighbors]1061-her neighbors in a rapture of enjoyment ; then a shrill jay swept down , a flash of blue flame , and stopped on a twig almost within [the boy]2044-the boy ’s reach , cocked [his]2044-the boy head to one side and eyed [the strangers]1063-the strangers with a consuming curiosity ; a gray squirrel and [a big fellow of the “ fox ”[1064-a big fellow of the “ fox ” kind] kind]1064-a big fellow of the “ fox ” kind came skurrying along , sitting up at intervals to inspect and chatter at [the boys]2054-the boys , for the wild things had probably never seen [a human being]1066-a human being before and scarcely knew whether to be afraid or not . All Nature was wide awake and stirring , now ; long lances of sunlight pierced down through the dense foliage far and near , and a few butterflies came fluttering upon the scene . [Tom]46-tom stirred up [the other pirates]1033-the other pirates and [they]1033-the other pirates all clattered away with a shout , and in a minute or two were stripped and chasing after and tumbling over each other in [the shallow limpid water of [the white sandbar]1069-the white sandbar]1068-the shallow limpid water of the white sandbar . [They]2054-the boys felt no longing for [the little village]1070-the little village sleeping in the distance beyond [the majestic waste of water]1071-the majestic waste of water . A vagrant current or a slight rise in [the river]346-the river had carried off [[their]2054-the boys raft]1073-their raft , but this only gratified [them]2054-the boys , since its going was something like burning the bridge between [them]2054-the boys and [civilization]1074-civilization . [They]2054-the boys came back to [camp]1075-camp wonderfully refreshed , glad - hearted , and ravenous ; and [they]2054-the boys soon had the camp - fire blazing up again . [Huck]45-huck found [a spring of clear cold water close by]1076-a spring of clear cold water close by , and [the boys]2054-the boys made cups of broad oak or hickory leaves , and felt that water , sweetened with such a wildwood charm as that , would be a good enough substitute for coffee . While [Joe]62-joe was slicing bacon for breakfast , [Tom]46-tom and [Huck]45-huck asked [him]62-joe to hold on a minute ; [they]2054-the boys stepped to [a promising nook in [the river - bank]995-the river - bank]1078-a promising nook in the river - bank and threw in [their]2054-the boys lines ; almost immediately [they]2054-the boys had reward . [Joe]62-joe had not had time to get impatient before [they]2054-the boys were back again with some handsome bass , a couple of sun - perch and a small catfish — provisions enough for quite [a family]1080-a family . [They]2054-the boys fried the fish with the bacon , and were astonished ; for no fish had ever seemed so delicious before . [They]2054-the boys did not know that the quicker a fresh - water fish is on the fire after [he]1081-he is caught the better [he]1081-he is ; and [they]2054-the boys reflected little upon what a sauce open - air sleeping , open - air exercise , bathing , and a large ingredient of hunger make , too . [They]2054-the boys lay around in the shade , after breakfast , while [Huck]45-huck had a smoke , and then went off through [the woods]2157-the woods on an exploring expedition . [They]2054-the boys tramped gayly along , over decaying logs , through tangled underbrush , among solemn monarchs of [the forest]770-the forest , hung from [their]2054-the boys crowns to the ground with a drooping regalia of grape - vines . Now and then [they]2054-the boys came upon snug nooks carpeted with grass and jeweled with flowers . [They]2054-the boys found plenty of things to be delighted with , but nothing to be astonished at . [They]2054-the boys discovered that [the island]1035-the island was about three miles long and a quarter of a mile wide , and that [the shore [it]1035-the island lay closest to]1085-the shore it lay closest to was only separated from [it]1035-the island by a narrow channel hardly two hundred yards wide . [They]2054-the boys took a swim about every hour , so it was close upon the middle of the afternoon when [they]2054-the boys got back to [camp]1075-camp . [They]2054-the boys were too hungry to stop to fish , but [they]2054-the boys fared sumptuously upon cold ham , and then threw [themselves]2054-the boys down in the shade to talk . But the talk soon began to drag , and then died . The stillness , the solemnity that brooded in [the woods]2157-the woods , and the sense of loneliness , began to tell upon the spirits of [the boys]2054-the boys . [They]2054-the boys fell to thinking . A sort of undefined longing crept upon [them]2054-the boys . This took dim shape , presently — it was budding homesickness . Even [Finn the Red - Handed]45-huck was dreaming of [his]45-huck doorsteps and empty hogsheads . But [they]2054-the boys were all ashamed of [their]2054-the boys weakness , and [none]1089-none was brave enough to speak [his]45-huck thought . For some time , now , [the boys]2054-the boys had been dully conscious of a peculiar sound in the distance , just as one sometimes is of the ticking of a clock which [he]45-huck takes no distinct note of . But now this mysterious sound became more pronounced , and forced a recognition . [The boys]2054-the boys started , glanced at [each other]227-each other , and then [each]231-each assumed a listening attitude . There was a long silence , profound and unbroken ; then a deep , sullen boom came floating down out of the distance . “ What is it ! ”[62-joe] exclaimed [Joe]62-joe , under [his]62-joe breath . “ [I]46-tom wonder , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom in a whisper . “ ’ Tain’t thunder , ”[45-huck] said [Huckleberry]45-huck , in an awed tone , “ becuz thunder — ”[45-huck] “ Hark ! ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ Listen — don’t talk . ”[46-tom] [They]2054-the boys waited a time that seemed an age , and then the same muffled boom troubled the solemn hush . “ Let ’s go and see . ”[2054-the boys] [They]2054-the boys sprang to [their]2054-the boys feet and hurried to [the shore]1007-the shore toward [the town]519-the town . [They]2054-the boys parted the bushes on [the bank]1096-the bank and peered out over [the water]1097-the water . [The little steam ferry - boat]1098-the little steam ferry - boat was about a mile below [the village]206-the village , drifting with the current . [[Her]1098-the little steam ferry - boat broad deck]1100-her broad deck seemed crowded with [people]756-people . There were a great many skiffs rowing about or floating with the stream in [the neighborhood of [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat]1102-the neighborhood of the ferryboat , but [the boys]2054-the boys could not determine what [the men in [them]1098-the little steam ferry - boat]1105-the men in them were doing . Presently a great jet of white smoke burst from [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat ’s side , and as it expanded and rose in a lazy cloud , that same dull throb of sound was borne to [the listeners]1107-the listeners again . “ [I]46-tom know now ! ”[46-tom] exclaimed [Tom]46-tom ; “ [somebody]262-somebody ’s drownded ! ”[46-tom] “ That ’s it ! ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck ; “ [they]262-somebody done that last summer , when [Bill Turner]116-bill turner got drownded ; [they]262-somebody shoot a cannon over [the water]1097-the water , and that makes [him]116-bill turner come up to the top . Yes , and [they]262-somebody take loaves of bread and put quicksilver in ’em and set [’em]2367-’em afloat , and wherever there ’s [anybody that ’s drownded]2368-anybody that ’s drownded , [they]262-somebody ’ll float right there and stop . ”[45-huck] “ Yes , [I]62-joe ’ve heard about that , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe . “ [I]62-joe wonder what makes the bread do that . ”[62-joe] “ Oh , it ai n’t the bread , so much , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom ; “ [I]46-tom reckon it ’s mostly what [they]262-somebody _ say _ over it before [they]262-somebody start it out . ”[46-tom] “ But [they]262-somebody do n’t say anything over it , ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck . “ [I]45-huck ’ve seen [’em]2367-’em and [they]262-somebody do n’t . ”[45-huck] “ Well , that ’s funny , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ But maybe [they]262-somebody say it to [themselves]262-somebody . Of _ course _ [they]262-somebody do . [Anybody]203-anybody might know that . ”[46-tom] [The other boys]1047-the other boys agreed that there was reason in what [Tom]46-tom said , because [an ignorant lump of bread , uninstructed by an incantation]1109-an ignorant lump of bread , uninstructed by an incantation , could not be expected to act very intelligently when set upon an errand of such gravity . “ By jings , [I]62-joe wish [I]62-joe was over there , now , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe . “ [I]45-huck do too , ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck . “ [I]45-huck ’d give heaps to know who it is . ”[45-huck] [The boys]2054-the boys still listened and watched . Presently a revealing thought flashed through [Tom]46-tom ’s mind , and [he]46-tom exclaimed : “ [Boys]183-boys , [I]46-tom know who ’s drownded — it ’s [us]2054-the boys ! ”[46-tom] [They]2054-the boys felt like [heroes]1111-heroes in an instant . Here was a gorgeous triumph ; [they]2054-the boys were missed ; [they]2054-the boys were mourned ; hearts were breaking on [their]2054-the boys account ; tears were being shed ; accusing memories of unkindness to [these poor lost lads]1112-these poor lost lads were rising up , and unavailing regrets and remorse were being indulged ; and best of all , [the departed]1113-the departed were the talk of [the whole town]1114-the whole town , and the envy of all [the boys]2054-the boys , as far as this dazzling notoriety was concerned . This was fine . It was worth while to be [a pirate]754-a pirate , after all . As twilight drew on , [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat went back to [her]1103-the ferryboat accustomed business and [the skiffs]1118-the skiffs disappeared . [The pirates]1014-the pirates returned to [camp]1075-camp . [They]2054-the boys were jubilant with vanity over [their]2054-the boys new grandeur and the illustrious trouble [they]2054-the boys were making . [They]2054-the boys caught fish , cooked supper and ate it , and then fell to guessing at what [the village]206-the village was thinking and saying about [them]2054-the boys ; and the pictures [they]2054-the boys drew of the public distress on [their]2054-the boys account were gratifying to look upon — from [their]2054-the boys point of view . But when the shadows of night closed [them]2054-the boys in , [they]2054-the boys gradually ceased to talk , and sat gazing into the fire , with [their]2054-the boys minds evidently wandering elsewhere . The excitement was gone , now , and [Tom]46-tom and [Joe]62-joe could not keep back thoughts of [certain persons at [home]197-home who were not enjoying this fine frolic as much as [they]2054-the boys were]1122-certain persons at home who were not enjoying this fine frolic as much as they were . Misgivings came ; [they]2054-the boys grew troubled and unhappy ; a sigh or two escaped , unawares . By and by [Joe]62-joe timidly ventured upon a roundabout “ feeler ”[46-tom] as to how [the others]1124-the others might look upon a return to civilization — not right now , but — [Tom]46-tom withered [him]62-joe with derision ! [Huck]45-huck , being uncommitted as yet , joined in with [Tom]46-tom , and [the waverer]1125-the waverer quickly “ explained , ”[1125-the waverer] and was glad to get out of the scrape with as little taint of chicken - hearted home - sickness clinging to [his]62-joe garments as [he]62-joe could . [Mutiny]117-mutiny was effectually laid to rest for the moment . As the night deepened , [Huck]45-huck began to nod , and presently to snore . [Joe]62-joe followed next . [Tom]46-tom lay upon [his]46-tom elbow motionless , for some time , watching [the two]720-the two intently . At last [he]46-tom got up cautiously , on [his]46-tom knees , and went searching among the grass and the flickering reflections flung by the campfire . [He]46-tom picked up and inspected several large semi - cylinders of the thin white bark of a sycamore , and finally chose two which seemed to suit [him]46-tom . Then [he]46-tom knelt by the fire and painfully wrote something upon each of these with [his]46-tom “ red keel ”[46-tom] ; one [he]46-tom rolled up and put in [his]46-tom jacket pocket , and the other [he]46-tom put in [Joe]62-joe ’s hat and removed it to a little distance from [the owner]1127-the owner . And [he]46-tom also put into the hat certain schoolboy treasures of almost inestimable value — among them a lump of chalk , an India - rubber ball , three fishhooks , and one of that kind of marbles known as a “ sure ’ nough crystal . [[”]2371-”]2371-”[46-tom] Then [he]46-tom tiptoed [his]46-tom way cautiously among the trees till [he]46-tom felt that [he]46-tom was out of hearing , and straightway broke into a keen run in the direction of [the sandbar]1128-the sandbar . CHAPTER XV A few minutes later [Tom]46-tom was in [the shoal water of the bar]1129-the shoal water of the bar , wading toward [the Illinois shore]1130-the illinois shore . Before the depth reached [his]46-tom middle [he]46-tom was halfway over ; the current would permit no more wading , now , so [he]46-tom struck out confidently to swim the remaining hundred yards . [He]46-tom swam quartering upstream , but still was swept downward rather faster than [he]46-tom had expected . However , [he]46-tom reached [the shore]1007-the shore finally , and drifted along till [he]46-tom found a low place and drew [himself]46-tom out . [He]46-tom put [his]46-tom hand on [his]46-tom jacket pocket , found [his]46-tom piece of bark safe , and then struck through [the woods]2157-the woods , following [the shore]1007-the shore , with streaming garments . Shortly before ten o’clock [he]46-tom came out into [an open place opposite [the village]206-the village]1134-an open place opposite the village , and saw [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat lying in the shadow of the trees and [the high bank]1137-the high bank . Everything was quiet under the blinking stars . [He]46-tom crept down [the bank]1096-the bank , watching with all [his]46-tom eyes , slipped into [the water]1097-the water , swam three or four strokes and climbed into the skiff that did “ yawl ”[46-tom] duty at [the boat]1140-the boat ’s stern . [He]46-tom laid [himself]46-tom down under the thwarts and waited , panting . Presently the cracked bell tapped and a voice gave the order to “ cast off . ”[46-tom] A minute or two later the skiff ’s head was standing high up , against [the boat]1140-the boat ’s swell , and the voyage was begun . [Tom]46-tom felt happy in [his]46-tom success , for [he]46-tom knew it was [the boat]1140-the boat ’s last trip for the night . At the end of a long twelve or fifteen minutes the wheels stopped , and [Tom]46-tom slipped overboard and swam ashore in the dusk , landing fifty yards downstream , out of danger of [possible stragglers]1143-possible stragglers . [He]46-tom flew along unfrequented alleys , and shortly found [himself]46-tom at [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ’s back fence . [He]46-tom climbed over , approached [the “ ell , ”]2373-the “ ell , ”[47-aunt polly] and looked in at the sitting - room window , for a light was burning there . There sat [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , [Sid]51-sid , [Mary]47-aunt polly , and [[Joe Harper]62-joe ’s mother]1145-joe harper ’s mother , grouped together , talking . [They]1146-they were by the bed , and the bed was between [them]1146-they and the door . [Tom]46-tom went to the door and began to softly lift the latch ; then [he]46-tom pressed gently and the door yielded a crack ; [he]46-tom continued pushing cautiously , and quaking every time it creaked , till [he]46-tom judged [he]46-tom might squeeze through on [his]46-tom knees ; so [he]46-tom put [his]46-tom head through and began , warily . “ What makes the candle blow so ? ”[47-aunt polly] said [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly . [Tom]46-tom hurried up . “ Why , that door ’s open , [I]46-tom believe . Why , of course it is . No end of strange things now . Go ’ long and shut it , [Sid]51-sid . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom disappeared under the bed just in time . [He]46-tom lay and “ breathed ”[46-tom] [himself]46-tom for a time , and then crept to where [he]46-tom could almost touch [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ’s foot . “ But as [I]47-aunt polly was saying , ”[47-aunt polly] said [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , “ [he]46-tom warn’t _ bad _ , so to say — only misch_ee_vous . Only just giddy , and harum - scarum , [you]2374-you know . [He]46-tom warn’t any more responsible than [a colt]2375-a colt . _ [He]46-tom _ never meant any harm , and [he]46-tom was the best - hearted boy that ever was”—and[47-aunt polly] [she]47-aunt polly began to cry . “ It was just so with [[my]47-aunt polly [Joe]62-joe]2376-my joe — always full of [his]46-tom devilment , and up to every kind of mischief , but [he]46-tom was just as unselfish and kind as [he]46-tom could be — and laws bless [me]47-aunt polly , to think [I]47-aunt polly went and whipped [him]46-tom for taking that cream , never once recollecting that [I]47-aunt polly throwed it out [myself]47-aunt polly because it was sour , and [I]47-aunt polly never to see [him]46-tom again in [this world]2377-this world , never , never , never , [poor abused boy]2378-poor abused boy ! ”[47-aunt polly] And [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper sobbed as if [her]118-mrs. harper heart would break . “ [I]51-sid hope [Tom]46-tom ’s better off where [he]46-tom is , ”[51-sid] said [Sid]51-sid , “ but if [he]46-tom ’d been better in some ways — ”[51-sid] “ _ [Sid]51-sid ! _ ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom felt the glare of [the old lady]189-the old lady ’s eye , though [he]46-tom could not see it . “ Not a word against [[my]189-the old lady [Tom]46-tom]2379-my tom , now that [he]46-tom ’s gone ! [God’ll]119-god’ll take care of _ him_—never [you]46-tom trouble _ your_self , [sir]2078-sir ! Oh , [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper , [I]189-the old lady do n’t know how to give [him]46-tom up ! [I]189-the old lady do n’t know how to give [him]46-tom up ! [He]46-tom was such a comfort to [me]189-the old lady , although [he]46-tom tormented [my]189-the old lady old heart out of [me]189-the old lady , ’ most . ”[189-the old lady] “ [The Lord giveth]2381-the lord giveth and [the Lord]2047-the lord hath taken away — Blessed be the name of [the Lord]2383-the lord ! But it ’s so hard — Oh , it ’s so hard ! Only last Saturday [[my]51-sid Joe]2376-my joe busted a firecracker right under [my]51-sid nose and [I]51-sid knocked [him]46-tom sprawling . Little did [I]51-sid know then , how soon — Oh , if it was to do over again [I]51-sid ’d hug [him]46-tom and bless [him]46-tom for it . ”[51-sid] “ Yes , yes , yes , [I]189-the old lady know just how [you]51-sid feel , [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper , [I]189-the old lady know just exactly how [you]51-sid feel . No longer ago than yesterday noon , [[my]189-the old lady [Tom]46-tom]2379-my tom took and filled the cat full of [Pain - killer]942-pain - killer , and [I]189-the old lady did think [the cretur]2387-the cretur would tear [the house]332-the house down . And [God]65-god forgive [me]189-the old lady , [I]189-the old lady cracked [Tom]46-tom ’s head with [my]189-the old lady thimble , [poor boy]2389-poor boy , [poor dead boy]2390-poor dead boy . But [he]46-tom ’s out of all [his]46-tom troubles now . And the last words [I]189-the old lady ever heard [him]46-tom say was to reproach — ”[189-the old lady] But this memory was too much for [the old lady]189-the old lady , and [she]189-the old lady broke entirely down . [Tom]46-tom was snuffling , now , [himself]46-tom — and more in pity of [himself]46-tom than [anybody else]1150-anybody else . [He]46-tom could hear [Mary]47-aunt polly crying , and putting in a kindly word for [him]46-tom from time to time . [He]46-tom began to have a nobler opinion of [himself]46-tom than ever before . Still , [he]46-tom was sufficiently touched by [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt ’s grief to long to rush out from under the bed and overwhelm [her]196-his aunt with joy — and the theatrical gorgeousness of the thing appealed strongly to [his]46-tom nature , too , but [he]46-tom resisted and lay still . [He]46-tom went on listening , and gathered by odds and ends that it was conjectured at first that [the boys]2054-the boys had got drowned while taking a swim ; then the small raft had been missed ; next , [certain boys]1153-certain boys said [the missing lads]1154-the missing lads had promised that [the village]206-the village should “ hear something ”[1153-certain boys] soon ; [the wise - heads]1156-the wise - heads had “ put this and that together ”[1156-the wise - heads] and decided that [the lads]1157-the lads had gone off on [that raft]1158-that raft and would turn up at [the next town below]1159-the next town below , presently ; but toward noon the raft had been found , lodged against [the Missouri]25-the missouri shore some five or six miles below [the village]206-the village — and then hope perished ; [they]2054-the boys must be drowned , else hunger would have driven [them]2054-the boys [home]197-home by nightfall if not sooner . It was believed that the search for the bodies had been a fruitless effort merely because the drowning must have occurred in mid - channel , since [the boys]2054-the boys , being [good swimmers]1163-good swimmers , would otherwise have escaped to [shore]1164-shore . This was Wednesday night . If the bodies continued missing until Sunday , all hope would be given over , and the funerals would be preached on that morning . [Tom]46-tom shuddered . [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper gave a sobbing goodnight and turned to go . Then with a mutual impulse [the two bereaved women]1165-the two bereaved women flung [themselves]1165-the two bereaved women into [each other]227-each other ’s arms and had a good , consoling cry , and then parted . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly was tender far beyond [her]47-aunt polly wo nt , in [her]47-aunt polly goodnight to [Sid]51-sid and [Mary]47-aunt polly . [Sid]51-sid snuffled a bit and [Mary]47-aunt polly went off crying with all [her]47-aunt polly heart . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly knelt down and prayed for [Tom]46-tom so touchingly , so appealingly , and with such measureless love in [her]47-aunt polly words and [her]47-aunt polly old trembling voice , that [he]46-tom was weltering in tears again , long before [she]47-aunt polly was through . [He]46-tom had to keep still long after [she]47-aunt polly went to bed , for [she]47-aunt polly kept making broken - hearted ejaculations from time to time , tossing unrestfully , and turning over . But at last [she]47-aunt polly was still , only moaning a little in [her]47-aunt polly sleep . Now [the boy]2044-the boy stole out , rose gradually by the bedside , shaded the candle - light with [his]2044-the boy hand , and stood regarding [her]47-aunt polly . [His]46-tom heart was full of pity for [her]47-aunt polly . [He]46-tom took out [his]46-tom sycamore scroll and placed it by the candle . But something occurred to [him]46-tom , and [he]46-tom lingered considering . [His]46-tom face lighted with a happy solution of [his]46-tom thought ; [he]46-tom put the bark hastily in [his]46-tom pocket . Then [he]46-tom bent over and kissed the faded lips , and straightway made [his]46-tom stealthy exit , latching the door behind [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom threaded [his]46-tom way back to [the ferry landing]1168-the ferry landing , found [nobody at large there]1169-nobody at large there , and walked boldly on board [the boat]1140-the boat , for [he]46-tom knew [she]47-aunt polly was tenantless except that there was [a watchman , who always turned in and slept like a graven image]1171-a watchman , who always turned in and slept like a graven image . [He]46-tom untied the skiff at the stern , slipped into it , and was soon rowing cautiously upstream . When [he]46-tom had pulled a mile above [the village]206-the village , [he]46-tom started quartering across and bent [himself]46-tom stoutly to [his]46-tom work . [He]46-tom hit the landing on the other side neatly , for this was a familiar bit of work to [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom was moved to capture [the skiff]1173-the skiff , arguing that it might be considered [a ship]1174-a ship and therefore legitimate prey for [a pirate]754-a pirate , but [he]46-tom knew a thorough search would be made for it and that might end in revelations . So [he]46-tom stepped [ashore]2337-ashore and entered [the woods]2157-the woods . [He]46-tom sat down and took a long rest , torturing [himself]46-tom meanwhile to keep awake , and then started warily down [the home - stretch]1178-the home - stretch . The night was far spent . It was broad daylight before [he]46-tom found [himself]46-tom fairly abreast [the island bar]1179-the island bar . [He]46-tom rested again until the sun was well up and gilding [the great river]1180-the great river with its splendor , and then [he]46-tom plunged into [the stream]355-the stream . A little later [he]46-tom paused , dripping , upon the threshold of [the camp]1182-the camp , and heard [Joe]62-joe say : “ No , [Tom]46-tom ’s true - blue , [Huck]45-huck , and [he]46-tom ’ll come back . [He]46-tom wo n’t [desert]2391-desert . [He]46-tom knows that would be a disgrace to [a pirate]754-a pirate , and [Tom]46-tom ’s too proud for that sort of thing . [He]46-tom ’s up to something or other . Now [I]62-joe wonder what ? ”[62-joe] “ Well , the things is ours , anyway , ai n’t they ? ”[62-joe] “ Pretty near , but not yet , [Huck]45-huck . The writing says [they]2054-the boys are if [he]46-tom ai n’t back here to breakfast . ”[62-joe] “ Which [he]46-tom is ! ”[46-tom] exclaimed [Tom]46-tom , with fine dramatic effect , stepping grandly into [camp]1075-camp . A sumptuous breakfast of bacon and fish was shortly provided , and as [the boys]2054-the boys set to work upon it , [Tom]46-tom recounted ( and adorned ) [his]46-tom adventures . [They]2054-the boys were [a vain and boastful company of heroes]1185-a vain and boastful company of heroes when the tale was done . Then [Tom]46-tom hid [himself]46-tom away in [a shady nook]1186-a shady nook to sleep till noon , and [the other pirates]1033-the other pirates got ready to fish and explore . CHAPTER XVI After dinner [all the gang]1188-all the gang turned out to hunt for turtle eggs on the bar . [They]1188-all the gang went about poking sticks into the sand , and when [they]1188-all the gang found a soft place [they]1188-all the gang went down on [their]1188-all the gang knees and dug with [their]1188-all the gang hands . Sometimes [they]1188-all the gang would take fifty or sixty eggs out of one hole . [They]1189-they were perfectly round white things a trifle smaller than an English walnut . [They]1188-all the gang had a famous fried - egg feast that night , and another on Friday morning . After breakfast [they]1188-all the gang went whooping and prancing out on the bar , and chased [each other]227-each other round and round , shedding clothes as [they]1188-all the gang went , until [they]1188-all the gang were naked , and then continued the frolic far away up the shoal water of the bar , against the stiff current , which latter tripped [their]1188-all the gang legs from under [them]1188-all the gang from time to time and greatly increased the fun . And now and then [they]1188-all the gang stooped in [a group]1191-a group and splashed water in [each other]227-each other ’s faces with [their]1188-all the gang palms , gradually approaching [each other]227-each other , with averted faces to avoid the strangling sprays , and finally gripping and struggling till [the best man]1194-the best man ducked [[his]1194-the best man neighbor]1195-his neighbor , and then [they]1188-all the gang all went under in a tangle of white legs and arms and came up blowing , sputtering , laughing , and gasping for breath at one and the same time . When [they]1188-all the gang were well exhausted , [they]1188-all the gang would run out and sprawl on the dry , hot sand , and lie there and cover [themselves]1188-all the gang up with it , and by and by break for the water again and go through the original performance once more . Finally it occurred to [them]1188-all the gang that [their]1188-all the gang naked skin represented flesh - colored “ tights ”[1188-all the gang] very fairly ; so [they]1188-all the gang drew a ring in the sand and had a circus — with three clowns in it , for [none]1089-none would yield this proudest post to [[his]1089-none neighbor]1195-his neighbor . Next [they]1188-all the gang got [their]1188-all the gang marbles and played “ knucks ”[62-joe] and “ ringtaw ”[62-joe] and “ keeps ”[62-joe] till that amusement grew stale . Then [Joe]62-joe and [Huck]45-huck had another swim , but [Tom]46-tom would not venture , because [he]46-tom found that in kicking off [his]46-tom trousers [he]46-tom had kicked [his]46-tom string of rattlesnake rattles off [his]46-tom ankle , and [he]46-tom wondered how [he]46-tom had escaped cramp so long without the protection of this mysterious charm . [He]46-tom did not venture again until [he]46-tom had found it , and by that time [the other boys]1047-the other boys were tired and ready to rest . [They]1188-all the gang gradually wandered apart , dropped into [the “ dumps]2393-the “ dumps , ”[46-tom] and fell to gazing longingly across [the wide river]1199-the wide river to where [the village]206-the village lay drowsing in the sun . [Tom]46-tom found [himself]46-tom writing “ [BECKY]86-becky ”[46-tom] in the sand with [his]46-tom big toe ; [he]46-tom scratched it out , and was angry with [himself]46-tom for [his]46-tom weakness . But [he]46-tom wrote it again , nevertheless ; [he]46-tom could not help it . [He]46-tom erased it once more and then took [himself]46-tom out of temptation by driving [the other boys]1047-the other boys together and joining [them]1047-the other boys . But [Joe]62-joe ’s spirits had gone down almost beyond resurrection . [He]62-joe was so homesick that [he]62-joe could hardly endure the misery of it . The tears lay very near the surface . [Huck]45-huck was melancholy , too . [Tom]46-tom was downhearted , but tried hard not to show it . [He]46-tom had a secret which [he]46-tom was not ready to tell , yet , but if this mutinous depression was not broken up soon , [he]46-tom would have to bring it out . [He]46-tom said , with a great show of cheerfulness : “ [I]46-tom bet there ’s been [pirates]2349-pirates on [this island]2395-this island before , [boys]183-boys . [We]2397-we ’ll explore [it]2395-this island again . [They]2349-pirates ’ve hid treasures here somewhere . How ’d [you]183-boys feel to light on a rotten chest full of gold and silver — hey ? ”[46-tom] But it roused only faint enthusiasm , which faded out , with no reply . [Tom]46-tom tried one or two other seductions ; but [they]1202-they failed , too . It was discouraging work . [Joe]62-joe sat poking up [the sand]1203-the sand with a stick and looking very gloomy . Finally [he]62-joe said : “ Oh , [boys]183-boys , let ’s give it up . [I]62-joe want to go [home]197-home . It ’s so lonesome . ”[62-joe] “ Oh no , [Joe]62-joe , [you]62-joe ’ll feel better by and by , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ Just think of the fishing that ’s here . ”[62-joe] “ [I]62-joe do n’t care for fishing . [I]62-joe want to go [home]197-home . ”[62-joe] “ But , [Joe]62-joe , there ai n’t such [another swimming - place]2401-another swimming - place anywhere . ”[62-joe] “ Swimming ’s no good . [I]62-joe do n’t seem to care for it , somehow , when there ai n’t [anybody]203-anybody to say [I]62-joe sha’n’t go in . [I]62-joe mean to go [home]197-home . ”[62-joe] “ Oh , shucks ! [Baby]2404-baby ! [You]2404-baby want to see [[your]2404-baby mother]2405-your mother , [I]62-joe reckon . ”[62-joe] “ Yes , [I]62-joe _ do _ want to see [[my]62-joe mother]2406-my mother — and [you]62-joe would , too , if [you]62-joe had one . [I]62-joe ai n’t any more baby than [you]62-joe are . ”[62-joe] And [Joe]62-joe snuffled a little . “ Well , [we]2407-we ’ll let [the crybaby]2408-the crybaby go [home]197-home to [[his]2408-the crybaby mother]531-his mother , wo n’t [we]2407-we , [Huck]45-huck ? [Poor thing]2411-poor thing — does it want to see [[its]2408-the crybaby mother]2412-its mother ? And so [it]2408-the crybaby shall . [You]45-huck like it here , do n’t [you]45-huck , [Huck]45-huck ? [We]2407-we ’ll stay , wo n’t [we]2407-we ? ”[62-joe] [Huck]45-huck said , “ [Y]2413-y - e - s”—without[62-joe] any heart in it . “ [I]62-joe ’ll never speak to [you]45-huck again as long as [I]62-joe live , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe , rising . “ There now ! ”[62-joe] And [he]62-joe moved moodily away and began to dress [himself]62-joe . “ Who cares ! ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ [Nobody]647-nobody wants [you]45-huck to . Go ’ long [home]197-home and get laughed at . Oh , [you]45-huck ’re [a nice pirate]2416-a nice pirate . [Huck]45-huck and [me]46-tom ai n’t [crybabies]2417-crybabies . [We]2418-we ’ll stay , wo n’t [we]2418-we , [Huck]45-huck ? Let [him]45-huck go if [he]45-huck wants to . [I]46-tom reckon [we]2418-we can get along without [him]45-huck , per’aps . ”[46-tom] But [Tom]46-tom was uneasy , nevertheless , and was alarmed to see [Joe]62-joe go sullenly on with [his]62-joe dressing . And then it was discomforting to see [Huck]45-huck eying [Joe]62-joe ’s preparations so wistfully , and keeping up such an ominous silence . Presently , without a parting word , [Joe]62-joe began to wade off toward [the Illinois shore]1130-the illinois shore . [Tom]46-tom ’s heart began to sink . [He]46-tom glanced at [Huck]45-huck . [Huck]45-huck could not bear the look , and dropped [his]45-huck eyes . Then [he]46-tom said : “ [I]46-tom want to go , too , [Tom]46-tom . It was getting so lonesome anyway , and now it ’ll be worse . Let ’s [us]2418-we go , too , [Tom]46-tom . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom wo n’t ! [You]46-tom can all go , if [you]46-tom want to . [I]46-tom mean to stay . ”[46-tom] “ [Tom]46-tom , [I]46-tom better go . ”[46-tom] “ Well , go ’ long — who ’s hendering [you]46-tom . ”[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck began to pick up [his]45-huck scattered clothes . [He]45-huck said : “ [Tom]46-tom , [I]45-huck wisht [you]46-tom ’d come , too . Now [you]46-tom think it over . [We]2419-we ’ll wait for [you]46-tom when [we]2419-we get to [shore]1164-shore . ”[45-huck] “ Well , [you]46-tom ’ll wait a blame long time , that ’s all . ”[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck started sorrowfully away , and [Tom]46-tom stood looking after [him]45-huck , with a strong desire tugging at [his]46-tom heart to yield [his]46-tom pride and go along too . [He]46-tom hoped [the boys]2054-the boys would stop , but [they]2054-the boys still waded slowly on . It suddenly dawned on [Tom]46-tom that it was become very lonely and still . [He]46-tom made one final struggle with [his]46-tom pride , and then darted after [[his]46-tom comrades]958-his comrades , yelling : “ Wait ! Wait ! [I]46-tom want to tell [you]958-his comrades something ! ”[46-tom] [They]2054-the boys presently stopped and turned around . When [he]46-tom got to where [they]2054-the boys were , [he]46-tom began unfolding [his]46-tom secret , and [they]2054-the boys listened moodily till at last [they]2054-the boys saw the “ point ”[2054-the boys] [he]46-tom was driving at , and then [they]2054-the boys set up a warwhoop of applause and said it was “ splendid ! ”[2054-the boys] and said if [he]46-tom had told [them]2054-the boys at first , [they]2054-the boys would n’t have started away . [He]46-tom made a plausible excuse ; but [his]46-tom real reason had been the fear that not even the secret would keep [them]2054-the boys with [him]46-tom any very great length of time , and so [he]46-tom had meant to hold it in reserve as a last seduction . [The lads]1157-the lads came gayly back and went at [their]1157-the lads sports again with a will , chattering all the time about [Tom]46-tom ’s stupendous plan and admiring the genius of it . After a dainty egg and fish dinner , [Tom]46-tom said [he]46-tom wanted to learn to smoke , now . [Joe]62-joe caught at the idea and said [he]62-joe would like to try , too . So [Huck]45-huck made pipes and filled them . [These novices]1208-these novices had never smoked anything before but cigars made of grapevine , and [they]1208-these novices “ bit ”[46-tom] the tongue , and were not considered manly anyway . Now [they]1208-these novices stretched [themselves]1208-these novices out on [their]1208-these novices elbows and began to puff , charily , and with slender confidence . The smoke had an unpleasant taste , and [they]1208-these novices gagged a little , but [Tom]46-tom said : “ Why , it ’s just as easy ! If [I]46-tom ’d a knowed this was all , [I]46-tom ’d a learnt long ago . ”[46-tom] “ So would [I]62-joe , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe . “ It ’s just nothing . ”[46-tom] “ Why , many a time [I]46-tom ’ve looked at [people]756-people smoking , and thought well [I]46-tom wish [I]46-tom could do that ; but [I]46-tom never thought [I]46-tom could , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ That ’s just the way with [me]46-tom , hain’t it , [Huck]45-huck ? [You]45-huck ’ve heard [me]46-tom talk just that way — haven’t [you]45-huck , [Huck]45-huck ? [I]46-tom ’ll leave it to [Huck]45-huck if [I]46-tom have n’t . ”[46-tom] “ Yes — heaps of times , ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck . “ Well , [I]46-tom have too , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom ; “ oh , hundreds of times . Once down by [the slaughter - house]2149-the slaughter - house . Do n’t [you]45-huck remember , [Huck]45-huck ? [Bob Tanner]76-bob tanner was [there]2038-there , and [Johnny Miller]60-johnny miller , and [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher , when [I]46-tom said it . Do n’t [you]45-huck remember , [Huck]45-huck , ’bout [me]46-tom saying that ? ”[46-tom] “ Yes , that ’s so , ”[45-huck] said [Huck]45-huck . “ That was the day after [I]45-huck lost [a white alley]2074-a white alley . No , ’ twas the day before . ”[45-huck] “ There — [I]46-tom told [you]45-huck so , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ [Huck]45-huck recollects it . ”[46-tom] “ [I]62-joe bleeve [I]62-joe could smoke this pipe all day , ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe . “ [I]62-joe do n’t feel sick . ”[62-joe] “ Neither do [I]46-tom , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ [I]46-tom could smoke it all day . But [I]46-tom bet [you]45-huck [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher could n’t . ”[46-tom] “ [Jeff Thatcher]63-jeff thatcher ! Why , [he]63-jeff thatcher ’d keel over just with two draws . Just let [him]63-jeff thatcher try it once . _ [He]63-jeff thatcher ’d _ see ! ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom bet [he]63-jeff thatcher would . And [Johnny Miller]60-johnny miller — [I]46-tom wish could see [Johnny Miller]60-johnny miller tackle it once . ”[46-tom] “ Oh , do n’t [I]62-joe ! ”[62-joe] said [Joe]62-joe . “ Why , [I]62-joe bet [you]45-huck [Johnny Miller]60-johnny miller could n’t any more do this than nothing . Just one little snifter would fetch _ [him]63-jeff thatcher _ . ”[62-joe] “ ’ Deed it would , [Joe]62-joe . Say — [I]46-tom wish [the boys]2054-the boys could see [us]2426-we now . ”[46-tom] “ So do [I.]46-tom ”[46-tom] “ Say — [boys]183-boys , do n’t say anything about it , and some time when [they]2054-the boys ’re around , [I]62-joe ’ll come up to [you]45-huck and say , ‘ [Joe]62-joe , got a pipe ? [I]62-joe want a smoke . ’ And [you]45-huck ’ll say , kind of careless like , as if it warn’t anything , [you]45-huck ’ll say , ‘ Yes , [I]62-joe got [my]62-joe _ old _ pipe , and another one , but [my]62-joe tobacker ai n’t very good . ’ And [I]62-joe ’ll say , ‘ Oh , that ’s all right , if it ’s _ strong _ enough . ’ And then [you]45-huck ’ll out with the pipes , and [we]2426-we ’ll light up just as ca’m , and then just see ’em look ! ”[62-joe] “ By jings , that ’ll be gay , [Tom]46-tom ! [I]46-tom wish it was _ now _ ! ”[46-tom] “ So do [I]46-tom ! And when [we]2426-we tell [’em]2054-the boys [we]2426-we learned when [we]2426-we was off pirating , wo n’t [they]2054-the boys wish [they]2054-the boys ’d been along ? ”[46-tom] “ Oh , [I]62-joe reckon not ! [I]62-joe ’ll just _ bet _ [they]2054-the boys will ! ”[62-joe] So the talk ran on . But presently it began to flag a trifle , and grow disjointed . The silences widened ; the expectoration marvellously increased . Every pore inside [the boys]2054-the boys ’ cheeks became a spouting fountain ; [they]2054-the boys could scarcely bail out the cellars under [their]2054-the boys tongues fast enough to prevent an inundation ; little overflowings down [their]2054-the boys throats occurred in spite of all [they]2054-the boys could do , and sudden retchings followed every time . [Both boys]235-both boys were looking very pale and miserable , now . [Joe]62-joe ’s pipe dropped from [his]62-joe nerveless fingers . [Tom]46-tom ’s followed . [Both fountains]1211-both fountains were going furiously and [both pumps]1212-both pumps bailing with might and main . [Joe]62-joe said feebly : “ [I]62-joe ’ve lost [my]62-joe knife . [I]62-joe reckon [I]62-joe better go and find it . ”[62-joe] [Tom]46-tom said , with quivering lips and halting utterance : “ [I]46-tom ’ll help [you]235-both boys . [You]235-both boys go over that way and [I]46-tom ’ll hunt around by the spring . No , [you]235-both boys need n’t come , [Huck]45-huck — [we]2428-we can find it . ”[46-tom] So [Huck]45-huck sat down again , and waited an hour . Then [he]45-huck found it lonesome , and went to find [[his]45-huck comrades]958-his comrades . [They]958-his comrades were wide apart in [the woods]2157-the woods , both very pale , both fast asleep . But something informed [him]45-huck that if [they]958-his comrades had had any trouble [they]958-his comrades had got rid of it . [They]958-his comrades were not talkative at supper that night . [They]958-his comrades had a humble look , and when [Huck]45-huck prepared [his]45-huck pipe after the meal and was going to prepare [theirs]958-his comrades , [they]958-his comrades said no , [they]958-his comrades were not feeling very well — something [they]958-his comrades ate at dinner had disagreed with [them]958-his comrades . About midnight [Joe]62-joe awoke , and called [the boys]2054-the boys . There was a brooding oppressiveness in the air that seemed to bode something . [The boys]2054-the boys huddled [themselves]2054-the boys together and sought the friendly companionship of the fire , though the dull dead heat of the breathless atmosphere was stifling . [They]2054-the boys sat still , intent and waiting . The solemn hush continued . Beyond the light of the fire everything was swallowed up in the blackness of darkness . Presently there came a quivering glow that vaguely revealed the foliage for a moment and then vanished . By and by another came , a little stronger . Then another . Then a faint moan came sighing through the branches of [the forest]770-the forest and [the boys]2054-the boys felt a fleeting breath upon [their]2054-the boys cheeks , and shuddered with the fancy that [the Spirit of the Night]1219-the spirit of the night had gone by . There was a pause . Now a weird flash turned night into day and showed every little grassblade , separate and distinct , that grew about [their]2054-the boys feet . And it showed [three white , startled faces]1220-three white , startled faces , too . A deep peal of thunder went rolling and tumbling down the heavens and lost itself in sullen rumblings in the distance . A sweep of chilly air passed by , rustling all the leaves and snowing the flaky ashes broadcast about the fire . Another fierce glare lit up [the forest]770-the forest and an instant crash followed that seemed to rend the treetops right over [the boys]2054-the boys ’ heads . [They]2054-the boys clung together in terror , in the thick gloom that followed . A few big raindrops fell pattering upon the leaves . “ Quick ! [boys]183-boys , go for [the tent]2430-the tent ! ”[46-tom] exclaimed [Tom]46-tom . [They]2054-the boys sprang away , stumbling over roots and among vines in the dark , [no two]1223-no two plunging in the same direction . A furious blast roared through the trees , making everything sing as it went . One blinding flash after another came , and peal on peal of deafening thunder . And now a drenching rain poured down and the rising hurricane drove it in sheets along the ground . [The boys]2054-the boys cried out to [each other]227-each other , but the roaring wind and the booming thunderblasts drowned [their]2054-the boys voices utterly . However , one by one [they]2054-the boys straggled in at last and took shelter under [the tent]2430-the tent , cold , scared , and streaming with water ; but to have company in misery seemed something to be grateful for . [They]2054-the boys could not talk , the old sail flapped so furiously , even if the other noises would have allowed [them]2054-the boys . The tempest rose higher and higher , and presently the sail tore loose from its fastenings and went winging away on the blast . [The boys]2054-the boys seized [each others]1228-each others ’ hands and fled , with many tumblings and bruises , to the shelter of a great oak that stood upon [the riverbank]1229-the riverbank . Now the battle was at its highest . Under the ceaseless conflagration of lightning that flamed in the skies , everything below stood out in cleancut and shadowless distinctness : the bending trees , [the billowy river]1230-the billowy river , white with foam , the driving spray of spumeflakes , the dim outlines of [the high bluffs on the other side]1231-the high bluffs on the other side , glimpsed through the drifting cloudrack and the slanting veil of rain . Every little while some giant tree yielded the fight and fell crashing through the younger growth ; and the unflagging thunderpeals came now in ear - splitting explosive bursts , keen and sharp , and unspeakably appalling . The storm culminated in one matchless effort that seemed likely to tear [the island]1035-the island to pieces , burn it up , drown it to the treetops , blow it away , and deafen every creature in it , all at one and the same moment . It was a wild night for [homeless young heads]1233-homeless young heads to be out in . But at last the battle was done , and [the forces]1234-the forces retired with weaker and weaker threatenings and grumblings , and peace resumed [her]1235-her sway . [The boys]2054-the boys went back to [camp]1075-camp , a good deal awed ; but [they]2054-the boys found there was still something to be thankful for , because the great sycamore , the shelter of [their]2054-the boys beds , was a ruin , now , blasted by the lightnings , and [they]2054-the boys were not under it when the catastrophe happened . Everything in [camp]1075-camp was drenched , the campfire as well ; for [they]2054-the boys were but [heedless lads]1239-heedless lads , like [[their]2054-the boys generation]1240-their generation , and had made no provision against rain . Here was matter for dismay , for [they]2054-the boys were soaked through and chilled . [They]2054-the boys were eloquent in [their]2054-the boys distress ; but [they]2054-the boys presently discovered that the fire had eaten so far up under the great log it had been built against ( where it curved upward and separated itself from the ground ) , that a handbreadth or so of it had escaped wetting ; so [they]2054-the boys patiently wrought until , with shreds and bark gathered from the under sides of sheltered logs , [they]2054-the boys coaxed the fire to burn again . Then [they]2054-the boys piled on great dead boughs till [they]2054-the boys had a roaring furnace , and were gladhearted once more . [They]2054-the boys dried [their]2054-the boys boiled ham and had a feast , and after that [they]2054-the boys sat by the fire and expanded and glorified [their]2054-the boys midnight adventure until morning , for there was not a dry spot to sleep on , anywhere around . As the sun began to steal in upon [the boys]2054-the boys , drowsiness came over [them]2054-the boys , and [they]2054-the boys went out on the sandbar and lay down to sleep . [They]2054-the boys got scorched out by and by , and drearily set about getting breakfast . After the meal [they]2054-the boys felt rusty , and stiff - jointed , and a little homesick once more . [Tom]46-tom saw the signs , and fell to cheering up [the pirates]1014-the pirates as well as [he]46-tom could . But [they]2054-the boys cared nothing for marbles , or circus , or swimming , or anything . [He]46-tom reminded [them]2054-the boys of the imposing secret , and raised a ray of cheer . While it lasted , [he]46-tom got [them]2054-the boys interested in a new device . This was to knock off being [pirates]2349-pirates , for a while , and be [Indians]89-the indians for a change . [They]2054-the boys were attracted by this idea ; so it was not long before [they]2054-the boys were stripped , and striped from head to heel with black mud , like so many zebras — [all of [them]2054-the boys [chiefs]1245-chiefs]1244-all of them chiefs , of course — and then [they]2054-the boys went tearing through [the woods]2157-the woods to attack [an English settlement]1247-an english settlement . By and by [they]2054-the boys separated into [three hostile tribes]1248-three hostile tribes , and darted upon [each other]227-each other from ambush with dreadful warwhoops , and killed and scalped [each other]227-each other by [thousands]1251-thousands . It was a gory day . Consequently it was an extremely satisfactory one . [They]2054-the boys assembled in [camp]1075-camp toward suppertime , hungry and happy ; but now a difficulty arose — [hostile Indians]1253-hostile indians could not break the bread of hospitality together without first making peace , and this was a simple impossibility without smoking a pipe of peace . There was no other process that ever [they]2054-the boys had heard of . [Two of [the savages]1255-the savages]1254-two of the savages almost wished [they]1254-two of the savages had remained pirates . However , there was no other way ; so with such show of cheerfulness as [they]2054-the boys could muster [they]2054-the boys called for the pipe and took [their]2054-the boys whiff as it passed , in due form . And behold , [they]2054-the boys were glad [they]2054-the boys had gone into savagery , for [they]2054-the boys had gained something ; [they]2054-the boys found that [they]2054-the boys could now smoke a little without having to go and hunt for a lost knife ; [they]2054-the boys did not get sick enough to be seriously uncomfortable . [They]2054-the boys were not likely to fool away this high promise for lack of effort . No , [they]2054-the boys practised cautiously , after supper , with right fair success , and so [they]2054-the boys spent a jubilant evening . [They]2054-the boys were prouder and happier in [their]2054-the boys new acquirement than [they]2054-the boys would have been in the scalping and skinning of [the Six Nations]1256-the six nations . [We]1257-we will leave [them]2054-the boys to smoke and chatter and brag , since [we]1257-we have no further use for [them]2054-the boys at present . CHAPTER XVII But there was no hilarity in [the little town]1258-the little town that same tranquil Saturday afternoon . [The Harpers]120-the harpers , and [[Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s family]1259-aunt polly ’s family , were being put into mourning , with great grief and many tears . An unusual quiet possessed [the village]206-the village , although [it]206-the village was ordinarily quiet enough , in all conscience . [The villagers]922-the villagers conducted [their]922-the villagers concerns with an absent air , and talked little ; but [they]922-the villagers sighed often . The Saturday holiday seemed a burden to [the children]383-the children . [They]383-the children had no heart in [their]383-the children sports , and gradually gave [them]383-the children up . In the afternoon [Becky Thatcher]86-becky found [herself]86-becky moping about [the deserted schoolhouse yard]1263-the deserted schoolhouse yard , and feeling very melancholy . But [she]86-becky found nothing there to comfort [her]86-becky . [She]86-becky soliloquized : “ Oh , if [I]86-becky only had a brass andiron - knob again ! But [I]86-becky have n’t got anything now to remember [him]2431-him by . ”[86-becky] And [she]86-becky choked back a little sob . Presently [she]86-becky stopped , and said to [herself]86-becky : “ It was right here . Oh , if it was to do over again , [I]86-becky would n’t say that — [I]86-becky would n’t say it for [the whole world]2432-the whole world . But [he]2431-him ’s gone now ; [I]86-becky ’ll never , never , never see [him]2431-him any more . ”[86-becky] This thought broke [her]86-becky down , and [she]86-becky wandered away , with tears rolling down [her]86-becky cheeks . Then quite [a group of [boys]183-boys and [girls]184-girls]1264-a group of boys and girls — [playmates of [Tom]46-tom ’s and [Joe’s]121-joe’s]1267-playmates of tom ’s and joe’s — came by , and stood looking over the paling fence and talking in reverent tones of how [Tom]46-tom did so - and - so the last time [they]1264-a group of boys and girls saw [him]46-tom , and how [Joe]62-joe said this and that small trifle ( pregnant with awful prophecy , as [they]1264-a group of boys and girls could easily see now!)—and [each speaker]1268-each speaker pointed out the exact spot where [the lost lads]1269-the lost lads stood at the time , and then added something like “ and [I]1268-each speaker was a - standing just so — just as [I]1268-each speaker am now , and as if [you]2433-you was [him]46-tom — [I]1268-each speaker was as close as that — and [he]46-tom smiled , just this way — and then something seemed to go all over [me]1268-each speaker , like — awful , [you]2433-you know — and [I]1268-each speaker never thought what it meant , of course , but [I]1268-each speaker can see now ! ”[1268-each speaker] Then there was a dispute about who saw [the dead boys]1270-the dead boys last in life , and [many]1271-many claimed that dismal distinction , and offered evidences , more or less tampered with by [the witness]1272-the witness ; and when it was ultimately decided who _ did _ see the departed last , and exchanged the last words with [them]1264-a group of boys and girls , [the lucky parties]1273-the lucky parties took upon [themselves]1273-the lucky parties a sort of sacred importance , and were gaped at and envied by [all the rest]1274-all the rest . [One poor chap , who had no other grandeur to offer]1275-one poor chap , who had no other grandeur to offer , said with tolerably manifest pride in the remembrance : “ Well , [Tom Sawyer]46-tom [he]46-tom licked [me]1275-one poor chap , who had no other grandeur to offer once . ”[1275-one poor chap , who had no other grandeur to offer] But that bid for glory was a failure . [Most of [the boys]2054-the boys]1276-most of the boys could say that , and so that cheapened the distinction too much . [The group]1278-the group loitered away , still recalling memories of [the lost heroes]1279-the lost heroes , in awed voices . When the Sunday - school hour was finished , the next morning , the bell began to toll , instead of ringing in the usual way . It was a very still Sabbath , and the mournful sound seemed in keeping with the musing hush that lay upon nature . [The villagers]922-the villagers began to gather , loitering a moment in [the vestibule]527-the vestibule to converse in whispers about the sad event . But there was no whispering in [the house]332-the house ; only the funereal rustling of dresses as [the women]2353-the women gathered to [their]2353-the women seats disturbed the silence there . [None]1089-none could remember when [the little church]1285-the little church had been so full before . There was finally a waiting pause , an expectant dumbness , and then [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly entered , followed by [Sid]51-sid and [Mary]47-aunt polly , and [they]1286-they by [the Harper family]1287-the harper family , all in deep black , and [the whole congregation]606-the whole congregation , [the old minister]1289-the old minister as well , rose reverently and stood until [the mourners]1290-the mourners were seated in the front pew . There was another communing silence , broken at intervals by muffled sobs , and then [the minister]544-the minister spread [his]544-the minister hands abroad and prayed . A moving hymn was sung , and the text followed : “ [I]544-the minister am [the Resurrection]2434-the resurrection and the Life . ”[544-the minister] As the service proceeded , [the clergyman]573-the clergyman drew such pictures of the graces , the winning ways , and the rare promise of [the lost lads]1269-the lost lads that [every soul there]1294-every soul there , thinking [he]573-the clergyman recognized these pictures , felt a pang in remembering that [he]573-the clergyman had persistently blinded [himself]573-the clergyman to [them]1295-them always before , and had as persistently seen only faults and flaws in [the poor boys]1296-the poor boys . [The minister]544-the minister related many a touching incident in the lives of [the departed]1113-the departed , too , which illustrated [their]1113-the departed sweet , generous natures , and [the people]502-the people could easily see , now , how noble and beautiful those episodes were , and remembered with grief that at the time [they]1113-the departed occurred [they]1113-the departed had seemed rank rascalities , well deserving of the cowhide . [The congregation]537-the congregation became more and more moved , as the pathetic tale went on , till at last [the whole company]1301-the whole company broke down and joined [the weeping mourners]1302-the weeping mourners in a chorus of anguished sobs , [the preacher]1303-the preacher [himself]1303-the preacher giving way to [his]1303-the preacher feelings , and crying in the pulpit . There was a rustle in [the gallery]540-the gallery , which [nobody]647-nobody noticed ; a moment later the church door creaked ; [the minister]544-the minister raised [his]544-the minister streaming eyes above [his]544-the minister handkerchief , and stood transfixed ! First one and then another pair of eyes followed [the minister]544-the minister ’s , and then almost with one impulse [the congregation]537-the congregation rose and stared while [the three dead boys]1309-the three dead boys came marching up the aisle , [Tom]46-tom in the lead , [Joe]62-joe next , and [Huck]45-huck , a ruin of drooping rags , sneaking sheepishly in the rear ! [They]1309-the three dead boys had been hid in [the unused gallery]1310-the unused gallery listening to [their]1309-the three dead boys own funeral sermon ! [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , [Mary]47-aunt polly , and [the Harpers]1311-the harpers threw [themselves]1309-the three dead boys upon [[their]1309-the three dead boys restored ones]1312-their restored ones , smothered [them]1312-their restored ones with kisses and poured out thanksgivings , while [poor Huck]45-huck stood abashed and uncomfortable , not knowing exactly what to do or where to hide from so many unwelcoming eyes . [He]45-huck wavered , and started to slink away , but [Tom]46-tom seized [him]45-huck and said : “ [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , it ai n’t fair . [Somebody]262-somebody ’s got to be glad to see [Huck]45-huck . ”[46-tom] “ And so [they]262-somebody shall . [I]46-tom ’m glad to see [him]45-huck , poor motherless thing ! ”[46-tom] And the loving attentions [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly lavished upon [him]45-huck were the one thing capable of making [him]45-huck more uncomfortable than [he]45-huck was before . Suddenly [the minister]544-the minister shouted at the top of [his]544-the minister voice : “ Praise [God]65-god from whom all blessings flow—_sing_!—and put [your]2436-your hearts in it ! ”[544-the minister] And [they]1314-they did . [Old Hundred]26-old hundred swelled up with a triumphant burst , and while it shook the rafters [Tom]46-tom Sawyer [the Pirate]1315-the pirate looked around upon the envying juveniles about [him]46-tom and confessed in [his]46-tom heart that this was the proudest moment of [his]46-tom life . As [the “ sold ”[1316-the “ sold ” congregation] congregation]1316-the “ sold ” congregation trooped out [they]1316-the “ sold ” congregation said [they]1316-the “ sold ” congregation would almost be willing to be made ridiculous again to hear [Old Hundred]26-old hundred sung like that once more . [Tom]46-tom got more cuffs and kisses that day — according to [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s varying moods — than [he]46-tom had earned before in a year ; and [he]46-tom hardly knew which expressed the most gratefulness to [God]65-god and affection for [himself]46-tom . CHAPTER XVIII That was [Tom]46-tom ’s great secret — the scheme to return [home]197-home with [[his]46-tom brother]1318-his brother pirates and attend [their]1318-his brother own funerals . [They]1318-his brother had paddled over to [the Missouri shore]1319-the missouri shore on a log , at dusk on Saturday , landing five or six miles below [the village]206-the village ; [they]1318-his brother had slept in [the woods]2157-the woods at [the edge of [the town]519-the town]1322-the edge of the town till nearly daylight , and had then crept through [back lanes]1324-back lanes and alleys and finished [their]1318-his brother sleep in [the gallery of [the church]384-the church]1325-the gallery of the church among a chaos of invalided benches . At breakfast , Monday morning , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly and [Mary]47-aunt polly were very loving to [Tom]46-tom , and very attentive to [his]46-tom wants . There was an unusual amount of talk . In the course of it [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly said : “ Well , [I]47-aunt polly do n’t say it was n’t a fine joke , [Tom]46-tom , to keep [everybody]490-everybody suffering ’ most a week so [[you]46-tom boys]2438-you boys had a good time , but it is a pity [you]46-tom could be so hard - hearted as to let [me]47-aunt polly suffer so . If [you]46-tom could come over on a log to go to [your]46-tom funeral , [you]46-tom could have come over and give [me]47-aunt polly a hint some way that [you]46-tom warn’t dead , but only run off . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Yes , [you]46-tom could have done that , [Tom]46-tom , ”[47-aunt polly] said [Mary]47-aunt polly ; “ and [I]47-aunt polly believe [you]46-tom would if [you]46-tom had thought of it . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Would [you]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[47-aunt polly] said [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , [her]47-aunt polly face lighting wistfully . “ Say , now , would [you]46-tom , if [you]46-tom ’d thought of it ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ [I]47-aunt polly — well , [I]47-aunt polly do n’t know . ’ Twould ’ a ’ spoiled everything . ”[47-aunt polly] “ [Tom]46-tom , [I]47-aunt polly hoped [you]46-tom loved [me]47-aunt polly that much , ”[47-aunt polly] said [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , with a grieved tone that discomforted [the boy]2044-the boy . “ It would have been something if [you]46-tom ’d cared enough to _ think _ of it , even if [you]46-tom did n’t _ do _ it . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Now , [auntie]2133-auntie , that ai n’t any harm , ”[47-aunt polly] pleaded [Mary]47-aunt polly ; “ it ’s only [Tom]46-tom ’s giddy way — [he]46-tom is always in such a rush that [he]46-tom never thinks of anything . ”[47-aunt polly] “ More ’s the pity . [Sid]51-sid would have thought . And [Sid]51-sid would have come and _ done _ it , too . [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom ’ll look back , some day , when it ’s too late , and wish [you]46-tom ’d cared a little more for [me]47-aunt polly when it would have cost [you]46-tom so little . ”[47-aunt polly] “ Now , [auntie]2133-auntie , [you]2133-auntie know [I]46-tom do care for [you]2133-auntie , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom . “ [I]46-tom ’d know it better if [you]2133-auntie acted more like it . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom wish now [I]46-tom ’d thought , ”[46-tom] said [Tom]46-tom , with a repentant tone ; “ but [I]46-tom dreamt about [you]2133-auntie , anyway . That ’s something , ai n’t it ? ”[46-tom] “ It ai n’t much — a cat does that much — but it ’s better than nothing . What did [you]2133-auntie dream ? ”[46-tom] “ Why , Wednesday night [I]46-tom dreamt that [you]2133-auntie was sitting over there by the bed , and [Sid]51-sid was sitting by the woodbox , and [Mary]47-aunt polly next to [him]51-sid . ”[46-tom] “ Well , so [we]2441-we did . So [we]2441-we always do . [I]46-tom ’m glad [your]2133-auntie dreams could take even that much trouble about [us]2441-we . ”[46-tom] “ And [I]46-tom dreamt that [[Joe Harper]62-joe ’s mother]1145-joe harper ’s mother was here . ”[46-tom] “ Why , [she]1145-joe harper ’s mother was [here]551-here ! Did [you]2133-auntie dream any more ? ”[46-tom] “ Oh , lots . But it ’s so dim , now . ”[46-tom] “ Well , try to recollect — can’t [you]2133-auntie ? ”[46-tom] “ Somehow it seems to [me]46-tom that the wind — the wind blowed the — the — ”[46-tom] “ Try harder , [Tom]46-tom ! The wind did blow something . Come ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom pressed [his]46-tom fingers on [his]46-tom forehead an anxious minute , and then said : “ [I]46-tom ’ve got it now ! [I]46-tom ’ve got it now ! It blowed the candle ! ”[46-tom] “ Mercy on [us]2441-we ! Go on , [Tom]46-tom — go on ! ”[46-tom] “ And it seems to [me]46-tom that [you]46-tom said , ‘ Why , [I]46-tom believe that that door — ’ ”[46-tom] “ Go _ on _ , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ Just let [me]46-tom study a moment — just a moment . Oh , yes — [you]46-tom said [you]46-tom believed the door was open . ”[46-tom] “ As [I]46-tom ’m sitting here , [I]46-tom did ! Did n’t [I]46-tom , [Mary]47-aunt polly ! Go on ! ”[46-tom] “ And then — and then — well [I]46-tom wo n’t be certain , but it seems like as if [you]46-tom made [Sid]51-sid go and — and — ”[46-tom] “ Well ? Well ? What did [I]46-tom make [him]51-sid do , [Tom]46-tom ? What did [I]46-tom make [him]51-sid do ? ”[46-tom] “ [You]46-tom made [him]51-sid — [you]46-tom — Oh , [you]46-tom made [him]51-sid shut it . ”[46-tom] “ Well , for [the land]2444-the land ’s sake ! [I]46-tom never heard the beat of that in all [my]46-tom days ! Do n’t tell _ [me]46-tom _ there ai n’t anything in dreams , any more . [Sereny Harper]123-sereny harper shall know of this before [I]46-tom ’m an hour older . [I]46-tom ’d like to see [her]123-sereny harper get around _ this _ with [her]123-sereny harper rubbage ’bout superstition . Go on , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ Oh , it ’s all getting just as bright as day , now . Next [you]46-tom said [I]46-tom warn’t _ bad _ , only mischeevous and harum - scarum , and not any more responsible than — than — [I]46-tom think it was a colt , or something . ”[46-tom] “ And so it was ! Well , goodness gracious ! Go on , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ And then [you]46-tom began to cry . ”[46-tom] “ So [I]46-tom did . So [I]46-tom did . Not the first time , neither . And then — ”[46-tom] “ Then [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper [she]118-mrs. harper began to cry , and said [Joe]62-joe was just the same , and [she]118-mrs. harper wished [she]118-mrs. harper had n’t whipped [him]62-joe for taking cream when [she]118-mrs. harper ’d throwed it out [her]118-mrs. harper own self — ”[46-tom] “ [Tom]46-tom ! [The sperrit]2445-the sperrit was upon [you]46-tom ! [You]46-tom was a prophesying — that ’s what [you]46-tom was doing ! Land alive , go on , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ Then [Sid]51-sid [he]51-sid said — [he]51-sid said — ”[46-tom] “ [I]51-sid do n’t think [I]51-sid said anything , ”[51-sid] said [Sid]51-sid . “ Yes [you]51-sid did , [Sid]51-sid , ”[47-aunt polly] said [Mary]47-aunt polly . “ Shut [your]46-tom heads and let [Tom]46-tom go on ! What did [he]51-sid say , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[47-aunt polly] “ [He]51-sid said — [I]46-tom _ think _ [he]51-sid said [he]51-sid hoped [I]46-tom was better off where [I]46-tom was gone to , but if [I]46-tom ’d been better sometimes — ”[46-tom] “ _ There _ , [d’you]46-tom hear that ! It was [his]51-sid very words ! ”[46-tom] “ And [you]51-sid shut [him]51-sid up sharp . ”[46-tom] “ [I]46-tom lay [I]46-tom did ! There must ’ a ’ been [an angel there]2446-an angel there . There _ was _ [an angel there]2446-an angel there , somewheres ! ”[46-tom] “ And [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper told about [Joe]62-joe scaring [her]118-mrs. harper with a firecracker , and [you]46-tom told about [Peter]111-peter and [the Pain - killer]949-the pain - killer — ”[46-tom] “ Just as true as [I]46-tom live ! ”[46-tom] “ And then there was a whole lot of talk ’bout dragging [the river]346-the river for [us]2450-we , and ’bout having the funeral Sunday , and then [you]46-tom and [old Miss Harper]124-old miss harper hugged and cried , and [she]118-mrs. harper went . ”[46-tom] “ It happened just so ! It happened just so , as sure as [I]46-tom ’m a - sitting in these very tracks . [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom could n’t told it more like if [you]46-tom ’d ’ a ’ seen it ! And then what ? Go on , [Tom]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] “ Then [I]46-tom thought [you]46-tom prayed for [me]46-tom — and [I]46-tom could see [you]46-tom and hear every word [you]46-tom said . And [you]46-tom went to bed , and [I]46-tom was so sorry that [I]46-tom took and wrote on a piece of sycamore bark , ‘ [We]2450-we ai n’t dead — [we]2450-we are only off being [pirates]2349-pirates , ’ and put it on the table by the candle ; and then [you]46-tom looked so good , laying there asleep , that [I]46-tom thought [I]46-tom went and leaned over and kissed [you]46-tom on the lips . ”[46-tom] “ Did [you]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , _ did _ [you]46-tom ! [I]1328-i just forgive [you]46-tom everything for that ! ”[1328-i] And [she]1328-i seized [the boy]2044-the boy in a crushing embrace that made [him]2044-the boy feel like [the guiltiest of villains]1330-the guiltiest of villains . “ It was very kind , even though it was only a — dream , ”[51-sid] [Sid]51-sid soliloquized just audibly . “ Shut up , [Sid]51-sid ! [A body]2452-a body does just the same in a dream as [he]2452-a body ’d do if [he]2452-a body was awake . Here ’s a big Milum apple [I]51-sid ’ve been saving for [you]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , if [you]46-tom was ever found again — now go ’ long to [school]2056-school . [I]51-sid ’m thankful to [the good God]2454-the good god and Father of [us]2455-us all [I]51-sid ’ve got [you]46-tom back , that ’s long - suffering and merciful to [them]2456-them that believe on [Him]2044-the boy and keep [His]2044-the boy word , though goodness knows [I]51-sid ’m unworthy of it , but if only [the worthy ones]2457-the worthy ones got [His]2044-the boy blessings and had [His]2044-the boy hand to help [them]2457-the worthy ones over [the rough places]2458-the rough places , there ’s [few enough]2459-few enough would smile here or ever enter into [His]2044-the boy rest when the long night comes . Go ’ long [Sid]51-sid , [Mary]47-aunt polly , [Tom]46-tom — take [yourselves]383-the children off — [you’ve]383-the children hendered [me]51-sid long enough . ”[51-sid] [The children]383-the children left for [school]2056-school , and [the old lady]189-the old lady to call on [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper and vanquish [her]189-the old lady realism with [Tom]46-tom ’s marvellous dream . [Sid]51-sid had better judgment than to utter the thought that was in [his]51-sid mind as [he]51-sid left [the house]332-the house . It was this : “ Pretty thin — as long a dream as that , without any mistakes in it ! ”[1335-a hero] What [a hero]1335-a hero [Tom]46-tom was become , now ! [He]46-tom did not go skipping and prancing , but moved with a dignified swagger as became [a pirate who felt that the public eye]1336-a pirate who felt that the public eye was on [him]46-tom . And indeed it was ; [he]46-tom tried not to seem to see the looks or hear the remarks as [he]46-tom passed along , but they were food and drink to [him]46-tom . [Smaller boys than [himself]46-tom]1337-smaller boys than himself flocked at [his]46-tom heels , as proud to be seen with [him]46-tom , and tolerated by [him]46-tom , as if [he]46-tom had been [the drummer at the head of a procession]1338-the drummer at the head of a procession or the elephant leading a menagerie into [town]526-town . [Boys of [his]46-tom own size]1340-boys of his own size pretended not to know [he]46-tom had been away at all ; but [they]1340-boys of his own size were consuming with envy , nevertheless . [They]1340-boys of his own size would have given anything to have that swarthy sun - tanned skin of [his]46-tom , and [his]46-tom glittering notoriety ; and [Tom]46-tom would not have parted with either for a circus . At [school]2056-school [the children]383-the children made so much of [him]46-tom and of [Joe]62-joe , and delivered such eloquent admiration from [their]383-the children eyes , that [the two heroes]1343-the two heroes were not long in becoming insufferably “ stuck - up . ”[383-the children] [They]383-the children began to tell [their]383-the children adventures to [hungry listeners]1344-hungry listeners — but [they]383-the children only began ; it was not a thing likely to have an end , with imaginations like [theirs]383-the children to furnish material . And finally , when [they]383-the children got out [their]383-the children pipes and went serenely puffing around , the very summit of glory was reached . [Tom]46-tom decided that [he]46-tom could be independent of [Becky Thatcher]86-becky now . [Glory]27-glory was sufficient . [He]46-tom would live for glory . Now that [he]46-tom was distinguished , maybe [she]86-becky would be wanting to “ make up . ”[86-becky] Well , let [her]86-becky — [she]86-becky should see that [he]46-tom could be as indifferent as [some other people]1345-some other people . Presently [she]86-becky arrived . [Tom]46-tom pretended not to see [her]86-becky . [He]46-tom moved away and joined [a group of [boys]183-boys and [girls]184-girls]1264-a group of boys and girls and began to talk . Soon [he]46-tom observed that [she]86-becky was tripping gayly back and forth with flushed face and dancing eyes , pretending to be busy chasing [schoolmates]1349-schoolmates , and screaming with laughter when [she]86-becky made a capture ; but [he]46-tom noticed that [she]86-becky always made [her]86-becky captures in [[his]46-tom vicinity]1350-his vicinity , and that [she]86-becky seemed to cast a conscious eye in [his]46-tom direction at such times , too . It gratified all the vicious vanity that was in [him]46-tom ; and so , instead of winning [him]46-tom , it only “ set [him]46-tom up ”[86-becky] the more and made [him]46-tom the more diligent to avoid betraying that [he]46-tom knew [she]86-becky was about . Presently [she]86-becky gave over skylarking , and moved irresolutely about , sighing once or twice and glancing furtively and wistfully toward [Tom]46-tom . Then [she]86-becky observed that now [Tom]46-tom was talking more particularly to [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence than to [any one else]1351-any one else . [She]86-becky felt a sharp pang and grew disturbed and uneasy at once . [She]86-becky tried to go away , but [her]86-becky feet were treacherous , and carried [her]86-becky to [the group]1278-the group instead . [She]86-becky said to [a girl almost at [Tom]46-tom ’s elbow]1353-a girl almost at tom ’s elbow — with sham vivacity : “ Why , [Mary Austin]125-mary austin ! [[you]125-mary austin bad girl]2460-you bad girl , why did n’t [you]125-mary austin come to [Sunday - school]2461-sunday - school ? ”[86-becky] “ [I]86-becky did come — didn’t [you]125-mary austin see [me]86-becky ? ”[86-becky] “ Why , no !
