Did [you]125-mary austin ? Where did [you]125-mary austin sit ? ”[86-becky] “ [I]86-becky was in [Miss Peters]126-miss peters ’ class , where [I]86-becky always go . [I]86-becky saw _ [you]125-mary austin _ . ”[86-becky] “ Did [you]125-mary austin ? Why , it ’s funny [I]86-becky did n’t see [you]125-mary austin . [I]86-becky wanted to tell [you]125-mary austin about the picnic . ”[86-becky] “ Oh , that ’s jolly . Who ’s going to give it ? ”[86-becky] “ [[My]86-becky ma]2462-my ma ’s going to let [me]86-becky have one . ”[86-becky] “ Oh , goody ; [I]86-becky hope [she]2462-my ma ’ll let _ [me]86-becky _ come . ”[86-becky] “ Well , [she]2462-my ma will . The picnic ’s for [me]86-becky . [She]2462-my ma ’ll let [anybody]203-anybody come that [I]86-becky want , and [I]86-becky want [you]125-mary austin . ”[86-becky] “ That ’s ever so nice . When is it going to be ? ”[86-becky] “ By and by . Maybe about vacation . ”[86-becky] “ Oh , wo n’t it be fun ! [You]125-mary austin going to have all [the girls]658-the girls and [boys]183-boys ? ”[86-becky] “ Yes , [every one that ’s friends to [me]1354-me]2466-every one that ’s friends to me — or wants to be ”[1354-me] ; and [she]1354-me glanced ever so furtively at [Tom]46-tom , but [he]46-tom talked right along to [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence about the terrible storm on [the island]1035-the island , and how the lightning tore the great sycamore tree “ all to flinders ”[46-tom] while [he]46-tom was “ standing within three feet of it . ”[1354-me] “ Oh , may [I]127-grace miller come ? ”[127-grace miller] said [Grace Miller]127-grace miller . “ Yes . ”[127-grace miller] “ And [me]61-sally ? ”[61-sally] said [Sally Rogers]61-sally . “ Yes . ”[61-sally] “ And [me]128-susy harper , too ? ”[128-susy harper] said [Susy Harper]128-susy harper . “ And [Joe]62-joe ? ”[128-susy harper] “ Yes . ”[61-sally] And so on , with clapping of joyful hands till [all the group]1356-all the group had begged for invitations but [Tom]46-tom and [Amy]64-amy lawrence . Then [Tom]46-tom turned coolly away , still talking , and took [Amy]64-amy lawrence with [him]46-tom . [Becky]86-becky ’s lips trembled and the tears came to [her]86-becky eyes ; [she]86-becky hid these signs with a forced gayety and went on chattering , but the life had gone out of the picnic , now , and out of everything else ; [she]86-becky got away as soon as [she]86-becky could and hid [herself]86-becky and had what [her]86-becky sex call “ a good cry . ”[86-becky] Then [she]86-becky sat moody , with wounded pride , till the bell rang . [She]86-becky roused up , now , with a vindictive cast in [her]86-becky eye , and gave [her]86-becky plaited tails a shake and said [she]86-becky knew what _ [she]86-becky ’d _ do . At recess [Tom]46-tom continued [his]46-tom flirtation with [Amy]64-amy lawrence with jubilant self - satisfaction . And [he]46-tom kept drifting about to find [Becky]86-becky and lacerate [her]86-becky with the performance . At last [he]46-tom spied [her]86-becky , but there was a sudden falling of [his]46-tom mercury . [She]86-becky was sitting cosily on a little bench behind [the schoolhouse]969-the schoolhouse looking at a picture - book with [Alfred Temple]129-alfred temple — and so absorbed were [they]1358-they , and [their]1358-they heads so close together over the book , that [they]1358-they did not seem to be conscious of anything in [the world]328-the world besides . [Jealousy]130-jealousy ran red - hot through [Tom]46-tom ’s veins . [He]46-tom began to hate [himself]46-tom for throwing away the chance [Becky]86-becky had offered for a reconciliation . [He]46-tom called [himself]46-tom [a fool]2290-a fool , and all the hard names [he]46-tom could think of . [He]46-tom wanted to cry with vexation . [Amy]64-amy lawrence chatted happily along , as [they]1358-they walked , for [her]64-amy lawrence heart was singing , but [Tom]46-tom ’s tongue had lost its function . [He]46-tom did not hear what [Amy]64-amy lawrence was saying , and whenever [she]64-amy lawrence paused expectantly [he]46-tom could only stammer an awkward assent , which was as often misplaced as otherwise . [He]46-tom kept drifting to the rear of [the schoolhouse]969-the schoolhouse , again and again , to sear [his]46-tom eyeballs with the hateful spectacle there . [He]46-tom could not help it . And it maddened [him]46-tom to see , as [he]46-tom thought [he]46-tom saw , that [Becky Thatcher]86-becky never once suspected that [he]46-tom was even in [the land of the living]1362-the land of the living . But [she]86-becky did see , nevertheless ; and [she]86-becky knew [she]86-becky was winning [her]86-becky fight , too , and was glad to see [him]46-tom suffer as [she]86-becky had suffered . [Amy]64-amy lawrence ’s happy prattle became intolerable . [Tom]46-tom hinted at things [he]46-tom had to attend to ; things that must be done ; and time was fleeting . But in vain — [the girl]334-the girl chirped on . [Tom]46-tom thought , “ Oh , hang [her]334-the girl , ai n’t [I]46-tom ever going to get rid of [her]334-the girl ? ”[46-tom] At last [he]46-tom must be attending to those things — and [she]334-the girl said artlessly that [she]334-the girl would be “ around ”[334-the girl] when school let out . And [he]46-tom hastened away , hating [her]334-the girl for it . “ [Any other boy]2467-any other boy ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom thought , grating [his]46-tom teeth . “ [Any boy in [the whole town]1114-the whole town but that Saint Louis smarty that thinks [he]46-tom dresses so fine and is aristocracy]2468-any boy in the whole town but that saint louis smarty that thinks he dresses so fine and is aristocracy ! Oh , all right , [I]46-tom licked [you]46-tom the first day [you]46-tom ever saw [this town]2162-this town , [mister]2471-mister , and [I]46-tom ’ll lick [you]46-tom again ! [You]46-tom just wait till [I]46-tom catch [you]46-tom out ! [I]46-tom ’ll just take and — ”[46-tom] And [he]46-tom went through the motions of thrashing [an imaginary boy]1364-an imaginary boy — pummelling the air , and kicking and gouging . “ Oh , [you]46-tom do , do [you]46-tom ? [You]46-tom holler ’ nough , do [you]46-tom ? Now , then , let that learn [you]46-tom ! ”[46-tom] And so the imaginary flogging was finished to [his]46-tom satisfaction . [Tom]46-tom fled [home]197-home at noon . [His]46-tom conscience could not endure any more of [Amy]64-amy lawrence ’s grateful happiness , and [his]46-tom jealousy could bear no more of the other distress . [Becky]86-becky resumed [her]86-becky picture inspections with [Alfred]129-alfred temple , but as the minutes dragged along and no [Tom]46-tom came to suffer , [her]86-becky triumph began to cloud and [she]86-becky lost interest ; gravity and absentmindedness followed , and then melancholy ; two or three times [she]86-becky pricked up [her]86-becky ear at a footstep , but it was a false hope ; no [Tom]46-tom came . At last [she]86-becky grew entirely miserable and wished [she]86-becky had n’t carried it so far . When poor [Alfred]129-alfred temple , seeing that [he]129-alfred temple was losing [her]86-becky , [he]129-alfred temple did not know how , kept exclaiming : “ Oh , here ’s [a jolly one]2472-a jolly one ! look at this ! ”[86-becky] [she]86-becky lost patience at last , and said , “ Oh , do n’t bother [me]86-becky ! [I]86-becky do n’t care for [them]2473-them ! ”[86-becky] and burst into tears , and got up and walked away . [Alfred]129-alfred temple dropped alongside and was going to try to comfort [her]86-becky , but [she]86-becky said : “ Go away and leave [me]86-becky alone , ca n’t [you]129-alfred temple ! [I]86-becky hate [you]129-alfred temple ! ”[86-becky] So [the boy]2044-the boy halted , wondering what [he]2044-the boy could have done — for [she]86-becky had said [she]86-becky would look at pictures all through the nooning — and [she]86-becky walked on , crying . Then [Alfred]129-alfred temple went musing into [the deserted schoolhouse]1367-the deserted schoolhouse . [He]129-alfred temple was humiliated and angry . [He]129-alfred temple easily guessed [his]129-alfred temple way to the truth — [the girl]334-the girl had simply made a convenience of [him]129-alfred temple to vent [her]334-the girl spite upon [Tom Sawyer]46-tom . [He]129-alfred temple was far from hating [Tom]46-tom the less when this thought occurred to [him]129-alfred temple . [He]129-alfred temple wished there was some way to get [that boy]2035-that boy into trouble without much risk to [himself]129-alfred temple . [Tom]46-tom ’s spelling - book fell under [his]129-alfred temple eye . Here was [his]129-alfred temple opportunity . [He]129-alfred temple gratefully opened to the lesson for the afternoon and poured ink upon the page . [Becky]86-becky , glancing in at a window behind [him]129-alfred temple at the moment , saw the act , and moved on , without discovering [herself]86-becky . [She]86-becky started [homeward]1370-homeward , now , intending to find [Tom]46-tom and tell [him]46-tom ; [Tom]46-tom would be thankful and [their]1371-their troubles would be healed . Before [she]86-becky was half way [home]197-home , however , [she]86-becky had changed [her]86-becky mind . The thought of [Tom]46-tom ’s treatment of [her]86-becky when [she]86-becky was talking about [her]86-becky picnic came scorching back and filled [her]86-becky with shame . [She]86-becky resolved to let [him]46-tom get whipped on the damaged spelling - book ’s account , and to hate [him]46-tom forever , into the bargain . CHAPTER XIX [Tom]46-tom arrived at [home]197-home in a dreary mood , and the first thing [[his]46-tom aunt]196-his aunt said to [him]46-tom showed [him]46-tom that [he]46-tom had brought [his]46-tom sorrows to an unpromising market : “ [Tom]46-tom , [I]196-his aunt ’ve a notion to skin [you]46-tom alive ! ”[196-his aunt] “ [Auntie]84-auntie , what have [I]196-his aunt done ? ”[196-his aunt] “ Well , [you]46-tom ’ve done enough . Here [I]196-his aunt go over to [Sereny Harper]123-sereny harper , like [an old softy]2474-an old softy , expecting [I]196-his aunt ’m going to make [her]123-sereny harper believe all that rubbage about that dream , when lo and behold [you]46-tom [she]123-sereny harper ’d found out from [Joe]62-joe that [you]46-tom was over here and heard all the talk [we]2475-we had that night . [Tom]46-tom , [I]196-his aunt do n’t know what is to become of [a boy that will act like that]2476-a boy that will act like that . It makes [me]196-his aunt feel so bad to think [you]46-tom could let [me]196-his aunt go to [Sereny Harper]123-sereny harper and make such a fool of [myself]196-his aunt and never say a word . ”[196-his aunt] This was a new aspect of the thing . [His]1375-i smartness of the morning had seemed to [Tom]46-tom a good joke before , and very ingenious . It merely looked mean and shabby now . [He]1375-i hung [his]1375-i head and could not think of anything to say for a moment . Then [he]1375-i said : “ [Auntie]84-auntie , [I]1375-i wish [I]1375-i had n’t done it — but [I]1375-i did n’t think . ”[1375-i] “ Oh , [child]2139-child , [you]2139-child never think . [You]2139-child never think of anything but [your]2139-child own selfishness . [You]2139-child could think to come all the way over here from [[Jackson]113-jackson ’s Island]1031-jackson ’s island in the night to laugh at [our]2479-us troubles , and [you]2139-child could think to fool [me]1375-i with a lie about a dream ; but [you]2139-child could n’t ever think to pity [us]2479-us and save [us]2479-us from sorrow . ”[1375-i] “ [Auntie]84-auntie , [I]1375-i know now it was mean , but [I]1375-i did n’t mean to be mean . [I]1375-i did n’t , honest . And besides , [I]1375-i did n’t come over here to laugh at [you]2139-child that night . ”[1375-i] “ What did [you]1375-i come for , then ? ”[1375-i] “ It was to tell [you]2139-child not to be uneasy about [us]2479-us , because [we]2479-us had n’t got drownded . ”[1375-i] “ [Tom]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , [I]1375-i would be [the thankfullest soul in [this world]2377-this world]2480-the thankfullest soul in this world if [I]1375-i could believe [you]46-tom ever had as good a thought as that , but [you]46-tom know [you]46-tom never did — and [I]1375-i know it , [Tom]46-tom . ”[1375-i] “ Indeed and ’ deed [I]1375-i did , [auntie]2133-auntie — [I]1375-i wish [I]1375-i may never stir if [I]1375-i did n’t . ”[1375-i] “ Oh , [Tom]46-tom , do n’t lie — don’t do it . It only makes things a hundred times worse . ”[1375-i] “ It ai n’t a lie , [auntie]2133-auntie ; it ’s the truth . [I]1375-i wanted to keep [you]2133-auntie from grieving — that was all that made [me]1375-i come . ”[1375-i] “ [I]1375-i ’d give [the whole world]2432-the whole world to believe that — it would cover up a power of sins , [Tom]46-tom . [I]1375-i ’d ’ most be glad [you]46-tom ’d run off and acted so bad . But it ai n’t reasonable ; because , why did n’t [you]46-tom tell [me]1375-i , [child]2139-child ? ”[1375-i] “ Why , [you]2133-auntie see , when [you]2133-auntie got to talking about the funeral , [I]1375-i just got all full of the idea of [our]2486-our coming and hiding in [the church]384-the church , and [I]1375-i could n’t somehow bear to spoil it . So [I]1375-i just put the bark back in [my]1375-i pocket and kept [mum]2273-mum . ”[1375-i] “ What bark ? ”[1375-i] “ The bark [I]1375-i had wrote on to tell [you]2133-auntie [we]2486-our ’d gone pirating . [I]1375-i wish , now , [you]2133-auntie ’d waked up when [I]1375-i kissed [you]2133-auntie — [I]1375-i do , [honest]2489-honest . ”[1375-i] The hard lines in [[his]1376-his aunt]196-his aunt ’s face relaxed and a sudden tenderness dawned in [her]196-his aunt eyes . “ _ Did _ [you]1375-i kiss [me]196-his aunt , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[196-his aunt] “ Why , yes , [I]1375-i did . ”[1375-i] “ Are [you]1375-i sure [you]1375-i did , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[1375-i] “ Why , yes , [I]196-his aunt did , [auntie]2133-auntie — certain sure . ”[196-his aunt] “ What did [you]1375-i kiss [me]1375-i for , [Tom]46-tom ? ”[1375-i] “ Because [I]1375-i loved [you]46-tom so , and [you]46-tom laid there moaning and [I]1375-i was so sorry . ”[1375-i] The words sounded like truth . [The old lady]189-the old lady could not hide a tremor in [her]189-the old lady voice when [she]189-the old lady said : “ Kiss [me]189-the old lady again , [Tom!—and]131-tom!—and be off with [you]46-tom to [school]2056-school , now , and do n’t bother [me]189-the old lady any more . ”[189-the old lady] The moment [he]1379-he was gone , [she]189-the old lady ran to [a closet]1380-a closet and got out the ruin of a jacket which [Tom]46-tom had gone pirating in . Then [she]189-the old lady stopped , with it in [her]189-the old lady hand , and said to [herself]189-the old lady : “ No , [I]189-the old lady do n’t dare . [Poor boy]2389-poor boy , [I]189-the old lady reckon [he]2389-poor boy ’s lied about it — but it ’s a blessed , blessed lie , there ’s such a comfort come from it . [I]189-the old lady hope [the Lord]2047-the lord — [I]189-the old lady _ know _ [the Lord]2047-the lord will forgive [him]2389-poor boy , because it was such good - heartedness in [him]2389-poor boy to tell it . But [I]189-the old lady do n’t want to find out it ’s a lie . [I]189-the old lady wo n’t look . ”[189-the old lady] [She]189-the old lady put the jacket away , and stood by musing a minute . Twice [she]189-the old lady put out [her]189-the old lady hand to take the garment again , and twice [she]189-the old lady refrained . Once more [she]189-the old lady ventured , and this time [she]189-the old lady fortified [herself]189-the old lady with the thought : “ It ’s a good lie — it ’s a good lie — [I]189-the old lady wo n’t let it grieve [me]189-the old lady . ”[189-the old lady] So [she]189-the old lady sought the jacket pocket . A moment later [she]189-the old lady was reading [Tom]46-tom ’s piece of bark through flowing tears and saying : “ [I]189-the old lady could forgive [the boy]2044-the boy , now , if [he]2044-the boy ’d committed a million sins ! ”[189-the old lady] CHAPTER XX There was something about [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s manner , when [she]189-the old lady kissed [Tom]46-tom , that swept away [his]46-tom low spirits and made [him]46-tom lighthearted and happy again . [He]46-tom started to school and had the luck of coming upon [Becky Thatcher]86-becky at [the head of [Meadow Lane]19-meadow lane]1381-the head of meadow lane . [His]46-tom mood always determined [his]46-tom manner . Without a moment ’s hesitation [he]46-tom ran to [her]86-becky and said : “ [I]46-tom acted mighty mean today , [Becky]86-becky , and [I]46-tom ’m so sorry . [I]46-tom wo n’t ever , ever do that way again , as long as ever [I]46-tom live — please make up , wo n’t [you]86-becky ? ”[46-tom] [The girl]334-the girl stopped and looked [him]46-tom scornfully in the face : “ [I]334-the girl ’ll thank [you]46-tom to keep [yourself]46-tom _ to _ [yourself]46-tom , [Mr. Thomas Sawyer]46-tom . [I]334-the girl ’ll never speak to [you]46-tom again . ”[334-the girl] [She]334-the girl tossed [her]334-the girl head and passed on . [Tom]46-tom was so stunned that [he]46-tom had not even presence of mind enough to say “ Who cares , [Miss Smarty]132-miss smarty ? ”[46-tom] until the right time to say it had gone by . So [he]46-tom said nothing . But [he]46-tom was in a fine rage , nevertheless . [He]46-tom moped into [the schoolyard]957-the schoolyard wishing [she]334-the girl were [a boy]191-a boy , and imagining how [he]46-tom would trounce [her]334-the girl if [she]334-the girl were . [He]46-tom presently encountered [her]334-the girl and delivered a stinging remark as [he]46-tom passed . [She]334-the girl hurled one in return , and the angry breach was complete . It seemed to [Becky]86-becky , in [her]86-becky hot resentment , that [she]86-becky could hardly wait for [school]2056-school to “ take in , ”[86-becky] [she]86-becky was so impatient to see [Tom]46-tom flogged for the injured spelling - book . If [she]86-becky had had any lingering notion of exposing [Alfred Temple]129-alfred temple , [Tom]46-tom ’s offensive fling had driven it entirely away . [Poor girl]1386-poor girl , [she]86-becky did not know how fast [she]86-becky was nearing trouble [herself]86-becky . [The master]656-the master , [Mr. Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins , had reached middle age with an unsatisfied ambition . The darling of [his]656-the master desires was , to be [a doctor]1388-a doctor , but poverty had decreed that [he]656-the master should be nothing higher than [a village schoolmaster]1389-a village schoolmaster . Every day [he]656-the master took a mysterious book out of [his]656-the master desk and absorbed [himself]656-the master in it at times when no classes were reciting . [He]656-the master kept that book under lock and key . There was not [an urchin]1390-an urchin in [school]2056-school but was perishing to have a glimpse of it , but the chance never came . [Every boy]1392-every boy and [girl]1393-girl had a theory about the nature of that book ; but no two theories were alike , and there was no way of getting at the facts in the case . Now , as [Becky]86-becky was passing by the desk , which stood near the door , [she]86-becky noticed that the key was in the lock ! It was a precious moment . [She]86-becky glanced around ; found [herself]86-becky alone , and the next instant [she]86-becky had the book in [her]86-becky hands . The titlepage — [Professor Somebody]134-professor somebody ’s _ Anatomy_—carried no information to [her]86-becky mind ; so [she]86-becky began to turn the leaves . [She]86-becky came at once upon a handsomely engraved and colored frontispiece — [a human figure]1394-a human figure , stark naked . At that moment a shadow fell on the page and [Tom Sawyer]46-tom stepped in at the door and caught a glimpse of the picture . [Becky]86-becky snatched at the book to close it , and had the hard luck to tear the pictured page half down the middle . [She]86-becky thrust the volume into the desk , turned the key , and burst out crying with shame and vexation . “ [Tom Sawyer]46-tom , [you]46-tom are just as mean as [you]46-tom can be , to sneak up on [a person]2496-a person and look at what [they]2496-a person ’re looking at . ”[86-becky] “ How could [I]86-becky know [you]46-tom was looking at anything ? ”[86-becky] “ [You]46-tom ought to be ashamed of [yourself]46-tom , [Tom Sawyer]46-tom ; [you]46-tom know [you]46-tom ’re going to tell on [me]86-becky , and oh , what shall [I]86-becky do , what shall [I]86-becky do ! [I]86-becky ’ll be whipped , and [I]86-becky never was whipped in [school]2056-school . ”[86-becky] Then [she]86-becky stamped [her]86-becky little foot and said : “ _ Be _ so mean if [you]46-tom want to ! [I]86-becky know something that ’s going to happen . [You]46-tom just wait and [you]46-tom ’ll see ! Hateful , hateful , hateful!”—and[86-becky] [she]86-becky flung out of [the house]332-the house with a new explosion of crying . [Tom]46-tom stood still , rather flustered by this onslaught . Presently [he]46-tom said to [himself]46-tom : “ What [a curious kind of a fool]2498-a curious kind of a fool [a girl]438-a girl is ! Never been licked in [school]2056-school ! Shucks ! What ’s a licking ! That ’s just like [a girl]438-a girl — [they’re]2502-they’re so thin - skinned and chicken - hearted . Well , of course [I]46-tom ai n’t going to tell [old Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins on [this little fool]2503-this little fool , because there ’s other ways of getting even on [her]2503-this little fool , that ai n’t so mean ; but what of it ? [Old Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins will ask who it was tore [his]133-mr. dobbins book . [Nobody’ll]2504-nobody’ll answer . Then [he]133-mr. dobbins ’ll do just the way [he]133-mr. dobbins always does — ask first one and then t’other , and when [he]133-mr. dobbins comes to [the right girl]2505-the right girl [he]133-mr. dobbins ’ll know it , without any telling . [Girls]184-girls ’ faces always tell on [them]184-girls . [They]184-girls ai n’t got any backbone . [She]2503-this little fool ’ll get licked . Well , it ’s a kind of a tight place for [Becky Thatcher]86-becky , because there ai n’t any way out of it . ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom conned the thing a moment longer , and then added : “ All right , though ; [she]2503-this little fool ’d like to see [me]46-tom in just such a fix — let [her]2503-this little fool sweat it out ! ”[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom joined [the mob of [skylarking scholars]1397-skylarking scholars outside]1396-the mob of skylarking scholars outside . In a few moments [the master]656-the master arrived and school “ took in . ”[656-the master] [Tom]46-tom did not feel a strong interest in [his]46-tom studies . Every time [he]46-tom stole a glance at [the girls]658-the girls ’ side of [the room]190-the room [Becky]86-becky ’s face troubled [him]46-tom . Considering all things , [he]46-tom did not want to pity [her]86-becky , and yet it was all [he]46-tom could do to help it . [He]46-tom could get up no exultation that was really worthy the name . Presently the spelling - book discovery was made , and [Tom]46-tom ’s mind was entirely full of [his]46-tom own matters for a while after that . [Becky]86-becky roused up from [her]86-becky lethargy of distress and showed good interest in the proceedings . [She]86-becky did not expect that [Tom]46-tom could get out of [his]46-tom trouble by denying that [he]46-tom spilt the ink on the book [himself]46-tom ; and [she]86-becky was right . The denial only seemed to make the thing worse for [Tom]46-tom . [Becky]86-becky supposed [she]86-becky would be glad of that , and [she]86-becky tried to believe [she]86-becky was glad of it , but [she]86-becky found [she]86-becky was not certain . When the worst came to the worst , [she]86-becky had an impulse to get up and tell on [Alfred Temple]129-alfred temple , but [she]86-becky made an effort and forced [herself]86-becky to keep still — because , said [she]86-becky to [herself]86-becky , “ [he]129-alfred temple ’ll tell about [me]86-becky tearing the picture sure . [I]86-becky would n’t say a word , not to save [his]129-alfred temple life ! ”[86-becky] [Tom]46-tom took [his]46-tom whipping and went back to [his]46-tom seat not at all broken - hearted , for [he]46-tom thought it was possible that [he]46-tom had unknowingly upset the ink on the spelling - book [himself]46-tom , in some skylarking bout — [he]46-tom had denied it for form ’s sake and because it was custom , and had stuck to the denial from principle . A whole hour drifted by , [the master]656-the master sat nodding in [his]656-the master throne , the air was drowsy with the hum of study . By and by , [Mr. Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins straightened [himself]133-mr. dobbins up , yawned , then unlocked [his]133-mr. dobbins desk , and reached for [his]133-mr. dobbins book , but seemed undecided whether to take it out or leave it . [Most of [the pupils]661-the pupils]1402-most of the pupils glanced up languidly , but there were two among [them]1402-most of the pupils that watched [his]133-mr. dobbins movements with intent eyes . [Mr. Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins fingered [his]133-mr. dobbins book absently for a while , then took it out and settled [himself]133-mr. dobbins in [his]133-mr. dobbins chair to read ! [Tom]46-tom shot a glance at [Becky]86-becky . [He]46-tom had seen a hunted and helpless rabbit look as [she]86-becky did , with a gun levelled at its head . Instantly [he]46-tom forgot [his]46-tom quarrel with [her]86-becky . Quick — something must be done ! done in a flash , too ! But the very imminence of the emergency paralyzed [his]46-tom invention . [Good!—he]135-good!—he had an inspiration ! [He]46-tom would run and snatch the book , spring through the door and fly . But [his]46-tom resolution shook for one little instant , and the chance was lost — [the master]656-the master opened the volume . If [Tom]46-tom only had the wasted opportunity back again ! Too late . There was no help for [Becky]86-becky now , [he]46-tom said . The next moment [the master]656-the master faced [the school]411-the school . Every eye sank under [his]656-the master gaze . There was that in it which smote even [the innocent]1407-the innocent with fear . There was silence while [one]934-one might count ten — [the master]656-the master was gathering [his]656-the master wrath . Then [he]656-the master spoke : “ [Who tore this book]2507-who tore this book ? ”[656-the master] There was not a sound . [One]934-one could have heard a pin drop . The stillness continued ; [the master]656-the master searched face after face for signs of guilt . “ [Benjamin Rogers]57-ben , did [you]2507-who tore this book tear this book ? ”[656-the master] A denial . Another pause . “ [Joseph Harper]62-joe , did [you]2507-who tore this book ? ”[656-the master] Another denial . [Tom]46-tom ’s uneasiness grew more and more intense under the slow torture of these proceedings . [The master]656-the master scanned the ranks of [boys]183-boys — considered a while , then turned to [the girls]658-the girls : “ [Amy Lawrence]64-amy lawrence ? ”[656-the master] A shake of the head . “ [Gracie Miller]127-grace miller ? ”[656-the master] The same sign . “ [Susan Harper]128-susy harper , did [you]2507-who tore this book do this ? ”[656-the master] Another negative . [The next girl]1415-the next girl was [Becky Thatcher]86-becky . [Tom]46-tom was trembling from head to foot with excitement and a sense of the hopelessness of the situation . “ [Rebecca Thatcher]86-becky ”[46-tom] [ [Tom]46-tom glanced at [her]1415-the next girl face — it was white with terror]—“did [you]1415-the next girl tear — no , look [me]46-tom in the face ”[46-tom] [ [her]1415-the next girl hands rose in appeal]—“did [you]46-tom tear this book ? ”[1415-the next girl] A thought shot like lightning through [Tom]46-tom ’s brain . [He]46-tom sprang to [his]46-tom feet and shouted—“I done it ! ”[46-tom] [The school]411-the school stared in perplexity at this incredible folly . [Tom]46-tom stood a moment , to gather [his]46-tom dismembered faculties ; and when [he]46-tom stepped forward to go to [his]46-tom punishment the surprise , the gratitude , the adoration that shone upon [him]46-tom out of poor [Becky]86-becky ’s eyes seemed pay enough for a hundred floggings . Inspired by the splendor of [his]46-tom own act , [he]46-tom took without an outcry the most merciless flaying that even [Mr. Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins had ever administered ; and also received with indifference the added cruelty of a command to remain two hours after [school]2056-school should be dismissed — for [he]46-tom knew who would wait for [him]46-tom outside till [his]46-tom captivity was done , and not count the tedious time as loss , either . [Tom]46-tom went to bed that night planning vengeance against [Alfred Temple]129-alfred temple ; for with shame and repentance [Becky]86-becky had told [him]46-tom all , not forgetting [her]86-becky own treachery ; but even the longing for vengeance had to give way , soon , to pleasanter musings , and [he]46-tom fell asleep at last with [Becky]86-becky ’s latest words lingering dreamily in [his]46-tom ear — “ [Tom]46-tom , how _ could _ [you]46-tom be so noble ! ”[86-becky] CHAPTER XXI Vacation was approaching . [The schoolmaster]872-the schoolmaster , always severe , grew severer and more exacting than ever , for [he]872-the schoolmaster wanted [the school]411-the school to make a good showing on “ Examination ”[872-the schoolmaster] day . [His]872-the schoolmaster rod and [his]872-the schoolmaster ferule were seldom idle now — at least among [the smaller pupils]1420-the smaller pupils . [Only the biggest boys]1421-only the biggest boys , and [young ladies of eighteen and twenty]1422-young ladies of eighteen and twenty , escaped lashing . [Mr. Dobbins]133-mr. dobbins ’ lashings were very vigorous ones , too ; for although [he]133-mr. dobbins carried , under [his]133-mr. dobbins wig , a perfectly bald and shiny head , [he]133-mr. dobbins had only reached middle age , and there was no sign of feebleness in [his]133-mr. dobbins muscle . As the great day approached , all the tyranny that was in [him]133-mr. dobbins came to the surface ; [he]133-mr. dobbins seemed to take a vindictive pleasure in punishing the least shortcomings . The consequence was , that [the smaller boys]1423-the smaller boys spent [their]1423-the smaller boys days in terror and suffering and [their]1423-the smaller boys nights in plotting revenge . [They]1423-the smaller boys threw away no opportunity to do [the master]656-the master a mischief . But [he]656-the master kept ahead all the time . The retribution that followed every vengeful success was so sweeping and majestic that [the boys]2054-the boys always retired from [the field]265-the field badly worsted . At last [they]2054-the boys conspired together and hit upon a plan that promised a dazzling victory . [They]2054-the boys swore in [the signpainter ’s boy]1427-the signpainter ’s boy , told [him]1427-the signpainter ’s boy the scheme , and asked [his]1427-the signpainter ’s boy help . [He]1427-the signpainter ’s boy had [his]1427-the signpainter ’s boy own reasons for being delighted , for [the master]656-the master boarded in [[[his]1427-the signpainter ’s boy father]1429-his father ’s family]1430-his father ’s family and had given [the boy]2044-the boy ample cause to hate [him]656-the master . [[The master]656-the master ’s wife]1433-the master ’s wife would go on a visit to [the country]351-the country in a few days , and there would be nothing to interfere with the plan ; [the master]656-the master always prepared [himself]656-the master for great occasions by getting pretty well fuddled , and [the signpainter ’s boy]1427-the signpainter ’s boy said that when [the dominie]1437-the dominie had reached the proper condition on Examination Evening [he]1427-the signpainter ’s boy would “ manage the thing ”[1427-the signpainter ’s boy] while [he]1427-the signpainter ’s boy napped in [his]1427-the signpainter ’s boy chair ; then [he]1427-the signpainter ’s boy would have [him]1427-the signpainter ’s boy awakened at the right time and hurried away to [school]2056-school . In the fulness of time the interesting occasion arrived . At eight in the evening [the schoolhouse]969-the schoolhouse was brilliantly lighted , and adorned with wreaths and festoons of foliage and flowers . [The master]656-the master sat throned in [his]656-the master great chair upon a raised platform , with [his]656-the master blackboard behind [him]656-the master . [He]656-the master was looking tolerably mellow . Three rows of benches on each side and six rows in front of [him]656-the master were occupied by [the dignitaries of [the town]519-the town]1441-the dignitaries of the town and by [the parents of [the pupils]661-the pupils]1443-the parents of the pupils . To [his]656-the master left , back of [the rows of [citizens]1446-citizens]1445-the rows of citizens , was a spacious temporary platform upon which were seated [the scholars who were to take part in the exercises of the evening]1447-the scholars who were to take part in the exercises of the evening ; [rows of small boys , washed and dressed to an intolerable state of discomfort]1448-rows of small boys , washed and dressed to an intolerable state of discomfort ; [rows of gawky big boys]1449-rows of gawky big boys ; snowbanks of [girls]184-girls and [young ladies clad in lawn and muslin]1451-young ladies clad in lawn and muslin and conspicuously conscious of [their]1451-young ladies clad in lawn and muslin bare arms , [[their]1451-young ladies clad in lawn and muslin grandmothers]1452-their grandmothers ’ ancient trinkets , [their]1451-young ladies clad in lawn and muslin bits of pink and blue ribbon and the flowers in [their]1451-young ladies clad in lawn and muslin hair . All the rest of [the house]332-the house was filled with [non - participating scholars]1454-non - participating scholars . The exercises began . [A very little boy]1455-a very little boy stood up and sheepishly recited , “ [You]2508-you ’d scarce expect [one of [my]1455-a very little boy age]2509-one of my age to speak in public on the stage , ”[1455-a very little boy] etc.—accompanying [himself]1455-a very little boy with the painfully exact and spasmodic gestures which a machine might have used — supposing the machine to be a trifle out of order . But [he]1455-a very little boy got through safely , though cruelly scared , and got a fine round of applause when [he]1455-a very little boy made [his]1455-a very little boy manufactured bow and retired . [A little shamefaced girl]1456-a little shamefaced girl lisped , “ [Mary]47-aunt polly had [a little lamb]2510-a little lamb , ”[1456-a little shamefaced girl] etc . , performed a compassion - inspiring curtsy , got [her]1456-a little shamefaced girl meed of applause , and sat down flushed and happy . [Tom Sawyer]46-tom stepped forward with conceited confidence and soared into the unquenchable and indestructible “ Give [me]46-tom liberty or give [me]46-tom death ”[46-tom] speech , with fine fury and frantic gesticulation , and broke down in the middle of it . A ghastly stage - fright seized [him]46-tom , [his]46-tom legs quaked under [him]46-tom and [he]46-tom was like to choke . True , [he]46-tom had the manifest sympathy of [the house]332-the house but [he]46-tom had [the house]332-the house ’s silence , too , which was even worse than its sympathy . [The master]656-the master frowned , and this completed the disaster . [Tom]46-tom struggled awhile and then retired , utterly defeated . There was a weak attempt at applause , but it died early . “ [The Boy]2044-the boy Stood on [the Burning Deck ”]2512-the burning deck ”[231-each] followed ; also “ [The Assyrian Came Down , ”]2513-the assyrian came down , ”[231-each] and other declamatory gems . Then there were reading exercises , and a spelling fight . The meagre Latin class recited with honor . The prime feature of the evening was in order , now — original “ compositions ”[1460-the young ladies] by [the young ladies]1460-the young ladies . [Each]231-each in [her]231-each turn stepped forward to the edge of the platform , cleared [her]231-each throat , held up [her]231-each manuscript ( tied with dainty ribbon ) , and proceeded to read , with labored attention to “ expression ”[231-each] and punctuation . The themes were the same that had been illuminated upon similar occasions by [[their]1460-the young ladies mothers]1462-their mothers before [them]1460-the young ladies , [[their]1460-the young ladies grandmothers]1452-their grandmothers , and doubtless all [[their]1460-the young ladies ancestors]1464-their ancestors in the female line clear back to the Crusades . “ Friendship ”[231-each] was one ; “ Memories of Other Days ”[231-each] ; “ Religion in History ”[231-each] ; “ [Dream Land]28-dream land ”[231-each] ; “ The Advantages of Culture ”[231-each] ; “ Forms of Political Government Compared and Contrasted ”[231-each] ; “ Melancholy ”[231-each] ; “ Filial Love ”[231-each] ; “ Heart Longings , ”[231-each] etc . , etc . A prevalent feature in these compositions was a nursed and petted melancholy ; another was a wasteful and opulent gush of “ fine language ”[231-each] ; another was a tendency to lug in by the ears particularly prized words and phrases until they were worn entirely out ; and a peculiarity that conspicuously marked and marred them was the inveterate and intolerable sermon that wagged its crippled tail at the end of each and every one of them . No matter what the subject might be , a brainracking effort was made to squirm it into some aspect or other that the moral and religious mind could contemplate with edification . The glaring insincerity of these sermons was not sufficient to compass the banishment of the fashion from [the schools]1465-the schools , and it is not sufficient today ; it never will be sufficient while [the world]328-the world stands , perhaps . There is [no school in [all [our]1469-our land]1468-all our land where [the young ladies]1460-the young ladies]1467-no school in all our land where the young ladies do not feel obliged to close [their]1460-the young ladies compositions with a sermon ; and [you]1471-you will find that the sermon of [the most frivolous and the least religious girl in the school]1472-the most frivolous and the least religious girl in the school is always the longest and the most relentlessly pious . But enough of this . Homely truth is unpalatable . Let [us]1469-our return to the “ Examination . ”[1460-the young ladies] The first composition that was read was one entitled “ Is this , then , Life ? ”[1460-the young ladies] Perhaps [the reader]213-the reader can endure an extract from it : “ In the common walks of life , with what delightful emotions does [the youthful mind]2514-the youthful mind look forward to some anticipated scene of festivity ! Imagination is busy sketching rose - tinted pictures of joy . In fancy , [the voluptuous votary of fashion]2515-the voluptuous votary of fashion sees [herself]1474-her amid the festive throng , ‘ the observed of [all observers]2516-all observers . ’ [Her]1474-her graceful form , arrayed in snowy robes , is whirling through the mazes of the joyous dance ; [her]1474-her eye is brightest , [her]1474-her step is lightest in the gay assembly . “[1460-the young ladies] In such delicious fancies time quickly glides by , and the welcome hour arrives for [her]1474-her entrance into [the Elysian world]1475-the elysian world , of which [she]1474-her has had such bright dreams . How fairy - like does everything appear to [her]1474-her enchanted vision ! Each new scene is more charming than the last . But after a while [she]1474-her finds that beneath this goodly exterior , all is vanity , the flattery which once charmed [her]1474-her soul , now grates harshly upon [her]1474-her ear ; [the ballroom]1476-the ballroom has lost its charms ; and with wasted health and imbittered heart , [she]1474-her turns away with the conviction that earthly pleasures can not satisfy the longings of the soul ! ” And so forth and so on . There was a buzz of gratification from time to time during the reading , accompanied by whispered ejaculations of “[1474-her] How sweet ! ” “[1474-her] How eloquent ! ” “[1474-her] So true ! ” etc . , and after the thing had closed with a peculiarly afflicting sermon the applause was enthusiastic . Then arose [a slim , melancholy girl , whose face had the “[1474-her] interesting ” paleness that comes of pills and indigestion]2517-a slim , melancholy girl , whose face had the “ interesting ” paleness that comes of pills and indigestion , and read a “[1474-her] poem . ” Two stanzas of it will do : “[136-a missouri maiden] [A MISSOURI MAIDEN]136-a missouri maiden ’S FAREWELL TO [ALABAMA]29-alabama “ [Alabama]29-alabama , goodbye ! [I]1474-her love [thee]29-alabama well ! But yet for a while do [I]1474-her leave [thee]29-alabama now ! Sad , yes , sad thoughts of [thee]29-alabama [my]1474-her heart doth swell , And burning recollections throng [my]1474-her brow ! For [I]1474-her have wandered through [[thy]29-alabama flowery woods]2518-thy flowery woods ; Have roamed and read near [[Tallapoosa]30-tallapoosa ’s stream]2519-tallapoosa ’s stream ; Have listened to [Tallassee]137-tallassee ’s warring floods , And wooed on [[Coosa]31-coosa ’s side [Aurora]138-aurora ’s beam]2520-coosa ’s side aurora ’s beam . “[1474-her] Yet shame [I]0-i not to bear an o’erfull heart , Nor blush to turn behind [my]0-i tearful eyes ; ’ Tis from [no stranger land [I]0-i now must part]1477-no stranger land i now must part , ’ Tis to [no strangers]1478-no strangers left [I]0-i yield these sighs . Welcome and [home]197-home were [mine]0-i within [this State]1480-this state , Whose vales [I]0-i leave — whose spires fade fast from [me]0-i And cold must be [mine]0-i eyes , and heart , and tête , When , [dear Alabama]29-alabama ! [they]1481-my turn cold on [thee]29-alabama ! ” There were very few there who knew what “[1481-my] _ tête _ ” meant , but the poem was very satisfactory , nevertheless . Next appeared [a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression , and began to read in a measured , solemn tone : A VISION Dark and tempestuous was night . Around the throne on high not a single star quivered ; but the deep intonations of the heavy thunder constantly vibrated upon the ear ; whilst the terrific lightning revelled in angry mood through [the cloudy chambers of [heaven]2523-heaven]2522-the cloudy chambers of heaven , seeming to scorn the power exerted over its terror by [the illustrious Franklin]2524-the illustrious franklin ! Even the boisterous winds unanimously came forth from [[their]1481-my mystic homes]2525-their mystic homes , and blustered about as if to enhance by [their]1481-my aid the wildness of the scene . At such a time , so dark , so dreary , for human sympathy [my]1481-my very spirit sighed ; but instead thereof , ‘ [[My]1481-my dearest friend]2526-my dearest friend , [[my]1481-my counsellor]2527-my counsellor , [my]1481-my comforter and guide — [My]1481-my joy in grief , [my]1481-my second bliss in joy , ’ came to [my]1481-my side . [She]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression moved like one of [those bright beings pictured in the sunny walks of fancy]2528-those bright beings pictured in the sunny walks of fancy ’s Eden by [the romantic and young]2529-the romantic and young , [a queen of beauty unadorned save by [her]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression own transcendent loveliness]2530-a queen of beauty unadorned save by her own transcendent loveliness . So soft was [her]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression step , it failed to make even a sound , and but for the magical thrill imparted by [her]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression genial touch , as other unobtrusive beauties , [she]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression would have glided away unperceived — unsought . A strange sadness rested upon [her]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression features , like icy tears upon the robe of [December]140-december , as [she]2521-a dark - complexioned , black - eyed , black - haired young lady , who paused an impressive moment , assumed a tragic expression pointed to the contending elements without , and bade [me]1481-my contemplate [the two beings]2531-the two beings presented . This nightmare occupied some ten pages of manuscript and wound up with a sermon so destructive of all hope to [non - Presbyterians]2532-non - presbyterians that it took the first prize . This composition was considered to be the very finest effort of the evening . [The mayor of [the village]206-the village]2533-the mayor of the village , in delivering the prize to [the author of it]2535-the author of it , made a warm speech in which [he]2533-the mayor of the village said that it was by far the most “[1481-my] eloquent ” thing [he]2533-the mayor of the village had ever listened to , and that [Daniel Webster]141-daniel webster [himself]141-daniel webster might well be proud of it . It may be remarked , in passing , that the number of compositions in which the word “[1481-my] beauteous ” was over - fondled , and human experience referred to as “[1481-my] life ’s page , ” was up to the usual average . Now [the master]656-the master , mellow almost to the verge of geniality , put [his]656-the master chair aside , turned [his]656-the master back to [the audience]2537-the audience , and began to draw a map of [America]9-america on the blackboard , to exercise the geography class upon . But [he]656-the master made a sad business of it with [his]656-the master unsteady hand , and a smothered titter rippled over [the house]332-the house . [He]656-the master knew what the matter was , and set [himself]656-the master to right it . [He]656-the master sponged out lines and remade them ; but [he]656-the master only distorted them more than ever , and the tittering was more pronounced . [He]656-the master threw [his]656-the master entire attention upon [his]656-the master work , now , as if determined not to be put down by the mirth . [He]656-the master felt that all eyes were fastened upon [him]656-the master ; [he]656-the master imagined [he]656-the master was succeeding , and yet the tittering continued ; it even manifestly increased . And well it might . There was a garret above , pierced with a scuttle over [his]656-the master head ; and down through this scuttle came a cat , suspended around the haunches by a string ; [she]2539-she had a rag tied about [her]2539-she head and jaws to keep [her]2539-she from mewing ; as [she]2539-she slowly descended [she]2539-she curved upward and clawed at the string , [she]2539-she swung downward and clawed at the intangible air . The tittering rose higher and higher — the cat was within six inches of [the absorbed teacher]2540-the absorbed teacher ’s head — down , down , a little lower , and [she]2539-she grabbed [his]656-the master wig with [her]2539-she desperate claws , clung to it , and was snatched up into the garret in an instant with [her]2539-she trophy still in [her]2539-she possession ! And how the light did blaze abroad from [[the master]656-the master ’s bald pate]2542-the master ’s bald pate — for [the signpainter ’s boy]1427-the signpainter ’s boy had _ gilded _ it ! That broke up the meeting . [The boys]2054-the boys were avenged . [Vacation]142-vacation had come . [ * ] [NOTE:—The]143-note:—the pretended “[1481-my] compositions ” quoted in this chapter are taken without alteration from a volume entitled “[1481-my] Prose and Poetry , by a Western Lady”—but they are exactly and precisely after the schoolgirl pattern , and hence are much happier than any mere imitations could be . CHAPTER XXII [Tom]46-tom joined [the new order of [Cadets of Temperance]2546-cadets of temperance]2545-the new order of cadets of temperance , being attracted by the showy character of [their]2545-the new order of cadets of temperance “[1481-my] regalia . ” [He]46-tom promised to abstain from smoking , chewing , and profanity as long as [he]46-tom remained [a member]2547-a member . Now [he]46-tom found out a new thing — namely , that to promise not to do a thing is the surest way in [the world]328-the world to make [a body]2452-a body want to go and do that very thing . [Tom]46-tom soon found [himself]46-tom tormented with a desire to drink and swear ; the desire grew to be so intense that nothing but the hope of a chance to display [himself]46-tom in [his]46-tom red sash kept [him]46-tom from withdrawing from the order . Fourth of July was coming ; but [he]46-tom soon gave that up — gave it up before [he]46-tom had worn [his]46-tom shackles over forty - eight hours — and fixed [his]46-tom hopes upon [old Judge Frazer]144-old judge frazer , [justice of the peace]2550-justice of the peace , who was apparently on [his]144-old judge frazer deathbed and would have a big public funeral , since [he]144-old judge frazer was so high [an official]2551-an official . During three days [Tom]46-tom was deeply concerned about [the Judge]476-the judge ’s condition and hungry for news of it . Sometimes [his]46-tom hopes ran high — so high that [he]46-tom would venture to get out [his]46-tom regalia and practise before the looking - glass . But [the Judge]476-the judge had a most discouraging way of fluctuating . At last [he]476-the judge was pronounced upon the mend — and then convalescent . [Tom]46-tom was disgusted ; and felt a sense of injury , too . [He]46-tom handed in [his]46-tom resignation at once — and that night [the Judge]476-the judge suffered a relapse and died . [Tom]46-tom resolved that [he]46-tom would never trust [a man like that]2555-a man like that again . The funeral was a fine thing . [The Cadets]2556-the cadets paraded in a style calculated to kill [the late member]2557-the late member with envy . [Tom]46-tom was [a free boy]2558-a free boy again , however — there was something in that . [He]46-tom could drink and swear , now — but found to [his]46-tom surprise that [he]46-tom did not want to . The simple fact that [he]46-tom could , took the desire away , and the charm of it . [Tom]46-tom presently wondered to find that [his]46-tom coveted vacation was beginning to hang a little heavily on [his]46-tom hands . [He]46-tom attempted a diary — but nothing happened during three days , and so [he]46-tom abandoned it . [The first of all the negro minstrel shows]2559-the first of all the negro minstrel shows came to [town]526-town , and made a sensation . [Tom]46-tom and [Joe Harper]62-joe got up [a band of [performers]2562-performers]2561-a band of performers and were happy for two days . Even the Glorious Fourth was in some sense a failure , for it rained hard , there was no procession in consequence , and [the greatest man in [the world]328-the world]2563-the greatest man in the world ( as [Tom]46-tom supposed ) , [Mr. Benton]145-mr. benton , [an actual United States Senator]2565-an actual united states senator , proved an overwhelming disappointment — for [he]145-mr. benton was not twenty - five feet high , nor even anywhere in [the neighborhood of]2566-the neighborhood of [it]2567-it . [A circus]2199-a circus came . [The boys]2054-the boys played circus for three days afterward in tents made of rag carpeting — admission , three pins for [boys]183-boys , two for [girls]184-girls — and then circusing was abandoned . [A phrenologist]2572-a phrenologist and [a mesmerizer]2573-a mesmerizer came — and went again and left [the village]206-the village duller and drearier than ever . There were [some boys - and - girls]2575-some boys - and - girls ’ parties , but [they]2575-some boys - and - girls were so few and so delightful that they only made the aching voids between ache the harder . [Becky Thatcher]86-becky was gone to [[her]86-becky Constantinople home]2576-her constantinople home to stay with [[her]86-becky parents]2577-her parents during vacation — so there was no bright side to life anywhere . The dreadful secret of the murder was a chronic misery . It was a very cancer for permanency and pain . Then came the measles . During two long weeks [Tom]46-tom lay [a prisoner]2578-a prisoner , dead to [the world]328-the world and its happenings . [He]46-tom was very ill , [he]46-tom was interested in nothing . When [he]46-tom got upon [his]46-tom feet at last and moved feebly [downtown]2580-downtown , a melancholy change had come over everything and every creature . There had been a “[1481-my] revival , ” and [everybody]490-everybody had “[1481-my] got religion , ” not only [the adults]2582-the adults , but even [the boys]2054-the boys and [girls]184-girls . [Tom]46-tom went about , hoping against hope for the sight of one blessed sinful face , but disappointment crossed [him]46-tom everywhere . [He]46-tom found [Joe Harper]62-joe studying a Testament , and turned sadly away from the depressing spectacle . [He]46-tom sought [Ben Rogers]57-ben , and found [him]57-ben visiting [the poor]2097-the poor with a basket of tracts . [He]46-tom hunted up [Jim Hollis]50-jim , who called [his]46-tom attention to the precious blessing of [his]46-tom late measles as a warning . [Every boy [he]46-tom encountered]2586-every boy he encountered added another ton to [his]46-tom depression ; and when , in desperation , [he]46-tom flew for refuge at last to the bosom of [Huckleberry Finn]45-huck and was received with a Scriptural quotation , [his]46-tom heart broke and [he]46-tom crept [home]197-home and to bed realizing that [he]46-tom alone of all [the town]519-the town was lost , forever and forever . And that night there came on a terrific storm , with driving rain , awful claps of thunder and blinding sheets of lightning . [He]46-tom covered [his]46-tom head with the bedclothes and waited in a horror of suspense for [his]46-tom doom ; for [he]46-tom had not the shadow of a doubt that all this hubbub was about [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom believed [he]46-tom had taxed the forbearance of the powers above to the extremity of endurance and that this was the result . It might have seemed to [him]46-tom a waste of pomp and ammunition to kill a bug with a battery of artillery , but there seemed nothing incongruous about the getting up such an expensive thunderstorm as this to knock the turf from under [an insect like [himself]46-tom]2589-an insect like himself . By and by the tempest spent itself and died without accomplishing its object . [The boy]2044-the boy ’s first impulse was to be grateful , and reform . [His]2044-the boy second was to wait — for there might not be any more storms . The next day [the doctors]2591-the doctors were back ; [Tom]46-tom had relapsed . The three weeks [he]46-tom spent on [his]46-tom back this time seemed an entire age . When [he]46-tom got abroad at last [he]46-tom was hardly grateful that [he]46-tom had been spared , remembering how lonely was [[his]46-tom estate]2592-his estate , how companionless and forlorn [he]46-tom was . [He]46-tom drifted listlessly down [the street]215-the street and found [Jim Hollis]50-jim acting as judge in [a juvenile court]2594-a juvenile court that was trying a cat for murder , in the presence of [[her]2594-a juvenile court victim]2595-her victim , a bird . [He]46-tom found [Joe Harper]62-joe and [Huck Finn]45-huck up [an alley]2596-an alley eating a stolen melon . [Poor lads]2597-poor lads ! [they]2597-poor lads — like [Tom]46-tom — had suffered a relapse . CHAPTER XXIII At last the sleepy atmosphere was stirred — and vigorously : the murder trial came on in [the court]2598-the court . It became the absorbing topic of village talk immediately . [Tom]46-tom could not get away from it . Every reference to the murder sent a shudder to [his]46-tom heart , for [his]46-tom troubled conscience and fears almost persuaded [him]46-tom that these remarks were put forth in [his]46-tom hearing as [“[1481-my] feelers ”]2599-“ feelers ” ; [he]46-tom did not see how [he]46-tom could be suspected of knowing anything about the murder , but still [he]46-tom could not be comfortable in the midst of this gossip . It kept [him]46-tom in a cold shiver all the time . [He]46-tom took [Huck]45-huck to [a lonely place]2600-a lonely place to have a talk with [him]45-huck . It would be some relief to unseal [his]46-tom tongue for a little while ; to divide [his]46-tom burden of distress with [another sufferer]2601-another sufferer . Moreover , [he]46-tom wanted to assure [himself]46-tom that [Huck]45-huck had remained discreet . “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck , have [you]45-huck ever told [anybody]203-anybody about — that ? ” “[45-huck] ’ Bout what ? ” “[45-huck] [You]45-huck know what . ” “[45-huck] Oh—’course [I]0-i have n’t . ” “[0-i] Never a word ? ” “[0-i] Never a solitary word , so help [me]0-i . What makes [you]45-huck ask ? ” “[45-huck] Well , [I]0-i was afeard . ” “[0-i] Why , [Tom Sawyer]46-tom , [we]1483-we would n’t be alive two days if that got found out . _ [You]46-tom _ know that . ” [Tom]46-tom felt more comfortable . After a pause : “[46-tom] [Huck]45-huck , [they]1484-they could n’t [anybody]203-anybody get [you]45-huck to tell , could [they]1484-they ? ” “[1484-they] Get [me]0-i to tell ? Why , if [I]0-i wanted [that halfbreed devil]1486-that halfbreed devil to drownd [me]0-i [they]1484-they could get [me]0-i to tell . [They]1484-they ai n’t no different way . ” “[1484-they] Well , that ’s all right , then . [I]0-i reckon [we]1483-we ’re safe as long as [we]1483-we keep [mum]2273-mum . But let ’s swear again , anyway . [It]1488-it ’s more surer . ” “[1488-it] [I]0-i ’m agreed . ” So [they]1483-we swore again with dread solemnities . “[1488-it] What is the talk around , [Huck]45-huck ? [I]0-i ’ve heard a power of it . ” “[45-huck] Talk ? Well , it ’s just [Muff Potter]96-potter , [Muff Potter]96-potter , [Muff Potter]96-potter all the time . It keeps [me]0-i in a sweat , constant , so ’s [I]0-i want to hide [som’ers]1489-som’ers . ” “[1484-they] That ’s just the same way [they]1484-they go on round [me]0-i . [I]0-i reckon [he]45-huck ’s [a goner]2296-a goner . Do n’t [you]0-i feel sorry for [him]45-huck , sometimes ? ” “[0-i] Most always — most always . [He]45-huck ai n’t no account ; but then [he]45-huck hain’t ever done anything to hurt [anybody]203-anybody . Just fishes a little , to get money to get drunk on — and loafs around considerable ; but [lord]1492-lord , [we]1493-we all do that — leastways most of [us]1493-we — [preachers]1494-preachers and such like . But [he]45-huck ’s kind of good — [he]45-huck give [me]0-i half a fish , once , when there warn’t enough for two ; and lots of times [he]45-huck ’s kind of stood by [me]0-i when [I]0-i was out of luck . ” “[45-huck] Well , [he]45-huck ’s mended kites for [me]0-i , [Huck]45-huck , and knitted hooks on to [my]0-i line . [I]0-i wish [we]1493-we could get [him]45-huck out of there . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i ! [we]1493-we could n’t get [him]45-huck out , [Tom]46-tom . And besides , ’ twouldn’t do any good ; [they]1495-they ’d ketch [him]45-huck again . ” “[1495-they] Yes — so [they]1495-they would . But [I]0-i hate to hear [’em]1496-’em abuse [him]45-huck so like the dickens when [he]45-huck never done — that . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do too , [Tom]46-tom . [Lord]1497-lord , [I]0-i hear [’em]1496-’em say [he]45-huck ’s [the bloodiest looking villain in [this country]1499-this country]1498-the bloodiest looking villain in this country , and [they]1495-they wonder [he]45-huck was n’t ever hung before . ” “[1496-’em] Yes , [they]1495-they talk like that , all the time . [I]0-i ’ve heard [’em]1496-’em say that if [he]45-huck was to get free [they]1495-they ’d lynch [him]45-huck . ” “[1495-they] And [they]1495-they ’d do it , too . ” [The boys]2054-the boys had a long talk , but it brought [them]2054-the boys little comfort . As the twilight drew on , [they]2054-the boys found [themselves]2054-the boys hanging about [the neighborhood of [the little isolated jail]2604-the little isolated jail]2603-the neighborhood of the little isolated jail , perhaps with an undefined hope that something would happen that might clear away [their]2054-the boys difficulties . But nothing happened ; there seemed to be [no angels]2605-no angels or fairies interested in [this luckless captive]2606-this luckless captive . [The boys]2054-the boys did as [they]2054-the boys had often done before — went to [the cell grating]2608-the cell grating and gave [Potter]96-potter some tobacco and matches . [He]96-potter was on the ground floor and there were [no guards]921-no guards . [His]96-potter gratitude for [their]2054-the boys gifts had always smote [their]2054-the boys consciences before — it cut deeper than ever , this time . [They]2054-the boys felt cowardly and treacherous to the last degree when [Potter]96-potter said : “[1495-they] [You]1500-you ’ve been mighty good to [me]0-i , [boys]183-boys — better’n anybody else in [this town]2162-this town . And [I]0-i do n’t forget it , [I]0-i do n’t . Often [I]0-i says to [myself]0-i , says [I]0-i , ‘ [I]0-i used to mend all [the boys]2054-the boys ’ kites and things , and show [’em]1504-’em where [the good fishin ’ places]1505-the good fishin ’ places was , and befriend [’em]1504-’em what [I]0-i could , and now [they]2054-the boys ’ve all forgot [old Muff]96-potter when [he]96-potter ’s in trouble ; but [Tom]46-tom do n’t , and [Huck]45-huck don’t—_they _ do n’t forget [him]96-potter , ’ says [I]0-i , ‘ and [I]0-i do n’t forget [them]2054-the boys . ’ Well , [boys]183-boys , [I]0-i done an awful thing — drunk and crazy at the time — that ’s the only way [I]0-i account for it — and now [I]0-i got to swing for it , and it ’s right . Right , and _ best _ , too , [I]0-i reckon — hope so , anyway . Well , [we]1507-we wo n’t talk about that . [I]0-i do n’t want to make _ [you]183-boys _ feel bad ; [you]183-boys ’ve befriended [me]0-i . But what [I]0-i want to say , is , do n’t _ [you]183-boys _ ever get drunk — then [you]183-boys wo n’t ever get [here]551-here . Stand a litter furder west — so — that ’s it ; it ’s a prime comfort to see [faces that ’s friendly when a body ’s in such a muck of trouble]1509-faces that ’s friendly when a body ’s in such a muck of trouble , and there do n’t [none]1089-none come here but [yourn]1511-yourn . [Good friendly faces — good friendly faces]1512-good friendly faces — good friendly faces . Git up on [one another]2278-one another ’s backs and let [me]0-i touch ’em . That ’s it . [Shake hands]1514-shake hands — [yourn’ll]1515-yourn’ll come through the bars , but mine ’s too big . Little hands , and weak — but [they]1516-they ’ve helped [Muff Potter]96-potter a power , and [they]1516-they ’d help [him]96-potter more if [they]1516-they could . ” [Tom]46-tom went [home]197-home miserable , and [his]46-tom dreams that night were full of horrors . The next day and the day after , [he]46-tom hung about [the courtroom]2611-the courtroom , drawn by an almost irresistible impulse to go in , but forcing [himself]46-tom to stay out . [Huck]45-huck was having the same experience . [They]2612-they studiously avoided [each other]227-each other . [Each]231-each wandered away , from time to time , but the same dismal fascination always brought [them]2612-they back presently . [Tom]46-tom kept [his]46-tom ears open when [idlers]2615-idlers sauntered out of [the courtroom]2611-the courtroom , but invariably heard distressing news — the toils were closing more and more relentlessly around [poor Potter]96-potter . At the end of the second day the village talk was to the effect that [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s evidence stood firm and unshaken , and that there was not the slightest question as to what [the jury]2617-the jury ’s verdict would be . [Tom]46-tom was out late , that night , and came to bed through the window . [He]46-tom was in a tremendous state of excitement . It was hours before [he]46-tom got to sleep . All [the village]206-the village flocked to [the courthouse]2619-the courthouse the next morning , for this was to be the great day . [Both sexes]2620-both sexes were about equally represented in the packed audience . After a long wait [the jury]2617-the jury filed in and took [their]2617-the jury places ; shortly afterward , [Potter]96-potter , pale and haggard , timid and hopeless , was brought in , with chains upon [him]96-potter , and seated where all the curious eyes could stare at [him]96-potter ; no less conspicuous was [Injun Joe]100-injun joe , stolid as ever . There was another pause , and then [the judge]476-the judge arrived and [the sheriff]880-the sheriff proclaimed the opening of [the court]2598-the court . The usual whisperings among [the lawyers]2625-the lawyers and gathering together of papers followed . These details and accompanying delays worked up an atmosphere of preparation that was as impressive as it was fascinating . Now [a witness]915-a witness was called who testified that [he]915-a witness found [Muff Potter]96-potter washing in [the brook]2627-the brook , at an early hour of the morning that the murder was discovered , and that [he]1272-the witness immediately sneaked away . After some further questioning , [[counsel]2628-counsel for [the prosecution]2630-the prosecution]2629-counsel for the prosecution said : “[1272-the witness] Take [the witness]1272-the witness . ” [The prisoner]703-the prisoner raised [his]703-the prisoner eyes for a moment , but dropped them again when [[his]703-the prisoner own counsel]2632-his own counsel said : “[1272-the witness] [I]0-i have no questions to ask [him]1272-the witness . ” [The next witness]2633-the next witness proved the finding of the knife near the corpse . [[Counsel]2628-counsel for [the prosecution]2630-the prosecution]2629-counsel for the prosecution said : “[1272-the witness] Take [the witness]1272-the witness . ” “[1272-the witness] [I]0-i have no questions to ask [him]1272-the witness , ” [[Potter]96-potter ’s lawyer]2637-potter ’s lawyer replied . [A third witness]2638-a third witness swore [he]2638-a third witness had often seen the knife in [Potter]96-potter ’s possession . “[0-i] Take [the witness]1272-the witness . ” [Counsel for [Potter]96-potter]2639-counsel for potter declined to question [him]2638-a third witness . The faces of [the audience]2537-the audience began to betray annoyance . Did [this attorney]2641-this attorney mean to throw away [[his]2641-this attorney client]2642-his client ’s life without an effort ? [Several witnesses]2643-several witnesses deposed concerning [Potter]96-potter ’s guilty behavior when brought to the scene of the murder . [They]2643-several witnesses were allowed to leave the stand without being cross - questioned . Every detail of the damaging circumstances that occurred in [the graveyard]786-the graveyard upon that morning which [all present]2645-all present remembered so well was brought out by [credible witnesses]2646-credible witnesses , but [none of [them]2646-credible witnesses]2647-none of them were cross - examined by [[Potter]96-potter ’s lawyer]2637-potter ’s lawyer . The perplexity and dissatisfaction of [the house]332-the house expressed itself in murmurs and provoked a reproof from the bench . [Counsel for [the prosecution]2630-the prosecution]2629-counsel for the prosecution now said : “[1272-the witness] By the oaths of [citizens whose simple word is above suspicion]1520-citizens whose simple word is above suspicion , [we]1521-we have fastened this awful crime , beyond all possibility of question , upon [the unhappy prisoner at the bar]1522-the unhappy prisoner at the bar . [We]1521-we rest [our]1521-we case here . ” A groan escaped from [poor Potter]96-potter , and [he]96-potter put [his]96-potter face in [his]96-potter hands and rocked [his]96-potter body softly to and fro , while a painful silence reigned in [the courtroom]2611-the courtroom . [Many men]2653-many men were moved , and [many women]2654-many women ’s compassion testified itself in tears . [Counsel for the defence]2655-counsel for the defence rose and said : “[1523-your] [Your]1523-your honor , in [our]1521-we remarks at the opening of this trial , [we]1521-we foreshadowed [our]1521-we purpose to prove that [[our]1521-we client]1524-our client did this fearful deed while under the influence of a blind and irresponsible delirium produced by drink . [We]1521-we have changed [our]1521-we mind . [We]1521-we shall not offer that plea . ” [ Then to [the clerk]2656-the clerk :] “[1521-we] Call [Thomas Sawyer]46-tom ! ” A puzzled amazement awoke in every face in [the house]332-the house , not even excepting [Potter]96-potter ’s . Every eye fastened itself with wondering interest upon [Tom]46-tom as [he]46-tom rose and took [his]46-tom place upon the stand . [The boy]2044-the boy looked wild enough , for [he]2044-the boy was badly scared . The oath was administered . “[46-tom] [Thomas Sawyer]46-tom , where were [you]46-tom on the seventeenth of June , about the hour of midnight ? ” [Tom]46-tom glanced at [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s iron face and [his]46-tom tongue failed [him]46-tom . [The audience]2537-the audience listened breathless , but the words refused to come . After a few moments , however , [the boy]2044-the boy got a little of [his]2044-the boy strength back , and managed to put enough of it into [his]2044-the boy voice to make part of [the house]332-the house hear : “[1521-we] In [the graveyard]786-the graveyard ! ” “[1521-we] A little bit louder , please . Do n’t be afraid . [You]46-tom were — ” “[46-tom] In [the graveyard]786-the graveyard . ” A contemptuous smile flitted across [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s face . “[46-tom] Were [you]46-tom anywhere near [[Horse Williams]146-horse williams ’ grave]1527-horse williams ’ grave ? ” “[2078-sir] Yes , [sir]2078-sir . ” “[2078-sir] Speak up — just a trifle louder . How near were [you]46-tom ? ” “[46-tom] Near as [I]0-i am to [you]46-tom . ” “[0-i] Were [you]46-tom hidden , or not ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was hid . ” “[0-i] Where ? ” “[0-i] Behind the elms that ’s on the edge of [the grave]794-the grave . ” [Injun Joe]100-injun joe gave a barely perceptible start . “[0-i] Any one with [you]46-tom ? ” “[2078-sir] Yes , [sir]2078-sir . [I]0-i went [there]2038-there with — ” “[0-i] Wait — wait a moment . Never mind mentioning [[your]46-tom companion]1532-your companion ’s name . [We]1533-we will produce [him]1532-your companion at the proper time . Did [you]46-tom carry anything there with [you]46-tom . ” [Tom]46-tom hesitated and looked confused . “[46-tom] Speak out , [[my]0-i boy]1534-my boy — don’t be diffident . The truth is always respectable . What did [you]46-tom take [there]2038-there ? ” “[46-tom] Only a — a — dead cat . ” There was a ripple of mirth , which [the court]2598-the court checked . “[1533-we] [We]1533-we will produce the skeleton of that cat . Now , [[my]0-i boy]1534-my boy , tell [us]1533-we everything that occurred — tell it in [your]1534-my boy own way — don’t skip anything , and do n’t be afraid . ” [Tom]46-tom began — hesitatingly at first , but as [he]46-tom warmed to [his]46-tom subject [his]46-tom words flowed more and more easily ; in a little while every sound ceased but [his]46-tom own voice ; every eye fixed itself upon [him]46-tom ; with parted lips and bated breath [the audience]2537-the audience hung upon [his]46-tom words , taking no note of time , rapt in the ghastly fascinations of the tale . The strain upon pent emotion reached its climax when [the boy]2044-the boy said : “[614-the doctor] — and as [the doctor]614-the doctor fetched the board around and [Muff Potter]96-potter fell , [Injun Joe]100-injun joe jumped with the knife and — ” Crash ! Quick as lightning the halfbreed sprang for a window , tore [his]46-tom way through [all opposers]2665-all opposers , and was gone ! CHAPTER XXIV [Tom]46-tom was [a glittering hero]2666-a glittering hero once more — [the pet of the old]2667-the pet of the old , the envy of [the young]2668-the young . [His]46-tom name even went into immortal print , for the village paper magnified [him]46-tom . There were some that believed [he]46-tom would be [President]2669-president , yet , if [he]46-tom escaped hanging . As usual , [the fickle , unreasoning world]2670-the fickle , unreasoning world took [Muff Potter]96-potter to [its]2670-the fickle , unreasoning world bosom and fondled [him]96-potter as lavishly as it had abused [him]96-potter before . But that sort of conduct is to [the world]328-the world ’s credit ; therefore it is not well to find fault with it . [Tom]46-tom ’s days were days of splendor and exultation to [him]46-tom , but [his]46-tom nights were seasons of horror . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe infested all [his]46-tom dreams , and always with doom in [his]100-injun joe eye . Hardly any temptation could persuade [the boy]2044-the boy to stir abroad after nightfall . [Poor Huck]45-huck was in the same state of wretchedness and terror , for [Tom]46-tom had told the whole story to [the lawyer]2673-the lawyer the night before the great day of the trial , and [Huck]45-huck was sore afraid that [his]45-huck share in the business might leak out , yet , notwithstanding [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s flight had saved [him]45-huck the suffering of testifying in [court]612-court . [The poor fellow]487-the poor fellow had got [the attorney]2676-the attorney to promise secrecy , but what of that ? Since [Tom]46-tom ’s harassed conscience had managed to drive [him]46-tom to [[the lawyer]2673-the lawyer ’s house]2678-the lawyer ’s house by night and wring a dread tale from lips that had been sealed with the dismalest and most formidable of oaths , [Huck]45-huck ’s confidence in [the human race]2679-the human race was wellnigh obliterated . [Daily Muff Potter]96-potter ’s gratitude made [Tom]46-tom glad [he]46-tom had spoken ; but nightly [he]46-tom wished [he]46-tom had sealed up [his]46-tom tongue . Half the time [Tom]46-tom was afraid [Injun Joe]100-injun joe would never be captured ; the other half [he]46-tom was afraid [he]46-tom would be . [He]46-tom felt sure [he]46-tom never could draw a safe breath again until [that man]2680-that man was dead and [he]46-tom had seen the corpse . Rewards had been offered , [the country]351-the country had been scoured , but [no Injun Joe]2682-no injun joe was found . [One of those omniscient and awe - inspiring marvels]2683-one of those omniscient and awe - inspiring marvels , [a detective]2684-a detective , came up from [St. Louis]32-st. louis , moused around , shook [his]2684-a detective head , looked wise , and made that sort of astounding success which [members of that craft]2685-members of that craft usually achieve . That is to say , [he]2684-a detective “[100-injun joe] found a clew . ” But [you]2686-you ca n’t hang a “[100-injun joe] clew ” for murder , and so after [that detective]2687-that detective had got through and gone [home]197-home , [Tom]46-tom felt just as insecure as [he]46-tom was before . The slow days drifted on , and each left behind it a slightly lightened weight of apprehension . CHAPTER XXV There comes a time in [every rightly - constructed boy]2689-every rightly - constructed boy ’s life when [he]2689-every rightly - constructed boy has a raging desire to go somewhere and dig for hidden treasure . This desire suddenly came upon [Tom]46-tom one day . [He]46-tom sallied out to find [Joe Harper]62-joe , but failed of success . Next [he]46-tom sought [Ben Rogers]57-ben ; [he]57-ben had gone fishing . Presently [he]46-tom stumbled upon [Huck Finn the Red - Handed]45-huck . [Huck]45-huck would answer . [Tom]46-tom took [him]45-huck to [a private place]2690-a private place and opened the matter to [him]45-huck confidentially . [Huck]45-huck was willing . [Huck]45-huck was always willing to take a hand in any enterprise that offered entertainment and required no capital , for [he]45-huck had a troublesome superabundance of that sort of time which is not money . “[614-the doctor] Where ’ll [we]1538-we dig ? ” said [Huck]45-huck . “[614-the doctor] Oh , most anywhere . ” “[614-the doctor] Why , is it hid all around ? ” “[614-the doctor] No , indeed it ai n’t . It ’s hid in mighty particular places , [Huck]45-huck — sometimes on [islands]1539-islands , sometimes in rotten chests under the end of a limb of an old dead tree , just where the shadow falls at midnight ; but mostly under the floor in [ha’nted houses]1540-ha’nted houses . ” “[1542-robbers] Who hides [it]1541-it ? ” “[1542-robbers] Why , [robbers]1542-robbers , of course — who’d [you]45-huck reckon ? Sunday - school sup’rintendents ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know . If ’ twas [mine]0-i [I]0-i would n’t hide it ; [I]0-i ’d spend it and have a good time . ” “[0-i] So would [I.]0-i But [robbers]1542-robbers do n’t do that way . [They]1542-robbers always hide it and leave it there . ” “[1542-robbers] Do n’t [they]1542-robbers come after it any more ? ” “[1542-robbers] No , [they]1542-robbers think [they]1542-robbers will , but [they]1542-robbers generally forget the marks , or else [they]1542-robbers die . Anyway , it lays there a long time and gets rusty ; and by and by [somebody]262-somebody finds an old yellow paper that tells how to find the marks — a paper that ’s got to be ciphered over about a week because it ’s mostly signs and hy’roglyphics . ” “[262-somebody] Hyro — which ? ” “[262-somebody] Hy’roglyphics — pictures and things , [you]45-huck know , that do n’t seem to mean anything . ” “[262-somebody] Have [you]45-huck got one of them papers , [Tom]46-tom ? ” “[45-huck] No . ” “[45-huck] Well then , how [you]45-huck going to find the marks ? ” “[45-huck] [I]0-i do n’t want any marks . [They]1542-robbers always bury it under [a ha’nted house]1545-a ha’nted house or on [an island]1546-an island , or under a dead tree that ’s got one limb sticking out . Well , [we]1547-we ’ve tried [[Jackson]113-jackson ’s Island]1031-jackson ’s island a little , and [we]1547-we can try it again some time ; and there ’s [the old ha’nted house up [the Still - House branch]1550-the still - house branch]1549-the old ha’nted house up the still - house branch , and there ’s lots of dead - limb trees — dead loads of ’em . ” “[45-huck] Is it under all of them ? ” “[45-huck] How [you]45-huck talk ! No ! ” “[45-huck] Then how [you]45-huck going to know which one to go for ? ” “[45-huck] Go for all of ’em ! ” “[45-huck] Why , [Tom]46-tom , it ’ll take all summer . ” “[46-tom] Well , what of that ? Suppose [you]45-huck find a brass pot with a hundred dollars in it , all rusty and gray , or rotten chest full of di’monds . How ’s that ? ” [Huck]45-huck ’s eyes glowed . “[1551-that ’s bully] [That ’s bully]1551-that ’s bully . Plenty bully enough for [me]0-i . Just [you]45-huck gimme the hundred dollars and [I]0-i do n’t want [no di’monds]1552-no di’monds . ” “[0-i] All right . But [I]0-i bet [you]45-huck [I]0-i ai n’t going to throw off on [di’monds]1553-di’monds .
