[I]0-i ’ve got to settle with [him]46-tom . ” [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher shook [her]159-mrs. thatcher head feebly and turned paler than ever . “[46-tom] [He]46-tom did n’t stay with [us]1821-us , ” said [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper , beginning to look uneasy . A marked anxiety came into [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s face . “[46-tom] [Joe Harper]62-joe , have [you]62-joe seen [[my]0-i [Tom]46-tom]2379-my tom this morning ? ” “[62-joe] No’m . ” “[62-joe] When did [you]62-joe see [him]46-tom last ? ” [Joe]62-joe tried to remember , but was not sure [he]62-joe could say . [The people]502-the people had stopped moving out of [church]533-church . [Whispers]163-whispers passed along , and a boding uneasiness took possession of every countenance . [Children]182-children were anxiously questioned , and [young teachers]2996-young teachers . [They]2996-young teachers all said [they]2996-young teachers had not noticed whether [Tom]46-tom and [Becky]86-becky were on board [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat on the homeward trip ; it was dark ; [no one]2998-no one thought of inquiring if [any one]2780-any one was missing . [One young man]3000-one young man finally blurted out [his]3000-one young man fear that [they]3001-they were still in [the cave]1723-the cave ! [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher swooned away . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly fell to crying and wringing [her]47-aunt polly hands . The alarm swept from lip to lip , from [group]868-group to [group]868-group , from [street]3005-street to [street]3005-street , and within five minutes the bells were wildly clanging and [the whole town]1114-the whole town was up ! The Cardiff Hill episode sank into instant insignificance , [the burglars]3008-the burglars were forgotten , horses were saddled , skiffs were manned , [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat ordered out , and before the horror was half an hour old , [two hundred men]3010-two hundred men were pouring down highroad and [river]3011-river toward [the cave]1723-the cave . All the long afternoon [the village]206-the village seemed empty and dead . [Many women]2654-many women visited [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly and [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher and tried to comfort [them]2654-many women . [They]2654-many women cried with [them]2654-many women , too , and that was still better than words . All the tedious night [the town]519-the town waited for news ; but when the morning dawned at last , all the word that came was , “[62-joe] Send more candles — and send food . ” [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher was almost crazed ; and [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , also . [Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher sent messages of hope and encouragement from [the cave]1723-the cave , but they conveyed no real cheer . [The old Welshman]2910-the old welshman came [home]197-home toward daylight , spattered with candle - grease , smeared with clay , and almost worn out . [He]2910-the old welshman found [Huck]45-huck still in the bed that had been provided for [him]2910-the old welshman , and delirious with fever . [The physicians]3019-the physicians were all at [the cave]1723-the cave , so [the Widow]1578-the widow [Douglas]71-the widow douglas came and took charge of [the patient]3022-the patient . [She]1578-the widow said [she]1578-the widow would do [her]1578-the widow best by [him]45-huck , because , whether [he]45-huck was good , bad , or indifferent , [he]45-huck was [the Lord]2047-the lord ’s , and nothing that was [the Lord]2047-the lord ’s was a thing to be neglected . [The Welshman]2928-the welshman said [Huck]45-huck had good spots in [him]45-huck , and [the widow]1578-the widow said : “[62-joe] [You]1823-you can depend on it . That ’s [the Lord]2047-the lord ’s mark . [He]2047-the lord do n’t leave it off . [He]2047-the lord never does . Puts it somewhere on every creature that comes from [his]2047-the lord hands . ” Early in the forenoon [parties of [jaded men]3028-jaded men]3027-parties of jaded men began to straggle into [the village]206-the village , but [the strongest of [the citizens]3031-the citizens]3030-the strongest of the citizens continued searching . All the news that could be gained was that remotenesses of [the cavern]3032-the cavern were being ransacked that had never been visited before ; that every corner and crevice was going to be thoroughly searched ; that wherever [one]934-one wandered through [the maze of passages]3034-the maze of passages , lights were to be seen flitting hither and thither in the distance , and shoutings and pistol - shots sent their hollow reverberations to the ear down [the sombre aisles]3035-the sombre aisles . In one place , far from [the section usually traversed by [tourists]3037-tourists]3036-the section usually traversed by tourists , the names “[86-becky] [BECKY]86-becky & amp ; [TOM]46-tom ” had been found traced upon the rocky wall with candle - smoke , and near at hand a grease - soiled bit of ribbon . [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher recognized the ribbon and cried over it . [She]159-mrs. thatcher said it was the last relic [she]159-mrs. thatcher should ever have of [[her]159-mrs. thatcher child]3038-her child ; and that no other memorial of [her]159-mrs. thatcher could ever be so precious , because this one parted latest from [the living body]3039-the living body before the awful death came . [Some]1572-some said that now and then , in [the cave]1723-the cave , a far - away speck of light would glimmer , and then a glorious shout would burst forth and a score of [men]185-men go trooping down [the echoing aisle]3043-the echoing aisle — and then a sickening disappointment always followed ; [the children]383-the children were not there ; it was only [a searcher]3045-a searcher ’s light . Three dreadful days and nights dragged [their]383-the children tedious hours along , and [the village]206-the village sank into a hopeless stupor . [No one]2998-no one had heart for anything . The accidental discovery , just made , that [the proprietor of [the Temperance Tavern]1783-the temperance tavern]3048-the proprietor of the temperance tavern kept liquor on [[his]3048-the proprietor of the temperance tavern premises]489-his premises , scarcely fluttered the public pulse , tremendous as the fact was . In a lucid interval , [Huck]45-huck feebly led up to the subject of [taverns]3051-taverns , and finally asked — dimly dreading the worst — if anything had been discovered at [the Temperance Tavern]1783-the temperance tavern since [he]45-huck had been ill . “[86-becky] Yes , ” said [the widow]1578-the widow . [Huck]45-huck started up in bed , wild - eyed : “[86-becky] What ? What was it ? ” “[2139-child] Liquor!—and [the place]791-the place has been shut up . Lie down , [child]2139-child — what a turn [you]1827-you did give [me]0-i ! ” “[1827-you] Only tell [me]0-i just one thing — only just one — please ! Was it [Tom Sawyer]46-tom that found it ? ” [The widow]1578-the widow burst into tears . “[46-tom] Hush , hush , [child]2139-child , hush ! [I]0-i ’ve told [you]2139-child before , [you]2139-child must _ not _ talk . [You]2139-child are very , very sick ! ” Then nothing but liquor had been found ; there would have been a great powwow if it had been the gold . So the treasure was gone forever — gone forever ! But what could [she]1578-the widow be crying about ? Curious that [she]1578-the widow should cry . These thoughts worked their dim way through [Huck]45-huck ’s mind , and under the weariness [they]3055-they gave [him]45-huck [he]45-huck fell asleep . [The widow]1578-the widow said to [herself]1578-the widow : “[46-tom] There — [he]46-tom ’s asleep , poor wreck . [Tom Sawyer]46-tom find it ! Pity but [somebody]262-somebody could find [Tom Sawyer]46-tom ! Ah , there ai n’t many left , now , that ’s got hope enough , or strength enough , either , to go on searching . ” CHAPTER XXXI Now to return to [Tom]46-tom and [Becky]86-becky ’s share in the picnic . [They]3055-they tripped along [the murky aisles]3057-the murky aisles with [the rest of [the company]3059-the company]3058-the rest of the company , visiting the familiar wonders of [the cave]1723-the cave — wonders dubbed with rather over - descriptive names , such as “[86-becky] [The Drawing - Room]1830-the drawing - room , ” “[86-becky] [The Cathedral]38-the cathedral , ” “[86-becky] [Aladdin ’s Palace]39-aladdin ’s palace , ” and so on . Presently the hide - and - seek frolicking began , and [Tom]46-tom and [Becky]86-becky engaged in it with zeal until the exertion began to grow a trifle wearisome ; then [they]3055-they wandered down [a sinuous avenue]3061-a sinuous avenue holding [their]3055-they candles aloft and reading the tangled webwork of names , dates , postoffice addresses , and mottoes with which the rocky walls had been frescoed ( in candle - smoke ) . Still drifting along and talking , [they]3055-they scarcely noticed that [they]3055-they were now in a part of [the cave]1723-the cave whose walls were not frescoed . [They]3055-they smoked [their]3055-they own names under an overhanging shelf and moved on . Presently [they]3055-they came to a place where [a little stream of water]3063-a little stream of water , trickling over a ledge and carrying a limestone sediment with it , had , in the slow - dragging ages , formed a laced and ruffled Niagara in gleaming and imperishable stone . [Tom]46-tom squeezed [his]46-tom small body behind it in order to illuminate it for [Becky]86-becky ’s gratification . [He]46-tom found that [it]1723-the cave curtained a sort of steep natural stairway which was enclosed between narrow walls , and at once the ambition to be [a discoverer]3064-a discoverer seized [him]46-tom . [Becky]86-becky responded to [his]46-tom call , and [they]3055-they made a smoke - mark for future guidance , and started upon [their]3055-they quest . [They]3055-they wound this way and that , far down into [the secret depths of [the cave]1723-the cave]3065-the secret depths of the cave , made another mark , and branched off in search of novelties to tell [the upper world]3067-the upper world about . In [one place]3068-one place [they]3055-they found [a spacious cavern]3069-a spacious cavern , from whose ceiling depended a multitude of shining stalactites of the length and circumference of [a man]208-a man ’s leg ; [they]3055-they walked all about [it]3069-a spacious cavern , wondering and admiring , and presently left [it]3069-a spacious cavern by one of the numerous passages that opened into [it]3069-a spacious cavern . This shortly brought [them]3055-they to a bewitching spring , whose basin was incrusted with a frostwork of glittering crystals ; it was in the midst of [a cavern whose walls were supported by many fantastic pillars which had been formed by the joining of great stalactites and stalagmites together , the result of the ceaseless water - drip of centuries]3071-a cavern whose walls were supported by many fantastic pillars which had been formed by the joining of great stalactites and stalagmites together , the result of the ceaseless water - drip of centuries . Under the roof vast knots of bats had packed themselves together , thousands in a bunch ; the lights disturbed the creatures and [they]3055-they came flocking down by [hundreds]3072-hundreds , squeaking and darting furiously at the candles . [Tom]46-tom knew [their]3055-they ways and the danger of this sort of conduct . [He]46-tom seized [Becky]86-becky ’s hand and hurried [her]86-becky into [the first corridor that offered]3073-the first corridor that offered ; and none too soon , for a bat struck [Becky]86-becky ’s light out with its wing while [she]86-becky was passing out of [the cavern]3032-the cavern . The bats chased [the children]383-the children a good distance ; but [the fugitives]3076-the fugitives plunged into [every new passage that offered]3077-every new passage that offered , and at last got rid of the perilous things . [Tom]46-tom found [a subterranean lake , shortly]3078-a subterranean lake , shortly , which stretched [its]3078-a subterranean lake , shortly dim length away until its shape was lost in the shadows . [He]46-tom wanted to explore [its]3078-a subterranean lake , shortly borders , but concluded that it would be best to sit down and rest awhile , first . Now , for the first time , the deep stillness of [the place]791-the place laid a clammy hand upon the spirits of [the children]383-the children . [Becky]86-becky said : “[86-becky] Why , [I]0-i did n’t notice , but it seems ever so long since [I]0-i heard any of the others . ” “[0-i] Come to think , [Becky]86-becky , [we]1831-we are away down below [them]1832-them — and [I]0-i do n’t know how far away north , or south , or east , or whichever it is . [We]1831-we could n’t hear [them]1832-them here . ” [Becky]86-becky grew apprehensive . “[1832-them] [I]0-i wonder how long [we]1831-we ’ve been down here , [Tom]46-tom ? [We]1831-we better start back . ” “[1831-we] Yes , [I]0-i reckon [we]1831-we better . P’raps [we]1831-we better . ” “[0-i] Can [you]46-tom find the way , [Tom]46-tom ? It ’s all a mixed - up crookedness to [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i could find it — but then the bats . If [they]1832-them put [our]1831-we candles out it will be an awful fix . Let ’s try some other way , so as not to go through there . ” “[46-tom] Well . But [I]0-i hope [we]1831-we wo n’t get lost . It would be so awful ! ” and [the girl]334-the girl shuddered at the thought of the dreadful possibilities . [They]1831-we started through [a corridor]3082-a corridor , and traversed [it]3082-a corridor in silence a long way , glancing at each new opening , to see if there was anything familiar about the look of it ; but they were all strange . Every time [Tom]46-tom made an examination , [Becky]86-becky would watch [his]46-tom face for an encouraging sign , and [he]46-tom would say cheerily : “[46-tom] Oh , it ’s all right . This ai n’t the one , but [we]1831-we ’ll come to it right away ! ” But [he]46-tom felt less and less hopeful with each failure , and presently began to turn off into diverging avenues at sheer random , in desperate hope of finding the one that was wanted . [He]46-tom still said it was “[46-tom] all right , ” but there was such a leaden dread at [his]46-tom heart that the words had lost their ring and sounded just as if [he]46-tom had said , “[46-tom] All is lost ! ” [Becky]86-becky clung to [his]46-tom side in an anguish of fear , and tried hard to keep back the tears , but [they]3083-they would come . At last [she]86-becky said : “[46-tom] Oh , [Tom]46-tom , never mind the bats , let ’s go back that way ! [We]1831-we seem to get worse and worse off all the time . ” “[1831-we] Listen ! ” said [he]46-tom . Profound silence ; silence so deep that even [their]1831-we breathings were conspicuous in the hush . [Tom]46-tom shouted . The call went echoing down [the empty aisles]3084-the empty aisles and died out in the distance in a faint sound that resembled a ripple of mocking laughter . “[1831-we] Oh , do n’t do it again , [Tom]46-tom , it is too horrid , ” said [Becky]86-becky . “[46-tom] It is horrid , but [I]0-i better , [Becky]86-becky ; [they]1833-they might hear [us]1831-we , [you]86-becky know , ” and [he]46-tom shouted again . The “[1833-they] might ” was even a chillier horror than the ghostly laughter , it so confessed a perishing hope . [The children]383-the children stood still and listened ; but there was no result . [Tom]46-tom turned upon [the back track]3086-the back track at once , and hurried [his]46-tom steps . It was but a little while before a certain indecision in [his]46-tom manner revealed another fearful fact to [Becky]86-becky — [he]46-tom could not find [his]46-tom way back ! “[1833-they] Oh , [Tom]46-tom , [you]46-tom did n’t make any marks ! ” “[86-becky] [Becky]86-becky , [I]0-i was such [a fool]2290-a fool ! [Such a fool]1835-such a fool ! [I]0-i never thought [we]1831-we might want to come back ! No — [I]0-i ca n’t find the way . It ’s all mixed up . ” “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , [Tom]46-tom , [we]1831-we ’re lost ! [we]1831-we ’re lost ! [We]1831-we never can get out of [this awful place]1836-this awful place ! Oh , why _ did _ [we]1831-we ever leave [the others]1124-the others ! ” [She]86-becky sank to the ground and burst into such a frenzy of crying that [Tom]46-tom was appalled with the idea that [she]86-becky might die , or lose [her]86-becky reason . [He]46-tom sat down by [her]86-becky and put [his]46-tom arms around [her]86-becky ; [she]86-becky buried [her]86-becky face in [his]46-tom bosom , [she]86-becky clung to [him]46-tom , [she]86-becky poured out [her]86-becky terrors , [her]86-becky unavailing regrets , and the far echoes turned [them]1124-the others all to jeering laughter . [Tom]46-tom begged [her]86-becky to pluck up hope again , and [she]86-becky said [she]86-becky could not . [He]46-tom fell to blaming and abusing [himself]46-tom for getting [her]86-becky into this miserable situation ; this had a better effect . [She]86-becky said [she]86-becky would try to hope again , [she]86-becky would get up and follow wherever [he]46-tom might lead if only [he]46-tom would not talk like that any more . For [he]46-tom was no more to blame than [she]86-becky , [she]86-becky said . So [they]3087-they moved on again — aimlessly — simply at random — all [they]3087-they could do was to move , keep moving . For a little while , hope made a show of reviving — not with any reason to back it , but only because it is its nature to revive when the spring has not been taken out of it by age and familiarity with failure . By - and - by [Tom]46-tom took [Becky]86-becky ’s candle and blew it out . This economy meant so much ! Words were not needed . [Becky]86-becky understood , and [her]86-becky hope died again . [She]86-becky knew that [Tom]46-tom had a whole candle and three or four pieces in [his]46-tom pockets — yet [he]46-tom must economize . By - and - by , fatigue began to assert its claims ; [the children]383-the children tried to pay attention , for it was dreadful to think of sitting down when time was grown to be so precious , moving , in some direction , in any direction , was at least progress and might bear fruit ; but to sit down was to invite death and shorten its pursuit . At last [Becky]86-becky ’s frail limbs refused to carry [her]86-becky farther . [She]86-becky sat down . [Tom]46-tom rested with [her]86-becky , and [they]3087-they talked of [home]197-home , and [the friends there]3090-the friends there , and the comfortable beds and , above all , the light ! [Becky]86-becky cried , and [Tom]46-tom tried to think of some way of comforting [her]86-becky , but all [his]46-tom encouragements were grown thread - bare with use , and sounded like sarcasms . Fatigue bore so heavily upon [Becky]86-becky that [she]86-becky drowsed off to sleep . [Tom]46-tom was grateful . [He]46-tom sat looking into [her]86-becky drawn face and saw it grow smooth and natural under the influence of pleasant dreams ; and by - and - by a smile dawned and rested there . The peaceful face reflected somewhat of peace and healing into [his]46-tom own spirit , and [his]46-tom thoughts wandered away to bygone times and dreamy memories . While [he]46-tom was deep in [his]46-tom musings , [Becky]86-becky woke up with a breezy little laugh — but it was stricken dead upon [her]86-becky lips , and a groan followed it . “[0-i] Oh , how _ could _ [I]0-i sleep ! [I]0-i wish [I]0-i never , never had waked ! No ! No , [I]0-i do n’t , [Tom]46-tom ! Do n’t look so ! [I]0-i wo n’t say it again . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m glad [you]0-i ’ve slept , [Becky]86-becky ; [you]0-i ’ll feel rested , now , and [we]1838-they ’ll find the way out . ” “[1838-they] [We]1838-they can try , [Tom]46-tom ; but [I]0-i ’ve seen such [a beautiful country]1839-a beautiful country in [my]0-i dream . [I]0-i reckon [we]1838-they are going there . ” “[0-i] Maybe not , maybe not . Cheer up , [Becky]86-becky , and let ’s go on trying . ” [They]1838-they rose up and wandered along , hand in hand and hopeless . [They]1838-they tried to estimate how long [they]1838-they had been in [the cave]1723-the cave , but all [they]1838-they knew was that it seemed days and weeks , and yet it was plain that this could not be , for [their]1838-they candles were not gone yet . A long time after this — [they]1838-they could not tell how long — [Tom]46-tom said [they]1838-they must go softly and listen for dripping water — [they]1838-they must find a spring . [They]1838-they found one presently , and [Tom]46-tom said it was time to rest again . [Both]230-both were cruelly tired , yet [Becky]86-becky said [she]86-becky thought [she]86-becky could go a little farther . [She]86-becky was surprised to hear [Tom]46-tom dissent . [She]86-becky could not understand it . [They]1838-they sat down , and [Tom]46-tom fastened [his]46-tom candle to the wall in front of [them]1838-they with some clay . [Thought]164-thought was soon busy ; nothing was said for some time . Then [Becky]86-becky broke the silence : “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , [I]0-i am so hungry ! ” [Tom]46-tom took something out of [his]46-tom pocket . “[46-tom] Do [you]0-i remember this ? ” said [he]46-tom . [Becky]86-becky almost smiled . “[0-i] It ’s [our]1840-us wedding - cake , [Tom]46-tom . ” “[46-tom] Yes — [I]0-i wish it was as big as a barrel , for it ’s all [we]1840-us ’ve got . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i saved it from the picnic for [us]1840-us to dream on , [Tom]46-tom , the way [grownup people]1841-grownup people do with wedding - cake — but it ’ll be [our]1840-us — ” [She]86-becky dropped the sentence where it was . [Tom]46-tom divided the cake and [Becky]86-becky ate with good appetite , while [Tom]46-tom nibbled at [his]46-tom moiety . There was abundance of cold water to finish the feast with . By - and - by [Becky]86-becky suggested that [they]1840-us move on again . [Tom]46-tom was silent a moment . Then [he]46-tom said : “[86-becky] [Becky]86-becky , can [you]86-becky bear it if [I]0-i tell [you]86-becky something ? ” [Becky]86-becky ’s face paled , but [she]86-becky thought [she]86-becky could . “[0-i] Well , then , [Becky]86-becky , [we]1840-us must stay here , where there ’s water to drink . That little piece is [our]1840-us last candle ! ” [Becky]86-becky gave loose to tears and wailings . [Tom]46-tom did what [he]46-tom could to comfort [her]86-becky , but with little effect . At length [Becky]86-becky said : “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom ! ” “[86-becky] Well , [Becky]86-becky ? ” “[86-becky] [They]1842-they ’ll miss [us]1840-us and hunt for [us]1840-us ! ” “[1842-they] Yes , [they]1842-they will ! Certainly [they]1842-they will ! ” “[1842-they] Maybe [they]1842-they ’re hunting for [us]1840-us now , [Tom]46-tom . ” “[46-tom] Why , [I]0-i reckon maybe [they]1842-they are . [I]0-i hope [they]1842-they are . ” “[1842-they] When would [they]1842-they miss [us]1840-us , [Tom]46-tom ? ” “[1842-they] When [they]1842-they get back to [the boat]1140-the boat , [I]0-i reckon . ” “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , it might be dark then — would [they]1842-they notice [we]1840-us had n’t come ? ” “[1842-they] [I]0-i do n’t know . But anyway , [[your]46-tom mother]2405-your mother would miss [you]46-tom as soon as [they]1842-they got [home]197-home . ” A frightened look in [Becky]86-becky ’s face brought [Tom]46-tom to [his]46-tom senses and [he]46-tom saw that [he]46-tom had made a blunder . [Becky]86-becky was not to have gone [home]197-home that night ! [The children]383-the children became silent and thoughtful . In a moment a new burst of grief from [Becky]86-becky showed [Tom]46-tom that the thing in [his]46-tom mind had struck [hers]86-becky also — that the Sabbath morning might be half spent before [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher discovered that [Becky]86-becky was not at [Mrs. Harper]118-mrs. harper ’s . [The children]383-the children fastened [their]383-the children eyes upon [their]383-the children bit of candle and watched it melt slowly and pitilessly away ; saw the half inch of wick stand alone at last ; saw the feeble flame rise and fall , climb the thin column of smoke , linger at its top a moment , and then — the horror of utter darkness reigned ! How long afterward it was that [Becky]86-becky came to a slow consciousness that [she]86-becky was crying in [Tom]46-tom ’s arms , [neither]3096-neither could tell . All that [they]383-the children knew was , that after what seemed a mighty stretch of time , [both]230-both awoke out of a dead stupor of sleep and resumed [their]230-both miseries once more . [Tom]46-tom said it might be Sunday , now — maybe Monday . [He]46-tom tried to get [Becky]86-becky to talk , but [her]86-becky sorrows were too oppressive , all [her]86-becky hopes were gone . [Tom]46-tom said that [they]383-the children must have been missed long ago , and no doubt the search was going on . [He]46-tom would shout and maybe [some one]3098-some one would come . [He]46-tom tried it ; but in the darkness the distant echoes sounded so hideously that [he]46-tom tried it no more . The hours wasted away , and hunger came to torment [the captives]3099-the captives again . A portion of [Tom]46-tom ’s half of the cake was left ; [they]3099-the captives divided and ate it . But [they]3099-the captives seemed hungrier than before . The poor morsel of food only whetted desire . By - and - by [Tom]46-tom said : “[2405-your mother] SH ! Did [you]1846-you hear that ? ” [Both]230-both held [their]230-both breath and listened . There was a sound like the faintest , far - off shout . Instantly [Tom]46-tom answered it , and leading [Becky]86-becky by the hand , started groping down [the corridor]3101-the corridor in its direction . Presently [he]46-tom listened again ; again the sound was heard , and apparently a little nearer . “[1846-you] It ’s [them]1847-them ! ” said [Tom]46-tom ; “[1847-them] [they]1847-them ’re coming ! Come along , [Becky]86-becky — [we’re]1848-we’re all right now ! ” The joy of [the prisoners]3102-the prisoners was almost overwhelming . [Their]3099-the captives speed was slow , however , because pitfalls were somewhat common , and had to be guarded against . [They]3099-the captives shortly came to one and had to stop . It might be three feet deep , it might be a hundred — there was no passing it at any rate . [Tom]46-tom got down on [his]46-tom breast and reached as far down as [he]46-tom could . No bottom . [They]3099-the captives must stay there and wait until [the searchers]3103-the searchers came . [They]3099-the captives listened ; evidently the distant shoutings were growing more distant ! a moment or two more and [they]3099-the captives had gone altogether . The heart - sinking misery of it ! [Tom]46-tom whooped until [he]46-tom was hoarse , but it was of no use . [He]46-tom talked hopefully to [Becky]86-becky ; but an age of anxious waiting passed and no sounds came again . [The children]383-the children groped [their]383-the children way back to the spring . The weary time dragged on ; [they]383-the children slept again , and awoke famished and woe - stricken . [Tom]46-tom believed it must be [Tuesday]165-tuesday by this time . Now an idea struck [him]46-tom . There were [some side passages near at hand]3105-some side passages near at hand . It would be better to explore some of these than bear the weight of the heavy time in idleness . [He]46-tom took a kite - line from [his]46-tom pocket , tied it to a projection , and [he]46-tom and [Becky]86-becky started , [Tom]46-tom in the lead , unwinding the line as [he]46-tom groped along . At the end of twenty steps [the corridor]3101-the corridor ended in a “[86-becky] jumping - off place . ” [Tom]46-tom got down on [his]46-tom knees and felt below , and then as far around the corner as [he]46-tom could reach with [his]46-tom hands conveniently ; [he]46-tom made an effort to stretch yet a little farther to the right , and at that moment , not twenty yards away , a human hand , holding a candle , appeared from behind a rock ! [Tom]46-tom lifted up a glorious shout , and instantly that hand was followed by the body it belonged to — [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s ! [Tom]46-tom was paralyzed ; [he]46-tom could not move . [He]46-tom was vastly gratified the next moment , to see [the “[86-becky] Spaniard ”]3107-the “ spaniard ” take to [his]3107-the “ spaniard ” heels and get [himself]3107-the “ spaniard ” out of sight . [Tom]46-tom wondered that [Joe]100-injun joe had not recognized [his]3107-the “ spaniard ” voice and come over and killed [him]3107-the “ spaniard ” for testifying in [court]612-court . But the echoes must have disguised the voice . Without doubt , that was it , [he]46-tom reasoned . [Tom]46-tom ’s fright weakened every muscle in [his]46-tom body . [He]46-tom said to [himself]46-tom that if [he]46-tom had strength enough to get back to [the spring]3109-the spring [he]46-tom would stay [there]2038-there , and nothing should tempt [him]46-tom to run the risk of meeting [Injun Joe]100-injun joe again . [He]46-tom was careful to keep from [Becky]86-becky what it was [he]46-tom had seen . [He]46-tom told [her]86-becky [he]46-tom had only shouted “[86-becky] for luck . ” But hunger and wretchedness rise superior to fears in the long run . Another tedious wait at the spring and another long sleep brought changes . [The children]383-the children awoke tortured with a raging hunger . [Tom]46-tom believed that it must be Wednesday or Thursday or even Friday or Saturday , now , and that the search had been given over . [He]46-tom proposed to explore [another passage]3112-another passage . [He]46-tom felt willing to risk [Injun Joe]100-injun joe and all other terrors . But [Becky]86-becky was very weak . [She]86-becky had sunk into a dreary apathy and would not be roused . [She]86-becky said [she]86-becky would wait , now , where [she]86-becky was , and die — it would not be long . [She]86-becky told [Tom]46-tom to go with the kite - line and explore if [he]46-tom chose ; but [she]86-becky implored [him]46-tom to come back every little while and speak to [her]86-becky ; and [she]86-becky made [him]46-tom promise that when the awful time came , [he]46-tom would stay by [her]86-becky and hold [her]86-becky hand until all was over . [Tom]46-tom kissed [her]86-becky , with a choking sensation in [his]46-tom throat , and made a show of being confident of finding [the searchers]3103-the searchers or an escape from [the cave]1723-the cave ; then [he]46-tom took the kite - line in [his]46-tom hand and went groping down one of [the passages]3115-the passages on [his]46-tom hands and knees , distressed with hunger and sick with bodings of coming doom . CHAPTER XXXII Tuesday afternoon came , and waned to the twilight . [The village of [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg]3116-the village of st. petersburg still mourned . [The lost children]3117-the lost children had not been found . Public prayers had been offered up for [them]3117-the lost children , and many and many a private prayer that had [the petitioner]3118-the petitioner ’s whole heart in it ; but still no good news came from [the cave]1723-the cave . [The majority of [the searchers]3103-the searchers]3120-the majority of the searchers had given up the quest and gone back to [their]3120-the majority of the searchers daily avocations , saying that it was plain [the children]383-the children could never be found . [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher was very ill , and a great part of the time delirious . [People]756-people said it was heartbreaking to hear [her]159-mrs. thatcher call [[her]159-mrs. thatcher child]3038-her child , and raise [her]159-mrs. thatcher head and listen a whole minute at a time , then lay it wearily down again with a moan . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly had drooped into a settled melancholy , and [her]159-mrs. thatcher gray hair had grown almost white . [The village]206-the village went to [its]206-the village rest on Tuesday night , sad and forlorn . Away in the middle of the night a wild peal burst from the village bells , and in a moment [the streets]3126-the streets were swarming with [frantic half - clad people]3127-frantic half - clad people , who shouted , “[86-becky] Turn out ! turn out ! [they]1849-they ’re found ! [they]1849-they ’re found ! ” Tin pans and horns were added to the din , [the population]3128-the population massed itself and moved toward [the river]346-the river , met [the children]383-the children coming in [an open carriage]3131-an open carriage drawn by [shouting citizens]3132-shouting citizens , thronged around [it]3131-an open carriage , joined [its]3131-an open carriage homeward march , and swept magnificently up [the main street]2834-the main street roaring huzzah after huzzah ! [The village]206-the village was illuminated ; [nobody]647-nobody went to bed again ; it was the greatest night [the little town]1258-the little town had ever seen . During the first half - hour [a procession of [villagers]3138-villagers]3137-a procession of villagers filed through [[Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher ’s house]3139-judge thatcher ’s house , seized [the saved ones]3140-the saved ones and kissed [them]3140-the saved ones , squeezed [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher ’s hand , tried to speak but couldn’t — and drifted out raining tears all over [the place]791-the place . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s happiness was complete , and [Mrs. Thatcher]159-mrs. thatcher ’s nearly so . It would be complete , however , as soon as [the messenger dispatched with the great news]3142-the messenger dispatched with the great news to [the cave]1723-the cave should get the word to [[her]47-aunt polly husband]1729-her husband . [Tom]46-tom lay upon a sofa with an eager auditory about [him]46-tom and told the history of the wonderful adventure , putting in many striking additions to adorn it withal ; and closed with a description of how [he]46-tom left [Becky]86-becky and went on an exploring expedition ; how [he]46-tom followed two avenues as far as [his]46-tom kite - line would reach ; how [he]46-tom followed a third to the fullest stretch of the kite - line , and was about to turn back when [he]46-tom glimpsed a far - off speck that looked like daylight ; dropped the line and groped toward it , pushed [his]46-tom head and shoulders through a small hole , and saw the broad Mississippi rolling by ! And if it had only happened to be night [he]46-tom would not have seen that speck of daylight and would not have explored [that passage]3145-that passage any more ! [He]46-tom told how [he]46-tom went back for [Becky]86-becky and broke the good news and [she]86-becky told [him]46-tom not to fret [her]86-becky with such stuff , for [she]86-becky was tired , and knew [she]86-becky was going to die , and wanted to . [He]46-tom described how [he]46-tom labored with [her]86-becky and convinced [her]86-becky ; and how [she]86-becky almost died for joy when [she]86-becky had groped to where [she]86-becky actually saw the blue speck of daylight ; how [he]46-tom pushed [his]46-tom way out at the hole and then helped [her]86-becky out ; how [they]3146-they sat there and cried for gladness ; how [some men]3147-some men came along in [a skiff]3148-a skiff and [Tom]46-tom hailed [them]3147-some men and told [them]3147-some men [their]3147-some men situation and [their]3147-some men famished condition ; how [the men]810-the men did n’t believe the wild tale at first , “[1849-they] because , ” said [they]810-the men , “[1850-you] [you]1850-you are five miles down [the river]346-the river below [the valley [the cave]1723-the cave is in”—then]3150-the valley the cave is in”—then took [them]3147-some men aboard , rowed to [a house]678-a house , gave [them]3147-some men supper , made [them]3147-some men rest till two or three hours after dark and then brought [them]3147-some men [home]197-home . Before day - dawn , [Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher and [the handful of searchers with [him]158-judge thatcher]3153-the handful of searchers with him were tracked out , in [the cave]1723-the cave , by the twine clews [they]810-the men had strung behind [them]810-the men , and informed of the great news . Three days and nights of toil and hunger in [the cave]1723-the cave were not to be shaken off at once , as [Tom]46-tom and [Becky]86-becky soon discovered . [They]810-the men were bedridden all of Wednesday and Thursday , and seemed to grow more and more tired and worn , all the time . [Tom]46-tom got about , a little , on Thursday , was downtown Friday , and nearly as whole as ever Saturday ; but [Becky]86-becky did not leave [[her]86-becky room]3156-her room until Sunday , and then [she]86-becky looked as if [she]86-becky had passed through a wasting illness . [Tom]46-tom learned of [Huck]45-huck ’s sickness and went to see [him]45-huck on Friday , but could not be admitted to [the bedroom]3157-the bedroom ; neither could [he]46-tom on Saturday or Sunday . [He]46-tom was admitted daily after that , but was warned to keep still about [his]46-tom adventure and introduce no exciting topic . [The Widow Douglas]71-the widow douglas stayed by to see that [he]46-tom obeyed . At [home]197-home [Tom]46-tom learned of the Cardiff Hill event ; also that [the “[1850-you] ragged man]3159-the “ ragged man ’s ” body had eventually been found in [the river]346-the river near [the ferry - landing]1714-the ferry - landing ; [he]3159-the “ ragged man had been drowned while trying to escape , perhaps . About a fortnight after [Tom]46-tom ’s rescue from [the cave]1723-the cave , [he]46-tom started off to visit [Huck]45-huck , who had grown plenty strong enough , now , to hear exciting talk , and [Tom]46-tom had some that would interest [him]46-tom , [he]46-tom thought . [[Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher ’s house]3139-judge thatcher ’s house was on [[Tom]46-tom ’s way]3164-tom ’s way , and [he]46-tom stopped to see [Becky]86-becky . [The Judge]476-the judge and [some friends]3166-some friends set [Tom]46-tom to talking , and [some one]3098-some one asked [him]46-tom ironically if [he]46-tom would n’t like to go to [the cave]1723-the cave again . [Tom]46-tom said [he]46-tom thought [he]46-tom would n’t mind it . [The Judge]476-the judge said : “[1850-you] Well , there are others just like [you]1853-you , [Tom]46-tom , [I]0-i ’ve not the least doubt . But [we]1854-we have taken care of that . [Nobody]647-nobody will get lost in [that cave]1856-that cave any more . ” “[647-nobody] Why ? ” “[647-nobody] Because [I]0-i had [its]1856-that cave big door sheathed with boiler iron two weeks ago , and triple - locked — and [I]0-i ’ve got the keys . ” [Tom]46-tom turned as white as a sheet . “[0-i] What ’s the matter , [boy]2839-boy ! Here , run , [somebody]262-somebody ! Fetch a glass of water ! ” The water was brought and thrown into [Tom]46-tom ’s face . “[262-somebody] Ah , now [you]1853-you ’re all right . What was the matter with [you]1853-you , [Tom]46-tom ? ” “[46-tom] Oh , [Judge]158-judge thatcher , Injun [Joe]100-injun joe ’s in [the cave]1723-the cave ! ” CHAPTER XXXIII Within a few minutes the news had spread , and [a dozen skiff - loads of men]3170-a dozen skiff - loads of men were on [their]3170-a dozen skiff - loads of men way to [[McDougal]160-mcdougal ’s cave]2862-mcdougal ’s cave , and [the ferryboat]1103-the ferryboat , well filled with [passengers]3173-passengers , soon followed . [Tom Sawyer]46-tom was in the skiff that bore [Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher . When the cave door was unlocked , a sorrowful sight presented itself in the dim twilight of [the place]791-the place . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe lay stretched upon the ground , dead , with [his]100-injun joe face close to the crack of the door , as if [his]100-injun joe longing eyes had been fixed , to the latest moment , upon the light and the cheer of [the free world outside]3175-the free world outside . [Tom]46-tom was touched , for [he]46-tom knew by [his]46-tom own experience how [this wretch]3176-this wretch had suffered . [His]46-tom pity was moved , but nevertheless [he]46-tom felt an abounding sense of relief and security , now , which revealed to [him]46-tom in a degree which [he]46-tom had not fully appreciated before how vast a weight of dread had been lying upon [him]46-tom since the day [he]46-tom lifted [his]46-tom voice against [this bloody - minded outcast]3177-this bloody - minded outcast . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s bowie - knife lay close by , its blade broken in two . The great foundation - beam of the door had been chipped and hacked through , with tedious labor ; useless labor , too , it was , for the native rock formed a sill outside [it]791-the place , and upon that stubborn material the knife had wrought no effect ; the only damage done was to the knife itself . But if there had been no stony obstruction there the labor would have been useless still , for if the beam had been wholly cut away [Injun Joe]100-injun joe could not have squeezed [his]100-injun joe body under the door , and [he]100-injun joe knew it . So [he]100-injun joe had only hacked [that place]3178-that place in order to be doing something — in order to pass the weary time — in order to employ [his]100-injun joe tortured faculties . Ordinarily one could find half a dozen bits of candle stuck around in the crevices of [this vestibule]3179-this vestibule , left there by [tourists]3037-tourists ; but there were none now . [The prisoner]703-the prisoner had searched them out and eaten them . [He]703-the prisoner had also contrived to catch a few bats , and these , also , [he]703-the prisoner had eaten , leaving only their claws . [The poor unfortunate]3182-the poor unfortunate had starved to death . In one place , near at hand , a stalagmite had been slowly growing up from the ground for ages , builded by the water - drip from a stalactite overhead . [The captive]3183-the captive had broken off the stalagmite , and upon the stump had placed a stone , wherein [he]703-the prisoner had scooped a shallow hollow to catch the precious drop that fell once in every three minutes with the dreary regularity of a clock - tick — a dessertspoonful once in four and twenty hours . That drop was falling when the Pyramids were new ; when [Troy]40-troy fell ; when the foundations of [Rome]41-rome were laid ; when [Christ]166-christ was crucified ; when [the Conqueror]167-the conqueror created [the British empire]3184-the british empire ; when [Columbus]168-columbus sailed ; when the massacre at [Lexington]42-lexington was “[158-judge thatcher] news . ” It is falling now ; it will still be falling when all these things shall have sunk down the afternoon of history , and the twilight of tradition , and been swallowed up in the thick night of oblivion . Has everything a purpose and a mission ? Did this drop fall patiently during five thousand years to be ready for this flitting human insect ’s need ? and has it another important object to accomplish ten thousand years to come ? No matter . It is many and many a year since [the hapless half - breed]3185-the hapless half - breed scooped out the stone to catch the priceless drops , but to this day [the tourist]3186-the tourist stares longest at that pathetic stone and that slow - dropping water when [he]3186-the tourist comes to see the wonders of [[McDougal]160-mcdougal ’s cave]2862-mcdougal ’s cave . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s cup stands first in the list of [the cavern ’s marvels]3188-the cavern ’s marvels ; even “[158-judge thatcher] [[Aladdin]169-aladdin ’s Palace]1860-aladdin ’s palace ” can not rival it . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe was buried near [the mouth of [the cave]1723-the cave]2852-the mouth of the cave ; and [people]756-people flocked there in [boats and wagons]3192-boats and wagons from [the towns]3193-the towns and from all [the farms]3194-the farms and [hamlets]3195-hamlets for seven miles around ; [they]756-people brought [[their]756-people children]638-their children , and all sorts of provisions , and confessed that [they]756-people had had almost as satisfactory a time at the funeral as [they]756-people could have had at the hanging . This funeral stopped the further growth of one thing — the petition to [the governor]3197-the governor for [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s pardon . The petition had been largely signed ; many tearful and eloquent meetings had been held , and [a committee of [sappy women]3199-sappy women]3198-a committee of sappy women been appointed to go in deep mourning and wail around [the governor]3197-the governor , and implore [him]3197-the governor to be [a merciful ass]3201-a merciful ass and trample [his]3197-the governor duty under foot . [Injun Joe]100-injun joe was believed to have killed [five citizens of [the village]206-the village]3202-five citizens of the village , but what of that ? If [he]100-injun joe had been [Satan]108-satan [himself]100-injun joe there would have been plenty of weaklings ready to scribble [their]3202-five citizens of the village names to a pardon - petition , and drip a tear on it from [[their]3202-five citizens of the village permanently impaired and leaky water - works]3204-their permanently impaired and leaky water - works . The morning after the funeral [Tom]46-tom took [Huck]45-huck to [a private place]2690-a private place to have an important talk . [Huck]45-huck had learned all about [Tom]46-tom ’s adventure from [the Welshman]162-the welshman and [the Widow Douglas]71-the widow douglas , by this time , but [Tom]46-tom said [he]46-tom reckoned there was one thing [they]3206-they had not told [him]46-tom ; that thing was what [he]46-tom wanted to talk about now . [Huck]45-huck ’s face saddened . [He]45-huck said : “[0-i] [I]0-i know what it is . [You]1861-you got into No . 2 and never found anything but whiskey . [Nobody]647-nobody told [me]0-i it was [you]1861-you ; but [I]0-i just knowed it must ’ a ’ ben [you]1861-you , soon as [I]0-i heard ’bout that whiskey business ; and [I]0-i knowed [you]1861-you had n’t got the money becuz [you]1861-you ’d ’ a ’ got at [me]0-i some way or other and told [me]0-i even if [you]1861-you was [mum]2273-mum to [everybody else]1864-everybody else . [Tom]46-tom , something ’s always told [me]0-i [we]1865-we ’d never get holt of that swag . ” “[46-tom] Why , [Huck]45-huck , [I]0-i never told on [that tavern - keeper]1866-that tavern - keeper . _ [You]1861-you _ know [[his]1866-that tavern - keeper tavern]1867-his tavern was all right the Saturday [I]0-i went to the picnic . Do n’t [you]1861-you remember [you]1861-you was to watch [there]2038-there that night ? ” “[1861-you] Oh yes ! Why , it seems ’bout a year ago . It was that very night that [I]0-i follered Injun [Joe]100-injun joe to the widder ’s . ” “[1861-you] _ [You]1861-you _ followed [him]100-injun joe ? ” “[1861-you] Yes — but [you]1861-you keep [mum]2273-mum . [I]0-i reckon [Injun Joe]100-injun joe ’s left [friends]2303-friends behind [him]100-injun joe , and [I]0-i do n’t want ’em souring on [me]0-i and doing [me]0-i mean tricks . If it had n’t ben for [me]0-i [he]100-injun joe ’d be down in [Texas]34-texas now , all right . ” Then [Huck]45-huck told [his]45-huck entire adventure in confidence to [Tom]46-tom , who had only heard of [the Welshman]162-the welshman ’s part of it before . “[100-injun joe] Well , ” said [Huck]45-huck , presently , coming back to the main question , “[100-injun joe] whoever nipped the whiskey in No . 2 , nipped the money , too , [I]0-i reckon — anyways it ’s a goner for [us]1871-us , [Tom]46-tom . ” “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck , that money was n’t ever in [No . 2]2786-no . 2 ! ” “[45-huck] What ! ” [Huck]45-huck searched [[his]45-huck comrade]796-his comrade ’s face keenly . “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , have [you]46-tom got on the track of that money again ? ” “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck , it ’s in the cave ! ” [Huck]45-huck ’s eyes blazed . “[45-huck] Say it again , [Tom]46-tom . ” “[46-tom] The money ’s in [the cave]1723-the cave ! ” “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom — honest injun , now — is it fun , or earnest ? ” “[170-earnest] [Earnest]170-earnest , [Huck]45-huck — just as earnest as ever [I]0-i was in [my]0-i life . Will [you]46-tom go in there with [me]0-i and help get it out ? ” “[46-tom] [I]0-i bet [I]0-i will ! [I]0-i will if it ’s where [we]1874-we can blaze [our]1874-we way to [it]1875-it and not get lost . ” “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck , [we]1874-we can do that without the least little bit of trouble in [the world]328-the world . ” “[45-huck] Good as wheat ! What makes [you]46-tom think the money ’s — ” “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck , [you]45-huck just wait till [we]1874-we get in [there]2038-there . If [we]1874-we do n’t find it [I]0-i ’ll agree to give [you]45-huck [my]0-i drum and every thing [I]0-i ’ve got in [the world]328-the world . [I]0-i will , by jings . ” “[0-i] All right — it ’s a whiz . When do [you]46-tom say ? ” “[46-tom] Right now , if [you]46-tom say it . Are [you]46-tom strong enough ? ” “[46-tom] Is it far in [the cave]1723-the cave ? [I]0-i ben on [my]0-i pins a little , three or four days , now , but [I]0-i ca n’t walk more’n a mile , [Tom]46-tom — least [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i could . ” “[0-i] It ’s about five mile into there the way [anybody]203-anybody but [me]0-i would go , [Huck]45-huck , but there ’s a mighty short cut that [they]1881-they do n’t [anybody but [me]0-i]1882-anybody but me know about . [Huck]45-huck , [I]0-i ’ll take [you]45-huck right to it in [a skiff]3148-a skiff . [I]0-i ’ll float [the skiff]1173-the skiff down there , and [I]0-i ’ll pull it back again all by [myself]0-i . [You]45-huck need n’t ever turn [your]45-huck hand over . ” “[45-huck] Less start right off , [Tom]46-tom . ” “[46-tom] All right . [We]1885-we want some bread and meat , and [our]1885-we pipes , and a little bag or two , and two or three kite - strings , and some of these new - fangled things [they]1881-they call lucifer matches . [I]0-i tell [you]45-huck , many ’s the time [I]0-i wished [I]0-i had some when [I]0-i was in [there]2038-there before . ” A trifle after noon [the boys]2054-the boys borrowed a small skiff from [a citizen who was absent]3209-a citizen who was absent , and got under way at once . When [they]1885-we were several miles below “[0-i] [Cave Hollow]43-cave hollow , ” [Tom]46-tom said : “[0-i] Now [you]45-huck see [this bluff here]1887-this bluff here looks all alike all the way down from [the cave hollow]1888-the cave hollow — [no houses]1889-no houses , no wood - yards , bushes all alike . But do [you]45-huck see [that white place up yonder where there ’s been a landslide]1890-that white place up yonder where there ’s been a landslide ? Well , that ’s one of [my]0-i marks . [We]1885-we ’ll get ashore , now . ” [They]1885-we landed . “[1885-we] Now , [Huck]45-huck , where [we]1885-we ’re a - standing [you]45-huck could touch that hole [I]0-i got out of with a fishing - pole . See if [you]45-huck can find it . ” [Huck]45-huck searched [all the place about]3210-all the place about , and found nothing . [Tom]46-tom proudly marched into a thick clump of sumach bushes and said : “[45-huck] Here [you]45-huck are ! Look at it , [Huck]45-huck ; it ’s [the snuggest hole in [this country]1499-this country]1891-the snuggest hole in this country . [You]45-huck just keep [mum]2273-mum about it . All along [I]0-i ’ve been wanting to be [a robber]1619-a robber , but [I]0-i knew [I]0-i ’d got to have a thing like this , and where to run across it was the bother . [We]1885-we ’ve got it now , and [we]1885-we ’ll keep it quiet , only [we]1885-we ’ll let [Joe Harper]62-joe and [Ben Rogers]57-ben in — because of course there ’s got to be [a Gang]1763-a gang , or else there would n’t be any style about it . [[Tom Sawyer]46-tom ’s Gang]1896-tom sawyer ’s gang — it sounds splendid , do n’t it , [Huck]45-huck ? ” “[45-huck] Well , it just does , [Tom]46-tom . And who ’ll [we]1885-we rob ? ” “[1897-most anybody] Oh , [most anybody]1897-most anybody . [Waylay people]1898-waylay people — that ’s mostly the way . ” “[1898-waylay people] And kill [them]1898-waylay people ? ” “[1898-waylay people] No , not always . Hive [them]1898-waylay people in [the cave]1723-the cave till [they]1898-waylay people raise a ransom . ” “[1898-waylay people] What ’s a ransom ? ” “[1898-waylay people] Money . [You]1900-you make [them]1898-waylay people raise all [they]1898-waylay people can , off’n [[their]1898-waylay people friends]1901-their friends ; and after [you]1900-you ’ve kept [them]1898-waylay people a year , if it ai n’t raised then [you]1900-you kill [them]1898-waylay people . That ’s the general way . Only [you]1900-you do n’t kill [the women]2353-the women . [You]1900-you shut up [the women]2353-the women , but [you]1900-you do n’t kill [them]2353-the women . [They]2353-the women ’re always beautiful and rich , and awfully scared . [You]1900-you take [their]2353-the women watches and things , but [you]1900-you always take [your]1900-you hat off and talk polite . [They]2353-the women ai n’t [anybody]203-anybody as polite as [robbers]1542-robbers — [you’ll]1900-you see that in any book . Well , [the women]2353-the women get to loving [you]1900-you , and after [they]2353-the women ’ve been in [the cave]1723-the cave a week or two weeks [they]2353-the women stop crying and after that [you]1900-you could n’t get [them]2353-the women to leave . If [you]1900-you drove [them]2353-the women out [they]2353-the women ’d turn right around and come back . It ’s so in all the books . ” “[46-tom] Why , it ’s real bully , [Tom]46-tom . [I]0-i believe it ’s better’n to be [a pirate]754-a pirate . ” “[0-i] Yes , it ’s better in some ways , because it ’s close to [home]197-home and circuses and all that . ” By this time everything was ready and [the boys]2054-the boys entered the hole , [Tom]46-tom in the lead . [They]2054-the boys toiled [their]2054-the boys way to the farther end of [the tunnel]3212-the tunnel , then made [their]2054-the boys spliced kite - strings fast and moved on . A few steps brought [them]2054-the boys to [the spring]3109-the spring , and [Tom]46-tom felt a shudder quiver all through [him]46-tom . [He]46-tom showed [Huck]45-huck the fragment of candle - wick perched on a lump of clay against the wall , and described how [he]46-tom and [Becky]86-becky had watched the flame struggle and expire . [The boys]2054-the boys began to quiet down to whispers , now , for the stillness and gloom of [the place]791-the place oppressed [their]2054-the boys spirits . [They]2054-the boys went on , and presently entered and followed [[Tom]46-tom ’s other corridor]3216-tom ’s other corridor until [they]2054-the boys reached [the “[0-i] jumping - off place]3217-the “ jumping - off place . ” The candles revealed the fact that [it]3217-the “ jumping - off place was not really a precipice , but only [a steep clay hill twenty or thirty feet high]3218-a steep clay hill twenty or thirty feet high . [Tom]46-tom whispered : “[0-i] Now [I]0-i ’ll show [you]1910-you something , [Huck]45-huck . ” [He]46-tom held [his]46-tom candle aloft and said : “[45-huck] Look as far around the corner as [you]1910-you can . Do [you]1910-you see that ? There — on [the big rock over yonder]1911-the big rock over yonder — done with candle - smoke . ” “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , it ’s a _ cross _ ! ” “[46-tom] _ Now _ where ’s [your]1910-you Number Two ? ‘ _ under the cross _ , ’ hey ? Right yonder ’s where [I]0-i saw Injun [Joe]62-joe poke up [his]62-joe candle , [Huck]45-huck ! ” [Huck]45-huck stared at the mystic sign awhile , and then said with a shaky voice : “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , less git out of here ! ” “[46-tom] What ! and leave the treasure ? ” “[45-huck] Yes — leave it . [Injun [Joe]62-joe ’s ghost]1912-injun joe ’s ghost is round about there , certain . ” “[1912-injun joe ’s ghost] No it ai n’t , [Huck]45-huck , no it ai n’t . It would ha’nt the place where [he]62-joe died — away out at [the mouth of [the cave]1723-the cave]2852-the mouth of the cave — five mile from here . ” “[45-huck] No , [Tom]46-tom , it would n’t . It would hang round the money . [I]0-i know the ways of ghosts , and so do [you]46-tom . ” [Tom]46-tom began to fear that [Huck]45-huck was right . Misgivings gathered in [his]46-tom mind . But presently an idea occurred to [him]46-tom — “[46-tom] [Lookyhere]171-lookyhere , [Huck]45-huck , what fools [we]1915-we ’re making of [ourselves]1915-we ! [Injun [Joe]62-joe ’s ghost]1912-injun joe ’s ghost ai n’t a going to come around where there ’s a cross ! ” The point was well taken . It had its effect . “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , [I]0-i did n’t think of that . But that ’s so . It ’s luck for [us]1915-we , that cross is . [I]0-i reckon [we]1915-we ’ll climb down there and have a hunt for that box . ” [Tom]46-tom went first , cutting rude steps in [the clay hill]3219-the clay hill as [he]46-tom descended . [Huck]45-huck followed . [Four avenues]3220-four avenues opened out of [the small cavern which [the great rock]3222-the great rock stood in]3221-the small cavern which the great rock stood in . [The boys]2054-the boys examined three of [them]3220-four avenues with no result . [They]2054-the boys found a small recess in [the one nearest the base of the rock]3224-the one nearest the base of the rock , with a pallet of blankets spread down in it ; also an old suspender , some bacon rind , and the well - gnawed bones of two or three fowls . But there was no moneybox . [The lads]1157-the lads searched and researched [this place]1596-this place , but in vain . [Tom]46-tom said : “[1917-he] [He]1917-he said _ under _ the cross . Well , this comes nearest to being under the cross . It ca n’t be under the rock itself , because that sets solid on the ground . ” [They]2054-the boys searched everywhere once more , and then sat down discouraged . [Huck]45-huck could suggest nothing . By - and - by [Tom]46-tom said : “[45-huck] Lookyhere , [Huck]45-huck , there ’s footprints and some candle - grease on the clay about one side of [this rock]1918-this rock , but not on the other sides . Now , what ’s that for ? [I]0-i bet [you]45-huck the money _ is _ under the rock . [I]0-i ’m going to dig in the clay . ” “[0-i] That ai n’t no bad notion , [Tom]46-tom ! ” said [Huck]45-huck with animation . [Tom]46-tom ’s “[46-tom] real Barlow ” was out at once , and [he]46-tom had not dug four inches before [he]46-tom struck wood . “[46-tom] Hey , [Huck!—you]172-huck!—you hear that ? ” [Huck]45-huck began to dig and scratch now . Some boards were soon uncovered and removed . [They]2054-the boys had concealed a natural chasm which led under [the rock]3227-the rock . [Tom]46-tom got into this and held [his]46-tom candle as far under the rock as [he]46-tom could , but said [he]46-tom could not see to [the end of [the rift]3229-the rift]3228-the end of the rift . [He]46-tom proposed to explore . [He]46-tom stooped and passed under ; the narrow way descended gradually . [He]46-tom followed its winding course , first to the right , then to the left , [Huck]45-huck at [his]46-tom heels . [Tom]46-tom turned a short curve , by - and - by , and exclaimed : “[172-huck!—you] [My]0-i goodness , [Huck]45-huck , lookyhere ! ” It was the treasure - box , sure enough , occupying [a snug little cavern]3230-a snug little cavern , along with an empty powder - keg , a couple of guns in leather cases , two or three pairs of old moccasins , a leather belt , and some other rubbish well soaked with the water - drip . “[45-huck] Got it at last ! ” said [Huck]45-huck , ploughing among the tarnished coins with [his]45-huck hand . “[0-i] [My]0-i , but [we]1919-we ’re rich , [Tom]46-tom ! ” “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck , [I]0-i always reckoned [we]1919-we ’d get it . It ’s just too good to believe , but [we]1919-we _ have _ got it , sure ! Say — let ’s not fool around here . Let ’s snake it out . Lemme see if [I]0-i can lift the box . ” It weighed about fifty pounds . [Tom]46-tom could lift it , after an awkward fashion , but could not carry it conveniently . “[0-i] [I]0-i thought so , ” [he]46-tom said ; “[0-i] _ [They]1920-they _ carried it like it was heavy , that day at [the ha’nted house]1598-the ha’nted house . [I]0-i noticed that . [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i was right to think of fetching the little bags along . ” The money was soon in the bags and [the boys]2054-the boys took it up to [the cross rock]3232-the cross rock . “[0-i] Now less fetch the guns and things , ” said [Huck]45-huck . “[0-i] No , [Huck]45-huck — leave them there . [They]1922-they ’re just the tricks to have when [we]1919-we go to robbing . [We]1919-we ’ll keep them there all the time , and [we]1919-we ’ll hold [our]1919-we orgies there , too . It ’s an awful snug place for orgies . ” “[45-huck] What orgies ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i dono . But [robbers]1542-robbers always have orgies , and of course [we]1919-we ’ve got to have them , too . Come along , [Huck]45-huck , [we]1919-we ’ve been in [here]551-here a long time . It ’s getting late , [I]0-i reckon . [I]0-i ’m hungry , too . [We]1919-we ’ll eat and smoke when [we]1919-we get to [the skiff]1173-the skiff . ” [They]1919-we presently emerged into [the clump of sumach bushes]3233-the clump of sumach bushes , looked warily out , found [the coast]3234-the coast clear , and were soon lunching and smoking in the skiff . As the sun dipped toward the horizon [they]1919-we pushed out and got under way . [Tom]46-tom skimmed up [the shore]1007-the shore through the long twilight , chatting cheerily with [Huck]45-huck , and landed shortly after dark . “[1919-we] Now , [Huck]45-huck , ” said [Tom]46-tom , “[45-huck] [we]1919-we ’ll hide the money in [the loft of [the widow]1578-the widow ’s woodshed]1926-the loft of the widow ’s woodshed , and [I]0-i ’ll come up in the morning and [we]1919-we ’ll count it and divide , and then [we]1919-we ’ll hunt up a place out in [the woods]2157-the woods for [it]1929-it where it will be safe . Just [you]45-huck lay quiet here and watch the stuff till [I]0-i run and hook [[Benny Taylor]173-benny taylor ’s little wagon]1930-benny taylor ’s little wagon ; [I]0-i wo n’t be gone a minute . ” [He]45-huck disappeared , and presently returned with [the wagon]3236-the wagon , put the two small sacks into it , threw some old rags on top of them , and started off , dragging [his]45-huck cargo behind [him]45-huck . When [the boys]2054-the boys reached [[the Welshman]2928-the welshman ’s house]3239-the welshman ’s house , [they]2054-the boys stopped to rest . Just as [they]2054-the boys were about to move on , [the Welshman]2928-the welshman stepped out and said : “[107-hallo] [Hallo]107-hallo , who ’s that ? ” “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck and [Tom Sawyer]46-tom . ” “[46-tom] Good ! Come along with [me]0-i , [boys]183-boys , [you]183-boys are keeping [everybody]490-everybody waiting . Here — hurry up , trot ahead — [I’ll]0-i haul [the wagon]3236-the wagon for [you]183-boys . Why , it ’s not as light as it might be . Got bricks in it?—or old metal ? ” “[46-tom] Old metal , ” said [Tom]46-tom . “[46-tom] [I]0-i judged so ; [the boys in [this town]2162-this town]1934-the boys in this town will take more trouble and fool away more time hunting up six bits ’ worth of old iron to sell to [the foundry]1936-the foundry than [they]1934-the boys in this town would to make twice the money at regular work . But that ’s human nature — hurry along , hurry along ! ” [The boys]2054-the boys wanted to know what the hurry was about . “[1937-you] Never mind ; [you]1937-you ’ll see , when [we]1938-we get to [the Widow Douglas]71-the widow douglas ’ . ” [Huck]45-huck said with some apprehension — for [he]45-huck was long used to being falsely accused : “[174-mr. jones] [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones , [we]1938-we have n’t been doing nothing . ” [The Welshman]2928-the welshman laughed . “[174-mr. jones] Well , [I]0-i do n’t know , [Huck]45-huck , [[my]0-i boy]1534-my boy . [I]0-i do n’t know about that . Ai n’t [you]45-huck and [the widow good friends]1940-the widow good friends ? ” “[1941-she] Yes . Well , [she]1941-she ’s [ben good friends to [me]0-i]1942-ben good friends to me , anyway . ” “[1941-she] All right , then . What do [you]45-huck want to be afraid for ? ” This question was not entirely answered in [Huck]45-huck ’s slow mind before [he]45-huck found [himself]45-huck pushed , along with [Tom]46-tom , into [[Mrs. Douglas]175-mrs. douglas ’ drawing - room]3243-mrs. douglas ’ drawing - room . [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones left [the wagon]3236-the wagon near the door and followed . [The place]791-the place was grandly lighted , and [everybody that was of any consequence in [the village]206-the village]3246-everybody that was of any consequence in the village was [there]2038-there . [The Thatchers]176-the thatchers were [there]2038-there , [the Harpers]1311-the harpers , [the Rogerses]3251-the rogerses , [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly , [Sid]51-sid , [Mary]47-aunt polly , [the minister]544-the minister , [the editor]3253-the editor , and [a great many more]3254-a great many more , and all dressed in [their]3246-everybody that was of any consequence in the village best . [The widow]1578-the widow received [the boys]2054-the boys as heartily as [any one]2780-any one could well receive [two such looking beings]3258-two such looking beings . [They]2054-the boys were covered with clay and candle - grease . [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly blushed crimson with humiliation , and frowned and shook [her]47-aunt polly head at [Tom]46-tom . [Nobody]647-nobody suffered half as much as [the two boys]701-the two boys did , however . [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones said : “[45-huck] [Tom]46-tom was n’t at [home]197-home , yet , so [I]0-i gave [him]46-tom up ; but [I]0-i stumbled on [him]46-tom and [Huck]45-huck right at [my]0-i door , and so [I]0-i just brought [them]1944-them along in a hurry . ” “[0-i] And [you]1945-you did just right , ” said [the widow]1578-the widow . “[1945-you] Come with [me]0-i , [boys]183-boys . ” [She]1578-the widow took [them]1944-them to [a bedchamber]3262-a bedchamber and said : “[1945-you] Now wash and dress [yourselves]183-boys . Here are two new suits of clothes — shirts , socks , everything complete . [They]1944-them ’re [Huck’s]177-huck’s — no , no thanks , [Huck]45-huck — [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones bought one and [I]0-i the other . But they ’ll fit both of [you]183-boys . Get into [them]1944-them . [We]1947-we ’ll wait — come down when [you]183-boys are slicked up enough . ” Then [she]3263-she left . CHAPTER XXXIV [Huck]45-huck said : “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , [we]1947-we can slope , if [we]1947-we can find a rope . The window ai n’t high from the ground . ” “[46-tom] Shucks ! what do [you]46-tom want to slope for ? ” “[46-tom] Well , [I]0-i ai n’t used to that kind of [a crowd]1948-a crowd . [I]0-i ca n’t stand it . [I]0-i ai n’t going down there , [Tom]46-tom . ” “[46-tom] Oh , bother ! [It]1949-it ai n’t anything . [I]0-i do n’t mind it a bit . [I]0-i ’ll take care of [you]46-tom . ” [Sid]51-sid appeared . “[46-tom] [Tom]46-tom , ” said [he]51-sid , “[2133-auntie] [auntie]2133-auntie has been waiting for [you]46-tom all the afternoon . [Mary]47-aunt polly got [your]46-tom Sunday clothes ready , and [everybody]490-everybody ’s been fretting about [you]46-tom . Say — ain’t this grease and clay , on [your]46-tom clothes ? ” “[52-siddy] Now , [Mr. Siddy]52-siddy , [you]46-tom jist ’ tend to [your]46-tom own business . What ’s all this blowout about , anyway ? ” “[1578-the widow] It ’s one of [the widow]1578-the widow ’s parties that [she]1578-the widow ’s always having . This time it ’s for [the Welshman]162-the welshman and [[his]52-siddy sons]2933-his sons , on account of that scrape [they]1954-they helped [her]1578-the widow out of the other night . And say — [I]0-i can tell [you]46-tom something , if [you]46-tom want to know . ” “[0-i] Well , what ? ” “[0-i] Why , [old Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones is going to try to spring something on [the people]502-the people here tonight , but [I]0-i overheard [him]174-mr. jones tell [auntie]2133-auntie today about it , as a secret , but [I]0-i reckon it ’s not much of a secret now . [Everybody]490-everybody knows — [the widow]1578-the widow , too , for all [she]1578-the widow tries to let on [she]1578-the widow do n’t . [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones was bound [Huck]45-huck should be [here]551-here — couldn’t get along with [his]174-mr. jones grand secret without [Huck]45-huck , [you]46-tom know ! ” “[45-huck] Secret about what , [Sid]51-sid ? ” “[45-huck] About [Huck]45-huck tracking [the robbers]1960-the robbers to [[the widow]1578-the widow ’s]1962-the widow ’s . [I]0-i reckon [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones was going to make a grand time over [his]174-mr. jones surprise , but [I]0-i bet [you]46-tom it will drop pretty flat . ” [Sid]51-sid chuckled in a very contented and satisfied way . “[51-sid] [Sid]51-sid , was it [you]51-sid that told ? ” “[51-sid] Oh , never mind who it was . _ [Somebody]262-somebody _ told — that ’s enough . ” “[262-somebody] [Sid]51-sid , there ’s [only one person in [this town]2162-this town]1964-only one person in this town mean enough to do that , and that ’s [you]51-sid . If [you]51-sid had been in [[Huck]45-huck ’s place]1966-huck ’s place [you]51-sid ’d ’ a ’ sneaked down [the hill]2700-the hill and never told [anybody on the robbers]1968-anybody on the robbers . [You]51-sid ca n’t do any but mean things , and [you]51-sid ca n’t bear to see [anybody praised for doing good ones]1969-anybody praised for doing good ones . There — no thanks , as [the widow]1578-the widow says”—and [Tom]46-tom cuffed [Sid]51-sid ’s ears and helped [him]51-sid to the door with several kicks . “[1578-the widow] Now go and tell [auntie]2133-auntie if [you]51-sid dare — and tomorrow [you]51-sid ’ll catch it ! ” Some minutes later [[the widow]1578-the widow ’s guests]3265-the widow ’s guests were at the supper - table , and [a dozen children]3266-a dozen children were propped up at little side - tables in [the same room]3267-the same room , after the fashion of [that country]3268-that country and that day . At the proper time [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones made [his]174-mr. jones little speech , in which [he]174-mr. jones thanked [the widow]1578-the widow for the honor [she]1578-the widow was doing [himself]174-mr. jones and [[his]174-mr. jones sons]2933-his sons , but said that there was [another person whose modesty — And so forth and so on]3271-another person whose modesty — and so forth and so on . [He]174-mr. jones sprung [his]174-mr. jones secret about [Huck]45-huck ’s share in the adventure in the finest dramatic manner [he]174-mr. jones was master of , but the surprise it occasioned was largely counterfeit and not as clamorous and effusive as it might have been under happier circumstances . However , [the widow]1578-the widow made a pretty fair show of astonishment , and heaped so many compliments and so much gratitude upon [Huck]45-huck that [he]45-huck almost forgot the nearly intolerable discomfort of [his]45-huck new clothes in the entirely intolerable discomfort of being set up as a target for [everybody]490-everybody ’s gaze and [everybody]490-everybody ’s laudations . [The widow]1578-the widow said [she]1578-the widow meant to give [[Huck]45-huck a home under [her]1578-the widow roof]3276-huck a home under her roof and have [him]45-huck educated ; and that when [she]1578-the widow could spare the money [she]1578-the widow would start [him]45-huck in business in a modest way . [Tom]46-tom ’s chance was come . [He]46-tom said : “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck do n’t need it . [Huck]45-huck ’s rich . ” Nothing but a heavy strain upon the good manners of [the company]3059-the company kept back the due and proper complimentary laugh at this pleasant joke . But the silence was a little awkward . [Tom]46-tom broke it : “[45-huck] [Huck]45-huck ’s got money . Maybe [you]1972-you do n’t believe it , but [he]45-huck ’s got lots of it . Oh , [you]1972-you need n’t smile — [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i can show [you]1972-you . [You]1972-you just wait a minute . ” [Tom]46-tom ran out of doors . [The company]3059-the company looked at [each other]227-each other with a perplexed interest — and inquiringly at [Huck]45-huck , who was tongue - tied . “[51-sid] [Sid]51-sid , what ails [Tom]46-tom ? ” said [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly . “[45-huck] [He]45-huck — well , there ai n’t ever any making of [that boy]2035-that boy out . [I]0-i never — ” [Tom]46-tom entered , struggling with the weight of [his]46-tom sacks , and [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly did not finish [her]47-aunt polly sentence . [Tom]46-tom poured the mass of yellow coin upon the table and said : “[0-i] There — what did [I]0-i tell [you]1972-you ? Half of it ’s [Huck]45-huck ’s and half of it ’s [mine]0-i ! ” The spectacle took the general breath away . [All gazed]3280-all gazed , [nobody]647-nobody spoke for a moment . Then there was a unanimous call for an explanation . [Tom]46-tom said [he]46-tom could furnish it , and [he]46-tom did . The tale was long , but brimful of interest . There was scarcely an interruption from [any one]2780-any one to break the charm of its flow . When [he]46-tom had finished , [Mr. Jones]174-mr. jones said : “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had fixed up a little surprise for this occasion , but it do n’t amount to anything now . This one makes it sing mighty small , [I]0-i ’m willing to allow . ” The money was counted . The sum amounted to a little over twelve thousand dollars . It was more than [any one present]3283-any one present had ever seen at one time before , though [several persons]3284-several persons were there who were worth considerably more than that in property . [CHAPTER XXXV]3285-chapter xxxv [The reader]213-the reader may rest satisfied that [Tom]46-tom ’s and [Huck]45-huck ’s windfall made a mighty stir in [the poor little village of [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg]3287-the poor little village of st. petersburg . So vast a sum , all in actual cash , seemed next to incredible . It was talked about , gloated over , glorified , until the reason of [many of [the citizens]3031-the citizens]3288-many of the citizens tottered under the strain of the unhealthy excitement . [Every “[0-i] haunted ” house in [St. Petersburg]3-st. petersburg and [the neighboring villages]3291-the neighboring villages]3290-every “ haunted ” house in st. petersburg and the neighboring villages was dissected , plank by plank , and [its]3290-every “ haunted ” house in st. petersburg and the neighboring villages foundations dug up and ransacked for hidden treasure — and not by [boys]183-boys , but [men]185-men — [pretty grave , unromantic men]3294-pretty grave , unromantic men , too , [some of [them]185-men]3295-some of them . Wherever [Tom]46-tom and [Huck]45-huck appeared [they]183-boys were courted , admired , stared at . [The boys]2054-the boys were not able to remember that [their]2054-the boys remarks had possessed weight before ; but now [their]2054-the boys sayings were treasured and repeated ; everything [they]2054-the boys did seemed somehow to be regarded as remarkable ; [they]2054-the boys had evidently lost the power of doing and saying commonplace things ; moreover , [their]2054-the boys past history was raked up and discovered to bear marks of conspicuous originality . The village paper published biographical sketches of [the boys]2054-the boys . [The Widow Douglas]71-the widow douglas put [Huck]45-huck ’s money out at six per cent . , and [Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher did the same with [Tom]46-tom ’s at [Aunt Polly]47-aunt polly ’s request . [Each lad]3298-each lad had an income , now , that was simply prodigious — a dollar for every weekday in the year and half of the Sundays . It was just what [the minister]544-the minister got — no , it was what [he]544-the minister was promised — [he]544-the minister generally could n’t collect it . A dollar and a quarter a week would board , lodge , and school [a boy]191-a boy in those old simple days — and clothe [him]191-a boy and wash [him]191-a boy , too , for that matter . [Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher had conceived a great opinion of [Tom]46-tom . [He]158-judge thatcher said that [no commonplace boy]3301-no commonplace boy would ever have got [[his]158-judge thatcher daughter]3302-his daughter out of [the cave]1723-the cave . When [Becky]86-becky told [[her]86-becky father]926-her father , in strict confidence , how [Tom]46-tom had taken [her]86-becky whipping at [school]2056-school , [the Judge]476-the judge was visibly moved ; and when [she]86-becky pleaded grace for the mighty lie which [Tom]46-tom had told in order to shift that whipping from [her]86-becky shoulders to [his]46-tom own , [the Judge]476-the judge said with a fine outburst that it was a noble , a generous , a magnanimous lie — a lie that was worthy to hold up its head and march down through history breast to breast with [George Washington]161-george ’s lauded Truth about the hatchet ! [Becky]86-becky thought [[her]86-becky father]926-her father had never looked so tall and so superb as when [he]926-her father walked the floor and stamped [his]926-her father foot and said that . [She]86-becky went straight off and told [Tom]46-tom about it . [Judge Thatcher]158-judge thatcher hoped to see [Tom]46-tom [a great lawyer]3309-a great lawyer or [a great soldier]3310-a great soldier some day . [He]158-judge thatcher said [he]158-judge thatcher meant to look to it that [Tom]46-tom should be admitted to [the National Military Academy]3311-the national military academy and afterward trained in [the best law school in [the country]351-the country]3312-the best law school in the country , in order that [he]46-tom might be ready for either career or both . [Huck Finn]45-huck ’s wealth and the fact that [he]45-huck was now under [the Widow Douglas]71-the widow douglas ’ protection introduced [him]45-huck into society — no , dragged [him]45-huck into it , hurled [him]45-huck into it — and [his]45-huck sufferings were almost more than [he]45-huck could bear . [[The widow]1578-the widow ’s servants]3315-the widow ’s servants kept [him]45-huck clean and neat , combed and brushed , and [they]3315-the widow ’s servants bedded [him]45-huck nightly in unsympathetic sheets that had not one little spot or stain which [he]45-huck could press to [his]45-huck heart and know for [a friend]2992-a friend . [He]45-huck had to eat with a knife and fork ; [he]45-huck had to use napkin , cup , and plate ; [he]45-huck had to learn [his]45-huck book , [he]45-huck had to go to [church]533-church ; [he]45-huck had to talk so properly that speech was become insipid in [his]45-huck mouth ; whithersoever [he]45-huck turned , the bars and shackles of [civilization]1074-civilization shut [him]45-huck in and bound [him]45-huck hand and foot . [He]45-huck bravely bore [his]45-huck miseries three weeks , and then one day turned up missing . For forty - eight hours [the widow]1578-the widow hunted for [him]45-huck everywhere in great distress . [The public]878-the public were profoundly concerned ; [they]878-the public searched high and low , [they]878-the public dragged [the river]346-the river for [his]45-huck body . Early the third morning [Tom Sawyer]46-tom wisely went poking among some old empty hogsheads down behind [the abandoned slaughter - house]3322-the abandoned slaughter - house , and in one of [them]3322-the abandoned slaughter - house [he]46-tom found [the refugee]3323-the refugee . [Huck]45-huck had slept [there]2038-there ; [he]45-huck had just breakfasted upon some stolen odds and ends of food , and was lying off , now , in comfort , with [his]45-huck pipe . [He]45-huck was unkempt , uncombed , and clad in the same old ruin of rags that had made [him]45-huck picturesque in the days when [he]45-huck was free and happy .
